declare wherein differ inordinate vnskilful collection men maruel seeing doe fully agree selfe malitious person haue fondely charged lette considered nothing perfect first incident mankinde erre slippe sometime onelye point fantasticall fooles perseuer continue error wherfore seeing perusing auncient record best approued history time without great difficultie obteined doe onely moue aucthoritie driue acknowledge mine men error acknowledging correct truste obtaine thus muche handes leaste wil call remembraunce moste gentle wise lawe politike persian wherein enacted man accused bee lawes trespasser founde guiltie crime straight waye bee condemned diligent enquirie searche whole life conuersation slaunder imputed vnto importaunce number laudable factes didde counteruaile contrarie full quit trespasse lawe wishe reader chronicle put vre error plentiful history truely alleadged wil beare promised haue tried matter worthie immortalitie certaine touchstone best allowed historiographer yet notwithstanding fault misprinting haue escaped correction whiche easily may seene amended diligent reader briefe description englande scotlande vvales cornvvall britaine brutanne two name called england scotland ilande ocean sea scituate right ouer france one parte isle englishman inhabite another parte scottes thirde parte walshme fourth part cornishman eyther language condition lawes differ among themselues england called englishman whiche winne greatest parte diuided xl countiesxl county shire call shire whereof ten say kent sussex surrey southampton barkeshire wiltshire dorsetshire somersetshire deuonshire cornwal doe conteyne ye first part iland part bounding toward south standeth betweene thames sea thence riuer trent passeth middest england xvj shyres wherof first sixe sta ding eastward essex middlesex hartfordshire suffolk northfolke cambridgeshire ten whiche stande middle country bedforde huntingdon buckingham oxforde northampton rutland leicester notingham warwike lincolne vj border westwarde vppon wale gloucester hereford worcester shropshire stafford chester monmouth middle region lie darbishire yorkshire lancashire cumberlande left hand toward west westmerland bishoppricke durham northumberlande whiche boundeth vpon north march scotland shyres diuided xxij bishoprikes greeke worke called diocese whiche diocese canterburie hath kent rochester hath part kent london hath essex middlesex part hartford chichester hath sussex winchester hath hampshire surrey isle wight salisburie hath barkeshire wiltshire exceter hath deuonshire cornwal bath welles hath sommersetshire worcester hathe worcestershire parte warwickshire gloucester hath gloucestershire hereforde hath part shropshyre herefordshyre couentrie lichfield hath staffordshyre darbishire part warwickshyre part shropshyre lincolne gretest lying betweene thames humbre hath lincolne leycester huntington bedforde buckingham residue hartfordshire ely hath cantabridgeshire isle ely norwich hath suffolke northfolke part cantabridgeshyre oxforde hath oxfordeshire peterborow hath northamptonshire rutlande bristowe hath dorsetshire prouince archbishop canterburie whych primate england wyth wale archbishop yorke hath yorkeshire notinghamshire piece lancashire bishop durha hath bishoprike commonly called northumberlande chester hath chesshire part lancashire richmonde part flintshire part denbighshire carlile conteyneth cumberlande westmerlande thys prouince archbishoppe yorke whiche another primate england long time also primate al scotland diocese take name city sea placed chiefe whereof london beginning archbishop sea afterwards transposed canterbury cittie kente placed soyle amiable pleasaunt london standeth middlesex northe side thames excellent goodly riuer hath first name ise beginneth coteswolde glocestershire mile titbery much high waye called frosse taketh firste name tamis neere dorcester bridge riuer tame forsayde ise meete maruellous quiet course passeth london breaketh french ocean maine tydes whiche twice xxiiij houres space doeth ebbe flow lx myles great commoditie trauellers whiche kindes marchandice easilye conueyed london principal store staple al comodities within realm upo ye riuer placed stonelodon bridge bridge work rare maruellous bridge hath reckning ye draw bridge xx arch made foursquare stone height lx foote bredth xxx foote distant one fro another xx foote compacte ioyned togither vault cellers uppon side house builded seemeth rather continual streete bridge ocea sea doth bound england first part brytaine east south wale cornwal west riuer twede deuideth england scotland north length iland beginneth portsmouth ye south parte endeth twede north contayning myles thys realme aboue moste fruitefull thys syde humbre beyonde fuller mountaines althoughe beholder countrey farre maye seeme playne yet full manye hilles moste parte voyde tree valleyes whereof verye delectable inhabited moste part noble men according auntiente old order desire dwel city neare vnto valleyes riuers seuerall village auoyding vehement windes bicause iland naturally stormie humbre hath beginning little side yorke runneth southward holdeth course eastward maine sea greatlye encreased riuers dune trent trent beginneth little stafforde running darbishyre leicestershire passing litchfielde notingham ye right hand dune left riuers make ileland whiche called auxolme ioyning togither side kingstone vpon hul goodly marchaunt towne fall humbre whiche riuer may ariue fraunce germanie denmarke england fruitefull beastes aboundeth cattel wherby inhabitant rather part grasiers plowman bycause giue themselues feeding tillage almoste third part countrey employed cattell deere red fallowe gotes wherof store north part cony euery iolly maintenaunce kindes beastes bycause full great wood ryseth pastime hunting gretly exercised specially nobilitie gentleman andrew bourd sayth moeandrevv bord parkes england europe beside scotland part brytain wherof place iscotland haue thought good treate large mentio situation therof might made hereafter began sometime hill called grampius nowe called grantsbeyn stretching furthest coaste northwarde ouerthrowe pictes began riuer twede sometimes riuer tyne fortune warres altering doth al thing therfore length scotland twede furthest coaste esteemed mile scotland longer englande narrowe endeth like wedge mountayne grampius euil fauoured craggie tacitus thecornelius tacitus life iulius agricola doth remember pearcing throughe bowel scotland coast germaine sea say mouth ye riuer dee irishe sea euen laake lomunde whiche lyeth betweene countrey hil riuer twede springeth little hyl far beyond roxborough mingled germaine ocean ioyning southward countrey whiche called march east bound england scotland said riuer twede separateth ye march northumberland furthest countrey englande hauing prospect germaine sea chiefe town wherof barwicke nowe possession english westerne limit scotlande whilom cumberlande whiche riuer solue deuideth annandale two region cheuiot hils appere next march pictlande bordereth nowe tearmed loughdean bounding vpo east hillie countrey barren almost tree famous townes dunbar hadington leith northberwik edenborough king seate also castel maydens strong defensible place citie riuer forthea commoly called frith doth water passe whiche caried germaine ocean maketh greate armes mere commonly called scottish sea wherein besides iland saint columbe name called aemonia riuer agayne deuideth loughdean countrey adioyning aboundant thing called ye fife whych country many townes donfermile cupre notable town saint andrewe speciallye famous uniuersitie beautified sea archbishoppe primate scotlande side towardes irishe side northwarde nidisdalia called riuer passeth therby bee strong townes douglasse donfriese upon south adioyneth galloway aboundaunte fodder cattel wheate wher towne candida casa called whitherne auntient te ple saint ninian adourned also episcopal sea part besides towne wighton laake wonderfull nature bycause one side winter doeth freese standeth countrey caricta renoumed wyth towne caricton whereof perchaunce tooke name aboue caricta towardes west elgonia name ptolome calleth countrey bordering vppon ocean wherein laake lomunde whiche brode large contayning manye ilandes situate foote mountaine grantesbeyn eyght myles castell donbriton besides riuer bodotria named leuinus entring riuer glota clude contende name bodotria well applyed leuinus bycause appeareth cornel tacitus bodotria glota haue sundry passage ye sea clearely dirempte one leuinus glota wherfore iudge rather riuer nowe called frith olde time name bodotria proue adde manye reason whiche omitte good space thys side grampius riseth riuer tau greatest scotland taking name laake whence springeth whiche falleth atholia calidonia many place chiefly perthum called saint iohns towne lastlye dunde time past called alectum breaketh germaine sea mouth forceth great estuars armes sea whereof tacitus maketh mention againste tau anguise whiche meanes riuer fertile prosperous deuided fife vpo north adioyneth athels barre nest countrey well water plentie soyle side arguile sheweth selfe whyche full laakes yeeldeth greater plentie fodder fruite whose vttermost bound stretch farre ireland distante past xvj mile promontorie foreland called land hed standeth coast whilom silures inhabite polidor gathereth wordes plinie hys booke chapter ireland situate ouer brytain distant fro nation silures shortest cut xx myles howbeit manifest plinie yt chapter also writer brytaine hys tyme well knowen farre north suppose mente silures shoulde inhabite arguile rather southwales whence passage ouer better known mighte haue vnderstanding shortest wher also wel tacitus antoninus seeme place people betweene argile olgouia westwarde lyeth countrey sterling called towne forest calydonia began left side within stretcheth farre broade forrest sometimes bred white bulles long maned like lion whiche wilde coulde tamed bycause flesh pleasant daintie mouth whole race almoste extinguished likewise castel calydone situate tau called doucheldine little hil forrest ryseth glota cluid brode chanel falleth irishe ocean stayed manner bankes mountaine grampius slydeth sea greate tydes witnesseth tacitus romaine thought another ilande riuer dale called glotevale whyche countrey riuer runneth citie glasco goodlye uniuersitie agayne towardes easte ioyned countrey anguish merne vppon sea coaste wherein fordune situation verye strong reliques palladius scottish apostle famous syde scotlande countrey marre garnished citie called aberdone standing betweene two riuers dona dea schole also adorned followeth morrey whiche two notable riuers doe compasse aboute called nessa spea mouthe thys last riuer standeth towne elgis aboute banckes whereof huge wood replenished wyth sortes wilde beastes laake also called spina stoared plentie swannes middle part standeth broad countrey rossia called beane rozen stretching vttermost angle euen sea goeth eastwarde better inhabited bosome sea nowe conuenient sailers comonly called port health hauen safetie towne thana breadth iland short falling ye forme wedge scant xxx mile ouer defended three promontory like tower repelleth greate waues surge sea inuironed two gulfes whiche promontory doe inclose entry quiet calme water peaceable straite lande day called cathanes coasting vpon sea deucalidon thus muche particular scotlande euery place ful good hauens nauigable entryes laakes marsh flouds fountaines full fishe mountaines vpon top wherof pleasant plaines yeelding great store grasse plentie fodder cattel wooddes likewise full wilde beastes part land well sustained commodity therefore people harde vanquished anye time reason wood marsh hande refuge hunger eased wyth ueneson fish scotlande irishe sea xl ilandes plinie tearmed brytanniae call meuania hebrides manye length leaste thirty mile breadth aboue xij amongest iona beautified tombes scottish king ilanders generally speake irishe whiche declareth take originall irishe nation beyonde scotlande towarde northe iles orchades whiche ptolome saith xxx number lying ducalidon sea germaine ocean principall whiche ilandes pamonia bycause byshops sea vnder gouernement scotlande ilanders vse gothes speeche whiche argueth proceede germaines tall stature verie helthie lustie body minde liuing long although chiefest foode fishe lande almost continually beset colde many place able bear corne generally almost without tree bushe beyonde orchades standeth thule frosen sea nowe called iselande marchauntes repaire fishing euery yeare sommer thus much haue say scite scotlande nowe nature maners people scottes whiche inhabite southern parte bee wel nurtured liue good ciuility ciuile vse english speech wood geason scant common fewel blacke stone whiche dig earth part northern ful mountaines rude homely kinde people doth inhabite called redshankes wilde scottes clothed mantel shyrte saffroned irishe manner going bare legged knee weapon bowes dartes verie brode sword dagger sharp one side speake irish feeding fishe milke cheese fleshe hauing great number cattell scottes differ englishe lawes customes bicause vse ciuill lawe almost countryes doe english haue theyr law edict certain condition farre vnlike language one habite complexion like one corage battel nobilitie one desire pregnancie hunting countrey house narrow couered straw reede wherein people beast lodge togither theyr town besides iohns towne vnwalled ascribed animositie hardinesse fixing succor helpe alway valiancie body scot verye wise learning declareth whatsoeuer art apply themselues easily profite ydle louthful chiefly shun auoyde labour liue great pouertie yet wil sticke boast nobilitie gentrie though seemely honest lacke comely exercise honest arte get liuing scot generally deuoute obseruers religion thus muche scotlande wale third parte brytaine lyeth vppon leftevvales hande whiche like promontorie foreland isle euery side compassed maine sea except ye southeast part riuer sabrine commonly called seuern diuideth wale england although late writer affyrme hereford bound betweene wale england say wale beginneth chepstow riuer wey augmented anthis arme sea udge novve called aust vvhere passage betvveene village aust chepsto riuer called lugge passing hereforde doth runne sea whiche riuer ryseth middle wale hil vncertayne whether oute spring sabrine doth euen place goeth great arme sea passing land westward right hand leaueth cornwal left wale whiche topographie description althoughe newe yet thought good follow therefore wale extended town chepstow beginneth almost straight line little aboue shrowsburie euen westchester northward part many brytaines remayned aliue slaughter losse countrey length driuen shiftes repayre auntient writing report partly refuge mountaines partly wooddes marishes remained safetie part enioy euen day land afterwards english men cal wale giraldus cambrensis brytaines inhabitant walshmen amongs germaines walshman signifieth stranger alien outborne strange man suche one hath cotrarie laguage wal tongue called stranger borne italian frenchman differ speech germaine man signifieth homo man englishe therefore englishman people germanie wonne brytaine called brytaines whiche escaped destruction theyr country country maner walshmen bicause tongue speach besides lad inhabited wale name afterward people country remaine meane brytaines kingdome loste name affirme name deriued kyng queene without doubt deceyued countrey soyle towardes sea coast place valley playnes moste fertile whiche yeeldeth bothe man beast great plenty fruite grasse place part barraine lesse fruitful bicause lacketh tillage whych cause husbandman doe liue hardly eating oten cake drinking milke mixt water bee many town strong castels foure bishoprickes thefoure bishope vvales bishopricke hereford counted england late wryters declare firste bishopricke meneue called meneua day call saint dauids citie auntient scituated vppon sea coast boundeth westwarde towarde irelande landaffe thirde bangor fourth saint asaph vnder ye archbishop canterbury welshme haue language fro englishman say yt fetch pedigree fro ye troians doth partly sounde troian antiquitie partly greeke hewsoeuer walshemen doe pronounce speache pleasauntlye gently englishman doe bicause speake throate contrariwise englishman rightly following latines expresse voice somewhat within lip whiche hearer seemeth pleasaunt sweete thus much wale thirde part brytaine nowe followeth fourth last part brytaine named cornwal part beginneth side standeth towarde spaine westward toward easte bredth foure score ten mile extending little beyond germains famous village situate ye right hand vppon sea coaste greatest bredth countrey xx mile parcel land right hande compassed coast maine sea left hand arme sea declared parteth land runneth vp chepstow wher coutry forme horne ye first narrow groweth broder little beyonde sayd town germain eastward bordreth vpo englad west south north ye main sea roud barren soile yeelding fruite trauel ye tiller husbadme goodnesse ground greate plentie lead tin mining digging wherof doth specially consist liuing sustentation inhabitats tong far dissonant english much like walsh tong bicause haue many word comon tongs yet difference walsh man speaketh cornish rather vnderstandeth manie word spoken walshman whole tale telleth whereby manifest three people doe vnderstand one another like maner ye southern scot doe perceiue vnderstand northern thing rare maruellous one iland varietie speech cornwal diocesse exceter whiche worthy counted fourthe parte iland contrariety language afterwards norma constituted kingdome al three part reckened cornwal one county shire countrey thus much particular description brytaine whole bodie realme member maye better knowne peraduenture neuer heard forme ilande triquetra three corneredstrab lib hauing three corner three side two whereof saye corner toward easte toward weast extending northwardes longest thirde side whiche south side farre shorter ilande greater length bredth two partes conteyned length euen ye last bredth place bredth beginneth continuing southe parte north narrowe first right corner iland eastwarde kent douer sandwich fro whence callais boloigne fraunce distance xxx myles angle france thirde angle northe scotlande maine wherof boundeth vpon germanie land seene iland like vnto wedge euen verye angle lande scotlande lengthe seauen hundred myles againe length corner douer kent vttermoste parte cornewall michael mount whiche west parte west angle supposed three hundered myles lefte angle west part vttermost part cornwal hath prospect towardes spaine parte also standeth irelande scituate betweene britaine spaine north angle part scotland parte iland doth end length eight hundred mile whych part good hauens safe harboroughes shippes apte passage ireland paste one dayes sayling shorter passage wale waterforde towne irelande vpon sea coast muche like passage betweene douer calays somewhat shortest passage scotland last angle hampton towne vpon sea coast hauen called toward south therfore called southhampton betweene angle kent cornwall doe measure straight line whole length ilande doe saye contayneth myles bredth meneua saint dauids yarmouth vttermost part iland towards easte doeth conteyne mile bredth ilande south part part front beginning lande endeth narrowe strayghte circuite compasse ilande myles lesse caesar doth recken accompt first habitation ilande short note reader recorded sacred auntientgene historie vniuersal floud isle gentile diuided posteritie iapheth sonne noah wee doubt isle brytaine also peopled progenie historie wished appertinet purpose sith irrecouerable onely vnto v also nation thinke better say nothing therein set downe samothes magus sarron druys bardus successours vpholden boulstered onely credite authoritie newe smal pamphlet falsely forged thruste worlde vnder title auntient historian berosus censure al best learned concerning comon berosus first appering one hundred yers since partly suspectlodouicus viues gasparus varrerius lodouicus viues afterwarde conuinced fabulous lerned gas varrerius seueral treatise vniuersally reiected skilful antiquariesas mere fable vnworthy name berosus therefore dare grounde beginning historie vppon credite therof vnlesse woulde preiudicial trueth wherevnto leuel al endeauour hope shal bee sufficient historie brytaines time follow authoritie receiued brytish historie geffrey archdeacon monmouth translated brytishe tong yeares since beginning brute progenie iapheth seemeth firste discouerer namer ruler land yet enter history brute shal bee impertinente note pomponius mela metioneth one hercules killed albion giant aboute mouth rhosne fraunce manye learned men haue iudged saide albion haue ruled sith greeke monumets always cal isle albion dethnicol perotus lilius giraldus solinus hercules came hither lilius giraldus writeth auntient aultar also conteyning inscription vowe founde vttermost north part britaine yeares since solinus reporteth plainelie proued vlisses renoumed graecian tenne yeares trauailes sacking troy arriued countrey thus much founde approued history co cerning britaine arriuall brutus race king britaine since brute margent placed yeares beefore christe byrth euerye kyng beganne raignes til cunobelinus whose time christ sauiour world borne followyng yeares chryste hys byrth placed brute sonne siluius sonne ascanius gaufrid sonne aeneas death hys father banished greece deliuered remnat troias ye long captiuitie wherin deteined vnder grecias whome departed thence seeke habitation associating hymselfe corineus wyth hys troians whome founde waye long weary iourney manye notable actes atchieued aquitaine arriued ilande whyche called albion place nowe called totnes deuonshire yeare world yere christ natiuitie wherein first began raigne named brytaine write rather owne name brutaine aethicus aethicus wonderfull philosopher scithian race istrian countrey translated saint hierome aboue thousand yeares past termeth iles adiacent insulas whyche oracle althoughe sibils owne worke suspecteoracula sibili yet antient indeede might seeme auntient vse moste auntient name countreys people englishe writer aboue hundred yeares since vsually doe name brutan otherwise mandeuil large historie thys lande translated oute frenche brute builded citie newe troy called london stablished therein ye troian law gaue ye vttermoste westerne parte innogen wife locrine camber albanact unto locrine gaue middle parte betweene humber seuern whiche called loegria camber gaue region beyonde seuern tooke name cambria called wale albanact gaue land legion nowe called chester auntient buyldyng wyth vaultes tower eche house like castell whych sometyme hadde beene greate pleasaunce legion romaine vigetius reporteth contained warriours moevigetius whiche legion diuided band first passed rest number souldioures also estimation band bare eagle whyche chiefest standarde romaine first bande contayned footemen heauy armed horseman named cohors miliaria saye companye thousand moe souldiours band head legion whensoeuer muste fight beginne battaile first set order front battell seconde band containeth footman horseman heauy armour bande called cohors quingentaria say company moe souldiours thirde bande likewise hath footman horseman fourth bande hath footemen horseman fifth bande hathe many fiue bandes set araye firste battaile sixte bande hath footemen horseman seauenth bande hath footemen horseman eighte bande hath footemen horseman ninth bande hath footemen horseman tenth hath footemen horseman ten band make ful perfect legion mean mother accorded brennus wholly giue ye study war left hys coutry yt gouernace brother wet frace amo gest ye galles excellet quality greatly esteemed made theyr soueraigne captaine passed italie sacked rome expelling tuscanes builded millain brescia como bergamo vincenza trent verona whiche called owne name brenona afteriustine writeth trogus pompeius abridged iustine hee raised hoste footemen horseman inuaded macedone againe sosthenes sawe wasted countrey village mette hys host macedones well appointed reason fewe enemy manye soone put worser wherefore macedones beaten kept within walles city brennus like conquerour man durst shew head make resistaunce foraged al iles macedone thence though booty spoyles seemed base simple eye tourned minde temple goddes immortall malapertlye scoffing goddes riche ought departe liberally men therfore toke iourney towards delphos setting ye gain gold ben offered goddes theyr displeasure temple apollo delphos situate ye mount parnassus vppon cliffe euerye side falling steepe downe confluence men hath made populous cittie moreouer temple towne enclosed steepenesse rocke middle part rocke inwarde fashion like theatre meanes whereof men make shouting trumpet sounded breaketh redoundeth wise vpon stone one another echo herd double treble noyce resounding farre lowder wente forth whyche causeth ignoraunt stande feare thinking presence godheade winding rocke almost midway toppe hil little playne deepe hole ground serueth giue oracle certaine colde breath ascending vpwarde stirreth mindes prophetes madnesse compelleth giue aunsweare come counsayle place therefore seene many riche gift kyngs people wherefore brutus came within view temple doubt greate whyle whether hee wer better attempt matter forthwith giue souldiours night respite rest euridanus thessalonus conetousnesse praye hadde ioyned themselues willed cut al delay theyr enimies vnprouided giuing night respite theyr enimies perchance get courage succour common souldiours frenchman long penurie founde countrey replenished wine kind victual dispersed themselues field making hauock al thing like conguerours meanes delphians respit lay themselues manned towne helpe theyr neyghbours euer frenchman coulde called wyne fat standarde brennus threescore fiue thousand chosen footemen best al hoste delphians al fighting men disdayne whiche small handful brennus entente sharpen mindes men shewed riche plentiful pray shoulde haue frenchman vouching captaine rather theyr owne beholding stirred vp also wounded wine poured day without respite da ger ran long encounter contrarie part delphians putting truste god owne strength resisted theyr enemyes stone weapon threw frenchman scaled headlong top mountain two partes thus striuing one another sodainely priestes al temple prophetes wyth theyr haire aboute eares c like men straught wittes came running forefront battaile cry al making supplication god ayde met yong beautie personage far excelling mortal creature companie two uirgins armour wherefore besought seeing god garde standarde shoulde sticke dispatch enimies forthwith perceyued god present side piece mountaine broken sodaine earthquake ouerwhelmed french hoste thickest theyr enimies without gret slaughter opened put flight necke whereof ensued tempeste hayle thunder lightning consuming manye anye thing sore wounded captaine brennus himselfe able abyde smarte woundes brennus killeth himselfe toke sworde killed himselfe thus farre abridged iustrne beline meane time bothe ciuill iustice also religion greatly encreased realm made tiberius emperour purposed come hither person death preuented guiderius raygnedgeffrey mo yeares aruiragus rather brytaynes tearmehumfrey l yd monrigus yongest sonne cunobelinus brother guiderius ordayned king brytaine slewg mon hamon neare haue sea threw gobbet meale therin called southhampton stregthned castellc r douer douer also castle richbourgh neare vnto sandwich kent raigned xxviij yeres buried gloucester albeit brytaine historie doth place aruiragus yet40 probable yt cunobelinus yet liued yeares christ admimus sonne cunobeline banishedsuetonius brytaine father receiued protection caius caligula fourth emperor dio lib set forwarde greate preparation againste brytaine came partes holland norffolke hee stayed writing vaunting letter ye senate al brytain yeelded vnto bycause admimus done afterwardethe ridiculo expedition caligula brytaine though would immediately fight fielde cast men battayles squadron vppon sea coaste disposing hys engine warlike manner man knowing ment done hymselfe gallye launched sea immediately returning caused trumpet sound battayle sodainly commaunded gather cockle muscle shelles therewith fill theyr helmet saying spoyles due capitoll spoyles greatlie triumphed thoughe subdued ocean rewarded souldiours retourned rome built hygh watche towre token victorie sea ruines wherof great remaining holland ouerflowed water thys daye called brytons house remembrance ridiculous expedition brytaine persuasion brytaine house holland bericus banished brytaine claudius emperoure dispatched aulus plantius wyth45 army brytaine wher dinerse conflict whe receyued part bodunni hys tuition hadde slaine cataracus togodumus sonnes cunobeline therby made brytains eagre reuege sent claudius himselfe great preparation elephantsdio suetonius came brytanne army encamped nere thames passed ouer essex fought brytanies obtained victorie tooke chiefe cittye cunobeline weapon brytaynes retourned rome sirthe month sette forth thence hee triumphed surnaming hys sonne brytanicus whiche triumphe permitted onely president prouinces also certayn banished prisoner repayre rome amidst spoyles taken brytains fixed top hys pallace crown gold beset stemmes forepart shippes token vanquished brytish ocean behaued himselfe verye courteously towards diuerse friendes muche plantius notable man voyage whych made brytaine atchieued diuers notable actes shold triumph emperour himselfe accompanied vse suche triumph shold go vp capitoll claudius gaue preheminence went left hand time vespatian emperor sent claudius brytain wher fought time brytaines subdued romane empire two worthy nation aboue townes ile wight ostorius appointed lieuetenaunt brytaine the50 roman first entry beginning winter assayleth brytaines purposeth pen vp include riuers fortificatios wherfore ye ioeni made insurrectio whe pacified wt slaughter marched ye gangi raging al cuntries passed forced new tumult tourne ye brigants slaughter promise pardon pacified made prouisio ye silures inhabited southwales bearing theselues bold vpon ye puissace caratacus valiant brytain skilful countrey remoued ye war shropshire wher fortified amogst craggie mountaynes place strong situation neuerthelesse romanes preuayled wise daughter brother caratacus taken flying cartisma dua q ruling yorkshire hir deliuered captiue enemy ix yeares warres began sending rome ther open assembly brought claudius wife daughter brother friendes spoyles bin taken fro wher nothing dismayed spirit countenance spake sort claudius moderation prosperous success bin correspondet state nobilitie might haue come citie rather friende captaine neyther haue disdayned admit league descended noble parentage soueraigne ouer many nation present state mine villanous toward honorable horsse men money munition wonder lost vnwillingly rule raigne ouer necessitie must come slauerie yeelded first neyther fortune thy glorie bin renoumed obliuion ensued immediately execution saue life shall euerlasting example clemency word claudius remitted offence graunted life senate adiudgedin ostorius time certaine city vvere giuen cagidunus brytish king colonie romanes vvas placed ostorius worthy triumph mean time inhabitaunts southwales reuenge caratacus captiuitie intercepted discomfited certain band ye roman amidst new war ostorius tired trauel departed life claudius sent didius supply place ostorius nowe52 ac u h sto departed mean time ye silures fought fortunatly legion vnder conduct manlius valens time war brake betweene cartismanda q brigants venutius hir husband refused matched hir self vellocatus esquire wherevpon venutius fauored people assayled hir territory succoured ye romains intercepted trechery venutius brother ally fought wher sharp fight ayde ye romaine preuayled also caesius nasica wt legion brytans place didius vsed others matter bicause aged onely kept others heretofore conquered claudius poysned agrippina wife nero hir son obteyned ye romain empire yeare raigne verennus appointed lieutenant died within ye first yere gouernmet saying would haue subdued prouinces suruiued ij yeares time great slaughter romaine svetonius paulinus sent hither arriual purposing subdue anglesey whither many brytains had62 drawne theselues invessels wt flat keeles ferried ouer footme bringing ouer horseme fourdes wher ye shore stood closely togither great nubers brytas among woman gadding vp frantickly mourning weedes haire hanging ear shaking firebrads ye druydes also casting vp hads toward heaue thundred cruel execration wt vncomely sightes ye romaine first stoode dismayed encouraged dion casstus general perswasion brust among made greate slaughter got ye possession ye ile felled ye wood co secrated supersticious v two citties beloging romains wer take people slaine whole ilad reuolted romanes reproch slaughter co mitted woma foretold many strange signes toke court heard noise wt much slaughter theatre greate tumulte muche wondering man ther either spake mourned besides riuer thames certaine house building seen image goddesse victoria temple camulodunum tourned hir backe though yeelded hyr enimies woman ranne madde saying singing destruction hande finally betwixt iland fraunce ocean sea appeared flowed bloud occasio war cofiscation brytains good remitted claudius emperoure decianus catus procurator ile saide ought haue bene renued cause added wheras theyr wils seneca lent fourtie sestercies vpon great vsurie wyth greate force kinde violence compelled paye whole summe one payment also persuaded make warre romaine bunduica brytaine woman noble byrth onely wyth muche honour ruled amongst also soueraigne theyr war deed stomack ly womanlike hauing gotten togyther armye men gotte hir vpon hyr seate made marrishe turues manner romaine tall woman comely shape seuere countenace sharp voice yealowe haire hanging downe hyr skyrtes ponticus virunius saith hir thyghes ware great chayne ofponticus virunius golde hadde hyr backe coate sundrye colour playted kirtle whe thus apparelled hir hand gret speare spake vnto effect first commended libertie shewing pouertie wyth libertie farre better great rich miserie bondage side wyth great eloquence shee declared mischiefes calamity suffered handes romaine exactyng tribute paymentes oppressed muche better dye long lyue suche extreame slauerie secondly reproued expelling enimies forefather done iulius caesar claudius caligula againe praised present readinesse helpe hir recouer auntient state thirdly disabled romaine fewe combred armoure faint courage rather fight far encounter hand stroke comended brytaines nu ber greater valor farre able abide hunger colde thirste raine winde heate c shee added vantage place home wooddes ryuers lake thing well knowne euery one lastly exhorted shewe themselues dog wolues among fearefull hare fox wherewithall let hir lap quicke hare thereby learn euent hir enterprice hare hauing prosperous passage multitude gaue greate showte bunduica clapping hir handes gaue thankes hir god ruled romaine nero though hee man yet deede woman sangvvhat brytaines vveregiuen playde harpe brytans esteemed better warriours plowman thing common wiues child hauing kingdome amongest suche kinde people prayed deuine aydes agaynste spitefull wicked kinde men called men vsednicenesse romaine hote bathe dainty fare wine ointmentes laye softe bed vassalles wanton minstrel emperor nero bunduica hauing spoken suche like amongst hir people hir hoste sette forward agaynste romains time without head gouernor paulinus gone army anglesey rehersed iland nere brytaine meanes whereof bunduica tooke two city committed notable slaughter remembred exercised kinde crueltie suche men shee tooke noble woman gat hanged vppe cutte pap sewed mouthes besides stretching body oute length thruste sharpe stake cleane throughe al thing done despighte sacrificed feasted templas specially woodde called andates paulinus subdued anglesey hearyng foresaide slaughter returned brytaine yet woulde hee aduenture fortune battaile fearing theyr number wanted victual enimies approched compelled abide battell bunduica hir army men hir selfe placed chariot ordered hir men length paulinus coulde stretche company long suche number length deuided army three partes one time mighte fighte sundry place exhorting abashed multitude enimies bothe forefather hadde wyth lesse number atchieued greater matter gotten greater victory adding time play men enioy quiet auncestours woon recouer whiche loste else liue euer misery shame againe shewed crueltie eye seene barbarous people suche ouercome exhorting reuenge thereof fighte manfully doubte god alwayes fauourable suffered crueltie woulde helpe better die fighting valiantly reproche taken die enimies handes like dogges finally sayeth whether liue dye brytaine shal though romaine lose yet shall bone continually keep hadde thus spoken signe battel giuen ech part prepareth himselfe brytaines great strange noise romaine silence came neare might throwe dartes perceiuing enimies approche greate violence rushed amongest brake araye compassed multitude enimies battel waxed doubtfull lighte harnessed men beganne smite eache heauy armoure togither horseman encountred romaine archer foughte againste britishe chariot whiche foughte withoute breastplate slaine dartes encounter made three seueral place foughte greate courage bothe side laste romaine departed conquerours many slaine battaile many taken greate number whych escaped prepared fight againe meane space bunduica died dissease mourned buried hir verye honorablye remayned easily ouercome dispersed tacitus saith prasutagus king iceni princecorneli tacitu greate wealth appointed caesar owne twoo daughter shoulde inherite landes hereby thinking life quiet deceassed wife daughter shoulde safer meanes protection fell oute farre otherwise centurion gat realme theyr seruauntes spoyled hys house beat hys wife deflowred daughter besides chiefest men lande displaced inheritaunces handled extremely reuenge whereof bunduica raysed warre committed slaughter remembred laste hir army ouerthrowne paulinus afraid fall hir enimies hand poisoned hir selfe policletus seruannt nero sente hither suruey state brytaine discharged paulinus suetonius gouernement petronius turpilianus sent brytaine manne64 petronius turpilianus easie entreated altogither acquainted offence enimies readier receiue grace setting matter former staye attempting deliuered prouince vnto trebellius maximus trebellius faintharted sluggishe also vtterly vnacquainted experimentes armes ruled prouince certaine mildenesse gouernement nowe barbarous people also learned wincke inticing vice ciuil warres romaine happening cloake cowardise presentlye arose discorde betweene roscius caelius legate xx legion souldiors accustomed employed expedition gaue themselues lasciuiousnesse wherevppon trebellius tooke flighte hid hys head auoyde furie army moste base beastly maner gouerned entreatie mighte seeme haue compounded souldiours shoulde liue libertie generall hys safetie time yeare halfe deadly ciuil war amog romaine empire galba otho vitelius vectius volanus sent hither vitelius did69 vectius volanus vse discipline correctio brytaine continued like slouth cowardise souldioures toward enimyes campe still full wantonnesse sauing volanus good milde man thereby made himselfe beloued hee shoulde haue beene feared time vitelius aduaunced many souldioures brytaine legion herdonius flaccus broughte vnto hym chosen men warre oute oftacitus brytaine brytans seeing ye romaine thus encombred ciuil war began trouble wherefore volanus would send succour vitelius commaundement vespasian warred againste empire brytaines fauored vespasian rest world vespasian recouered70 brytaine placed great captaines notable army enemyes hope abated petilius cerealis broughte greate feare vppon brytaines thepetilius cerealis citie brigantes accounted one greatest lande beyng hym assayled hadde manye encountres withoute slaughter whereby hee eyther conquered assayled greate part country iulius frontinus man worthye valiaunt wasiulius frontinus possible tooke charge vpon subdued nation silures valiant warlike notwithstanding valor enemy difficulty place state brytaine course warres whych agricola found arriuing middest sommeriulius agricola souldiors euen beginning retire strengthes enimye searching aduantage citie ordouices fewe dayes hys arriuall almoste wholly defeated company lying vppon bordures beginning stirred vp prouince seruing example coueted warres yet desired see newe gouernor agricola although sommer nowe well spent bandes dispersed aboute prouince souldiours determined reste yeare time late incommodious commence warre thinking woulde better manne peeces moste suspected yet determined neuerthelesse preuent daunger gathering togither standard legion forraine aide ordouices durst take field marched foorth agaynste hymselfe vauwarde armye others might take like courage danger put almoste whole nation sworde followyng hys good successe inuaded anglesey whiche suetonius attempted causing certaine brytaines serued knewe shallow maner swimming wyth horse harnesse passe ouer isle sodaine wherewith inhabitauntes amazed whotacitus feared nothing bycause sawe nauie submitted ile vnto immediately nowe hauing quietnesse perceyuing warre would little preuaile againste brytaines iniuriouslye handled purposed cut al cause quarrel first reforming owne familie nothing partially onely respected vertue men loosened tribute behaued himsefe moste honourably thus muche firste yeare sommer beganne assembled army trayned souldioures forrayed enimies country sodaine inuasions greate feare yet fauorably many country willingly yeelded vnto suffered castelles builte among winter following spente ciuill administration counsayling people priuately helping publikely builde house temple courte house procured noble men child study liberall science beganne brytaines conforme themselues romaine fashion attyre thirde yeare discouered people northe hitherto vnknowne euen farre tau terrifying people placing fortress moste wisely annoyaunce enimie fourth sommer employed getting country whiche hitherto passed throughe euen edenborough frith cluid narrowe space betweene whych water fortified fifth yeare sea discouered vanquished nation north placed garrison coast towarde irelande wherevnto also aspired end reteyned irish prince driuen oute country ciuil dissention sommer whiche beganne sixt yere hys gouernement searched hauens nauie purpose sent sea fearing leaste nation beyonde vnited themselues kept passage land afterward marched forward nauie coasting army land sometime campe horseman footemen seaman lodged togither reported suche taken prisoner sighte nauie much astonied brytaines men refuge cutte secret sea discouered wherefore determining trie hand blowes inhabitantes calidonia greate preparation although reporte thereof greater often hapneth vnknowne matter accorde assayled castelles seeyng themselues rather bee assaylantes defendauntes putte romaine doubte wherevpon owards pretending pollicie aduised retire side bodotria rather driuen thereto force meane agricola knowing enimye woulde charge hym seuerall troupe companyes fearing bee ouermatched couped wyth number deceyued ignoraunce place diuided army three battailes marched forwarde whiche order marked hys enimyes made alter purpose night killing watch brake vpon ninth legion halfe asleepe halfe afrighted tooke weakest fighte continued within camp til day light time romaine began gather courage brytaines discomfited hadde bene woodes bogges victorie ended whole strife battaile romain souldiors grew hautie corage cry pierce country calidonia might finde oute vttermoste porte boundes brytaine romaynes side ascribing prayse victorie prowesse romaine souldioure fortune wilinesse capitaine vsed al meanes possible hearten vppe arme youth bestowing wiues child place safegarde sacrifice holy assemblyes vnite city togither vpon resolution remoued beginning next sommer viij yere charge agricola seding fleet often put land spoyled countreys thereby causing great vncertaine feare himselfe picked army whervnto added valiantest brytains came mountain grampius whereon enimies encamped brytaines nothing quailed successe former encounter expecting nothyng reuenge bondage learning length common daunger resisted common consent league embassages hadde stirred vppe mindes city aboute nowe seene armes thirtie thousande vpwarde vnto whiche number youth strong lustie yeares euery man bearing token prayse continually repayred al side amongest manye capitaines calgacus man bothe nobilitie valor aboue rest spake assembly manner often behold cause warre oure necessitie minde gyueth greate hope day youre mutuall consent shal beginning libertie brytaine euerye one hauing tryed seruitude hauing land sea whiche saue v romaine nauie elbowes verye warre weapon whyche honoure worthy muste onelye safetie faintharted manye suche reason drawne calamitie future seruitude pride tira ny gouernoures fickle friendship stranger seruing enimies campe ready change vpon anye highe occasion presente remedye misery whyche sayde beginning onely valiancie stirred vp men mindes applauded oration theyr manner song diuers kinde noyses oration ended also agricola hys speeche hys souldioures twoo army beganne encounte agricola placed hys battayles order made mayne battayle straungers aydes whiche number viij thousand eche side wherof wing placed hys horssemen number three thousande legion caused guard trench campe possible victorie mighte gained without sheading romaine bloude maine battel broken might gathered againe fighte restored hys legion battaile brytaines terrify enimies also make brauest shew stode higher ground vawarde beyng come vppon playne reste foote hill chariot meane tyme galloping vp downe fielde making greate showtes cry agricola perceyuing number enimes bee greater owne fearing charged bothe face lanke battayle one time manye thoughte necessary haue legion aduannced forwarde remayned notwythstanding firme firste resolution causing battaile somewhat drawn lengthe himselfe alighted horse stoode foote standerdes first fighte shotte arrowes dar e whiche time brytaines skilfully couragiouslye huge swordes small buckler eyther bare brake romaine shotte answered infinite number like vntill agricola perswaded bandes holanders brabanders matter mighte broughte swordes handstrokes whiche kinde fight acquainted withall long haunting warres incommodious enjuries bearing small shieldes vnmeasurable swordes pointlesse sword brytaynes vnfi te throng wanted roomth wherefore holanders strake thicke togither thrust ouer buckler wounding face hauyng broken battell passed forward towarde whiche kepte hill whiche seene reste romaine bandes partelye moued enuye others glorye partelye heat owne courage cutte peeces firste encountred leauing notwythstanding halfe deade others touched haste obtaine perfecte victorie meane whyle troupe brytaine horsemenne dydde take flighte chariot putte themselues peecemeale among foote bandes whyche kinde fighte firste seemed somewhat terrible enimies long serued tournes assayled wyth thicke prease ennimyes grounde commodious chariot ryders beste laste theyr chariot horse coursing vppe downe field without guiders ouerran manye owne company fled feare one place another brytaines whiche al kepte hill came ye fight making little reconing smal number romaine beganne little little descend entending hem middest conquest surely done agricola suspecting hadde dispatched foure company horseman whiche kept sodaines encounter fiercely assayled much sharply repulsed sent flight wherevpon deuise brytaines turned owne harme moreouer agricola comandement wing horseman taken front battel made charge vpon battel enimies standing ouer might beholde open field greeuous lamentable spectacle folowed chace tooke prisoner killed take others enimies euery one thoughte beste fledde heapes armed fledde smaller number thoughe vnarmed tarryed slaine euery laye weapon rcasses lymmes ground bloudy sometime vanquished approching neare woodes woulde make hed entrap heedlesse follower agricola hadde caused certayne lusty bandes manner search also diuers horseman leauing horse wooddes thicke horsebacke wooddes would suffer raunge aboute might haue detriment receiued much hardinesse brytaines sawe themselues pursued order battaile tooke againe flight company tarrying one euen men glad escape sought long wayes night wearinesse slaughter ended chase slaine brytaines tenne thousand romaine army three hundred fortie among whome aulus atticus capitaine aband heat youth corage horse broughte hand enimies night victor made mery wyth spoyle brytaines wandering vppe downe men woman lamenting togither releeued fetcht awaye hurte men assembled togither whole forsooke house anger sette fire choosing themselues lurking place straite forsooke againe sometime conceyuing good hope whyche straighte waye quayled agayne knowen kyll theyr wyues chyldren thoughe hadde therein taken compassion vppon nexte daye made victorie manifest nothing silence hilles forsaken also house smoking far agricola sendyng abroade espialles coulde finde ennimye make ed wherefore sommer farre spente proceede warre hadde souldioures coastes horest taking hostage caused nauie coaste aboute brytaine whiche laste arriued hauen called trutulensis afterwarde hauing bestowed souldioures wintering place departed brytaine lefte prouince quiet successor diuers uthours affirme time gospellfirste christian disproue lawes god haue receiued lately god goodnes kingdom ye faith law christ haue kingdom testament god grace aduice realme take law thereby patiently gouern ye kingdom ye uicar god kingdom according ye kingly prophet earth ye lord fulnesse ye whole world al yt psalm dwel therin thou hast loued righteousnes hated iniquitie wherfore god eue thy god hath annoynted thee ile gladnes aboue thy fellow ye king child christian nation people kingdome liue consist vnder protection peace kingdom according scripture hen gathereth chicken vnder hir wing people nation kingdome brytaine youres suche diuided shoulde gather togither lawe christe holy churche peace concorde cherishe maintaine protect gouerne defend iniurious malicious enimies woe kingdome king whereof childe prince eate earely morning doe call king child youth minoritie follie iniquitiepsalm madnesse according kingly prophet bloudthirsty deceitfull menne shall outliue halfe dayes eating shall vnderstande gluttonie gluttonie luxurie luxurie filth wickednesse mischiefe according king salomon wisedome notsapience enter spitefull soule inhabite body subiecte sinne king hathe name gouerning hys kingdome long shall king rule well otherwise shall named lose name god forbid god graunt maye rule realme brytaine may raigne wyth hym euerlastingly whose uicar saide kingdome whome father c remayneth churche saint peter vpon wrote brytishioseline furneys bishop saith thean first archbishop lo time lucius builded said church peter archbishop london place called cornhil london aide help ciran chief butler king lucius also clauus secod archbishop builded librarie church adioyning conuerted many erwydes learned men pagan law christian faith third archbyshop named cadar fourth obinus fift conan sixt paladius seuenth stephan eighte iltut ninth dedwin tenth thedred eleuenth hillary twelfth guidilinus thirtenth vodinus slain sarons came first lande lucius raigned yere buryed gloucester comodus father antonius philosophus succeded181 dion empire cruel tyranny time northerne britain burst wall forrayed countrey slew romaine generall souldiours wherfore vlpius marcellus appointed careful vigilant captaine sore annoyed brytains enemy romain state purchasing enuie vertue shortly dismissed ceronnis ruled vnder comodus appointedlampidi dion certaine men base estate gouerne romain enemy wherewith souldiours greeued sent chosen men theyr number rome accusing hym comodus compasse empire sonne deliuered vnto immediatelye mangled hym slew wife two sonnes comodus sent holnius pertinax brytain surnamedlampridi himselfe brytanicus thervnto perswaded flatterer brytaines euill affected toward woulde haue nominated emperour againstcapitolinus namely pertinax tumult appeased wisdome pertinax great danger welnere slaine tumulte left among dead whiche iniurie seuerallye reuenged sued discharge afterwarde preferred empire clodius albinus sente hyther comodus whocapitolinus first greatlye esteemed honored hym title caesar clodius refused afterwards false rumor dispersed yt comodus slain made oratio legion brytain impeaching yt gouernement emperours preferring senate whervpon commodus sharpned againste hym sente iunius seuerus rule heere shortly comodus slaine slaine pertinax chosen emperour within iij months194 slaine throughe per wations didius iulianus enioyed empire two monthes practice clodius albinus returned brytain seemeth recouered former gouernement seuerus death pertinax saluted emperor194 immediately slewe didius iulianus bycause feared clodius albinus brytain legion created caesar partaker empire sente heraclitus gouerne ile subdued niger also vsurped empire moued warre albinus passing hence fraunce brytish army encountered seuerus neare lion slaine henceforthe seuerus quietly enioyed romaine empire made sharp war easterne partes world great glorie returning rome vnderstoode war raysed in209 brytaine wherefore hasted hyther two sonnes bassianus geta arriuall peace offered whithe refused leauing yonger sonne geta gouerne prouince hyther part ile bassianus hys eldest sonne entred northe passed parte thys ilande without resistaunce yet ambush difficultie way inconueniences lost men returned enforcing enemy conclude league yeelde parte theyr countrey conclusion league sonne rid treate caledontans northern brytains bassianus sonne drawing sworde sighte enemie ready haue slaine done company made outcry yet fault remitted league brytaines north resorted emperours courte wher iulia seuerus wife obiected woma brytaine wife argentorix caledonian brytish woman accompanyed wyth men dishonestlye ye quoth brytishe woman satisfy naturall luste better sorte romaynes accompanye selues openly wyth beste menne committe adulterie closely wyth moste vyle person league generall reuolte brytaynes againste romaine yet pacifyed great slaughter builte wall turfe inhibite uerus vvall northern brytaines whence retourned nexte lodging blacke moore serued notable scoffer mette wyth crowne cypre hee moued colour man cypre whiche vsed burial signes euill lucke commaunded manne sente awaye wherewyth cryed thou haste bene hast banquished couquerour thou god commyng citie yorke supposed byspartia mistaking brought temple bellona blacke beast also ordayned sacrifice followed home hys pallace thing dyd accopt ominons shortly departed life yorke partly sicknesse partly griefe conceiued hys sonnes euill demeanoure last gaspe vttered word found state troublesome euery leaue quiet euen brytaines herodian writeth war seuerus ye herodian north brytains founde country full watry marishes marishes britain swim skirmish enemy couered water vp vnto nauell caring men saw priuie partes theyr naked bodyes neyther dyd knowe vse apparel accustomed compasse theyr bellyes neckes onely wt iron esteemed ornament token rich barbarous people supposed gold paynted bodyes diuerse picture formes beastes therefore ware garmente leaste painting hidden nation valiaunt warlyke greedy slaughter content small target speare skayne hanging naked side ignoraunt vse shyrtes mayle helmet reckned ye comberous vnto shoulde swimme ouer lake c greetious disease came vpon seuerus sore appalled age constrained keepe chamber sende antonius vnto warres antonie regarding businesse brytaine endeauoured meanes coulde winne harte souldiours vnto hym deprauing hys brother intente shoulde aide attayning soueraintie long maladie father caused perswade phisitions rid olde man worlde vntil seuerus consumed ended life moste famous emperours war like affayres none obtayned many victory conquest either ciuil aduersaries rayne barbarous nation thus deceased gouerned empire space xviij yeares leauing sonnes successours vnto left also greate aboundaunce rich none previcessours hym done antony gotten supreme authoritie put death phisitios bycause obeyed commaundemente hastnyng hys father deathe slewe owne brother bringers vp instructers wente reconcile leauing none aliue eyther dignity reuerenced father captaines army enticed perswade souldiours proclayme emperour imagining dayly manifold mischiefes brother could win souldiours good willes wherefore antony hauing taken truce britans remoued towardes mother brother mother laboured bring agreement wherein also manye prudente counsellours earnestly trauelled antony thereby enduced rather force good counterfaite loue done two brother gouerning empire equal honour launched brytaine sayled reliques theyr father toward rome burned bodye custome romaine carryed ash intermedled pleasaunt odour boxe alabaster rome mighte ther enterred amongst monument prince themselues led thus army conqueror brytain passed ouer ye ocean vnto next coaste fraunce hasted towards rome entred rome people crowned laurel receyued senate welcomed formost roade emperor themselues clothed emperial purple nexte vnto followed consul bearing vessel seuerus reliques whiche vessel people saluted newe emperour reuerently worshippe emperours consul thus accompanyed wyth princely pompe aryed saine temple deuine monument marcus emperor seene finished solemne sacrifise according ye auntient vsage celebrated funerall ceremony brethre departed emperiall palace deuided betweene closed vp backe dores priuie postern mette togither outter gate chose besides eyther vnto himselfe soundry guarde neuer came togyther vnlesse sometime little whyle seene people neuerthelesse firste accomplished due funeral father romaine accustome consecrate immortalitie emperours theyr death lea e eyther child successoures empire behinde endued honor canonize ongst god cittie certaine dolefull lamentation mixed fearefull vse enterre dead corpse sumptuously haue image made like deade emperour may within porche emperial pallace lay gret high bed iuorie couered ouer cloth gold image looketh pale like diseased patient bed eyther side great part day certayne person sit wit left side senate clothed blacke garment right side many matrones none seene weare ouches chaynes golde clad wyth thinne white vesture shew countenaunce mourner thus doe continue space seauen dayes euery daye emperours phisitions repayre vnto bed though felt patiets pulse declare waxeth sicke finally seemeth deceased certain noble worthye yong men order knightes senator doe take vp bedde theyr shoulder cary streete called sacrum via vnto olde market place romain magistrats accustomed render vp office side certaine stage made steppe vppon whiche one side queare boyes noble men sonnes side many beautiful woman singing himnes ballade prayse deade emperour measured diuerse lamentable verse finished yong men take vp bedde againe beare citie fielde called campus martius broadest part whereof erected towre foure square side equall height builded great timber like vnto tabernacle within forthe filled wyth drye chippes reedes outter side hanged wyth arras clothes golde decked image iuorie sundry painted picture within also another lesse towre like forme doores portal opened ouer third fourth many roomes ascebdubg continually vntill retche vnto highest lesse man maye compare thys building vnto towres whyche sette hauens wyth fire toppes directe shippes whiche sayle nighte sea theyr perfecte porte commonly called phani nowe haue putte bed seconde tabernacle gather kyndes spice perfume wyth diuerse odoriferous fruites hearbes iuyces whyche throwe heapes tabernacle neyther anye nation citie person whyche excelleth honoure dignytie tyme wyll vttermoste hys power honorablye celebrate laste funeralles emperour haue couched greate heape spice togither stuffed building therewyth romayne knightes doe ride aboute towre iuste course order fro chariot also drawne aboute wherein manye doe sitte clothed purple representyng person noble men magistrate captaines rome ceremony throughly ended successour empire taketh brande fire hande fireth therewith tabernacle whome present doe throwe fire likewise immediately building filled drye stickes spice beginneth burne vehementlye highest leaste towre hygh steeple let forth eagle beleeue doeth beare emperours soule heauen thencefoorthe emperour worshipped god time raigne wine raigned fine yeares slaine souldiours caius succeeded two sonnes numerianus vopisens carinus whiche carinus assigned brytaine gaule called fraunce illiricum italie spaine three within three yeares space lost liues valerius dioclesianus chosen emperour284 adioyned maximianus vnto hym lyke gouernement aboute thys tyme holy alban professing christ beingvita albani ledde cittie verolamium vnto holmehurst nowe towne saint albans builded suffered martyrdome specified first martyre brytaine shortly number one thousande christias martyred lichfielde amphabole instructerliber lichfielde whiche sente surprise retourned maximianus encombered newe warre gaule agaynste peasantes meane time carausius built shippes brytayn intercepted certayn copanyes souldiours assembled gret number barbarous people spoyle hope purposed trouble sea coastes gallia spaine holland also holden certayne frankes reuolted carausius purposed maximianus seconde tyme make288 warre agaynste carausius stormye weather wante pilotes hee enforced deferre hys purpose leauyng gouernement thys ile carausius shortlye two emperours elected two caesar valerius maximus constantius chlorus constantius committed recouerie brytaine hee immediatelye passing gaule hytherwarde sodaynely surprised gesseriacum nowe called bullen whiche carausius manned stopped hauen could stande carausius steede building shippes passe ouerpaneg constantius dictus hither first assayled luckily hollander whiche reuolted carausius staying conuenient winde houered sea coaste meane tyme carausius traytorously slayne alectus familiar friende albertus vsurped empire brytayne292 agaynste whome constantine wyth hys former preparation made readye warre launched haste thoughe winde contrarie whyche hys souldiours vnderstoode sette also wyth side windes seyne port suche foggie mystieseyne weather passed alectus nauie honering aboute ile wighte seeing one romaine soone landed burnte theyr shippes determining either winne lose liues allectus vnderstoode left shore prepared himselfe battaile mercenarie barbarous souldiours slaine asclepiodatus lorde greate maister emperours house thys fight none romaynes perished al fielde ouerspred deade bodyes enimies among lay alectus himselfe without imperiall ornamentes scantly knowen romaine souldiours also whiche loste theyr companye myste arriued london slewe citie greate number barbarous people whyche escaped battaile purposed haue sacked london constantius came lande brytains wiues child flocked vnto submitted themselues ioyfully nowe deliuered long thraldome thys expedition constantius brytain ascribed maximianus error false inscription panegirike hath led asclepiodatus touched recouered brytaine290 galfridu belayde citie london strong siege wherein liuius gallus romaine captaine ere wer long knightly force violence entred citie slew forenamed gallus neare vnto brooke daye running whiche brooke threwe reason wherof called brytish nant gallon since saxon tongue gallus wallus brooke thys daye streete sometime brooke ranne called walbrooke coill asclepiodatus toke kingdome of301 brytaine constantius bega empire gallerius empire305 deuided constantius shoulde possesse affrica italie fraunce brytaine gallerius shoulde haue illirica asia east partes whiche done substituted vnder two caesar costantius holding himselfe content dignitie augustus refused sustaine trouble whiche shoulde haue endured administration affaire italie affricke hee sought meanes howe mighte enriche people empire abolished superstition gentile dominion afterwarde brytaine felt persecution yeare following passed fraunce hyther pictes whiche time sonne constantine serued galerius perceyuing destructien compassed posted father al haste howghing killing post horsses whych way euer passed mighte pursued came father verye houre wente aboorde come brytaine constantius aspanegiricus soone came yorke sodainely sickned perceyuing daye drawe neare asked whome hee woulde leaue empire aunswered constantine shortly departed constantine surnamed great sonne constantius by306 helena first consecrated hys father nowe deade great sorrowe sheading teares solempnized burial souldiours hoping would resemble hys father saluted emperour yorke wil romaine senate confirmed hys election theyr consent willingly accepted yere folowing setting affayres brytaine order passed hence wyth manye brytaines firste agaynste frankes whome vanquished agaynste maxentius usurper whome slewe afterwarde agaynste licinus named hymselfe emperour whome also subdued many barbarous nation also hym discomfited establyshed gospell hys empyre hym emperoures christian firste beginnyng hys raygne hee worthye haue bene compared wyth beste chiefest prince romaine euer ende thereof resembled meaner sort much giuen purchase prayse fame feates cheualrie hee good fortune battaile yet good industrye excelled farre repressed ciuill warres vanquished gothes diuerse place wanne greate memorie prayse among barbarian applyed himselfe wholly studye liberal artes endeauored gayne loue people well deseruings seeking great liberalitie cittie whiche builte made able brytain362 empire seen passing wel liberal scieces earnest aduersarie christian religion banishedammian marcellinus palladius gret honorable person brytain vpon suspition sent alipius bin lieuetenaunt slaine hys enimies preased vnaduisedly battels succeeded empire ieninian held ix monthes valentinian chosen emperor souldiours365 pictes scottes attacots saxon grieuously molested brytaines enquirie confederats bycause would renew tumult whiche done returned rome shortly valentinian sente hither fraomarins ordayned king buccenobats germanie marshall almaines whiche serued brytain long valentinian dyed gratian brother valentinian created375 emporour entent might better repaire decayed state empire made theodotius copartener maximus valiaunt worthy man shortly forced383 brytain take empire vpon passed fraunce immediately al germaine legion romaine souldiours reuolted vnto hym gratian hee destitute men warre fledde lyon slayne treason maximus gaue gratians wife comming hir husbande whiche gratian intierly louing hys wife lightlye credited therfore accompanyed wyth wente forthe meete hyr coache supposed haue founde hys wife andragatius desperate man leaping coache killed gratian maximus created sonne victor caesar andzozimu vsed crueltie gratians captaines valentinian herewith terrifyed sent ambrose vnto treate peace accepted theodotius permitted vse title augustus setled himselfe trier insige ertus germanie empouerished countryes rounde hym executed certaine hereticks called priscillianists entred italie breaking peace thought haue intercepted valentinian mother fledde theodotius persuaded take reuenge maximus meane time maximus came aquileia italie affrica submitted themselues vnto sodainelye theodotius comming constantinople moued warre corrupted souldiours brybes one two skirmish enforced maximus flye aquileia owne souldiours deliuered theodosius whose commaundement shortly beheaded andragatius also kept sea vnderstanding drowned himselfe victor sonne maximus slaine fraunce arbogustes brytaines serued retourned fraunce setled countrey called brytaine brytaine recoueredgiraldus againe romaine empire saint vrsula uirgins whiche sentethe virgin flores historiaru brytaine married conon hys knyghtes slaine martyred barbarous people sea write attila king hu e honorius sonne theodosius succeeded empire365 bede pelagius heresie whose time pelagius brytaine borne disparckled venome faithlesse doctrine farre abroade holding man might liue well without help grace god vsing heerein ayde iulianus campania intemperately stirred losse bishoprike whome saint austen father also haue answered ample maner yet would amended thereby conuicted falsehoode rather would encrease defending maynteyning amend returning truth time marcus chosen emperoure souldyouresl zi brytaine fearing inuasion vandales immediately slewe elected gratianus whome also murthered within foure monethes constantine souldiour base estate onely vpon confidence name elected heere emperoure passing hence france youth brytaine gote men warre take part honorius sent therefore sarus withstand foughten field slew iustinian constantine captayne pursued constantine made take valentia wherein sharply beseeged vntill gerentias brytaines edebrichus franck raysed seege constantine fortifyed alpes rhene garrison sent constans sonne whome monke made caesar great armie spayne tooke afterward slew certayne noble personage lyed honorius returning father left gerontius gouerne spayne constantius himselfe craued pardon honorius vsurping empire saying compulsion honorius heard wel liked sent imperiall roabe vnto trouble brytaine greatly endangered pictes scottes sued honorius succoure sending letter willed looke owne state shortly constance monke slayne gerontius owne captayne vienna france constantine himselfe beseeged arles honorius souldiers entred holy order fled church thinking thereby saue himselfe drawen thence slayne gerontius trayterously killed maister besette rounde aboute withnicephorus spanyards lodging wherefore first slew allanus tryed friend nunichia wife lastly himselfe honorius recouered brytaine time saith beadebeade rome destroyed gothes yeare buylded time romanes left rule britaine almost yeares iulius caesar first entered sayd ile romanes dwelt within ye french haue sayd seuerus drew ouerthwart ye iland ye south part thing may appeare ye city temple bridge paued streetes day remayning notwithstading possession vnder dominio farther part britaine also ilands brytaine meanes afore sayd ye romanes vsed trasport ouer france floure al youth brytaine serue foraigne warres men warre consumed able defende theselues inuasions enimies wherevpon many yeares togither liued vnder oppression two cruel nation scottes pictes ye circuite britaine deuided lande britaine two armes sea running betwixt one east sea weast runneth farre wide land though may one reake middle east creeke citie builded called guidi aboue weast creeke toward right hand standeth citie called alcluith language asalcluith much say rocke cluith standeth floud fame name britaines thus afflicted said nation sent embassador letter vnto rome lamentable supplication requiring ayd succour promising continuall fealtie would rescue ye oppression enimies wherevpon sent vnto legio armed souldiers rome comming iland encountring enimies ouerthrew great number draue rest frontier countrey setting liberty free miserie greeuously ouercharged counselled make wall betweene two sea might force keep euill neyghbours yt done returned home great triumph britaines building wall bid make stone willed turffe hauing none amog skil therin made slender serued little purpose wall made betwene ye two said armes creekes sea many mile long fence water lacked help ye trench might keepe country breaking enimies peece worke remayneth euen vnto day assured token yet seene trench beginneth two mile fro monastery abercuring place pictes language called penuahil english called panwell runningpenuahil westward ended city alcluith former enimies whe perceiued yt romane legion returned home againe forthwith set land boates inuaded border ouercame ye countrey beate downe whervpon embassador sent rome beseeching would suffer miserable countrey vtterly destroyed againe sent another legion coming vpon suddaine made great slaughter enimies chased ouer country ye romanes told britaines yt ease take trauellous iourneys defence therefore bade practise armoure themselues learne withstand enimies builded vp wall hard stone sea sea right betweene two city whiche made keepe enimie selfesame place seuerus cast trench publike priuate charge brytaines also putting helping handes builded eyght foote broade twelue foote high right line east weast doth day appeare perfected giue people straight warning looke well themselues teach handle weapen instruct warlike feates also sea side southward shippes lay harbor least enimies land aboutes made vp bulwarkes along one somewhat distant another done bid farewelgildas sapiens minded returne time almost treasure brytaine hidde vnder ground transported ouer france soone gone scottes pictes hauing intelligence made promise woulde come taking heart grace returne agayne businesse first without wall tooke owne giue assault vnto wall britaynes graples pulled downe otherwise assaulted leauing city wall also dispersed put flight enimies following killed slayed cruelly euer wherevpon driuen owne house possession fall robbing spoyling one farre foorth whole countrey brought exigent none sustenance gote hunting killing wilde beastes theodosius yonger sonne arcadius succeeded his408 uncle honorius appoynted valentinianus cousin emperour weast partes time timotheus heere brytaine vnder pretencesigebertus religion great continencie drew many dangerous heresie chrisanthus sonne byshop martian consull ofsocrates lib italy made uiceroy lord deputie britayne afterward made bishop constantinople poore remnant brytaines directed letter aetius whereof beginning aetius thrice consull mourning brytaines processe epistle thus set foorth pitifull estate barbarous enimie driueth v vpon sea sea agayne vpon enimie betweene twayne riseth two manner deathes eyther killed drowned yet suite could obtayne ayde hym whiche hand full businesse battayle home bleda attila king hunnes pelagian heresy brought agricola pelagian heresie sonne seuerianus pelagian bishop time fore corrupt faith brytaines brytaines beeing neither willing receyue lewde doctrine blasphenrous againste grace god neyther able refute wilie wicked persuasion deuised wholsome counsell seeke ayde bishop france spirituall enimies calling common counsell consulted among themselues whome best send help neighbour fayth assent chosen two woorthie prelate germanus altisiodorensis lupus bishop citie germanus lupus trecassa whiche shoulde passe ouer britaine confirme faith whiche readie obedience accepting commandement sinode tooke shipping thitherward prosperous windes set ashore place themselues desired thither great multitude people assembled receyued priestes god word god preached onely church also open streetes countrey sigebert kinsman sigebert sonne sigebalde brother sebert ruled eastsex perswasion oswy king northumbers eade abandoned superstition became christian toke holye manne ced wyth hym mightily beate errours wan many preaching christian religion dominion wherevpon ced finan consecrated bishoppe east saxon proceeded authoritie hys functio ordering priest deacon place essex especially ithancester tilberie thys cittie ithancester stoode bancke riuer pante runneth maldune hundered dansey citie drowned pante yt nothing remaineth ruines citie sayde riuer tilbery standeth thamis sideralph cogshal rendlesham eastenglande sigher ruled sebba whyche sebba became monke buried saint paules london sigehard raigned erkenwald bishop eastangle founded monastery chartesey surrey barking essex anno seofride nexte successiuely whome finde nothyng recorded offa sonne sigher ruled prouince enlarged building enriched landes churchrich cices westminster forsaking hys wife landes kinne countrey went rome kenrede king mercia monkes coule ended life leauing selred rule countrey selred call colred peaceably offa raigned718 ri grincastri essex thirty yeares length slaine svthred selred slayne raigned continued sigehricke sigehard afterwarde aspired kingdome east saxon good successe mercians mercia fifth kingdome greatest contayned gloucester hereford chester stafforde wircester oxforde warwicke
