yeares and718 chronicle holande ro mai epistle boniface ethelbald procurement beruredus slaine hys subiects unto ethelbald boniface ye secod bishop verche holland archbishop men vpon rijne english maborn afterward martyred sent epistle whiche sette downe peece seene sheweth partlye state time serueth example time come deare lorde preferred loue christ aboue king england edbaldus boniface archbishoppe germaine legate perpetual helth charitie loue christ acknowledge god reioyce heare prosperitie faith good workes sory heare thing goeth eyther successe warre danger soule haue heard forbid thefte robbery loue peace defende widowe poore giue god thanks refuse lawfull marriage preferring chastitie comendable sith wallow leacherie adultery uirgins consecrate god shamefull damnable doth confounde renowme bothe god man placing among idolators bicause violate temple god wherfore deare sonne repent remember filthy thing thou gifte god raygnest ouer many nation shouldest great displeasure god make thy selfe bonde slaue thyne owne fleshly lust wee haue hearde also parte noble men people mercians thyne euill example haue left theyr lawfull wiues haue defiled wiues also uirgins whiche howe farre differeth good order honestie let lawes straunge nation touche auntient countrey saxon knowledge god eyther mayde hyr father house married husband become aduoutresse shoulde strangled hir hande closed hyr mouth corrupter shoulde hangedaduoutry amog infidel pushed death vpon pitte aduoutresse buryed shee vsed hyr garmentes cutte awaye downe gyrdlesteede chaste matrones dyd scourge whip hyr pricke hyr wyth kniues sent towne towne freshe newe scourger whipper meete whippe hir vntyll hadde killed hyr likewise womedeans moste vncleane kinde people hadde thys manner vsage wyth husbande beyng deade woman togyther wyth deade bodye shoulde caste hyr selfe headlong fiered stacke pile woodde prepared burning theyr bodyes therefore gentile knowing god hadde greate zeale chastitie howe muche deare sonne required thy handes arte christian king haue therefore compassion thyne owne soule spare greate number people thy fatherlye example yet may beware offende god whose soules thou shalt giue accompte consider also englshe nation despising lawfull matrimonye doe encrease aduoutrye frenche men italian also verye pagan caste teeth vpbrayde v withall suche coniunctions copulation shall spring vppe peakishe dasterdely people shall despise god wyth theyr wicked quality vndoe countrey came passe burgundians people prouance spaniardes sarazen haue many yeares assaulted theyr sinnes whiche time past committed besides told v take away priuileges church thereby giue euill example noble men like praye remember howe terrible vengeaunce god toke vppon king predecessours whiche committed suche offence rebuke wicked spirit came vpon colredus predecessoure whiche defiler uirgins breaker ecclesiasticall priuileges sitting royally among barrons dinner diuell plucked away soule without confession sinnes diuell also drewe suche rage osredus king northumbers whiche guiltie crime vile death loste kingdome life lusty yong age also charles king fraunce whiche ouerthrewe church altered churche money hys owne vse consumed long tormet fearefull death followeth therefore deare beloued sonne fatherlye earnest prayer beseeche despise counsel father diligently admonishe highnesse nothing commodious good king willinglye amend faultes warned salomo sayth loueth discipline loueth wisdome therfore deere son declaring aduice beseech liuing god sonne jesus christ lord hys holy spirit remember transitorie present life howe shorte momentane pleasure filthie fleshe vile shamefull thing man shall leaue euill example vnto posteritie euer beginne therefore frame life better wayes amend error youth may obtayne prayse men life eternall glorie life come wish highnesse well fare encrease goodnesse ethelbald slayne secgeswald buryed hrependune beraredus murtherer ethelbald seaueteene yeares buryed warham deede noble ordeyned thenceforth king wiues called queenes suffered sitte place estate eadburge infinite treasure fled france offering greate portion hir golde king charles france sayd vnto hir choose eadburge whome thou wilte haue thy husband sonne answered choyse granted choose sonne bycause younger quoth charles thou hadst chosenafter vvicked life follovved miserable end queene eadburge thou shouldest haue sonne bycause thou hast chosen sonne thou shalt haue neyther gaue hir monasterie wherein professed hirselfe nunne became abbesse yeares afterwards christian within four dayes fought battell paganes assendune paganes deuided themseluesbattayle assendune two battels two king christian sawe likewise deuided armie two companyes determined king ethelred battell shoulde goe againste two pagan king battell brother aelfrede armye shoulde set pagan duke theyr armyebattayle assendoune thing thus ordered king farried long hys prayer pagan readilye prepared came chipenhane battel pitched aelfred seeing muste either retire sette enemiessca cron brother come straight way set vpon though place battel vnequall pagan gotten higher grounde christian brought battel valley place one onely thorne tree short tree battels met ioyned wher long time fought hubba one king fiue earles many thousandes moe pagan slaine chased great heape stone layd copped riuer wily whiche riuer whole shyre taketh hys name foughte greate parte daye pagan fled seeing fewnesse pursued sette themselues battayle againe got fielde weast saxon made league pagan vppon condition shoulde departe theyr countrey next yeare wintred london made league mercy nexte yeare wintered lindesey kingdome northumberlande next yere ripindune constrayned burgoredus king mercy flee seest burne thou art glad eate ere halfe baked woman thought bin k aelfred made many battels dane gotte manye victory god onely vouchsafe giue victorie ouer enemy also wearied sight owne people ende side ouer whome cruelly tryumphed long departed life geynesburge left canutus sonne successour kingdome etheldrede hearing swanus dead leauing normandie duke richard sister sonne emma wife child hadde hyr returned al speede englande edmunde sonne hys firste wife ma state trustinesse men ayde norman moued warre enimie canutus finding himselfe vnable matche went denmarke minding returne hither immediatly againe etheldred contrarie expectation thus restored kingdome shewed great crueltie vpon dane remained england sparing neither man woman yong old therefore canutus desirous reuenge prepared london riuer thamis doth runne dane fleeing king followed passing ouer brentford vanquished notable victorie rest ye dane remayned cnute whileslondon beseeged land vvater edmond rested set matter order againe beseege london water lande citizen stoutely withstoode repulsed wherefore shewed anger vpon countrey mercy spoyling townes uillages robbery burning murther caryed pray shippes whiche gathered togither riuer medway runneth rochester whence driuen king taking foorde brentford put flight slew great number sixt last battell essendone essex neere rochford battell edmond gote victoriecogshal sca cro edrike agayne playing traytor greate slaughter englishman made honor englande ouerthrowen edmonde wente almost alone foote glocester hee gathered newe force set vpon enimies cnute pursued fledde hauing prepared army king themselues attempted fight hand hand right thecombate kingdome kingdome ile olania seuerne combate weeryed fell couenant deuide one halfe kingdome shoulde beengland deuided vnder canutus halfe vnder edmond edmond long dyed oxford whereas saide slayne treason edrike straton buryed glastenbury leauing edmonde edwarde child yong edrike long vnrewarded according desertes hymselfe making vaunt thereof vnto canutus baynardes castell london sayde wise thus haue done canutus loue theeedrikus traytor whome answered saying thou shalt dye well thou art woorthy bycause thou art giltie treason god thou hast slayne thine owne lord king ioyned league brother bloud vpon thine owne head straight wayes least tumulte traytor samespeculum histo ri cirecest chamber tormented death firebrand linkes feete bounde togither drawne streetes citie cast ditch called houndes ditch citizen cast deadhunsditch treason revvarded dogges filth accompting chalenged england himselfe alone law call growing easie thing bycause man durst erect himselfe patrone defend childrens right title suttle craftie interpretation couenant dane gote monarchie england slew brother edmond conueyed child farre away england least time brought againe receiue right say sent certaynethe king child conueyed svvethen man prince swethland dispatched waye prince vnderstanding king child spared cotrarie credit trust committed vnto appeareth true foraigne lord kept brought vppe child honourablye yongest whiche whose name edwarde afterwardes marrie agatha theagatha emperor daughter vvife edvvarde daughter henry fourth emperour rome whome many child whiche shall speake heereafter ye elder brother whose name edmond dyed without child meane season canutus bycause heire lawfully might succeede kingdome harold swaine begotte ofharolde svvayne concubine child concubin partly might establish time come kingdome gotten vnto owne kindred yt came lawfull succession partly might purchase himselfe friendship englishman norman procured haue giuen marriage emma widow king etheldred time edward alured hir sonnes exile duke richard normandy whiche mariage seemeth made euen god prouidence determined restore common wealth england whereby law title recouerie returne exile monarchie england dane taken englishman possessed sixe twentie yeares returne againe englishman right heires emma concluded mariage dane vpon conditionmariage made vpon conditio kingdome england remayne vnto none child begotten hir remaine aliue reason mariage shortly beare canutus sonne owne name commonly called hardycanutus second name giuen bycause greathovv tvvo name vvere giuen king courage like brother harold named harefoote say lightfoote bycause notable swiftnesse foote affinitie aliance dane became strength power kept englishman seruice long liued subdued scottes whereby king england canutus king foure kingdomes scotland denmarke norway went denmarke rome returned againe england kept good iustice life many charitable deedes made faire church ashendume essex founded anew monasterie saint edmondesbury saint edmundsbury buylded ex charta regia marianus restoring donation edmond king west saxon giuen saint edmund king martyr lyeth buryed appoynted king norway swanus sonnemarianus sayde alfgine daughter althelme duke northampton lady vulfrune said priest sonne shomakers daughter affirming himselfe sonne canutus andpeter de ich marianus floriacen alfgina earle northhamptons daughter slept vppon occasion oportunitie offered vsing force dane dwelt england inuaded realme brother hardycanute gouerned denmarke tooke mother law emma parte rich treasure canute father left hir consent great lord began raigne mightily father canutus iust heire hardycanutus looked wherevpon kingdome deuided north part harold south hardycanute edward alfred sonnes king ethelred many knightes came normandy see mother winchester whiche sore troubled mindes many greate men bare fauour king harold especially godwine earle kent feigning receiue alfred friend came meete end put prison parte companye put fetter put eye caused skinne plucked ouer eares chopping hand feete commanded solde diuers murthered gilforde queene emma hearing dealing sent hir sonne edward backe againe normandy alfride conueyed ile eely eye firste plucked deliuered monckes kept prisoner shortly hee departed life buryed south ile west part church bycause hardycanutus delayed come ouer sent vtterly reiected harold king mercy northumbers chosen king england shortly expelled mother law emma realme raigned three yeares dyed oxford buryed westminster saint clements without templebarre london hardycanutus lawfull begotten sonne canutus and1041 emma soone gotten father kingdome fetched home mother exile reuenge displeasure done hir murther brother alured commanded carkas harold digged earth throwen riuer thamis fisher taken vp brought dane buryed church yard hadthis supposed clements church vvithout temple barre london done king appoynted eyght markes payde euery sayler name twelue markes euery pilote maister tribute payd al england greeuous scarce able beare shortly sent edward sonne etheldred brother mother side come england embraced loue fauour mariage feast pleasantly drincking bride person middest cup fell suddaynely downe ground remaining dumbe departed life third yeare raigne buried father winchester edward borne islip besides oxford sonne etheldred alfridus beuerla io rouse hardycanutus sent england crowned winchester edward excellet holynesse vntill day called saint edward soone gotten father kingdome owne free released tribute pound called dane gelt whichdane gelt english people euen beginning reigne dane compelled pay king euerythe first com ing vp common lavv yeare also chiefe author cause law call common law first brought vp gathered togither lawes ordinaces four nation receiued island subiect diuers regiment gouernances witte mercy west saxon dane northumbers mercy vvest saxon dane northumbers hard mother bycause hard minoritie also suspected alwine bishop winchester whome put prison counsell roberte archbishop canturbury mother purged hirselfe alwine deliuered robert archbishop conueyed himselfe england tooke wife edgitha sea cron daughter earle godwine bycause broughtedgitha vvas barreyne forth child neyther hope beare whe see many gaye kingdome began carefull one iustly succeede therfore following reason commo law sent home england nephew edward sonne king edmond brother reason log absence countrey comonly called ye outlaw edward sonne king edmond surnamed ironside remained aliue whome canutus gotten england sent swethen brother knowing aduise uncle came againe england brought agatha wife edgar margaret christian child borne panonia hope kingdome liued thus edward disappoynted nephew heire edward outlaw neerenesse bloud lawfull succession right heire vnto kingdome withoute delaye pronounced edgar outlawes sonne greate nephew bee heire kingdome gaue surname adeling name dayes peculiar onely king child borne hope possibilitie kingdome thys worde adeling english tong much say prince lorde contrary word vnderling isthe signification vvord adeling say seruan bondman according walche speech adeling signifieth heire bycause edgar yong yeares within age testamente made harold sonne godwine stoute man warre peace regent vntill yong edgar age receyue kingdome made king thing harold solemne oth promised see performed done notwithstanding like traytour force armes immediately death edward refused name regent pronounced himselfealfridus beuerl speculum histo r cirecest flores histo king whiche thing shortly brought destruction himselfe england anno eustace earle bullogne wifefloriacen goda sister king edward arriued douer one men quarelling aboute lodging slewe one townesmen reuenge whereof quareller company many towne slayne whiche muche offended godwine earle kent assembled great power wherewith marched toward glocester king lay vnto whome sent messenger denounce warre except would deliuer eustace fellow norman bolognians held castell dominion kent godwins armie entered glocester agreed day appoynted king earle godwine meete london thus departing time king increasing armie ledde london godwine power came southwarke side riuer thamis bycause armie little little stipped fledde king forthwith pronounced fiue sonnes banished straightwayes wife two sonnes came thorney shippe laden golde siluer precious thing sayled towarde flanders sonnes tooke shippe bristow sayled ireland next yeare harold leofwine sonnes earle godwine returning ireland entred seuerne arriued many shippes somerset dorsetshires spoyled many townes countrey slew many people returned pray sayle portesmouth c earle godwine landed kent gathered power sayled ile wight wasting along sea coastes till sonnes harold leofwine came nauy come togither take course vp riuer thamis came southwarke stayed tide weyed vp anchor finding none offered resist bridge sayled vp south side riuer armie land placing selfe vppon banckes side made shew thicke terrible battayle nauie turned toward north shore though would haue compassed king nauie king godwine abhorred fight againste owne kindred countreymen wherefore peace made godwine sonnes restored former honor norman banished land william malmesbury writeth certayne yong woman w malme king euill healed king terribly diseased reason humor gathered hir necke great swelling kernel came king edward right hand dipped water handled hir necke forthwith ye hardnesse breake wormes matter ranne noysome dwelling asswaged perfectly hole faire skinned ere weeke ended knewe life sayd oft cured plague normandy edward raigned three twentie yeres sixe monethest rudborn odde dayes buryed day epiphanie abbey saint peeter westminster newly builded day harold eldest sonne godwine earle kent brother edgitha queene hauing obteyned fayth nobilitie tooke crowne leofrike earle mercia hereford founded monasterie couentrie anno also granted great priuiledges towne harold might behalfe seeme make the1066 yeare lord beginneth heere christmas yong edgar amendes wrong done gaue earledome oxford king made earle meane season england began tossed turmoyled warres within without disheriting right heire alwayes wont beginning ciuill warres day aprill comete appeared people land also part world seauen dayes toftus enuying men said prosperitie og houed simon nel gualter couen brother stirred vp trouble realme ioyning himselfe harold king norway assaulted england warlike sort sea land whose attempt while harold england prepared withstand william duke normandy notwithstading bastardvvilliam conquerour cousyn king edvvard mother side kinne saint edward thirde fourth degree consanguinitie seeing conuenient time occasion offered take kingdome gathered nauie shippes came england well appoynted armie alledging right title due gift king edward kinsman also couenant made othe established betwixt harold landed pemsey nine milesgualter couen hastings september harold notwithstanding bare men reason battel fought toftus men norway yet hearing williams comming wente straightwayes againste army broughte aray battell fought wherin great slaughter englishman made andengland conquered vvoden bovves arovves norman gote victorie especially meanes wodden bowes arrowes englishman vse duke william commanded men thatio rouse shoote directly forwarde vpward reason whereof arrow shot vpward destroyed english stouped arrow shot directly afore hand wounded stoode vpright king harold himselfe countie kent declared peril danger imminent miserie neighbour come pride insolencie norman hardnesse griefe bondage seruile estate wherevpon people rather choosing end vnfortunate life submit themselues vnaccustomed yoke seruitude bondage common consent determined meete duke william fight law countrey foresayd stigand archbishop abbot egelsin choosing rather die battell see nation euill estate encouraged example holy machabees became captayne armie day appoynted people met swanescombe two mile west grauesend hidden wood lay priuily wayte comming foresayd duke william bycause hurt wary case agreed hande duke come passage euery side stopped end way able escape euery one well horseman footemen beare boughes hand next day whe duke come field territory neere vnto swanescombe saw countrey set placed round bin stirring mouing wood meane pace approched drewe neere vnto great discomfiture mind wondered sight soone captaynes kentishmen sawe duke william enclosed middest armie caused trumpet sounded banner displayed threw downe boughes bowes bent sword drawne speares kinde weapon stretched forthe shewed themselues readie fight duke william stoode maruell sore astonied amazed thought already england fast fist dispaire owne life therefore behalfe kentishmen sent vnto duke william archbishop stigand egelsin abbot saint augustine told message sort lord duke behold people kent commeth forth meete receiue liege lord requiring hand thing pertayne peace vnder condition people kent may enioy euer antient liberty may euermore vse lawes customes countrey otherwise ready presently bidde battell minded rather die heere altogither departe lawes customes countrey submit themselues bondage whereof yet neuer experience duke seeing driuen straight narrow pinch calledfrederike abbot albons policie duke vvilliam fretherike hearing comming duke william hartfordshire caused wood betwixt london saint albons felled man could eyther ride go way thus abbot kept monasterie duke william might come fayne coast ouer castell barkehamsteede vnder suretie sent frederike abbot saint albons demanded felling wood made place frederike answered saide spirituall men land done indeuour shoulde haue bin thy power haue entred land farre spiritualtie great power duke william answered may liue reioyce shall loose power make lesse specially beginne thee abbot thought said farre soone might departed home called chapiter breethre tolde duke william tooke leaue went eely neuer returned duke william toke much liuelode saint albons christmasse would crowned glocester whitsontide westminster easter winchester feastes kept great royaltie made comons bare himselfe riche proude port great belly balde heade bigge man part body good archer right fewe might bende bowe preferred byshoppe london long hys prudencie sincere fidelitie admitted counsel moste victorious prince william king englande name first obteyned great large priuiledges famous citie senate citizen lo hauing well deserued haue made continued bishop xx yeares died yere christ natiuitie marble monument thee thy citizen assigne rewardes father far vnfit desert thine thee vnto faithfull friend thy london people founde thys towne small weyght stay sure sounde liberty restorde mean thee haue publike weale meanes thee large gift haue felte seen thy rich stocke beautie braue one houre hathe supprest yet thy vertues good deedes v euer reste king william leauing brother odo byshop bayon marianus ypodigm neustri william fitz osberne made earle hereforde warden england retourned normandie countesse githa mother king harolde sister swanus king denmarke manye fleeing cittie escaped got ouer flaunders citizen yeelded kinganno reg ypodigma mathild wife king william came forth normandie whitsonday consecrated queene aldred archebyshop yorke marleswin gospatricke noble menne northumberlande auoyde king williams roughe boysterous dealing taking edgar etheling mother agatha two sister margaret christian wente sea scotlande receiued well entertayned malcoline king scottes tooke margaret sister edgar wifeiohn rouse king william armye wente notingham andcastel notingham yorke lincolne builded builded castel went yorke made two castels put garisons comaunded also castels made lincolne place yere henrie king sonne borne englad rudborne earle northumberlande slaine eldest son robert william rufus borne normandie conquered england king william gaue robert commin earledomeliber dunelme anno reg northumberland entred force duresme outrage done men slaine men countrey bishoppes palace thatsea cro himselfe receyued honourablye king william came afterward vpon slewe euery one agelricus bishop durham accused treason was1069 imprisoned westminster brother egelwine made bishop soone banished englishman fledde englande hauyng edgar captaine returned scotlande sodainely set vpon garisons king william sette yorke put flighte slewe possessed citie pronounced edgar king long king william came great armye recouered thr citie constrayning edgar retourne scollande edgar seeing coulde make partye good king william adioyned vnto hym canutus king dane promising hym halfe kingdome thus entred englande came yorke normaines left defende citie setteyorke brent suburbes fire enimies shoulde haue commoditie winde droue fire high set cittie fire garisons forced flee enimies hand kirmish slaine norman wherevppon north parte england fell william edgar william word slaughter men hee great trauel came yorke fought hys enimies put flighte canutus dane got shippes edgar englishman escaped retourned scotland king william spoyled countrey beyonde humber dearth england men eate horsses anno reg man flesh good meate ioh taxtor monastery rifled cattes dogges man flesh king william bereaued monastery abbayes englande theyr golde siluer sparing neyther chalice shrine appropriating sayd monastery abbayes himselfe also brought vnder knightes seruice bishoprickes abbayes held barony bin free secular bondage appointing howe many souldiours finde successours time warre counsel winchester stigand deposed ypodigma stigand deposed apostata archebishop money got bishopricke lanfranke chosen archbishop canturburie anno reg edwine earle mercia marcherus earle northuberlande swardus earle egelwine bishop durham many cleargie laitie keeping thenoble men fled wooddes able abyde king displeasure last came ile elie herewarde captaine sore afflicted countrey king william besieging ile sauing herewarde submitted plesure committed perpetual prison put death ransomed hereward strong hande broughte men ile escaped castell lede kent builded creueken anno reg ex libro castel leder oxforde builded iohn rouse mathew paris yorke subiect canturburie anno reg anno reg castel oxforde robert de olly two noble men came england william conquerour counsel holden windsore primacie church canturburie ouer churche yorke examined founde good aucthoritie olde writing church yorke ought subiect church canturburie faithfully obey king william great power inuaded scotland forced malcoline homage fealtie king william greate power englishman wente normand e broughte hym henrie anno reg king richarde taken prison emperour kepte hym prison yeare fiue monthes enuyed hys valiauncie hadde shewed proofe hys prowes wolfangus lazius hys booke de romano imperio affirmeth leopolde austria hadde taken king richard iniurie done house austria heeking richard england builded vvals vienna compelled hym builde walles aboute vienna chiefest cittie austria whyche wals wythin oure memorie defended germanie inuasion turke rumor spredde king richarde takenearle iohn rebelled king richard yee haue hearde forth wyth frenche king erle iohn made greate conspiracie togyther meaning take kingdome englande herevppon greate number flemmings assembled witsa e innumerable multitude flemmings readye come ouer theyr messenger taken treason bewrayed elianor olde queene caused sea coastes bee watched ouer flaunders notwithstanding erle iohn came secreetely englande rayse walchmen scottes king scottes woulde ayde hym walchmen partes kingstone windsore toke prayes ferme citizen thereof pound yerely paid auntient time bene accustomed fermed king henrie first graunted citizen pounde yearely also gaue full aucthoritie chose depriue sherifes theyr pleasure sherifes arnolde fitz arnolde richard fitz barthelmew maior henrie fitz alwyne king iohn made lawe tunne wine poiters price vvines gual couen solde dearer twentie shilling anioye foure twentie shilling french wine fiue twentie shilling vnlesse french wine good woulde giue sixe twentie shilling eyghte penny aboue sexter wine poiters dearer twelue penny white wine aboue sixe penny king iohn hauing made peace beyonde sea required annoreg taske aide realme xxx markes wherefore edict made euery plow land pay three shilling troubled lande sore considering escuage went afore euery knight fee two markes whiche neuer payde aboue twentie shilling king deuorced wife isabel earleking iohn deuorsed mathew paris ypodigma radul cogshal glocesters daughter passed ouer sea paide thirtie markes french king vanquished william king scottes homage king scottes rotland lorde galloway many noble men homage one twetith day nouember noble man aquitaine named hugh brune rebelling1201 hugh brune rebelled king iohn inuaded diuers part prouince bicause king maried daughter earle angolesme sayd brune affied custodie wherefore passed ouer restrained rebel attemptes june arose cruell tempest thunder ypodigma annoreg tempestes lightning hayle vehemente raine destroyed corne cattell menne house brenning c july another tempest much like former hapned medowes could mowed hay downe carried away outragious course water ouerflowed grounde greate number fish corruption water dyed many bridge borne downe corne hay caried away many men drowned al men thought new deluge bene come sherifes walter fitz ali simon de adermanbury maior henrie fitz alwyne king iohn sharplye warred vppon earle march radulphu cog hugh brune earle eue hys brother beeing able resist complayned phillip king france soueraigne chiefe lorde sent ofttimes king iohn mouing cease vexing woulde serue wherefore sommoned annoreg noble fraunce duke earle aquitaine anioy come vnto courte frenche king stande iudgement hys peeres kyng iohn denyedk iohn somoned french king court wherevpon courte adiudged hym depriued landes predecessours helde king fraunce c king phillip forth assembled armye inuaded castel buteuant normandie king richard buylded rased ground tooke land hugh gorney castels tooke castell albomarle county eue land arch none resisting also arthure earle britayne made knight french king whosearthure earle britayne taken yonger daughter fianced sixteene yeres olde wente hugh brune geffrey lucingnam knightes beseeged castell mirable queene eleanor aunte enclosed king iohn came power deliuered mother daunger tooke vpon seyne builded king richard bin valiantly kept connestable chester sherifes walter browne william chamberlayne maior henry fitz alwyne king iohn doubting treason owne men december retourned embassadoures treate peace king france bycause worlde wente woulde agree wise except arthure mighte deliuered aliue dead woulde haue sister mariage land side sea shortly tooke falaise caen forth countrey barflot charburgh dunfront roane vernoll arch proude normandy angiow briteyne mayne poitow thoraigne within short time deliuered king phillip king iohn marryed iane hys bastarde daughter lewlin prince wale gaue hir castell lordshippe elingsmore march southwales robert fitz parnell earle leycester dyed without issueliber bernewell simon de mountford sayer de quincy deuided earledome betwixt bycause sayer de quincy father simon mountford marryed sister sayd robert sherifes thomas hauerell hamond bronde maior henry fitz alwyne fourtenth day january beganne frost whiche continued till two twentith day marche sogreat frost grounde coulde bee tilled whereof came passe sommer folowing quarter wheate solde marke siluer many place englande dearth corne whiche parte dayes king henry seconde solde twelue penny quarter beanes pea halfe marke quarter otes forty penny wont solde foure penny also thenno reg money sore clipped remedie haue renued king iohn gathered greate armyes menne haue gone ouer sea beeing sayled onwarde voyage hee returned againe tooke escuage two markes halfe euery knightes fee englande pretending quarrell agaynste hys baron bycause theyiohn taxtor would gate saue one londoner comming king henry hoste yeelded citie wherefore confirmed liberty londoner meete haue lengthe baron fraunce one eustace le moyne gret man fraunce hauing prepared nauie lx ship set forward come englad aide lewes hubert de brugh conestable douer castel multitude armed men ship fiue porte met sea slew eustace leader escaped fifteen ship al wer taken drowned lewes heard wist doe wherevppon compelled necessitie sued peace length legate bishop noble englande meeting ile neere vnto kingstone treatie peace togither sayde lewes presence released excommunication renounced realme england peace restored thirteenth day september lewes returnedlevves returned france fro benefit absolution peace wer exempted bishop abbot pryors al ye cleargy whyche borne fauour good lewes viell septemb searle mercer october frier preacher thirteene number sente englande hauing prior gilbert de fraxineto company beter de roche bishop winchester came canturbury presenting themselues archbishoppe stephen commaunded saide prior preach lyked well euer loued order saint laurence day came london oxford day assumption whose ho builded oratorie also schooles since called saint oxwards schooles whose parishe tooke place time remayned remoued place without walles whyche king assygned king henry subdued welchmen rebelled nobleman graunted king twoo markes euery hide lande isabell aboute tooke violence twelue abbot horsses away cruelly beating men c while foresayde daubney laboured pacifie vprore abbot gotte backe dore house boate thamis hardlye escaped citizen throwing stone woulde rule hymselfe hys pleasure forthwith made ye charter ye liberty forrests frustrate alledging graunted while vnder warde power owne bodie followed yt woulde enioy liberty afore graunted muste duke october upon day saint paules conuersition roger niger bishop london masse cathedrall church saint paule greate multitude people sodainely weather waxed darke one coulde scantly see another churche sodainely horrible thunder clappe lighted churche shaken though shoulde haue fallen darke cloude came lightning churche seemed fire stincke men thought shoulde haue died thousandes men womenne ran churche astonied fell vppon grounde voyde al vnderstanding none al multitude taried churche saue bishoppe one deacon stoode stil high alter awayting wil godanno reg king henrie great army sayled againe naturall subiectes submitted himselfe counsel richard marshal ireland raising warre geffreynicholas triuet de marisco slaine buried kilkeny gilbert brother succeeded earledome yere great dearth doubtyng destroyed vermine commanded deliuer husbande men dwelte hys manor vppon condition paye muche newe corne haruest would giue none poore god sake fortuned men came greate stacke corne neygh towne ripon belonging sayde archbishoppe therecorne ful vermine appeared sheues ouer heades wormes serpentes toades voyce hearde corne mowe saying laye handes corne archebyshoppe hee hathe diuelles honor came visit vnto whome chanons answered hauing learned bishop ought contempt toarchbishop canturbury visiteth saint barthelmevves smithfield beateth supprior channons c visited answere much misliked archbishop forthwith fell subprior smote face fiste saying indeede indeede doth become english traytors answere thus raging othes recited rent peeces rich coape subprior trode vnder feete thrust piller chancell almost killed ye chanons seeing subprior almost dead ranne plucked archbishop violence ouerthrew backwards whereby might see armed prepared fight archbishop men seeing mayster downe stranger maysters countreymen borne prouance fell vpon chanons beate tare trode vnder feete length chanons getting away well could ranne bloudy mirie rent torne bishop london complayne bade go king westminster tell thereof wherevpon foure went thither rest able sore hurt came westminster king woulde neyther heare see returned without redresse meane season whole citie vprore readie haue rong common bell haue hewed archbishop small peeces secretly gotte away lambeth frier order preacher christendome hierusalem common conuocation assembled togither house holborne london entreate estate made england charter liberty forest kept instance boniface archbishop canturbury accursed shuld breake lewlin prince wale gathering mighty ad inuaded cheshire ye king lately giue son edward destroyed noble confirmation actes chosen twelue peeres whiche authoritie correct ye breaker king breethren noble men baron taking oth see obserued shortly banished william valence galfrede stranger banished gwydon aylmer elect winchester foure breethren king mother side stranger great dearth followed wet yeare passed quarterdearth corne wheate solde fifteene shilling twenty shilling worst could none found money wherethrough many poore people costrayned eate horse flesh barkes tree many staruedcro ouesham want foode twentie thousand london sayd iew tewkesburie fell priuie vpon saterdaya ievv drovvned woulde reuerence sabboth plucked wherefore richard clare earle glocester kept till munday time foundeanno reg ex record tho w ke dead richard clare earle glocester dyed also brother william richard walbroke september sherifes maior macy french man connestable glocester robert glocest thomas fitz thomas fitz richard october sir macy de bescile frenchman king made sherife connestable glocester wherwith baros offended chose sherife placed knight countrey called sir william tracy sir william keeping court vpon day towne glocester macy frenchman number armed men came sodeinely vpon drew ground castel cast prison whereof whe baron vnderstoode sent roger clifford sir iohn gifford great power glocester beseeging castellclocester castell taken baron brent bridge entred last tooke said macy company carpenter fro castell quarell slaine esquier baron partie sir iohn gifford made carpenter leape top castell wherethrough crushed death sir roger clifford tooke keeping castell vpon sente macy march sir iohn gifford tooke macies goodes sherestone elsewhere peter de egblonuch frenchman bishop hereford bishop hereford french man drawne cathedrall churche thomas turberuill sent castel erdesley sir macy committed safe ward treasure spoyled chanons sent prison thus frenchman serued land mought founde baron part simon de mountfort baron pitched theyr tent istleworth parke manor istleworth belo gingtho wikes richard king almayne burnt londoner also burned another house neere westminster meane king queene remainedthe queene chased nicho triuet tower london queene would haue gone water vnto windesore londoner getting bridge great number vnder must passe cried hir vsing many vile reprochful word threw durt stone hir constreyned returne againe tower citizen fortified citie iron chaynes drawne ouerthwart theirstreetes lo chayned annales hyde streetes munited citie maruellous thing peace concluded betwixte king baron condition henry sonne kyng almayne tooke baron parte prison shoulde deliuered king castels england put baron hand prouisions oxford shoulde kept stranger within certaine time depart land except whose abode faithfull person realme one assent shoulde accept lastly englishman borne faithfull men kingdome shoulde order rule businesse land vnder king notwithstanding certayne knightes king part fortified castel windesore vittayles armour edward king sonne came bristow discorde rose betwixte knightes townesmen townesmen minded haue beseeged castell whiche edward vnderstoode sent walter bishop winchester tooke baron part company might go court father promising perswade father peace heerevpo going forth bishop til came windsore entred castell great misliking bishop edward shortly returned wente meete simon earle leicester adherent co ming beseege windesore castell edward king sonne met sayd simon kingston offered meanes peace simon trusting bishop walter counsell deteyned edward woulde suffer depart till castell yeelded within hauing libertie departe whither woulde stranger minded passe sea safeconducts granted lewlin prince wale confederate earle simon meane time wasted countrey chester march ouerthrew grounde castle diffard gannoke parliament holden london many held earle went king part henry almaine sonne richard king romaynes king partie encreased wente douer endeuoured haue gotte castell earlesanno reg hand trauelled vayne robert mountpiler osbert suffolk september sherifes maior thomas fitz thomas fitz richard october lewes king fraunce throughe procuring boniface archbishop canturburie politicke sermon paris well frier prechers minor declared doings betwixt king englande earle leicester toke vpon make peace betwixte wherevpon king englande sonne edwarde diuerse english nobilitie came paris aboute xxij januarie earle leicester fearing ye french king displeasure mother sake cause knowen stayed home england proceeded hys businesse wherefore roger mortimer began destroye possession earle uf leicester helde againste prince wale went besieged castel radnore brought yeelde edward king sonne returne paris lent toke iourney toward march passingthe schollers burgess oxforde one spoyle oxford burgess shut vp gate againste hym whereby forced lye king hall without towne till next morrowe departed schollers oxford shut within towne brake vppe gate leadeth toward bea monte deede maior sent prison long whyle schollers dinner maior common wyth banner displayde thoughte haue spoyled clearkes ere bin aware espied schollers ran togither bowes weapon slewe wounded burgess common brake vp manye house spoyling good set house portriues william spicer geffrey hencley fier south side towne moreouer bycause maior nicholas kingstone uintener brake vp uintryclarkes oxforde banished dranke wine spoyled facte king caused clearkes schollers banished uniuersitie edward king sonne toke castels hay huntington belonging earle hereforde castel brecon also rendered deliuered roger mortimer keepe teritorie adiacent robert ferrers earle darbie toke part erle simon besiegedvvorcester besieged worcester entring olde castel spoyled citizen good compelled jewes christenedglocester besieged towne glocester taken baros assailed edward king son entred ye castel great force next morning meanes bishop worcester reignald abbot glocester truce taken betwixt baron town king sonne castell shortly baron fled burgess submitting themselues hanged residue cast prison grieuously raunsomed towne destroyed whence king sonne departed spoyling wasting country contrarie othe made baron till came oxforde lodged house frier prechers ioyned power king father lately come thyther make offering saint friswide fearing superstitious opinion yt king entred ye town uirgin would auenged kyng hauing brother richard king wente towardes notingham wasting fire sworde maner place baron gathered lordes great men earle simon went london thence rochester rochester besieged whiche iohn earle warren defended bridge first gate wherof wonne informed king comming towards london lefte siege went backe meete hym king turning waye london toke castel kenington kingston wascastel kingstone taken erle glocesters going rochester chased away remayned siege slewe many moe thence went tonbridge castel whereof toke county glocester within leauing garrison therecastel tonbridge taken went winchester receiued v porte peace passing lewes receiued ye priory son castel wher while remained baron writ letter ye may read mathew paris nicholas triuet taking effect ye baron armes approched towards lewes inuading ye king peoplebattel levves wer gone forth forrage wherof king warned goeth forth meete army deuided three sort first led edward king son hauing william de valence erle penbroke iohn de waren earle surrey sussex seconde guided richard k almain wt son henrie third k gouerning baron army deuided four wardes first led henrie de mountfort wt erle hereford seconde led gilbert de clare wyth iohn fitz iohn willia de moutchance third londoner nicholas segraue fourth erle simo led thomas de pelueston edwarde king sonne hys battayle brake enimies made giue backe many drowned londoner put flyghte whilest king sonne pursued space foure mile made great slaughter separate fro rest army weakened part sore meane time manye king battayle slaine king almaine taken windmil syrthe king almaine taken iohn de beuis robert le bruis iohn commyne brought scottes king henrie also hauing hys horsse slaine vnder yeelded earle gloucester king henrie taken sent prisoner priory edward returning receyued sharpe battayle earle waren william de valence grey de lesmute king halfe brother hugh bigod armes nuber haberions gotte castel pemsey many slayne eyther side lorde edwarde ryding aboute towne sound father priorie meane time assault giuen castle valiauntly defended baron withdrew wherevpon lord edward greatly incouraged hauing gathered people woulde haue made new battayle baron sued peace whiche ye meanes frier preacher minor brought passe friday following lord edwarde henrie theyr father england almayne king deliuered themselues earle simon vpon hope quietnesseedvvard king son taken peace might concluded saterdaye king licenced aboute depart theyr house writ vnto tonbridge castel shoulde molest baron returned homewardes notwithstanding armes heard londoner fled battaile receiued croydon hasted king sonne deliuered slain battayle lewes fought xij may aboute robert glocest vvestchepe london brent men time gret part westcheape london brent treason erle simon led k son edward himw hey whiche belonged earle hereforde toke castel ludlow wastyng ye castel ludlovv taken landes roger mortimer goeth towardes mountgomerie taking pledge peace ye sayd noble turneth south part meete power sayd come fraunce king ayde pope vrbane sent legate cardinall bishop sabrine englande might enter realm fiue port prohibiting wherevpon called certain english bishop first amience bulloigne committed sentence excomunication pronounced citie london fiue porte al troubled king englads peace byshops dissembled matter yeare june notable blasing starre appeared one ben seene age rising east gret brightnesse vnto midst ofblasing starre nic triuet rober glocester anno reg sherifes semisperie drew streame continued till michaelmas gregory rokesley thomas deford septem arose simond kept king commanded auoyde realme iohn de waren earle surrey sussex william de valece erle penbroke brought great power sea weast part wale arriuing penbroke earle simon leading king went hereforde gathered great power oppresse sayd knight prelate laboured peace edward king son ye castel hereford permitted exercise himselfe horssebackeedvvard king son taken keeper medowe without citie keeper wearied diuerse horsses mounting fresh appointed purpose rode quite away passing riuer wey two knight foure esquire folowed hard keeper aduised standarts roger mortimere roger clifford comming reliefe returned escaped wigmore chaunced whitson weeke lord edward thus escaped gathereth army confederateth submitteth countreys hereford worcester salop chester townes city castelles also winneth force citie glocester whiche earle simon lately fortifyed townes men led castel xv dayes yeelded departed earle leicester wan castle monmouth layde flat grounde entring lande earle glocester called glomorgan meeting prince wale castel monmouth raced comming ayde destroyed al fire sword edwarde king sonne hearing manye earle simonds partaker come castel kenilworthe takyng erle glocester departed worcester came vpon sodaine toke earle oxford sir william mountchalsie sir adam newmarch sir walter de solenle simon sonne earle simon hardly escaped castell earle leicester hauing king returned southwales lammas daye came kemsey place bishop worcester tarried next day edwarde king son returned kenelworth worcester whose returne knowne erle simon departing kemsey vnhappy chaunce stayed towne euesham ye morrow ij august edward king son departed worcester passing riuer neare towne called cliue closed vp passage betwixt earle simon simon son killingworth next mornyng lord edward approched encountred ech large fielde without towne earles part hadde worste earle killed fielde henrie sonne earle simon peter de mountfort hugh dispencer justice england william de mandeuile ralph basset turned backe kenilworth castel sixth september releasedking almain deliuered king almain mother brother sir reimond fitz pierce many parliament holden winchester thea parliament vvinchester statute made oxforde disanulled good againste king seased london great danger haue bin destroyed king displeasure conceyued ye citizen citizen wholly submitted liues good vnto eight person carrying submission toward windsor met sir roger leyborne knight colbrooke turned backe againe discoursed whole matter willed deliuer submission woulde moue king whiche thing sixe dayes thys knight returned citie sayde king receyued writing willing first take away chaines streetes citie pull postes grounde fixed bring chaynes postes tower london maior fortie citizen nexte day following attende vpon king windsor confirme theyr wryting shoulde goe come safe witnesse whereof deliuered king letter seale space foure dayes next daye citizen windsore attended gate vntill king came hunting whiche time woulde looke king entred woulde haue followed forbidden shortly called castell locked vp towre homely entertainment nexte day king gaue vnto prince edwarde maior foure alderman ye rest committed seueral prisonsanno reg sherifes maior pierce longtofe robert brune edward blund peter aunger september thomas fitz thomas fitz richard october king henrie came westminster gaue vnto diuerse housholde seruauntes aboute number three score housholdes house within citie owner compelled agree redeeme theyr house good else auoyde made custos citie sir othon conestable tower chose baylifes accomptable iohn adrian walter haruy king toke pledge best men sonnes citie whiche put tower london kept costes parent great labour sute made al foresayde person whiche windsor castell eight except deliuered king agreed citizen twentie thousand markes payd leauying fine taxed wel seruauntes housholders many refused liberty citie quit charge castell douer yeelded edward king sonne put guy de mountfort kepte othobone shortly comming counsel holden northampton accursed al bishoppes priest ayded earle simon king especially cursed name walter worcester henrie london stephen chichester bishop lincolne worcester shortly deceased glocest ther three went rome assoyled legate also published pope bull tenthes church bee payde king next yeare sir simond yonger fled kenilworth castel disherited knightes ile oxholme wher remayned log messenger faire promise hostage giuen edward king sonne forsaking went london king nobilitie priuily warned guile made escape got ouer fraunce keeper guy mountfort easter brybed let go went fraunce guy wet tuscane serued earle rufus whose war waxing famous obtained haue daughter mariage robert ferters earle darby henrie hastings baudewinde battaile chesterfielde wake iohn der le theyr power towne chesterfielde darbishire came iohn earle waren sir henrie almaine sir waren basingborne manye knightes whitson euen met without town hunting sir baudwyn wake sir hen hastings sir gregory caldwel sir iohn clynton sir roger maundeuil sir richard caldwel number xxij knightes al vnder one speare al chased put flight wherof sir iohn danuil towne vnderstanding small companye rode pierced hoste wounding many escaped erle waren entring towne slew many man toke erle ferrers sicke goute day bene letten bloud sente tower london whence lately bin deliuered henrie hastings company comming kenilworth founde sir iohn de eynuile many valiant knight sir william de la knowe sir iohn de la ware well stored ye castel thing necessarie king henrie hastyngkenilvvorth castel besieged thyther beganne siege morrowe midsommer daye whiche siege continued til christmasse within castell fearing force great set open theyr gate neuer closed daye night come would came theyr cost many man slaine side manye taken raunsomed length legate archbishop two bishop came make accorde betweene king disherited also castle disherits castel would grant king wherfore legate coursed theyr accord castell regarding legate cursing mockage therof clothed priest surgeon phillip porpeis cope white setting castel wal white legate red made accurse ye k legate al partaker while businesse lasted kenilworth disherites toke ye ile ely strengthned wise helde long robbed norffolk suffolke cambridgeshire spoyled ye citie norwich ransomed ye rich men pleasure bartholmewtide k held parliament killingworth wherein baron chosen vj person whiche sworne chose vj xij make accord k disherits ye first vj walter gefford bishop bath nicholas ely bi worcester walter b excester roger de sumerey roberte walronde alayne de la souch baros vj chose gilbert e glocester humfry erle hereford b dauids sir iohn bailiol sir phillip basset sir warayn de basingborne xij could agree legate henrie son richard king almaine shold umpiers met agreed lastanno reg sherifes maior iohn hinde iohn walrauen september william richards october king comandement ye bishop abbot prior erles baron knight ye realme assebled northampton twesday next alhalownday ther vnstand confirme statute forenamed twelue stats deereed state ye kingdome baron none disherite ye mountfort ferrers redeeme land wt money hand possession king gift none payde aboue vij yeres value vnder iij yeares value lest shal assessed according ye quatity trespasse siege kenilworth yet continuing within castel began sore troubled ye flixe also wer without hope succour come whervpo thomas day christmasse yeeldedkenilvvorth castel ye elded castel k conditio depart wt life lims wt losse good imprisonment disherited disherited person liked ye ordinaunce kenilworth whose captaine iohn ciuille taken citie lincoln spoyled iewes fled ile ely whose comming abroade kyng great army hadde stopped edwarde king sonne bridge made hurdle bordes place conuenient inhabitaunts thereabout instructed entred vpon ile within yeelded dispersed flight while thingsthe erle glocester toke citie london newe trouble began earle glocester taking part disherites came army gathered wale vnto london seauenth april therein builded bulwarkes cast ditch trench diuerse place king gathered army windsor v mayeannales hyde ensignes came towardes london pitched tentes stratford tarried space one moneth many entreated make peace vj june earle glocester peaceable maner rendred citie vnto king againe many disherited reconciled instance legate sayde erle foure bare cognisaunce erle darby put sack cast thamis thomas fitz theobalde agni wife sister thomasmercors chapel becket archbishop canturburie gaue master brother hospitall called saint thomas acre beyonde sea lande appurtenaunces sometime gilbert becket father thomas becket land ye said thomas becket borne make church michaelmasse king came shrewsburie passenicho triue wale vanquish ye prince wale lewlyne hadde ayded simon earle leicester sending thepeace vvith prince vvales anno reg king granted xxxij l sterling haue peace legats mean restored ye prince land cantredes law armes k taken iohn adriant lucas batecourt september baylifes custos alyn souch october othobone legate calling counsel london ordayned many thing reformation english church uariance fell betwene felowship goldsmith anda yot london taylor london causing great ruffling citie many men slaine ryot thirteene chiefe captaines hangedparliament marleborovve anno reg baylifs custos sokenreure liber trinitatis great frost nic triuet king helde parliament marleborow whiche made statute marlebrige walter haruey william duresme september sir stephen edesworth october thomas wimborne riuer thamis harde frozen saint androwes tide candlemasse men beastes passed foote lambeth westminster marchandise caryed sandwich hauens london lande day aprill edmund king sonne marryed daughter william de albemarle earle holdernesse named auelina whyche heyre hir father mother reason whereof haue hir countie deuonshyre lordshippe ile wight deceassed father mother loste allanno reg sherifes maior thomas basing robert cornhil septemb hugh fitz thomas october noble england kyngs commaundementanuals hyde edmond campion assembled london treate dyuers matter amongest whiche one men justicestho wikes shewe right held landes whyche matter muche molest people vntill iohn warren earle surrey appeared asked right helde landes drewe sodainely sword sayde holde grandfather land keepe upon multiplying wordes earle slewe allen de la zouch lorde chiefe justice ireland justice bench shortly iohn erle surrey othe knight winchester affirmed commit facte vpon pretenced malice neyther contempte king summe markes reconciled edward king sonne hys brother edmunde andanno reg many noble sayling asia infidel hys policie manly actes demeaned himselfe oftentimes put turkes great disworship dispight whereof suborned sarasine wounde venemous dart whereof long sicke henrie sonne richard king almayne went tuscane viterbe slaine guy de mountfort walter potter phillip taylour september sherifes maior w rishanger iohn adrian vintener october steeple bow cheape fell downe slew manye people men woman eyghte twentie januarie richarde king almaine earle gornewall brother king henrie deceased castel berchamsteede buried hayles abbey foundationanno reg sherifes maior gregorie rokesley henrie waleys september iohn adrian october diuerse ournes breake hollow placestho de wike earth ouerflowed great parte canturburie citie streame wherof swift violent bare downe building house drowned manye people june beganne great ryot citie norwiche w rishanger riot norvvich anno reg monasterie trinitie burned wherevpon king rode downe making enquiry chiefe doer thereof caused xxx condemnemned drawen hanged brent richard paris iohn de wodeley september sherifes maior sit water haruy october king henrie sicke called hym gilberte iber trinitatis clare erle glocester caused sworn kepe peace lande house edwarde sonne dyed sixteench nouember yere raigned lvj yeares xxviij dayes buried westminster whiche church newly builded left issue edward eldest sonne vnto hee haddei treklon giuen earledome chester succeeded kingdome edmund seconde sonne vnto giuen earledome lancaster also death simond mountfort robert ferrers maynteyne hys power counsell citie keepe c right beloged robert fitz walter chastelein london lord wedeham sayde robert heires ought chiefe banerars london fee chastelerie ancesters castle baynard said citie time warre sayde robert heires ought serue citie manner followeth sayd robert ought come twentith man armes horsebacke couered cloth armour vnto great weast dore saint paule banner displayed armes come sayd dore mounted apparelled sayde maior alderman sheriffes armed armes shall come sayd church saint paule vnto sayde dore banner hande foote whiche banner shall gueles image saint paule golde face hand feete sword siluer assoone sayde robert shall see maior alderman sheriffes come foote churche armed banner shall alight horsse salute maior say sir maior come seruice owe citie maior alderman shall answere giue banerar fee citie banner citie beare gouerne honor profit citie power sayd roberte heires shall receyue banner shall goe foote gate banner hand maior alderman sheriffes shall follow dore bring horse sayde roberte worth twentie pound horse shall sadled saddle armes saide robert shall couered sendall saide armes also shall presente xx sterling money deliuer chamberlayne said robert expences day sayde robert shal mount vpon horse ye maior presented ye banner assone vp shal say maior cause marshall chosen host one citie marshal chosen sayde robert shall commaund maior burgess citie warne commoner assemble togither shal al go vnder banner saint paul said robert shall beare himselfe vnto aldegate sayde robert maior shall deliuer sayde banner saint paule thence shall assent thinke good must make issue forth citie sayd robert ought chose two forth euery warde sage personage forsee safe keeping citie gone forth counsell shall taken priorie trinitie neare vnto aldegate euery towne castel whiche hoaste london besiege siege continue whole yeare sayde roberte shall haue euery siege communaltie london hundred shilling trauell right sayd robert hath time war right belonging robert fitz walter heires citie london time peace saye sayd robert hath soken ward citie wal chanonrie saint paul man goeth streete brewhouse saint paul vnto thamis side mill whiche water commeth fleete bridge goeth london walles betwixt frier preacher ludgate returneth backe house sayd frier vnto sayd common wall said chanonry saint paule al parish saint andrew whiche gifte hys auncestours saide senioritie sayde robert hath appendant vnto sayd soken al thing vnder written ought haue soke man place sokeman sokemanrie ward sokemanry impleaded ye guild hall thing toucheth body maior time toucheth bodye sherife lawfull sokeman sokemanrie sayd robert fitz walter demand court sayd robert maior citizen london ought grat haue court court ought bring iudgement assented agreed vppon guilde hal shall giuen therefore taken hys sokenry ought haue stockes imprisonment soken shal brought thece ye guild hall maior shall prouide iudgement ought giuen iudgement shal published till come courte sayde robert libertie iudgement shall haue deserued death treason tyed post thamis woodwharfe boates fastened two ebbing two flowing water hee bee condemned common theefe ought ledde elmes suffer iudgemet theeues said robert heyres hath great honor holdeth gret franches within citie maior citie citizen bounde right say maior holde greate counsel hee ought call sayd robert heyres hym counsell counsell citie sayde robert ought sworne counsel citie people sauing king heyres sayde robert commeth huystings guilde hall citie maior lieuetenaunt ought ryse set hym neere vnto long guilde hall iudgemente oughte giuen mouth according recorde recorder sayde guilde hall manye weifs come long ought giue baylifes town counsell maior citie franchise belonged richard grauesend byshop london deceased reported haue purchased charter liberty citie london yeare lord sixteenth yeare king richard seconde vntrueth whereof haue thought good thus muche place note king edward went scotland besieged castel striueline william clifford kept space tho de la dayes sundry valiaunt assaultes able longer resist put shoe haulters neckes came forth castel fel prostrate king committing liues lims mercie king pardoned life sent prisoner england king returning scotlande citie yorke commaunded courtes king benche exchequer remayned yorke vij yeares remoued theyr olde place london roger pares iohn de lincolne september sherifes custos anno reg dravv thy staffe adam meri sir iohn blound october king edwarde helde christmasse lincolne ordayned justice traylebaston againste intruder men landes truce breaker extortioner murderer suche like offendours whyche meanes king treasure maruellously encreased roger brabason robert de reuer satte guilde hall london heare complaintes made concerning foresayde article traylebaston citizen norwiche made peticion vnto thenorvvich vvalled parliament recordes king lyke hadde pleased hym heretofore graunte hys helpe lycence certayne yeares wallyng aboute theyr towne whiche tearme nowe expyred graunte longer tyme yet finished wherevppon v yeares granted parliament westminster iohn leyland writeth marchaunte norwich leyland nameth builded great part almost halfe wall robert fitz walter requested king fry offriers sacke sinagoge ievves neare baynards castel londo parliament recor sacke comonly called de penitentia iesu london might assigne sayde robert one chappel olde time called sinagoge iewes neare adioyning place robert request graunted frier liued altogither begging late multiplyed number greatly vntill counsel lion wherein decreed frier beggers receyue none order except grey white frier wer also licensed enter religion larger rule time forth mendicant frier began decrease short time brought nothing except preching frier william wale ofttimes sette scotland gretvv vvales scotland trouble taken brought london greate number men woman wondring vppon lodgedadam merimo house william delect citizen london fanchurche streete morrow euen saintetho delamore bartholmew brought horssebacke westminster iohn segraue geffrey knight maior sherifes alderman london many horsseback foote accompanying gret hall westminster placed vppon south benche crowned laurel sayd time past ye ought bear crowne hall commonly reported appeched traytour sir peter mallorie ye king justice aunswered neuer traytour ye king england crime whereof accused hee confessed headed quartered opened k conspiracie wrought archbishop canturburie diuerse earles baron time flaunders earle marshal examined able purge himselfe made king heire put possession landes haue grace thus kyng gaue pound land yeare hys life william cosine reignalde thunderle september sherifs custos anno reg sir iohn bloud october robert bruce englishman presuming righte wife vsurpe kingdome scotlad called parliament noble scotland within church friers1306 minor domfries slewe iohn comin bycause woulde agree treason shortlye wit feast anunciation lady abbay scone caused solemnely crowned king bishoppes glasco saint andrewes firste third day countesse bowan bicause hir brother earle fife whome right inheritaunce office belonged absent england feast penticost king edward honored eldest sonne edward carnaruan degree knighthoode also moe hundred noble yong men westminster feast natiuity lady king wet againe scotland great army hauing sent son edward ayner de valence earle penbroke roberte clifforde henrie lacy many noble knightes gentleman whitsontide also sente hym justice trayle basto two two togither euery citie place woulde come giuing power kill traytours drawe hang periured person burn worke deceite destroy wicked set englishman place taken space two monthes inquisition jury hundred thousand breaker peace conspiratoures amongst nigellus de bruse brother robert de bruse drawne berwicke hanged moreouer christopher iohn seyton brother wer hanged countesse bowan closed cage whose breadth length height depth eight foote hanged ouer wa berwike bishop saint andrew glasco abbot stone sent seuerall prison england king edward besieged simon frisell lilyscho tooke sent london tower founde many scottish waller sente tower london hanged headed lawrence de megos esquire taken douer beheaded earle stratherne yeelded king edward condemned remaine life yron fetter castel rochester time long king edward scotland good obedience gaue landes thereof hysex charta regia seruauntes subiectes england market fayres warren amongst others haue seen vnder broade seale sayd king edward manour called ketnes countie ferfare scotland neere furthest parte nation northwarde giuen iohn evre hyslord evre heires ancester lord eyre seruice done partes market euerye monday fayre three dayes euery yeare feast theyr principal house realmes came parliamente sente pope cardinall called petrus hispanus treate mariage betwixte edwarde prince wale frenche course fleete dike london sore decayed vvhich sometime bare ship smal burden holborn bridge great commoditie citie vvest part king daughter amongst many sutes made ther earle lincolne complayned whereas time past course water running london vnder holborne bridge fleete bridge thamis hadde bin suche large breadth deapth ten twelue ship merchaundises wonte come forsayde bridge fleete holborne bridge nowe course filth taners sore decayed also raysing vp wharfes especially turning water ye new temple made theyr milles without baynardes castel diuerse perturbation sayde shippes nowe coulde enter wont oughte wherefore desired maior london sherifes certain discrete alderman might appointed see course sayde water othe honest men forsayde hindraunces might remoued made wont old time c aunswered recorded roger le brabazon conestable tower maior sherifs assigned taking honest discrete men make diligente searche inquirie howe sayde riuer old time leaue nothing may hurt stop keepe state wont king edwarde remayning winter sommertho walsing carlile disposed manye thyngs scotlande hys pleasure meane tyme robert de bruis going aboute countrey slewe manye woulde obey hym sente parte hys armye two hys brother thomas knyghte alexander prieste deane glasco another parte countrey myghte allure people vnto gentle perswasions whyche comming englishman vppon taken ledde iustices condemned hanged headed carlile kyng edvvarde sente messenger englande commaundyng oughte hym seruice bee readye carlile wythin three weekes feaste saint iohn baptiste himselfe vexed bloudye flixe sente sonne shoulde come speede heare hys laste word whome among thyngs hee counselled bee mercifull iuste constante hys wordes deedes hee commanuded hym bee hastye take hym crowne englande tyll hee hadde reuenged iniuries done scottes staye partes cause hys father boanes beyng closed cheaste bee borne aboute wyth hym tyll hee hadde gone thorow scotlande ouercome hys aduersaries also commaunded hym honoure hys mother loue hys two brother thomas earle marshall edmvnde earle cornewall moreouer hee charged hym hys cursse shoulde presume call home pierce glauaston comon decree banished without common fauour spende xxxij siluer otherwayes businesse holy land whiche purpose prepared willed heart bee buried king also called vnto henrie lacy earle ofwil pakington lincolne guy earle warwicke aymerde valence earle penbroke robert clifford baron desiring bee king fraunce hys sonne king nauar king almaine king cicile many xxiiij day februarye king edward queene crowned westminster henrie bishop winchester admitted robert archbishop canterburie king offered firste pounde golde made like king holding ring hande offered marke golde whiche eight ounce made like pilgrime putting forth hande receyue ring sir iohn bachauell knyghte thruste deathe hys coronation king gaue vnto pierce guaston giftes andghro n jewel bin giuen crownes hys father ancestours treasure many thing affirming could succeede kyngdome calling brother granting thing without consent lord therfore enuying told king father pierce traytour king fraunce executed mother burned witch said pierce banished consenting mother witchcraft hee bewitched king himselfe besought kyng heare therefore petition whiche shoulde owne honoure wealth people first woulde confirme vse suche auntiente1 lawes customes contayned charter kyngs hys predecessonrs woulde graunt twentith part good true subiectes secondly woulde take nothyng man but2 price owner payde vttermost thyrdlye soeuer alyenated the3 crowne since hys father death might restoared therevnto fourthly would obserue oth made before4 father reuoking peter gauaston prosecuting scottish warre amisse shoulde amended leaste hys enymies reioyce c iustice iudgemente mighte done the5 lande well ryche poore accordyng auntiente olde approued lawes customes englande man shoulde bee restrayned kyngs writte prosecuting hys ryghte defend himselfe law king taking counsell pierce hugh spencer treasurer chancellour others appointed answere baron parliamet hocday baron departed london citie gate shut vp chayned great watch kept hugh spencer made conestable london king peter gauaston wet towarde wallingford castel wyth great company souldiours well straungers english hugh spencer taried still london parliament hocday kepte kyng baron decreed pierce shoulde banished lande departe morrowe midsommer day neuer returne agayne france beeing sent legate pope demaund legacie king edward father gaue holy land earnestly request king edward remoue peter gauaston whose conuersation world infected king appoynted parliamente northhampton determining thence passe scotland baron came parliament well furnished king sente worde woulde come yet last came stony stratford whither sente baron earles warwike clare requested come owne profite commoditie realme length went habite squire baron met without armour ende louingly embraced made friend voyage scotland reiourned til another time michaelmas parliament holden london vnto whiche parliamente came lewes french king brother bishop poytow kyng fraunce entrenie vnitie betwixt king lordes diuers get ordinaunces made agayne though sore agaynst king mind caused pierce obiure condition added baron founde agayne lande subiecte king dominion shoulde taken common enimy condempned beyng done passed flanders thence country seeking reste coulde finde iames saint edmond roger leaste straungers shoulde enter ayde kyng easter brother pierce gauaston taken greate treasure whiche hadde conueyed oute kyngs treasurie shippe beyng tossed wyth tempeste sea driuen taken treasure sayde turkes dayly long time religion greatly preferred fall templers whose possession giuen counsell holden vienna anno reg robert de bruce gote againe almost scotland castels munition english garrison cast tooke agayne power yeare therefore tho de la hugh spencer yonger consent prelate certayne noble hugh spe cer sonne appoynted king chamberlayne place peter gaueston whome rather preferred bycause knew king hated neuerthelesse long great diligence brought himselfe king fauour father hugh beeing olde yet liuing knight great vertue counsell wi e armes valiant whose confusion shamefull end wanne vnto himselfe naturall loue though disordinate towardes hys sonne body comely spirite proude action wicked whose couetousnesse ambition disheriting widdowes stranger wrought death noble fall king vtter destruction himselfe father iohn lambin richard wilford september sherifes maior tho de la sir iohn gisors peperer october king edwarde gathering greate power marched towards scotland breake seege striueling castell lodged himselfe people fielde euen saint iohn baptist neuer afore time wasbattayle striuelin seene like preparation pride cost time war affirmeth robert paston carmelite frier presentrobert paston taken scottes sorowfully bewayled heroycall uerse while prisoner firste night sayeth yee might haue seene englishman bathing themselues wyne casting gorge cry showting wassaling drinking rioting farre aboue measure side yee might haue seene scottes quiet still close fasting euen saint iohn baptist labouring loue libertie countrey morow scottes hauing gotten conuenient place fielde victorie made ditch grounde three foote deepe like breadth right wing army vnto least couering weake twigges herdles agayne ouer turffe grasse whiche strength beare horseman armie scottes beeing deuided certayne troupe stoode farre dike whiche betwixt englishman side armie englishman comming weast sunne rising casting beames golden target bright helmet armoure gaue reflection wonderfull terrible beholde first warde light horseman heauie courser second archer footemen appoynted chase aduersaries thirde king bishop religious amongst whome hugh spencer horseman first front making vpon enimies foundered forefeete ditch laye ther tumbling abiding cruelty scottes comming vpon slewe e tooke greate many richemen raunsome slayne gilbert de clare earle glocester whome scottes woulde gladly haue kept raunsome hadde knowne hee hadde forgotten putte hys coate armes wyth hym flaine sir edmond manly syr roberte clifford sir paine ptofte syr wyllyam marshall syr giles dargenton many knight esquiers taken humfrey de bohun erle hereford iohn segraue iohn claueringham william latimer syr roger northbroke bearer king shielde seale syr rauf mounthermer married ioane acre countesse glocester king sister beyng takenanno reg founde suche fauour raunsome pardoned hee returning englande broughte backe wyth hym king shield seales syr edmond manly king steward drowned himselfe banockesborne almoste three hundreth men armes slaine place archer killing manye seeyng scottes cruelly bent vppon horsemenne falne ditche shotte arrowes wyth highe compasse mighte fall betwixte armoure theyr ennimyes whyche vayne sh tte right forth sle fewe scottes reason armed eastes many englishemen reason theyr naked king bishoppes hughe spencer bee tooke themselues flight whiche daunger fleeyng king wed god hee woulde buylde vnto oor earmelite riers house whyche hee woulde place twentie brother student diuinitie whyche hee afterwardes performed oxforde ralphe bald byshoppe london deceassed incro wil past hys lyfe tyme gaue two thousande markes building newe worke chappell southe side ofnevve vvorke paules churche london churche saint paule london lefte muche hys testament worke digging foundation worke founde hundreth heades ox kine whyche thing confirmed great lye opinion whych haue reported olde tyme hadde beene called temple iupiter sacrifice beastes
