false nursse stolne cradle edward king put place shortly conuict vntruth confessed motion familiar spirit house likenesse catte whome serued three yeares seruice hanged north hampion king parliament lincolne gaue rodde marshall vnto thomas brotherton earle norffolke brother also reuoked prouisions beforewil paston tho walsing made selling victualles permitted men make best neuerthelesse dearth creased abundance rayne fel haruest quarter wheate salte sold midsomer thirtie shilling fortie shilling followed famine greeuous mortalitie anno reg mortalitie men people quirke might vnneath bury dead beastes cattell also corrupt gr whereof fedde dyed whereby came passe eating flesh suspected men flesh beastes corrupted hard finde horsseflesh counted great delicates poore stale fatte dogges eate somedogges flesh good meate child vvere eaten said compelled famine hidde place eate fleshe owne child stale others deuoure theeues prisonstheeues prison deuoure one another plucke peeces newly brought amogst greedily deuoured hal e aliue gallon small ale two penny better three penny best four penny londoner considering wheate made maltvvheate forbydden bee made muche consumed ordained thenceforthe shoulde made grayne also gallon better ale solde j ob small ale j aboue king according statute london sente hys writ realme commaunding wel within liberty without city borough townes uillages gallon ale shoulde solde j thenceforth wheate shoulde bee made malt whyche sooner caused proclaimed greatest parte people haue perished throughe famine earle waren excommunicate byshoppe ofcro chichester adultrey wherevppon sayde earle came bishop armed men foure hasty reste threatned bishoppe wherevpon byshops men fell tooke earle hamond goodsheape william bodele sept sherifes maior tho walsing stephen abindon october arriued england king request gaustelinus lucas de flisco two cardinalles make peace betwixte realmes england scotland reconcile vnto king thomas earle lancaster broughteiohn trocklow tho de la bulles pope excommunicate scottes except returned vnto peace king england cardinal wente north partes enstall lodowike beomond whome pope kyngs instaunce hadde giuen byshopricke durham came neare vnto towne derlington certayne robber breaking valley gilbert middleton walter selby beyng capitaynes sodaynelye sette vppon family cardinal lodowike tvvo cardinal robbed wigelesden robbed treasure carryed lodowike byshoppe durham morpeth constrayned hym paye greate raunsome broughte henrye beaumont castell r ntforde kepte hym tyll hee hadde payde greate raunsome cardinalles came durham tarryed fewe dayes aunsweare scottes vnder king conducte retourned yorke left businesse whyche came vndone gilbert middleton manye domages doneanno reg priory rymuth taken owne castell nitforde wyllyam felton thomas hetton robert horneclife carryed london presence cardinalles drawne hanged cardinalles vnder certayne condition made peace betwixte king thomas earle lancaster whyche condition shortlye vniustly broken syr gosseline de uile brother roberte wyththeeues lyke fryer two hundred habite frier many notable robbery spoyled byshoppe durham pallaces leauing nothing bare walles whiche hanged yorke william cawston raufe balancer september sherifes maior iohn wengraue october margaret daughter philip sonne lewes kyng fraunce wife edwarde firste deceassed fourteenth februarye buryed myddle quire gray fryer churche london edwarde de bruis king scottes brother ioh trocklowe edvvarde de bruse beheaded space three yeares hadde assaulted irelande crowned hymselfe kyng taken englishemen king englandes subiectes beheaded dundalke battel slayne nine twentie baronet scotlande fiue thousande eight hundreth primate armakh beeyng chiefe capitayne kyng england yeare earlye haruest corneearly haruest cheape corne inned saint giles daye bushel wheateanno reg solde tenne shilling solde ten penny bushell otes eighte shyllings solde eight penny earle warrin tooke wife earle lancaster shut hir vppe hys castell sayde betrothed hym marryed earles eyther wife neyther cared iohn prior william furneys sept sherifes maior barvvike betrayed iohn wengraue october aboute midlent towne berwicke betrayed scottes throughe treason peter spalding englishemen whome kyng scottes caused hanged beeyng traytors theyr countrey castell held oute till wante victualles wythin constrayned delyuer scottishmens handsthe scottes inuaded england richard south iohn ucklowe wanne also tyme castelles harbotel warke mydforde possessed parte northumberlande euen newecastell vppon tyne sauing certayne castels defended agaynst may entred lande brenning al tyll came rypon whyche towne spoyled tarrying three dayes receyued thousande markes gote churche bycause put town fyre hadde done townes northallerton borough bridge c theyr returning backe brent knaresburghe skipton crauen afore carrying scotlande maruellous multitude cattel besides prysoners men woman yorkeshiremen gathered togither number oftho walsing ten thousad met scot town mitton ten myles northweast yorke loste threew packington thousande ouercome scottes whych kyng hearde tell hee lefte siege barwike hasted meete scottes returned way pope ordayned parson haue one benefice peece wherevpon patron straight presented newe parson residue greate morreyne kine hapned mortally infected dog rauens eating carriona morreyne kyne kine poysoned swel death man durst eate beefe iohn pointell iohn dallyng sept sherifes maior scot bren suburb yorke adam meri herdmen vvomen goe tovvard ierusalem anno reg iohn wingraue october kyng yorke scottes entered englande came yorke brent suburb citie tooke sir iohn brytaine earle richemonde prisoner wyth manye many herdes men certayne woman england partes world gathered themselues togither woulde goe seeke holy lande kil enemy christ sayde bycause could passe ouer greate sea slewe manye iewes party tholose gascoyne wherefore many taken put death simon abindon iohn preston sept sherifes maior exchequer kept yorke wil paston hamond chickwell peperer october fifteenth october clearkes exchequer wente towardes yorke booke called dome day recordes prouision laded one twenty carte wythin space halfe yeare kalendes marche dydde retourne agayne london yeare king justice fate tower1320 london wherevpon iohn gisors late maior london many others fled citie thing presumptuously done knewe themselues guilty thischro dun tyme citizen acknowledged right whiche oughte robert fitz walter heires castle baynard earle hereforde boughte sir william bruis knight portion lande march wale called gowers roger mortimer vncle roger nephew knowing foresaide bargayne also bought saide ground said william bruis also lorde mowbray married daughter heire sayde william claymed inheritance wife last al hugh spencer yonger bought land putte foresaide noble sore amoued humfrey earle hereforde complayned thomas earle lancaster whyche twoo earles allured almost al earles baron take part thomas erle lancaster captainethe baron armour came sherborne thence banner displayed saint albons thence sent king london requiring banishe two hughe spencer whyche condemned comminaltie many article king woulde graunteanno reg baron came london length kyngthe elder spencer banished graunted petition hughe spencer elder banished yonger hugh fell spoyling sea taking two dronionds aboute sandwiche goodes value poundes reignolde conduit william produn sept sherifes maior ievves leaper poysoned vvaters conradus memdember nicholas farendon goldsmith october certaine leaper made couenaunt iewes poyson christian europe layde poyson welles spring pittes whiche many conuict bret died almain cause aboue twelue thousand iewes feaste saint michaell isabell queenet de la came canterbury ye castle lede kent purposing haue lodged night coulde permitted enter king herewith beyng offended beyng done inleedes castell besieged contempte hym calling hym common essex london besieged castle whyche belonged bartholomewe de badelsmere hauing lefte hys wyfe chyldren therein gone wyth reste noble men ransacking spencer goodes meane time leedes castle dispayring safegarde noble men wyth armye came kyngston uigill saint simon iude demaunding byshoppes canterbury london earle penbroke sent betweene king woulde gyue ouer hys siege promising nexte parliament woulde delyuer castell kyngs handes become obedient vnto kyng woulde graunte noble men petition beyng returned partes kyng wyth muche laboure obtayned castell hanging sixe chiefe whome hee founde therein sente wife child badlesmere tower london kyng edwarde helde hys christmasse circister christmasse leanyng gloucester wircester hee wyth hys armye wente shrewsbury bridgenorth mortimer meeting king reuerently peaceably submitted themselues vnto kyng sente themmortimer sente tovver tower london mawrice barkeley hugh audley like sorte submitting themselues sent wallingforde castel humfrey earle hereforde gilbert talbot raufe atanno reg thorpe neere vnto yorke thys yere phillip king fraunce dyed brother charles succeeded beginning auguste king edwarde pikering came ambassador new french king lorde benuille sir andrew de florentia cite king come doe homage yon aquitaine land helde though hugh spencer sonne lorde chamberlayne roberte baldocke lorde chauncellour procured sayde ambassadours declare theyr message king yet shoulde depart admoni hing come sayd syr andrew de florence notarie made publike instrument sayde citation admonition iohn grantham richard ely septem sherifes maior tho de la hamond chickwel peperer october frenche king made processe againste king englande charles de valoys vncle king charles fraunce deadly enimy englishman sea e dukedome angue countie portowe vnto vse nephew king length going forward towne ryall founde wel defended edmond woodstocke earle kent betwixte whome finall truce taken continue vntill suche time coulde determined betweene king concerning peace towne yelded vp army departed home next lent parliament holden london adam tarleton bishoppe hereforde accused treason buthenrie blanford archbishop caterburie yorke dubline suffragan bishoppes taken barre away hys temporall good hate spencer deadlye dyd henrie burwashe lincolne friendes withheldetho de la handes reuerence king lammas daye roger mortimer wigmore byhenrie blanford giuing keeper sleepe drinke got thamis helper two moe counsell passed riuer auoyding high wayes came sea finding shippe passed ouer fraunce adam salisburie iohn oxforde septem sherifes maior tho de la anno reg nicholas farendon edwarde sente queene hys wife vnto hyr brotherthe queenset fraunce french kyng establishe peace went ouer small company hyr mediation peace fullye finished witte kyng englande giue eldest sonne edwarde dukedome aquitaine earledome po e french kyng shoulde receyue homage hym wherevpon edwarde king sonne wente ouer wyth competent housholde aboute feaste saint mathewe homage vnder certaine protestation vncle frenche king bennet fulham iohn cowson september sherifes maior hamon chickwel peperer october while queene wyth hyr sonne remayned fraunce longer king pleasure would come agayne wythout roger mortimer noble fledde englande especially hatred shee bare two hughe spencer kyng displeasure banished bothe toke theyr partes wherevppon manye fledde ouer sea queene amongst whych one subtill knyght sir robert walkefare slaying conestable corfe castel brake long line prisoner sir oliuer ingham knight yong duke edwarde oliuer ingham hadde made keeper aquitaine gathered great armye inuaded prouince aniowe whiche frenche king contrarie couenauntes dydde wythholdeanno reg broughte wholby dominion england moreouer king nauie tooke hundred ship norman brought england cause gret hatred grew betwixt two king realmes q perceyuing noble france corrupted gift sent englad could trust none secretly conueyed hir selfe hir sonne erle heynalde desiring ayde receyued intreated hyr honourably long remayned gilbert mordon iohn cotto september sherifes maior richard betaine goldsmith october isabel queene made mariage betwixt hir eldest son edward phillip earles daughter heynalde hir sonne edwarde edmunde woodstocke erle kent king brother roger mortimer many noble men fledde englande iohn brother earle heynalde captaine stipedarie knightes almaine henalde toke sea hir power whiche number mm dcc luii menne well armed arriued vrewel orwel hauen besides harwich essex michaelmasse whether immediately earle marshal earle leicester bishop lincolne hereforde diuelyn ely came ioyned queene made great army anno reg queene isabel returned bishop specially canturburie ayded hyr mony refreshed hir armye saint edmondesburie went forwardes pursuing hir enimies whose good applyed hir owne vse king requested ayde citizen london made aunsweare wouldethe king requested ayde due obedience honour king queene theyr sonne lawfull heyre realme woulde shut theyr gate forraine traytors realme would go citie fighte except might according theyr liberty return home againe day sunne sette k hearde fortified tower london lefte hysproclamation king yonger sonne iohn eltham caused also proclaimed euery resist arriued inuade vttermost theyr power queene hir edward erle kent brother excepted wholoeuer coulde bring heade roger mortimer shoulde haue thousande pounde proclaymed queenes behalfe al menproclimation queene haue good peace except disturber realm wit spencer father son robert baldocke byshop norwich king chancellour theyr fautours whosoeuer bring queen head hugh spencer shoulde haue pound citizen london without respect beheaded took queenes enimies among whiche beheaded one owne citizen named iohn marshal bicause familiar hugh spencer yonger toke also maister walter kingdome seeyng matter vnrecouerable prayed forgiue hym thanked chosen eldest sonne messenger renounce homage dueties due edwarde carnaruan late king thomas blunte knight stewarde housholde brake hys rodde resigned hys office shewed kyngs housholdehad free libertie departe returned king aunswere made people ioyfull thus deposed raigned ninteene yeares sixe monethes odde dayes deliuered custodie excellent modestie temperaunce aduaunced person dignity excel innocencie life feates de la gual baker swinbroke armes expert noble enterprise hym atchieued doe well declare beginning hys raigne couent king request present nobilitie forgaue remitted pounde sixe shilling eightburie amerced perice summe rest vsed suche fauour truely payde markes twentie yeares following obserued couenaunts good order quietnesse forgaue rest thys time like stir made againste therecord ecclesia christi cantu monkes canterburie whereof fynde recorded followeth king edward preparing army scotland comma ded baylifes citizen canterburie furnish twelue horssemen sende nowcastel towarde charge citizen required ayde monkes aunswered without assent kyng theyr archbishoppe would agree therevnto much king englande founded theyr churche free perpetuall almes wherevpon william chilham baylife many common citie assembled themselues preaching frier churchyarde conspired sware monkes followeth would ouerthrow pentises windowes milne belonging monkes citizen dwell house belonging monk rent belonging monkes canterburie gathered vse common man shoulde sende sel monkes anye victual sell horsses beast came citie cariage monkes al monk came forth house shold spoyled garment trench shoulde cast stop men going comming euery pilgrime shold entring swere make offering also euerye common aforesayde weare finger ring golde belonged thomas becket syr iohn earles brother henalt came helpecro pet coledge edwarde thirde againste scottes fiue hundred men armes whiche henawders englishman fell chaunce trinitie sonday yorke lincolnshire men slaine buried vnder stone clements churchyarde fosegate king wente againste scottes entrediourney tovvards scotland englande farre stanhope parke wardale besieged three dayes escaped iames douglas one night secretly entring english campe came neere king tent haue taken slain chaplein bolde man well armed beyng slaine much adoe got backe vnhurte isabel queene perswaded earle leicester muche fauoured olde king hyr husbandetho de la walter barker swinebroke subtile deuise hyr scholemaster adam tarleton bishop hereforde appointed thomas gornay iohn maltrauers knightes hauing receyued theyr custody carrie whether would none hys well willers shoulde haue accesse vnto vnderstand made long abode brought nighte kenilworth firste brought castell corfe bristow season kept shut vp close castel vntil suche time vnderstoode certaine burgess towne deliueraunce said edward conueyed themselues ouer sea whose determination beeing knowne keeper certaine darke night conueyed thence berkeley tormentours forced ride bareheaded woulde sleepe would suffer hym neyther hungry would giue suche meate liked suche lothed euerye worde spake contraried giuing moste slaunderously madde conclude matter coulde imagine contrarie hys wyll eyther colde watchyng vnholesome meates melancholy infirmitie myght languishe dye contrariwise thys man good disposition nature stoute suffer patiente throughe god grace abyde griefes hee endured wicked deuises hys enymies touching poysons whiche ministred benefit nature dispatched away cha pion sayd bring olde king towardes barkeley guarded rabble helhoundes along graunges belonging castell bristow wicked man gerney making crown hey put hys heade souldiours aboute mocked saying tprut auaunt sir king making kinde noise theyr mouthes though farted doubting meete hys friendes bent theyr iourney ouer marish ground lying ruier seuerne moreouer diuising meanes disfigure hee mighte knowen determined shaue well heare hys heade also bearde wherefore comming little water whiche ranne ditche commaunded alighte horsse shauen whome set molehill barbour came bason colde water taken ditch edwarde sayd shall haue warme water barber answered wyll serue quoth edward ye nil yee haue warme water might keepe promise beganne weepe shed teares plentifullye reported william byshop sir thomas de la knight length came berkeley castel edward shutte vppe close like ancher isabel wife taking grieuously hir husbads life thus prolonged made complaint adam bishop hereforde fayning certayne dreames interpretation whereof misliked like sorte bishop hys conscience guiltie treason stoode feare like feare also stoke heartes offence diuer gathered together effect wherfore seemed good many great dignity bloud wel spiritual temporal yt al fear taken away ye death edwarde whervppon letter sent hys keeper blaming suffering enioy much libertie nourishing delicately moreouer priuie motion made thatsophistical letter procuring murder olde king death edwarde woulde misliked vnto pointe great deceyte sophisters stoode force set downe bishoppe hereforde wrote thus edwardum occidere nolite timere bonum est kyl edward feare good thing thus seeke shed king edward bloud refuse feare counte good thys saying resolued two proposition whereof first consisting three wordes witte edwardum occidere nolite seconde three timere bonum est seeme perswade subtilly receyuers letter ignorant sophistical writing chaunged meaning thereof thys sense edwardum occidere nolite timere afterwarde ioyned wordes bonum est nowe olde king broughte castell aforesayde curteouslye receiued thomas lorde barkeley tormentor receyued letter concerning gouernemente castell thomas lord berkley commaunded departe thence wherefore taking leaue sighes goeth dwelling place olde king shutte vp close chamber stincke deade carkasses layde celler vnder miserablye tormented manye dayes suche sorte well nyghe suffocated therewith paine almost intollorable appeared complainte made certayne daye chamber windowe certayne carpenter working righte side thereof hearing tyraunts perceyuing woulde force hys death one night xxij september came rushing vppon laye bedde greate heauyethe old king murdered eatherbeddes muche weyghte xv menne coulde beare wherwyth oppressed smoothered hym also thrust plummers yron made redde hotte vp bowel throughe certaine instrumente like end trumpet glister pipe put hys fundiment burning thereby inward partes prouiding thereby least wound founde king bodye might caused aunsweare sort stoute king oppressed cry lowde voyce many well within castell without heard perceyuing cry one suffered violente deathe caused many berkeley affirmed take co passion thereof pray soule departing isabel bishop tyrannye mighte hid outlawed banished thomas gournay murderer fledde iohn maltrauers thomas fleeing marcel three yeares known taken brought towards englande beheaded sea least shoulde accuse chiefe doer iohn maltrauers repenting himselfe lay long hid germanie yeare died charles king fraunce thirde brother whiche brother lady isabel queene englande k edvvards title fraunce mother king edward thirde whose deathe succession kingdome fraunce came said edwarde vsurped possessed phillip de valoys vncle sayde charles dyd intrude force king edward married phillip earles daughter ofedvvard third married heynalde yorke fiue twentith februarie shee sister daughter phillippe de valoys aforesayde henrie darcy iohn hauten september sherifes maior hamond chikwel grocer october parliament holden northampton whiche anno reg parliament northampton peace vvith scottes shameful peace made betwixt englishman scot dauid sonne robert bruis scarce seuen yeres olde married ioan tower king edwardes sister berwike twelfth july also king made scottes charter tenour whereof vnknowen englishman al done pleased olde queene roger mortimer iames dowglas scottes made manye tannting time englishman fond ormond parliament earle lancaster ye lord wake henrie beamonde earle marshal noble men absent theselues far fro thence armour whiche king highly displeased notwithstanding sommer following submitted themselues vnto kyngs mercy seekyng fauour simon fraunces henrie combmartin sep sherifes maior iohn grantham october certaine men land intent try friendsk edvvard seconde bruted aliue england craftily deuised edward second king england aliue castell gorffe bee seene daye time therefore vsed manye nightes make shewes maskyng wyth dauncing vpon tower wals castel perceyued people countrey thoughte bin great king vnto dyd greate solemnity rumour spredde ouer englande witte olde king aliue whence came passe earle kent sente thyther fryer precher trye truth matter thought hauing corrupted porter castell rewardes isanno reg let lay day porter lodge verye close whe night come willed put habit lay brought hal wher saw thought edwarde father king sitting royally supper great maiestie frier thus perswaded returned againe earle kente reported thought saw whervpon erle saide affirmed othe would indeauoure meanes coulde deliuer brother prison yeare earnest request king1329 held parliament winchester procurement olde queene roger mortimer sayde earle ofparliament vvinchester kent manye noble men religious person witte prouincials white carmilit frier blacke preaching frier frier richarde wliten accused conspiracie touching sayde deliuerye king father matter although deuised fantasie meere lye yet sayde earle certaine confession whyche made certayne letter founde beheaded wit prouincials predicants erle kent king vncle beheaded vvinchester carmilites banished bishop london set libertie robert de taunton priest certain carmilite frier predicants condemned perpetual prison death sayde earle lesse lamented bycause familye seruauntes aboue measure afflicted common taking vp thing trauayled king price paying nothing verye lyttle richarde lazer wyllyam gisours septsherifes maior richarde swanland october parliament holden notingham roger mortimer suche glorie honoure without comparison man durst name earle marche greater rowt men wayted heeles king person would suffer king rise would walke king equally step step cheeke cheeke neuer preferring king would go formost himselfe officer greatly rebuked earle lancaster cousin kyng withoute hys consent hee appointed certayne lodging noble men towne demaundyng made bolde take vppe lodging nighe vnto queene wyth whyche wordes conestable beeyng greatelye feared appoynted lodging earle lancaster one myle oute towne lykewise lodged earle hereforde iohn de bohune estsex highe conestable englande others whyche meanes contention rose among nobleman greate murmuring among common people sayde roger mortimer queenes paragon kyngs mayster sought mean could destroy kyngs bloude vsurpe regall maiestie whyche reporte troubled muche kyngs friendes weete william mountacute safegarde kyng sware themselues true person drew vnto robert de hollande hadde long tyme beene chiefe keeper castell vnto whome secreate corner knowne vppon certayne night kyng lying without castel bothe friendes brought torchlight secrete waye vnder ground beginning far said castell til came euen queenes chamber whyche chaunce found open therfore beyng armed naked sword hads went forward leauing king also armed without dore chamber least mother espie entred slew hugh turpinton knighte resisted mayster iohn neuell horneby giuing deadly wound thence went toward queene mother whome found earle march readie haue gone bedde hauing taken sayde earle ledde hall whome queene followed cry bele fit bele fit ayes pitie de gentil mortimer good sonne good son take pitie vpon gentle mortimer suspected hir sonne though saw keyes castell sent euery place furniture yeelded vp king hand suche secret wise none without castell except king friend vnderstoode thereof next day morning early bring roger mortimer frieds taken horrible shout cry earle lancaster blind one made shoute ioy towards london committed tower afterward condemned westminster presence whole parliament saint andrewes euen next following drawne elmes hanged common gallowes whereon hung two dayes two nightes king commandement buryed grey frier church condemned peeres yet neuer brought answere custome death earles lancaster winchester glocester kent wherefore earle law selfe appoynted cause death laid first consenting murthering king father secondly receiued great summe money whereby king honor greatly abated stanhope parke gaue signe vnto scottes flie thirdly caused certayne auntient deedes charter brent wherein king scot stood bound vnto king englande especially caused contra made betwixt king sister dauid sonne robert le bruis fourthly vnprofitably consumed greate deale treasure found king treasurie treasurie earles winchester glocester fiftly appropriating vnto himselfe wardes mariages england sixtly euill counseller king queene mother ouermuch familiarno iustice hir died friend simon de burford knight brother sir william burford justiceanno reg iohn deuerell esquier desirous haue made open confession king father cruell death could suffered king edward bishop winchester wil mountacute others passed ouer1 sea like bin merchant hauing hym scarse xv horseman left iohn eltham brother protector realme returned againe beginning april helde great turniament dertford kent xv june borne vnto king edward turniament dertford edvvard blacke prince borne first sonne wodstoke named edwarde blacke prince k tooke hand ye land assigned three dayes queene phillip many ladyes fell stage notwithstanding hurt wherefore queene tooke greate care saue carpenter punishmente hir prayer whiche made hir knee pacifyed king counsell whereby shee purchased greate loue people robert ely thomas whorwode sept sherifes maior saint lavvrence pultney sir iohn pultney draper october sir iohn pultney builded colledge london called saint laurence pultney little alhallowes parish churche thamis streete also carmeliteregist carmil frier church couentrie wet sommer exceeding rayne thislate haruest yeare corne field could ripe many place began haruest till michaelmas house croxton got wheate till hallontidew sheepeshed pea andrewes tide monkes alhallowen day martelmas day serued pea greene coddes stead peares apple king edward held solemne christmas welles whichanno reg continued till feast epiphany manye strange sumptuous shewes made1331 beginning august edward bailioll sonne heire iohn king scottes came england edward bin time banished scotland comming declared right kingdome henry beawmont earle bohune gilbert vmfreuill earle angus dauid earle athels richard talbot ralph baron stafford fulx fitz williams many noble men affirming right inheritance scotland desired licence ayde king englande recouer sayd kingdome landes due king hauing regard peace lately made also sister sake queene scottes woulde suffer leade armie lande wherefore sayde lordes getting fleete shippes entred sea sayling toward scotland landed kinkehorne earle fife robert bruse bastard sonne robert bruse tenne thousand scottes resisted neere vnto dunfermeling englishman put flight slew many afterward weete saint lawrence day sore conflict gledesmore two thousand englishman ouercame fortie thousand scottes reason great throng multitude amongst themselues fiue earles many thronged death morrow englishman tooke towne saint iohns well furnished victualles seauen twentith september edward baylioll edvvard baylioll resigned crovvne scotland king edvvarde england sherifes maior hospitall leycester crowned king scottes afterward resigned king edward england remayned vnder protection many yeares iohn mocking andrew aubury september sir iohn poultney draper october henry earle lancaster leycester high steward england founded new hospitall castell leycester wherein one hundred poore impotent people prouided thing necessarie edward baylioll foresayde lord noblesanno reg iohn maundeuill continued warres scotland vnto whome came many nobleman realme england voluntarily seruing owne charge beseeged berwike king england gathered great power beseeged1 berwike length yeelded want victualles seege scottes sought many wayes remoue leuying great army ouer scotland comming seege could bring purpose effect yet still prouoking king army battell wherevpon length two army appoynted fight setting vpon halidowne hill commeth forth scottes campe certayne stout champion greate stature facte done called turnebull standing midst betwixte two armiescallenge combate challenged englishman one fight combate legth one robert ven e knight nonffolke man requesting licence king armed sword drawne marcheth toward champion meeting way certayne blacke mastife doggeturnebull callenger ouercome combate wayted champion whome sworde suddaynely strake cut loynes sight whereof mayster dogge slayne much abashed battayle warie fearefull whose left hande head also afterwarde worthye knight cut combate army met fighting scarce halfe houre certayne scottes beeing slayne closed armie three one battayle length fleeing king followed taking chacing lake pittes space fiue mile slayne eyght earles horseman common souldioures place berwike called bothull neere vnto halidon meane season scottes beseeged castell kambrugh time queene heard victorie aforesaid lefte seege fledde townesmen berwike yeelded theking edvvarde vvan barvvike king england castell towne placing garrison sent edward baylioll noble keepe realme scotland earle patritius next worcester anno reg translated winchester edward bayholl king scottes held parliamente at1333 gallowey came noble men englande made clayme landes possession whiche scotland returned peaceably countrey king edward kept christmas wallingford queene deliuered daughter named isabell wodstoke king sommoned parliamente holden yorke begin monday seconde weeke lent parliament king scottes called conquerour although warned yet came sent messenger excuse weete henry de bellemount william montacute earles certaine baron knightes signified king scottes conquerour coulde withoute great danger certaine scottes lay ilands ready domage feast saint iohn baptist said king scottes king scottes homage conquerour homage king edward england newcastell vpon tine long king edward tooke homage duke briteine earledome richmont parliament london tolde king scottes taken richard talbot sixe knightes slayne many footemen wherefore king tooke fifteenth laytie tenth cleargie intente malice scottes mought bee brideled iohn hamond william hausard september sherifes maior sir iohn poultney draper october king edwarde wente toward march scotland wintered coastes vnderstanding earle dassels trayterously turned scot henry bellemount beseeged scottes entred scotland reysed seege kept christmas roxborow anno reg presently feast epiphany french king sente messenger king edward weete bishop aur enges certayne lordes treate peace scottes wayted answere englande till midlent nottingham truce granted vnto vntill feast saint iohn next comming meane time parliament might holden matters1334 concerning peace state kingdomes parliament holden yorke decreed king shoulde passe armie scotlande beyond scottish sea thing quickly performed done scottes desirous fight fielde fayned woulde haue peace obteyne many came aboute feast saint michaell chiefely earle dascels wherevpon came passe afterward earle morefe taken prisoner edenborough sente kept prisoner england richard talbot ransomed two thousand fiue hundred markes earle dascels willing shew truly reuolted king england rode againste scottes seege certayne castell falling hand enimies bycause woulde yeeld slayne thirteene men feast saint michaell king continuing still march scotlande dayly entreated messenger french king concerning peace made feast saint martine edwarde bohune noble man drowned march scotland driuing bootie cattell ouer riuer felte himselfe danger causing guide ride hym water smoothnesse stone whereon water ranne guide able take sure footing fell downe mayster armed help could come drowned bottome channell iohn archbishop canterburie went ouer sea phillip de valoys king france requesting continuance peace amitie betwixt two kingdomes mainteyned secondly townes castels taken time father restored king england thirdly sayde french king sweare neuer giue ayde scottes agaynst king englande vnder condition two king realmes shoulde prepare trauell towardes holy lande fight agaynst enimies christ french king accompted king englande worthie friendship long continued warres scottes friendes whome sayde iust men unto seconde petition woulde otherwise consente therevnto charge repayde agayne father charles de valoys layde warres gascoigne thirdly sayde friend louer iustice equitie whiche woulde neuer swarue neyther friendship affinitie woulde meanes could molest vex breaker peace kingdome scotland saith shall neuer perfecte peace quietnesse among christian king fraunce sitte place judgement right kingdomes france england scotland iohn kingston walter turke september sherifes maior reignald conduct vintner october part uniuersitie oxford wente stamforde ro de auesbery bycause variance fell betweene northerne southerne schollers upon saint clements night abundance watersanno reg specially thamis cattell beastes neere therevnto drowned land made1335 vnfruitefull salte water king edwarde tenth cleargie also burgess fifteenth common feast pentecost helde parliament atparliament northampton tho de la northampton leauing prelate state common debating matter himselfe secretely rode berwike taking men armes went saint iohns towne whiche strengthned wyth trench rampire sente earles king conquerour make inrode vpon countrey see scottes could finde would resist butro de auesbery none durst abide comming hidde themselues hilles wooddes marishes meane tyme many earles baron came submitted themselues king edward vpon condition followeth poyntes agreed betwixt counsell king england scotland one partie alexander mowbrey geffrey mowbrey godfrey de roos william bulloke eustace de loreyne first accorded sayd earle dassels great men communaltie scotlande whiche shall come condition shal haue life member land tenement fee office within scotland ought haue inheritance right except shall surprised common assent item shall pardoned emprisonmente manner trespass done realmes england scotland beginning world vnto date present item earle dassels alexander mowbrey shall haue landes tenementes possession fee englande departure homage done newcastell vpon tine item franchise churche scotlande shall mainteyned auntiente vsage scotlande item lawes scotland borough townes shriuewikes within landes king scotlande vsed antient vsages custome scotland vsed dayes king alexander item office scotland ministred people nation yet notwithstanding alwayes king scotland may put officer shal please nation soeuer item within condition earle dassels haue landes within landes king england scotland shall haue agayne landes tenement possession office fee departure homage done newcastell vpon tine except shall forprised common assent item empleded landes tenement oresayd haue defence recoueries court ought haue item touching demaund earle dassels claymeth king england ought acquite land england hath gage eyght hundred markes king neyther ought touching manour byphingdone said earle layd pledge two hundred fiftie poundes accorded sayde earle come within one yeare date present acquite manoure king shall cause hee haue manoure item touching castell land chilham accorded sayde earle point hee hys departure haue hys recouerie lawe kyng promiseth good fayth cause may haue land without delaying eyther partie touching land sayde earle claymeth haue norffolke hathe charter accorded hys charte beeyng seene kinges counsell wyll doe reason em case man surmise treason vpon sayd earle may defend himselfe body according lawes vsages scotland march within condition haue like graunt item pardon william ramsey knight demandeth trespasse done william lorde mountagew weete beating downe castell haghtordone william shall readie according shall aduised king england scotland item sayd stacie de lorayne haue landes tenement ought haue within realme scotland man haue trespassed towardes shall haue recouerie law written iohns towne scotlande eighteenth august anno walter mordon richard vpton september sherifes maior nicholas wutton october phillip queene england beare hir second sonne vntill prouided commodiouslie liue art although statute seemed beginning nothing profitable yet short time arte clothing increased much thereby twentie time vsed also enacted man time buy cloth made beyond sea none weare furres might dispend one hundred pound yeare iohn clarke william curteis september sherifes maior sir iohn poultney draper october feast saint michaell parliament holdentho de la anno reg london connocation assembled archbishop wherein cleargie graunted tenth three yeares common fiftenth consideration king warres hote scotlande also resist french king made great bragges shewed great crueltie outlawed slew emprisoned englishman confiscated goodes cattayles found kingdome france threatning would reuenged friendes scottes moreouer left muche one towne castell county aquitayne poyters seized handes wherevpon king edward sente brabant take vp woolles whiche merchant brought thither made sale thereof readie money also wrote letter french king exhorting woulde continue olde amitie sir walter many beeing embassadour king englande desirous reuenge bloud two englishman slayne comming lande freshe water certayne islande called ile agnes nigh vnto flanders caused hee founde sayde island put sworde tooke prisoner earle flanders brother captayne ile certayne island men beeing fled churchtho wals g brent number three thousande church welchmen warres b eing thus aforesayde begonne betwixte two kingdomes rumour thereof came vnto court rome wherevpon pope sent two cardinalles reformation ordering peace betwixte two kingdomes comming westminster declared king cause comming wherevnto king answered although without reason dyd seeme restreyne hym right equitie hee ought succeede kingdome hys forefather whyche hys aduersarie phillip de valoys dyd denye hym expelling murthering emprisoning hys people taking away dukedome aquitayne earledome poyters without cause maynteyning scottes rebelles agaynste hym yet iniuries notwithstanding hee contented coulde take order quiet enioying aquitayne fee belonging vnto hym whiche hys predecessoures enioy moreouer dismissing ayde french king shoulde gyue vnto scottes tyme rebellion offered money also mariage eldest sonne also resigne suche rite interest hadde kyngdome france cardinalles beeyng greately comforted aunswere departed hoping warres nowe ended tooke iohn archbishoppe canterburie richarde bishoppe durham geffrey lorde scrope altogyther wente message kynges aunswere frenche kyng hauing full authoritie treate conclude peace beeing reasonable offer coulde pacifye furious minde frenche king reposed greate trust scottes hopyng theyr meanes quite dispossesse disherite king england title walter neale nicholas crane september sherifes maior henry darcy october king caused confiscate goodes lonibards also monkes order cluny cisteaux whole realme king tooke wooll certaine number sackesanno reg low price euery countrey number set vpon staffordshire sixe hundred sackes price nine markes sacke good wooll nothing payde first wooll vniuersally taken secondly halfe whose hand soeuer founde well merchats third time king tooke fiftenth comminalty payde wooll price euery stone contayning fourteene pound two shilling king appointed also corne glebe lands1338 serue warres saint margarets day king edward queenero auesbery philip wife great army passed sea nauie sayle shippes flanders cullen fourth october fiftie galley well manned andsouthhampton sacked bret french irats furnished came southampton nine clocke sacked towne townesmen running away feare breake next day fledde helpe countrey came againste pirats fought whiche skirmish slayne number three hundred pirate togither captayne yong souldioure king sicils sonne yong man french king giuen whatsoeuer got kingdome england beeing beaten downe certayne man countrey cried rancon notwithstanding husbandman layde clubbe till slayne hym speaking word yea quoth know well ynough thou art fran therefore shalt thon dye vnderstoode speech neyther anye skill take gentleman prisoner keepe raunsome wherfore residue gennowayes set towne fire brent vp quite fledde galleyes theyr fleeing certaine drowned inhabitantes towne compassed strong great wal king still mayntayning warres fraunce euen annuntiation lady j galleyes approching towne harwich cast fire therein force whereof contrarie winde stayd gret harme done thereby furthermore yeare feaste pentecost certaine pirate normandie geno shipped gallenes pinaces made shew sea southampton woulde haue come alande threatned sore spoyle towne againe perceyuing townesmen ready resist returned ile wight entred put backe inhabitauntes wherevppon sayled sea coastes seeking lande place lesse defended came hastings brente fisher cotages theyr boates slewe many men also made greate shewes many time ile thanet douer fulkestone place little harme excepte poore fisherman thence sayled hauens cornewall deuonshire place much harme fisher men suche shippes founde vnma ned fiered length entred plimouth hauen brent certain great shippes great parte towne met hugh curtney earle onshire knight foure scoure yeares olde accompanyed manye souldiours countrey hauing lost firste fronte fewe men whiche slaine quarrel french ioyned fighte wyth hande hande slaying many pyrates vpon drye lande chased residue fled take galley able come nigh wading ere drowned ea nuber fiue hundred new brought king lying brabant diuers part englande spoyled pirate hee declared friend wit marque iult cence cer e cardinall great cause reuenge vpon end aunswered cardinal followeth kingdome fr sayde compassed thr ed lke whiche broken strength kingdome englande wherefore lorde king must stay comming dutchman friendes confederate greater part wherof l king raking great disdaine hereat staying nothing al said woulde ride land fraunce banner displayed ther wold l ke mightie power french men hee woulde eyther winne man else nestly dye fielde po et hugh betel septem sherifes maior hence dar october king edward wintere antwerp queene philip deliuered hir thirde son lionel erle vl er king toke vppon lieuetenauute theking edvvarde made vicegere empire empire bauare helde himselfe emperour sodaine inundation water newcastle vpon tine richard south nevvcastel drovvned bare downe peece towne wall sixe pearches length neare place called walkenew men woman drowned u g saint matthy king edwarde beganne ryde banner displayed twelue thousand men armes frenche king burnyng townes castels wheresoeuer came first night verye darke geffrey lord scrope one king justice led one cardinal wit bertrand de mount fa ntyne title ladie vp high tower shewing hym whole lande towarde fraunce compasse fifteene league euery place saying wordes sir doth si en threed wherwith fraunce compassed seme broken cardinall aunswering nothing fel downe deade sorowe feare thys sort king edward made ourneyes france dayly continuing space fiue weekes caused armye trauell sort destroyed whole countrey cambray tourney vermode landenewe excepting city wer sword wt church castels inhabitauntes countrey fledde neyther anye man durst resist enterpryses althoughe frenche king gathered greate army within walled city lying strog towne saint quintines time brabanders determined returne home againe entred theyr iourney forced vnto partlye wante victual partlye coldnesse winter whyche grew fast french king vnderstanding thereof beganne moue himselfe hys armye towarde campe king england gladly loking comming called back brabanders hauing receyued letter fro frenche king woulde ioyne battayle hym sent worde back againe woulde stay three dayes wherefore fourth daye kyng loking frenche king comming whiche woulde come nearer two mile breaking bridge felling tree king englande mighte followe hym fled paris wherevpon king edwarde returned hanonia brabrant continued almost whole winter william thorney roger frosham septe sherifes maior andrewe awbery grocer october winter time king edwarde grewe greate friendshippe flemmings prepared themselues time shewe selues good subiectes vnto swearing doe homage fealtie vppon condition would call himselfe king fraunce token thereof would thence forth giue armes flouredeluces otherwise durste obey feare pope curse layde vppon time rebelled king fraunce wherefore co friend flemmings consent noble men agreed vnto tooke vppon name armes king france also toke flaunders vnder gouernement people wherof long matter obedient vnto king fraunce conquerer touching title armes aforesayde frenche king sayde certayne englishman sent vnto cousin quoth doth wrongfully beare quartered armes england fraunce whiche matter notwithstanding doth much displease v descended weaker side kin therfore batcheller woulde content graunt licence beare part armes fraunce wheras seales letter patent nameth hymself well king englande fraunce doth set firste quarter armes leopardes quarter liles doth grieue v muche making apparaunt beholder little islande englande preferred great kingdome france unto sir iohn shordich knighte made aunswere custome men dayes set title armes theyr progenitor armes title righte descending mother thus dutie reasonanno reg sayde doth lord king englande preferre hys armes king edwarde thus busied mariner cinque port embarked themselues pinaces smal beates wel appointed feast hillarie arriued bononie vpo sea coast weather cloudie darke could scarsely perceyued hauen brent lower towne ninteene galley four great shippes twentie small boates theyr tackling suche house scituate nyghe sea cost amongst one great house full dare sayles weapon necessary sufficiente furnish nineteene galley men ye length skirmish betwixt townes men englishman many land men slaine beginning februarie king edwarde returned englande came vnto gaunt queene layiohn gaunt parliament vvestminster childbed hir fourth sonne named iohn helde parliament westminster wherein temporalty granted hym euery ninth fleece wool euery ninth lambe euery ninth sheafe sort corne cleargie gaue newe tenth immediatety easter earles salisburie suffolke accompanyed fewe men gaue assault towne lile flaunders town confederate french king chasing frech men far within gate percolices let fal beset multitude men armes taken conueyed fraunce fettered shackeled yron although orne true prisoner drawen cart middest euery citie towne uillage hamlet greate shoutes cryes rayling length beeing brought presence french king woulde haue shamefully slaine bin otherwise perswaded counsel king boemia king edward kept whitsontide ipswich intended thence take passage flaunders certified french king sent great nauie spanish ship also whole fleete fraunce stoppe passage caused ship cinque port assembled fleete great small shippes wherefore thursdaye matiuity saint iohn baptist hauing prosperous winde began sayle nexte daye euen sayde feaste escried french fleete lying swine hauen wherefore king caused fleete come ancker next day feast iohn baptist arly morning french fleet deuided themselues three part remoued themselues myle approching towards king fleete whiche king perceyued nine clocke hauing winde sunne backe set forwarde met enimies woulde haue wished wherewithall whole fleete gaue terrible shoute showre arrowes long woodden bowes powred downe french men thousandes slaine meeting length closed came hand blowes pike powle ax swordes threw stone toppes shippes wherewith many brained greatnesse heigth spanish shippes caused many english men strike many stroke vaine short french shippes ouercome al men spente firste parte englishman entred tooke french shippes chayned togyther suche sort coulde separated one another fewe englishman kepte part fleete wherfore set vpon second ward greate difficultie gaue charge whiche done sooner ouercome firste french men leauing ship many leapt ouer borde englishman hauing thus ouercome first seconde parte fleete hauing night drawyng partly want light partly wearie determined take rest till next morning wherefore night xxx shippes thirde crewe fled awaye greate shippe called iames deepe thinking haue carried away certaine ship sandwiche belonging prior canterburie stayde saylers stoutely defended themselues helpe earle huntingdon saued themselues theyr ship frenchman fight continued al night morning norman ouercome take wer found shippe aboue men slaine moreouer king vnderstanding xxx ship fledde hee sent fortie ship well appointed followe ouer made iohn crabe gouernour good speede knowen firste companye shippes taken founde conquered shippes denise george christopher blacke cocke whiche ship taken erenchmen sluce carried normandie number shippes warre taken barge number enimies slaine drowned aboue fiue twentie thousande englishman foure thousand among foure knightes sir thomas mortimer king cousin sir thomas latimer son sir william butteler seortkorne sir thomas poynings time scot came great power englande burning spoyling march fire sworde returning wyth great bootie cattayle neuer withstoode nobilitie march common people wold suffer passe set vpon toke theyr bootie slewe manye toke scot good reputation whome kept raunsome whiche fact noble menne march highly displeased lammas certaine french pirats gaue assault ile wight sodainly entred sir peter russel knight meeting people ile put backe made flee staying manye skirmish sayde knight wounded wherof dyed pirate sayled thece toward coast deuonshire comming teygnemouth sette fire towne brent thence sayled towardes plimouth towne defended coulde hurte burnt farmes fayre place nigh adioyning toke knight prisoner caried yeare king edward besieged turney vpon entreatie made frenche truce taken michaelmasse til midsommer wherfore king comming gaunt flaunders stayed looking money england came adam lucas bartholmew mari september sherifes maior andrew auburie grocer october king edwarde eight men fayning hee woulde ride abrode pleasure secretly came elande taking shippe sayled three dayes three nightes saint andrewes day night aboute cock crowing entred tower londo water wayted earle northampton nicholas ca tilopo reignalde cobham giles de bello campo iohn de bello campo knightes william killesby phillippe weston priestes earely morning sent cha cellour treasurer justice london bishop chichester chauncellour bishop couentrie treasurer put office minding also haue sent flaunders haue ben pledge money owed bishoppe chichester declared vnto daunger might insue hym canon churche whervpon king dismissed tower concerning high justice witte iohn lorde stoner robert lord willowby william lorde scharshel especially nicholas lord bech time lieutenant tower london sir iohn molens knight certaine marchaunt men iohn poultney william pole richard brother chauncellours chiefe clearkes witte maister iohn de saint paule michael wathe henrie stafforde certaine exchequer maister iohn thorpe many moe king commaunded imprisoned one place another neyther woulde suffer discharged thence til hee throughlye pacified anger conceyued sendyng money whiche shoulde haue serued siege torney yeare christmas henrie bishoppe lincolne geffrey lord scrope chiefe justiciar kyng chiefe counseller dyed gaunt anno reg king edwarde kept christmasse gildforde great justing reading also candlemasse hee kept greate iusting langley honor noble men vascon trayned vp feates war made robert de boursier knight lord chancellour englande robert parnike knighte treasurer one succeede also sent justiciar thatiustice tral baston shoulde set euerye shire enquyre concerning collectours tenthes fifteenthes wool ouersee al officer bicause citie london would suffer officer set justice within theyr citie inquisitours suche matter contrarie theyr liberty king prouided justice shoulde holde theyr session tower london make inquisition domages londoner bycause londoner woulde aunswere vntill theyr liberty fully confirmed neyther anye suche confirmation coulde eyther king chauncellour touching writ charter towre rose thereof suche greate tumulte justicies appointed sit fayned woulde holde session till easter wherevpon king highly offended sayde tumult desirous know name raysed coulde vnderstande certaine meane person claymed theyr liberty wherevpon king pacified troubled minde forgaue offence committed londoner justice breaking vp theyr sitting touching sayde place1 parliament london yeare within quindene easter parliamente holden london wherein earles noble realme common others amongst thing requested charter called magna carta carta foresta liberty beelonging churche kingdome obserued officer chiefe ruler king house shoulde chosen peeres realme parliament peticions king would confirme could abide heare talked beginning moneth julye kyng edwarde receyued letter lodowike duke bauarie vsurper romaine empyre whyche pretendyng friendshippe betwixt phillip french king hee signifyed warres whyche king england begonne fraunce greately mislike therefore desired shoulde concorde amitie betwixte king realmes whyche bee performed offered bestowe labour requestyng kyng edwardes letter aucthoritie thereof treate conclude truce one yeare twaine towarde ende whiche letter addeth wordes deputation lieutenauntship whiche gaue vnto diuers sundry cause reuoke dated frankeford fourteenth june seauen twentith ure raign empire fourteenth letter king edwarde wrote inscription sorte followeth renoumed prince lodowicke grace god romaine emperour alwayes augustus edwarde grace king fraunce englande lorde ireland c richard de barking iohn de rokesley sept sherifes maior iohn oxford vintener october yeare iohn maluerne fellowe oriall colledge oxford made finished booke entituled vision pierce plowman tho de la king edwarde gaue earledome cambridge iohn lord henault vncle queene phillip keptanno reg feast saint katherine newcastel christmas also untill time dauid king scottes threatned leuie armie enter lande wherevpon king edwarde entred scotland followed dauid fled beyonde scottish sea wasting spoyling al went except castels marishes scottes togither dauid theyr king hyd themselues william mountacute earle salisburie hauing gotten1342 greate fleete entred iland belonging scotlande victoriouslye conquered ile called ile man kyng gaue conquerour franckelye freely possest caused hymking man called crowned king ile king edward returning towards south part kept solemn torneymentes dunstable beyng accompanyed wyth knightes yeare parliamente westminster wherein archbishoppe canterburie reconcyled king archbishoppe sware althoughe kyng hys counsell consente hadde done homage french king dukedome aquitaine earledome poytowe yet neuer consented therto anye hurte preiudice kyng hys counsel myghte incurre fauoure seeke please french king presente tyme thoughte beste done obtayning peace also profit kyng realme parliament king commaunded florence golde made tower london saye peny value sixe shilling eight penny halfe penye value three shilling foure penny farthing worthe twentyeflorences golde sherifes maior anno reg penny iohn louekyn richard rifling bury septem simon fraunces mercer october parliament westminster moneth may religious men certifye counsell al person helde king landes capite anya general suruey vvhole realme england fee value one hundred shilling name suche shoulde enrolled giuen vp recorde also certaine put aucthoritie signifie howe many sufficient able bowman euerye shire also sufficient men able beare armour defence theyr country see practised suche kinde weapon wherein beste skill thus assembled part realme speciallye suche lawfull age commaundemente giuen shoulde readye kyngs commaundemente fyghte agaynste theyr enimies king edwarde noble perceyuing derogationro de auesbury gual homingford done realme reseruations prouisions collation benefice pope practised england wrote requiring sith church englande bene founded endued noble worthy men ende people might instructed people owne language beyng farre coulde vnderstande defaultes yet hys predecessours bene vsed diuerse reseruations prouisions collation made diuerse person straungers yea enimies realme whereby money profit carried forth theyr cure prouided according founder mindes therefore vpon due consideration therof signifyed coulde suffer enormity longer therefore besought reuoke reseruations prouisions collation wholy auoyde suche slaunders mischieues harmes mighte ensue cure might committed person meet exercise beseeching wythout delay signify intention sith ment bestow diligence remedie matter see redresse might giuen ful parliament westminster xviij may yeare iohn steward iohn aylesham september sherifes maior iohn hamonde october many called ayde king scot ready contributed money wherewith king might hyre souldiours place remayned home king edward caused called togither great many anno reg tho walsing round table vvindsore artificer castell windsore began builde house whiche called rounde table floure wherof center midde point compasse hundred foote whole diameter foote circunference thereof foote three quarter time phillip de valoys king fraunce buyldedround table fraunce scala croni rounde table countrey ende mighte allure menne warre germanie italie keepe kyng englandes rounde table kyng edwarde succour iohn mountfort duke ofth de la brytaine wife child remayned king custodie sent earles northampton oxforde hugh spencer richard talbot knightes maister william kilesby clearke euerye one hauing vnder many armes archer britaine entred thereinto despight al theyr enimies whych resisted making many conflictes toke well walled townes diuerse fortress castelles assaulte surrender whiche meanes whole countrey vnder theyr subiection conquering till came towne morleis charles de bloys mette wyth greate armye therfore champion grounde nygh vnto morley thebattayle morley two armyes made greate moste stoute battayle wherin worthinesse sortes dyd full well appeare fought stout side first conflict chaunced like bene seene chiefe captaines charles de bloys frenche king hadde giuen dukedome countrey william de bohune earle northamton defence ye right iohn de mountfort naturall heire duke lande king englande made generall ouer army english men foughte long wyth hande stroke fielde daye manne lyar coulde giue prayse one three tymes daye beyng wearied side wythdrewe themselues take breathe fell speare shielde sworde targe ye ende right worthy stoute charles de bloys men fleeing away also forced flee himselfe wherevppon many slaine side victorie fell englishman geffrey wichingham thomas legge sep sherifes maior iohn hamond october king edwarde sente ouer henrie earle darbie son earle lancaster cousin fiue hundered men armes amongst earle ofro auesbery anno reg penbroke walter de many manye archer gascoigne ralph baron stafforde seneshal gascoigne come thyther sayde earle made fiftie knightes armye wanne manye walled townes castelles making many worthy skirmish length towne dagu lown assaulte keeping wherof appointed ralph stafford afterward appointed three iourneys toward townes especially brigerecke called strength thereof also called chamber fraunce also ye town saint iohn de laruel many greate strong townes well fortified great toyles diuerse daungerous assaultes wan earle darbie souldiours vndermining tower wals sayde towne sore assaulted whiche defended thus conquered city townes castelles fortress number one hundred fiftie bringing greate parte gascoigne vnder subiection euen tolouse vnto whiche citie domage neyther inhabitantes therof made wonderfully afrayde certaine tolde sayeth aucthour fear religious people constrayned beare armour prior carmelitetho de la frier lady tolouse hauyng banner ladye golde set fielde siluer displayed prouoking thereby many take armour second sonday lent earles fully fraught bootie prisoner gold siluer returned towardes burdeaux iohn de valoys eldest sonne french king accompanyed great number hyred dutche souldiours besieged towne agnlowne captaines thereof earle stafforde entrenched towne without greate daunger englishman coulde haue accesse vnto earle darby bet awaye besieged citie e soones new victualled notwithstanding able raise siege bycause hadde entrenched themselues without towne refusing fight fielde would aunswere came pitch fielde besiege town wherefore continued siege vntil decollation saint iohn vnderstanding king england chaced father phillip sore grecie fearing shoulde come verye late ayde hys father gaue vppe siege setting tentes fire fled darke earle stafforde wyth hys power pursued cut theyr tayle tooke greate manye theyr horsses prisoner retourned certaine bowman mustered england appointed sente ouer sea commyng ouer layde garrison fordefence countrey also twenty thousande sackes wooll graunted king moreouer geffrey de harecourte norman came king requiring ayd french king wrongfully withhelde hys landes first comming fealtie sware homage king edward afterward reuolted thomas hatfielde king secretary meanes oftho walsing kyngs letter pope admitted byshoppe durham certaine cardinalles sayde sayd thomas light person lay man pope answered truly king england timeansvvere pope made request asse haue obteined yeare dyed adam tarleton bishop winchester bin long time blind whome succeeded william edendon treasourer mercels stayde fiue dayes whiche time countrey towne barbefleete men consumed fire thence departed veloygus set fire went senet combe de mount whiche nigh sea garantam thence serius saint lewes passing along vnto towne turney wasting fire night kyng lodged carmalin gerin religious house belonging vnto cane leauing nothing behinde vnspoyled afterward made assaulte entred citiecane normandy beseeged edvvard third cane making entrance bridge whiche strongly defended slayne hundreth three fortie knightes among whiche earles ewe camberlin de tankeruill dyuers captaynes whyche sente england lady abatesse cane citie slayne aboue one thousande three hundred citie armie remayned sixe dayes spoyle thereof solde marriners whiche followed coast king went wente monasterie towne toward strong thyng well defended afterwarde came vnto argon nighte burning still wente till came citie licens founde cardinalles clarimount naples one archbishop offered king treatie peace king continued three dayes refusing treate peace wente lestentnoland towne briue lodged new burge selelefe vpon sayne welchmen amme water segan beeing resisted inhabitantes slewe many passed nigh towne castell pount darch beeing strong place sautable thys nighte lodged lury vpon segan nigh vnto good towne louars whiche burne passed towne castell gaylon whiche tooke brente lodged lingeuie whiche nigh good towne castell vernon whiche touched first entred france night brente castell roche blanche whiche standeth side segan lodged fremble vpon segan passed towne de maunt lodging night oporne nexte day passed frigmas nexte daye good towne poecie beeyng bridge passe ouer riuer segan frenche spoyled kyng caused bee reedifyed nexte daye came vnto amia three greate army appoynted keepe king passing way hee making greate conflicte slewe three hundreth firste charge put residue flighte spoyled tentes burning three hundreth two carte wagon lade crossebowes quarels armor victual king staying two dayes went gresile nigh vnto pountoys antell next day passed citie wenneys touched tr solours water lodged next day wan towne poys brent castell thence went aregnus achen lodged next day came noell vpon sea side trumpettes giue signe battayle themselues felt force english archer quarels fell short great way moreouer footemen placed among owne horseman gaulled english shotte arrowes ouerrunne troden vpon great french king profered battayle king certayne condition accepted gladlye meane season beseeged made knowne state french king signes token first comming within towne set vp auntient chiefest tower castell also set banner duke earles france little shutting euening made great light toppe one highest tower towards armie frenchman therewithall made greate shoute noyse wyth trumpet drommes second night made like somewhat lesse third night small fire giuing forth therewith sorrowfull voyce signifying thereby strength touching keeping towne quite spent done night tooke flagges antients except standart last day battayle drew tyme came england dutchland toward helpe king edwarde seauenteene thousande fighting men wherevpon french king betimes morning thethe french king fleeth second day august making fire tentes fledde whose tayle duke lancaster earle northampton wil norwell cutting slewe tooke many caleis perceyued thys tooke standart downe greate sorrow cast tower downe ditch saterday following iohncaleis yeelded de vienna captayne man skilfull warlike affayres opening gate towne came thethe order hovv caleis vvas yeelded king england sitting little nagge lame feete could well goe halter necke burgess souldiours following foote bare headed bare footed hauing halter neckes captayne comming thus king offered warlike sword vnto chiefest prince armes amongst christian king one taken towne mightiest christian king noble cheualrie deliuered keyes towne thirdly requesting pitie asked pardon deliuered sword peace wherewith giue right iudgement spare forbeare humble lowly brought london wyth the1348 king scottes licenced departe home agayne swearing king peace fealtie afterwarde liuing peaceably march requested william dowglas ride hunting comming behind backe vppon hys shoulder vntill hee crowne france due vnto peaceable possession little easter great justings holdeniusting lincolne lincolne duke lancaster presente many ladyes countesse also certayne de la great pestilece tho wa sing iohn loueken fishmonger october beganne amongst east indian tartarians certayne pestilence length waxed generall infecting middle region ayre greatly destroyed sarasins turkes sirians palestinian gretians wonderfull rather incredible death much people beeing exceedingly dismayde terrour thereof consulted amongst themselues thought good receyue christian faith sacramentes intelligence christian whiche dwelte side greekish sea greatly common custome troubled wyth sicknesse mortalitie length terrible slaughter passed ouer countreys side alpes thence partes france called hesperia order along germany dutchland seauenth yeare beganne came england first beganne townes port ioyning sea coastes dorsetshire euen countreys made countrey quite voyde inhabitantes almost none left aliue thence passed deuonshire somersetshire euen vnto bristowe raged suche sort glocestershiremen woulde suffer bristowmen haue anye accesse vnto countrey anye meanes
