uery fewe noble men dyed among whome departed iohn mountgomery lady lord clisteles captayne1349 caleis dyed caleis buryed white frier london common people togither religious clearkes dyed innumerable sorte man god onely knewe many dyed first january first july citie norwich person besides ecclesiasticall mendicantsnorvvich regist norwich ecclesi yermouth dominikes buryed church churchyard yermouth one yeare men woman time personage worth markes yeare afterwardes scarse worth fortie pounde yeare note certified king henry seauenth raigne written gate church yermouth great pestilence began london feast sainctes yeare time pestilence wasted england ye scot greatly reioycing mocked sware ofttimes vile death englishman sword god wrath departing fro thence slew cosumed scot lesse nu bers also wasted welchmen within passed ouer ireland destroyed great nuber english people dwelt suche right irishman borne dwelt hilly countreys scarcely touched died therof plague cotinued sometime one place sometime another vntill yeare lord yeare truce finall peace concluded b norwich earle northampton earle stafford richard talbot walter mayny knightes sayled ouer sea france frenchman met peaceably would agree nall peace vnlesse caleis restored againe would granted truce whiche taken yeare continued earle flanders would case receyue condition peace vnlesse french king quite forsaken notwithstanding solemne oth long entred flanders great power frenchman burning killing euer came people countrey englishman withstoode stoutely gaue sore skirmish beside many frenchman slayne earle himselfe forced flie whiche worthy acte many knightes made amongst iohn de filebert english man feast natiuitie saint iohn queene purified windesore solemne iustes running tilt dauid king scottes iustes vvindsore present earle ewe lord tankeruill lord charles de valoys many stranger captiues king licence permitted runne also tilte pastime price field adiudged earle ewe sommer season stranger passed time hunting company king noble realme claringdon wiltshire nigh salisburie diuers forrestes while king thus occupyed frenchman notwithstanding truce entred march britaine sonnes sabater went forraging tooke thomas dagworth knight man great experience men weete sixteene armed men entred woodde robber inuaded slaying number three hundred length stricken fiue time face quarelssir thomas dagvvorth slayne men first slayne himselfe thrust body sword adam burie ralph linne september sherifes maior ro auesbery adam mer william turke fishmonger october feast saint michael person sealande hollande comming flaunders vnto london sometime church saint paule sometyme place citie twice day sighte people loynes vnto heeles couered lynnena bloudy procession publican clothe rest body bare hauing theyr heades hat red cross behinde euery one right handes whip three cordes eache corde hauing knotte middest beat themselues theyr bare bloudie body going procession foure singing theyr owne language aunswering yeare earle lancaster baron stafforde greystocke also heires lordes percy neuel lord burniual barthelmew burwash diuerse feast alsaintes passed ouer sea gascoign delay furious vprore iohn de valoys sonne french king made dukedome greatly spoyling wasting also king counsel ordained none king justice time office shoulde receyue fee gift reward man except king himselfe also thys yeare countie oxforde nyghe vntoa serpent vvith tvvo heades oxfordshire towne called chippingnorton founde serpent hauing two heades face like woman shaped newe tyre time another manner old attyre great wing manner flyndermouse bat feast alsainctes kyng edwarde beyng accompanyedk edvvarde sayled tovvards flaunders earle lancaster southfolke diuerse others passed ouer sea flaunders thece leading armie towardes fraunce french men made meanes vnto renewe truce nowe earle flaunders submitted himselfe thirde time vnto king mercie dominion king returning toward englande solemnizate translation thomas confessour bishoppe hereforde dyd wyth presence nobilitye honoure greate expences nicholas cantulupus baron cousin sayde saint thomas whiche feaste solemnitie signified king secretary emericus padua feed manne king ofcalleis like haue bin betrayed englande fourteenth day januarie nexte comming geffrey cherney knight manye frenche men shoulde receyued caleis vnto sayd towne solde sayde emericus towne beyng presentlye rescued king edwarde sayde emericus padua genoways cotinued caleis beyng maintayned costes frenche king againste king englande besieged also yeelding king england pardoned bothe life lymme thenceforth continued dwelte feed man kyngs sayde towne defence thereof tyme sayde geffrey lorde matas man skylfull warfare anye frenche man fraunce wherefore greatelye esteemed euen time death craftie deuiser indeuored letter wherin made promise large giftes golde sophisticall perswasitions quite subuert fayth loyaltie sayde emericus finally thys craftie deuiser agreed false man twentie thousande french crownes shoulde lette frenche menne towne muche laye hym delyuer vppe frenche menne towne castell bargaine traytorously made othe breaking ye sacrament betwixt yet notwythstanding wrote letter vnto kyng touching state whole matter verye priuilye howe hee readie shewe friendshippe frenche menne yet meanyng make frustrate theyr purpose whereby shoulde conuicted breakyng truce also manye shoulde taken bee raunsomed wherefore kyng edwarde speedilye passed ouer beyng accompanyed wyth hys eldest sonne earle marche fewe commyng tyme appoynted yeeldyng towne certayne dayes thereforeanno reg hee beyng come callayes hee sayde certayne men armes wythin uaultes whyche betwixte outter gate inner parte castell buyldyng thinne stender wall newelye sette vppe made playster counter ayte matter whyche ioyned wal craftilye deuised made like olde worke manne woulde judge anye enclosed therin also caused maynepostes drawe bridge bee sawed almoste sunder yet suche sort horssemen mighte ryde ouer purpose hadde greate stone whiche layde vppe hole made forme arche beyng foreparte tow e hangyng ouer bridge whyche hee appoynted faythfull souldiour bee tyme throwe downe sayde stone vppon bridge wyth fall thereof bridge beyng halfe cutte two broken sunder hole stone layde shoulde bee wrought suche sorte hee wythin shoulde perceiue throughe hole howe manye dyd enter made priuie practise neyther many knowe king presence prince wale wroughte thys feate secretely conueyed themselues towne daye tyme delyuerie thys towne geffrey cherney fifteene faithfullest menne wyth g parte golde whiche payde shoulde also faythe emericus order castell searching euery euery tower corner whiche could finde open coulde perceyue nothing contrarie theyr lykyng wherevpon next day morning set vp french king standerde highest towre castell auntientes also geffrey lordes vpon tower place people town kept common watch warde knowing secrete deuice gretly terrifyed therwith muche taking weapon hande beganne giue charge castell french men hadde entred day toke thomas kingstone fleeing awaye quite ignoraunt whiche deuised forceably set stockes certaine sent french men companion maisters laye without ambush shewed auntients standerd set vp well euen woulde haue hastning forwarde come defence castell againste townes men wherfore rysing lorking place aduaunced themselues pride bragging came heapes gate castell townes men perceyuing muche adoe forebeare handes chiefe leader withdrawen least daunger haue happened laye hid laye hid closed vnder arch walles prepared themselues breake vpon enimies like sorte also great stone man shut vp hole see many entred eeming fellowes sufficient ouerthrowe great stone put custodie hee brake drawe bridge whiche enemy entred coulde goe waye againe stone thus downe discharged thing layde vp french men deceiued pollicy wer enclosed safe ynough noyse stone bridge brake armed men spake breaking downe counterfaite wall behinde deceyte hyd presently set themselues order inuade french men bidden bitter breakfast conflict sharp good season length enimies ouercome yeelded themselues plesure conquerours without entred soone perceyued theyr companion deceyued fled whome king scarce sixteene men armes many archer followed pace runnawayes knowing company woulde followe many thys chase wearied many moe slaine small time king ouercame daungerous great labour length vnderstoode fledde howe fewe chased fourescore armed men turned king dare ascribe thystho de la boldnesse king chasing enimies hys wisedome outnesse minde whiche wel knowen god grace brought good effect meanes though daunger neuer gret perceyued french men turned selues withstande caste away scaberde hys sword comforting men setting good order exhorted play men lustily archer placed marche side enimies stoode dry hilles compassed aboute quagmyers foggie place neyther horssemen footemen might approch rather drowned mud come neere hurt also king comfort saying doe well archer play men lustily knowe edwarde windsor presence king necessitie matter styrred vp theyr harte doe well archer vncouering theyr heades stripping vp theyr sleeues bente themselues bestow theyr arrowes sort might loste french men drewe towardes saluted arrowes armed men partes stoode order fighte vppon long narrowe causewaye bredth whereof able receiue scarce twentie men armes fronte hauing side thereof marishe whiche archer placed gauled wounded theyr enimies side fleeing thicke hayle kyng men wyth archer side slewe tooke greate manye manye stoode stoutlye till length comming prince wale frenche putte flighte long chase pursuing enimies returning backe againe caleis numbred fledde well whiche taken founde taking castell prisoner reported came thousand men armes sixe hundred armed men serued aboue three thousand among taken geffrey charney sonne edwarde1 de renty robert danquile otto de gulo baron martingham baldyne saylly henrie de prees garinus baylofe peter renel peter dargemole eustace de riplemount manye lordes knightes baronet chased ranne away theyr auntientes lorde de mountmarice also laundas maried lady saint paule countesse penbroke england also ye lord fenas lorde planckes another eustace de replemount slaine skirmish lord henrie de boy lord archibalde many others whose name conqueror able certifie thus pollicie deuised treason aucthours therof came death destruction neither eustachius himselfe escaped scot free fro snare within taken french men burned aliue hotte yron degraded fro order knighthood cutting heeles depriuing tong alsitio afterward ha ged vp laste beheaded quartered receyuing iust punishment treason false forswearing yeare lord fur uall giuing rash enterprise vpon enimies taken prisoner gascoign long king edwarde prepared make voyage france earle lancaster returning gascoigne signied truce taken reason whereof passage prepared king layde aside yeare saint george day kiug held great tho de la mor great feast vvindsor saint george solemne feaste castel windsor augmented chappell henrie firste hys progenitor king england erected eight canon added eight chanons deane fifteene chanons xxiiij poore impotent knightes minister seruauntes appeareth tho walsing ex charta regia first founder noble order garter record garter charter dated two twentith hys raigne besides king also contributor foundation colledge followeth soueraigne king edward thirde edward eldest sonne prince wale henrie duke lancaster erle warwicke captain de bouch ralph erle stafforde william montacute erle salisburie roger lord mortimer erle march sir iohn de lisle sir bartholmew burwash sir iohn beauchampe sir iohn de mahune sir hugh courtney sir thomas hollande sir dabridgecourte sir william panell al togither king clothed gownestho de la russet poudered gartiers blew wearing like garter also right legges mantel blewe withfirst feast saint george scutcheon saint george sort apparell bareheaded heard masse celebrat simon islipe archbishop canterburie bishop winchester excester afterwardes went feaste setting themselues orderlye table honoure feast named saint george martyre chosing knightes garter sommer following variaunce rysing betweene fleetes englande spaine spaniardes besette brytaine sea foure fortie great ship warre whiche sonke ten english ship comming fro gascoigne towardes englande taken spoyled thus former iniuries reuenged entred sluce flaunders king edwarde vnderstanding hereof furnished nauie fiftie shippes pinaces forecasting meete wyth spaniardes theyr returne hauing companye prince wale earles lancaster northampton warwicke salisburie arundale huntington glocester baron knightes seruauntes archer vpon feast decolatio saint iohna euensongro de auesbery time nauies met winchelsea wher great spanish vessel surmounting shippes foystes like castels cotages sharply ayled men ye stone quarels flying fro top sore cruelly wounded lesse busie fight alofe launce swordbattaile sea foreward manfully defende themselues length archer perced theyr arbalisters retch tha coulde strike againe thereby compelled forsake place caused fighting hatch shade themselues table ship compelled threwe stone toppes hyde durst shew theyr head tumble men enfring ye spanish uessels sword halberd killed met wtin whyle make voyd vessel furnish wyth english men vntil beset darknesse night could decern xxvij yet remayning vntaken men cast ancker studying hoped battayle supposing nothing finished whilest thing remayned vndone dressing wounded throwing myserable spaniard sea refreshing themselues victualles sleepe yet committing vigilant watche armed bande night ouerpassed englishe men prepared vaine new battayle sunne began appeare viewing sea coulde perceyue signe resistaunce xxvij shippes fleeing away nighte lefte xvij spoyled euening kyngs pleasure agaynste theyr wil king returned england victorie triumphe king preferred noble ympes order knighthoode greatlye bewayling losse one witte sir richard goldesborough knight thys yeare phillippe de valoys frenche kyngphillip frech king died deceased hys eldest sonne iohn crouned iohn notte william worcester september sherifes maior richard killingburie october two hyred souldiours kyng armenia came englande presence king shewed letter aforesayde king armenia wherein signified one witte iohn de viscount man borne cipres slanderou ly charged thomas de la marche frenche man borne bastarde sonne phillippe late king fraunce saying sayde thomas shoulde haue receyued turkes certaine golde betraying armye christian vnto emperour turkes proofe slaunder iohn chalenged combat wyth sayde thomas tryed iudgement edward king englande moste worthy prince strife shoulde ended therefore two worthy souldiours appointed fight performed within listes king pallace westminster mondaye nexte following feaste saint michael thomas declaration hys innocencie accused ouercame enimye yet killed could bycause able wounde hym beyng armed anye kynde piercing weapon except hys face whiche bare hadde runne tilte foughte foote striuing togither grounde wyth certaine prickes bothe shorte sharpe called gadlings closed ioyntes hys righte gauntlet sayde thomas strucke sayde iohn face sore wounded hym side iohn hadde suche shorte kinde weapon wherewyth hee myght hurte thomas face therefore cryed aloude moste horribly whervpon king commaundemente combatte ended victorie adiudged thomas gaue sayde iohn thus ouercome prince wale captiue offered owne armoure sainte george sainte paules churche london wyth greate deuotion matter beyng thus finished cipres man manumitted fette libertie free man againe thomas thinking boldely goe presence brother frenche king toke hys iourney thyther comming founde sayde king nobilitie fraunce greatlye offended indignation agreed combat shoulde tried king england wherefore thomas thinking secretly himselfe howe winne false friendship brother desirous shewe therein hee hadde done well among thing greatelye praysed nobilitie edwarde worthy fame spredde ouer al worlde also iustice whiche vsed iudging accepting person manne cipres yea thoughe loued kyng himselfe verye well neyther suffered preferred whiche frenche manne brother friende thee lorde kyng fraunce iudge ouer sayde king edwarde aduersarie also earle ewe hyghlye praysed king england hee hadde receyued greate comforte commoditye hys handes tyme hys captiuitie englande shewing also howe farre good kyng hadde banished enuie hatred hys hearte time iustyng beyng fielde exercise kyng also commaunded kyng hymselfe beare awaye price pricke commendation frenche kyng enuie indignation moste wickedlye commaunded setter forthe prayses beheaded colour matter better fayned earle vsed muche familiaritie queene wife brother guiltie treason againste king fraunce bycause committed cause combat tryed iudgement king englande thus murdered brother tormented wife death famine daughter noble king boheme lately slaine battayle geffrey william edington bishoppe winchester treasurergroates halfe groates anno reg tho walsing histo au england wise man caused newe coyne called groate halfe groate coyned lesse wayght penny called esterlings reason wherof victualles merchandice became dearer thorough whole realme octaues purification lady aparliament vvestminster parliament holden westminster henrie earle lancaster created earle lincolne leicester derby grosmount ferrers duke lancaster vnto whome also giuen great priuiledges suche neuer erle time also lionel antwerpe king sonne made earle v star irelande iohn gaunte brother made earle richmonde ralph baron stafforde made earle stafforde lent following walter de maine roberte herle captain caleis rod france making gret praes great domage brought away gret store beastsa fat covv sixteene penny sheepe swine caleis fat cowe scarcelye solde sixteene penny sterling easter duke lancaster departing caleis marched alongst sea coastes artoys picardie brent suburbes bulloign assaulting town preuayled ladder short therefore wasted city tirwin hauen also townes fauconbridge staple hauens brent aboue ship diuerse mould brenning champion countrey rode vnto saint omers winning force manye fortress great pray many prisoner returned caleis feast saint george thing prospered wel gascoine marshal france greate number armed men spoyled countrey dangel edmond rose norffolke man captayne garison valiauntly encountred enimies flew many toke sayde marshal manye noble fraunce chasing aboue knightes yeare spanish shippes treatie peace came englande last yeare restrayned nowe truce taken twentie yeares betwixt england spaine truce betwixt englande fraunce one yeare whiche french men brake reason taking castel guisnes next yeare shall shewed iohn wroth gilbert steineshorpe septem sherifes maior andrew auberie grocer october season old coine gold changed new olde noble worth muche aboue taxed rate newe therfore marchauntes boughte olde conueyed realme greate losse king kingdome whiche remedie prouided chaunging stampe beginning januarie french men beeing occupied repayring ye wals guisnes town afore time destroyed english men armes caleis vnderstanding doings deuised might ouerthrow work done sort archer named iohn dancaster prison inanno reg castel guisnes time take hauing wherwith pay raunsome let lose condition shoulde worke amongst french menthe getting guisnes englishe fellow chaunced lye laundres strumpet learned hir beyond principal ditch bottome wall made two foote broade stretching bottome brimme ditche within forthe couered water coulde seene drowned man going alofte theron shoulde wette paste knee beyng made vse fisher therefore middest discontinued space two foote archer hys harlot shewyng hym measured heygth wall wyth threede thing thus known one day slipping wal passed ditche hydden wall lying hidde marish till euening came night neare vnto cale tarrying cleare daye wente towne else might instructed greedie praye scale castell howe might enter caused ladder made length archer appointed thirtie conspyring togither clothing themselues blacke armour without brightnesse went castell guiding sayde iohn de dancaster clyming wall ladder slewe watchman threwe headlong beside wall hall slew many founde vnarmed playing chesse hazarde brake chamber turret vpon ladyes knightes laye asleepe made maisters within shutting prisoner strong chamber bereft armour toke english men bin taken yeare kept prison hadde relieued well meate drinke made guardens ouer custodie wanne fortress castell vnknowen towne appointed ouersee repayring broken wals happened within castell morning commaunded workemen towne cease theyr workes therevppon perceyuing castell wonne streyghte wayes fledde newe castilian suffered ladyes depart horssebacke wyth theyr apparell writing munimentes oughte holde theyr fee daye came caleis theyr ayde suche person sente whose ayde kepte castell aboute three clocke came two knightes sente earle gu snes demaunding truce willed know thus entred castel belonged whose aucthoritie kept castell taken time truce wherevnto aunsweared intruded woulde declare man theyr purpose til tryed longer possession therefore saint mawrice day abbot king busie parliamente french men sente sayde earle guisnes declared preiudice truce sayd castel taken therefore right mutuall fayth ought restored vnto king aunswered without hys knowledge enterprice made therefore hee gaue commaundemente subiectes none shoulde deteyne castell guisnes deliuer vnto lawfull lordes thereof messenger returned1352 home reporting done earle guisnes commeth castel demanding within time whose name kepte constantly affirming kepte name iohn dancaster required knowe iohn king englandes liegeman woulde obey answearing knewe messenger hadde bin englande earle offered castle besides treasure founde many thousand crownes possession exchaunge perpetuall peace king france aunsweared takyng castel english men nation theyr demerites bannished peace king englande wherefore place thus helde would willingly sell exchaunge none sooner theyr naturall king englande sayde woulde sell castel obtaine peace would buy woulde sell king fraunce whome soeuer would giue earle thus shifted king englande boughte deede place whyche greatlye desired fortresse wont stoppe vppe passage higher countrey gyuing greate suertye forragers issue forth caleis counsell fraunce therefore wishing haue castell agayne builde another like vtilitie defence countrey thereaboutes sente geffrey charney latelye redeemed englishe captiuitie aucthoritie builde fortifye followeth trauayle guisnes caleis place lefte hande strong decayed hauyng churche certaine nunnes resident called lalbastie place neare guisnes lalbastie fortified englishe menne standyng without gate theyr fortresse might shoote thys monasterie nunnes mighte easilye made defensible hadde high wals like castell highe towre verye large steeple beyng scituate marishe grounde mighte small labour compassed ditche place englishe men hadde spared deuotion sake vntil forsayde geffrey breache truce wyth mightye power besieged guisnes remoued nunnes churche making castell church fensing walles rampire ditch pentecoste whiche season water impeaching hym people myghte worke marishe wythin castel therefore besieged vnneth able come abroade wyth theyr boates ditch ful water marish vnpassable also full water neyther caleis coulde victuall anye manner meane reason siege wardyng kepte lalbastie thus besieged oft time sailed fought lalbastie slue sometime arrow sometime wt weapon length vpon day appointed calisians oye markes one part within guisnes met set enimies slew many chased many away finally set fire brent vp lalbastie andlalbastie brent rased dismanteling walles made plaine groud yeare duke lancaster going spruce aduise ordinance king daughter dispousate england william duke zeland eldest sonne lewes duke bauire intruded vpon romane empire yeare fifteenth august walter bentley vvalter bentley robert knolles make voyage france captayne robert knolles march briteine valiantly encountered enimies fight doubtfull good slayne principall marshall france also lord quintin cur noke richmont mount albon legenell launey montbech vile chastel de la march knightes number bachelers number fiue hundred whose coatearmours brought away number commos compted take lord brusebeke sonne marshall bertram also tristram de maleis also lord maletret uicount comaine geffrey de graues william de la vall charles darchesill iohn de bause knightes bachelers aboue armie frenchman vnder conduct sayde marshall purpose deuised besette backehalfe steepenesse mountayne flie could end hope flight take courage fight might ye encrease many knightes surnamed starre whoknightes sta e profession conspired neuer turne fearefull backes enimies number knightes among slayne taken numbred xlv dangerous encounter escaped vnhurt among foresayd walter bentley captayne sore wounded commanded thirtie archer condemned greatest heate fight fledde earle stafford also entered gascoigne encountering greate armie frenchman issued forth fortresse gagent discomfited tooke chased natiuitie lady taken valiant knight ruse gaude seauen knightes starre shortly dyed iohn dediaseles thomas wale knightes greate valor iohn pe che iohn stotley september sherifes maior adam francis mercer october yeare heard pirats troubled sea seauen shippes warre ordeyned certayne pine attending vpon ouer whiche admiralles thomas cooke richard tottlesham knightes scoured sea coast picardie normandie feast saint george returned wished whilest thing sea lande otto sonne duke brunswike french king feedotto brunsvvike chalengeth combate vvith duke lancaster french king paris man sent letter duke lancaster returned spruce tenour whereof accused affirming returned spruce colein malitiouslie informed coleners sayd otto went stealth haue taken prisoner haue presented french king adding heerevnto bycause neuer meant taking ready declaration good name singular combate onely french king court proue duke lancaster lyar touching sayd article letter sealed therefore least might haue bin thought follie haue giuen credite letter deliuered seruant duke sent vnto otto two knightes learne cause chalenge demaund thereof letter patentes sealed seale armes knightes accomplishing effect iourney returning speede duke sent french king safe conduct himselfe men much ado obteyning went paris listes presence french king king nauarre duke burgoigne many peeres realme france mounted steede seemely wise readie signes without default trie combate stayde till aduersarie readie voyce herault canton common othe assurance word obey law contrary parte sayde otto scarcely set horse able decently set helmet weelde speare else fayned whose vnablenesse beeing perceyued french king king nauarre kyng tooke quarrell hys handes wherevpon otto commaunded first departe listes wente hys way duke abode still within commandement frenche king otto sware neuer day appeach duke lancaster article thence duke returned home zeland epiphanie parliament holden westminster anno reg parliament vvestminster wherin ordinace made instance londoner knowne weare fro thenceforth hoode excepte reyed striped diuers couloursapparell appoynted harlot furre garmentes reuersed turned wrong syde outwarde vppon payne forfeyte yeare dearth corne ireland irishman brought corne sell vnto diuers hauens realme waged great releefe people king edward altered chappell progenitor founded saint stephen westminster colledge twelue secular canon twelue uicars minister accordingly endewed reuenewessaint stephen chappell vvestminster ex carta summe fiue hundred pound yeare morrow saint matthies day began parliament wherein ordeined staple wooll kept flanders bridge thencefoorth holden diuers partes england wale ireland atstaples vvoll kept england newcastell yorke lincolne canterbury norwich westminster chichester winchester excester bristow carmarden earle northampton went scotland wyth great company armed men archer rode march enforced ye castell loghmaban fortress yeeld tooke scottes layde ambush also held treatie peace scottes gladly would haue redeemed king made perpetuall peace englishman yet king scottes hold land king england william weld iohn little september sherifes maior adam francis mercer october innocent desire peace sent cardinal bononi caleis heare treatie finall peace betwixttreatie peace kingdomes england france whome repaired counsellours realmes full authoritie treate constitute condition peace length agreed vpon poynt king englande resigne right realme france remitte french king haue therefore dutchie aquitayne county artoys guisnes successor king england without holde thecounties french king manner wise condition king england gaue consente assurance couenants embassadoures sente sea rome eyther realme king england anno reg behalfe went bishop norwich duke lancaster earle arundell knightes going auinion came archbishop rohan duke burgoigne geffrey charney french king counsell receyued great honor many cardinalles bishop met duke lancaster brought space two mile vnto auinion pope pallace length consistorie pope cardinalles embassadoures present cause message declared embassadoures england requested haue couenants cofirmed bin concluded caleis frenchme answered gladly would haue peace touching aquitaine foresaid countreys sayde french king could might giue assent shoulde alienated entire body kingdome well king taken oth maynteyne yet could contented profitable dominion sayd duchy countreys deliuered come king england auncesters aquitayne yet regalitie crowne france euer reserued englishman requested sayd dominion should1354 absolutely without condition restored king answere also made reason frenchman touching oth king themselues whereby bound conserue integritie honour kingdome weete pope benefite peace might assoyle saide othe certayne article premitted shoulde well done yet nothing done might offorce furthering peace embassadoures without effect returned home bishop norwich excepted deceassed buried whome succeeded thomas percy king nauarre brawle raysed slewe charles de spayne marshall france wherevpon auoyd displeasure punishment french king fled owne countrey sending unckle vnto duke lancaster letter humbly besieching woulde come normandie ayde defence receyue oth fidelitie amitie hym men duke therefore getting licence king assembled togither great nauie southampton duke readie haue made sayle knightes sente normandie came backe view truth businesse whome notifyed duke sayde king nauarre hys cousin reconciled king duke voyage stayde frier augustine church london reedified humfrey bohun earle hereford estsex whosefrier augustine church london ro de auesberie dissention oxford isto auria body buryed quire church great dissention fell oxford betweene scholler uintner quart wine scholler poured wine uintners head brake head potte reason whereof great conflict made betwixt schollers uniuersitie lay men towne many lay men wouded twentie slaine trouble continued space two dayes religious men towne labouring make peace lay men pursued scholler wounded death yet day tumult appeased morrow people uillages oxford cofederate lay men towne came great force erected blacke banner whervpon schollers fled colledges lay breaking vp dores slew many threw priuies cut rent bookes bare away listed meanes uniuersitie dissolued schollers sauing marton colledge went friend continued yeare many schollers lay men enditedcitizens oxford endited king justice amogst four burgess bin maiors oxford sente tower london william totingham richard smelt septem sherifes maior thomas leggy skinner october xx nouember k edward held parliametro auesbery westminster granted towards recouerie title france fiftie shilling euery sacke wooll transported ouer sea space sixe yeares next following meanes whereof king might dayly dispend said sixe yeares markes sterling comon opinion ther tha sackes wooll yearely foraigne land transported sixe yeares sayd grant extended fifteene hudred thousand pound sterling king edward helde great justing wodstoke honour anno reg iusting vvodstock queene purifyed hir sonne thomas gaster parliament westminster king1355 tooke quarell oxford hand sauing euery man right forgaue schollers whole trespassero de auesburie sommer following uniuersitie begannevniuersitie oxford restored agayne flourish king gaue chancellour oxford view assise bread ale wine victualles excluding maior vtterly office communaltie towne gaue uniuersitie poundes amends sauing vnto neuerthelesse action vnto euery singular person towne parliament processe iudgement made roger mortimer earle march reuoked soex recordis yong roger mortimer sonne edmond mortimer restored title possession earledome march cousin heire grandfather king edward sandwich iourney towardesking edvvard sayled france france prince wale sutton deuonshire hys voyage towardes aquitayne looking prosperous winde space fortie dayes thing else readie french king armie deuided sundrie place hauens normandie partes empeach landing king prince long lay frenchman hired souldioures fowly wast owne countrey consumed many thousand crownes french king coffer vaynely ende needie payde people forsaken king edward wasted france french king men encounter fledde followed brenning owne townes destroying victual king find neyther harborough meate moneth august king england duke lancaster seauen thousand armed men retinue entered france space nine dayes iourney went wasting fire came way returning caleis king heard scot entred stealth taken towne berwike thebervvike taken scottes baron graystoke armie king whome charge towne bin committed wherevpon king hasted vnto berwike within fifteene dayes recouered towne againe deliueredbervvike taken englishman vnto life libertie depart giuen vnto found therein passed scotlande vnto scottish sea bycause victual fayled armie king giuing licence returned towarde englande followed tayle armie space twelue mile robert herle almerike de saint edmond robert de hildesley whome scottes night season found asleepe rest doubting nothing misaduenture wherefore gaue cruell assault vppon hideous noyse cry long resistance robert de hildesley iohn brancester knightes taken prisoner robert herle almerike hauing much ado escape said knightes perceyuing scottes strong thought themselues lord baron whome held fee would redeeme wylie withdrawing deliuered scottes captiuitie duke lancaster appoynted chiefe admirall english nauie landed hogges feast saint barthelmew thence rode towards normandie accompanied philip brother king nauarre desired aide sayd duke requested come help season french king hauing king nauarre geffrey harecourt diuers noble men greate suspection touching realme kingdome bidde feast tooke saide king nauarre cast prison murthered rest noble men sauing geffrey harecourt whome caused beheaded axe king nauarre thus emprisoned brother phillip seased many castels holdes hads normandy strongly fortifying men victualles help duke lancaster manned well englishman men countrey withstande frenchman walter forester thomas brandon septem sherifes maior simon france mercer october time king passed ouer caleis france eldest sonne prince wale hauing earles warwike suffolke salisburie oxforde tooke shipping beginning october sutton hauen deuonshire luckely sayled landed burdeaux honourably receyued bishop cleargie accompanyed common people first sonday moneth monday following prince going lodged two mile burdeaux castell vrnoun nexte daye passed streight woodde middle towne lougan sometimes walled nowe defaced passing long iourney lost many horsses came length strong castel dandert thurseday came citie besas hauing cathedrall church couent frier minor friday proclamation made armie euery man beare armes saint george said enimies bare also saterday passed castell nan stand three castels three lordes whereof one sheweth farre friday twelfth moneth armie passed land wordiux whiche belonging earle flux dayes iourney long tedious lost many horsses wast grounde called laundes two mile towne areule displayde banner deuided army diuers troupe vaward wherein three thousand men armes earle warwike high connestable reignold cobham lord marshall lord beawchamp somersetshire man lord clifford lord thomas hampton belonging auntients seauen baron gascoigne middleward wherin seauen thousand men armes besides clearkes page prince himselfe double auntient earle oxford lord barthelmew burwash lorde iohn de lile lorde wilowby lord le ware ye lord maurice barkeley son thomas lord barkeley liuing old lorde iohn boursers lord iohn rose elder burdeaux captayne de la busch lord camount lord mountferraunt auntients rerewarde foure thousand armes comitted charge earle suffolke earle salisburie lord nemers led bernences whole armie armes clearkes page archer brigants aboue men day ienken barefort diuers made knightes village aurule three village wherof wil lord raymond captaine deliuered vp vnto ye prince wherin lodged armie resting two dayes many would wer suffered go tooke victual brenned enimies coutrey tuesday lodged ye towne mount clere ye castel belonging therevnto giue vp prince left againe frenchman reason fire brake vp towne wherevpon prince went field lodged tentes euer refusing lie towne day hauing taken three townes brenning made knightes gilotus de straton diuers also iohn de lile stricken quarell austage died wednesday thurseday lay stil friday came strog town loegeron lodged tentes saterday came placence faire towne strong inhabitant whereof fled away ye castell earle molesni many knightes take captaine de la bouch lord mountferrant de loachis day made knight sonday luke day staid ewant taking fort galian force set fire brent monday casting fire townes placence passed along leauing towne beal marchi right hand lodged towne archbishop anfer called le base day richard stafford brother vnto earle stafford led men antient towards ye towne next day tuesday ye town yeelded vnto bicause beloged ye church prince would suffer enter excepting certain person appointed purpose deliuering victual wednesday leauing ye faire town escamount ye left came noble towne merand belonging ye earle commege ful armed souldiours prince lodged great monastery bartons ye abbey much one liuing creature foud thurseday lay still harme sayde abbey friday went faire rich cou trey arminake entred coutrey austerike passage hard hilly lodging saxaunt towne set fire contrarie comandement ye prince al day three dayes following passed alongst high hilles aragon saterday came towne ye rereward army lodged great monasterie blacke monkes fled away middleward vilfrankes vaward tremaine village rich full victualles man inhabitant fledde sonday xxiiij october passed certaine foord entred land ye earle comenge reached vnto tolouse coutreys wer wasted fire sword leauing left hand towne called sannetere austrike passed strong citie winbers pope iohn remouing blacke monkes erected bishop sea lodged great rich towne called sotanco beloging ye earledome comenge couet frier minor burning towne monday passed goodly wide countrey plaine came townes foy litz tuesday rested wednesday feast simon iude armie passed ye riuer geroud water fierce stony terrible day ye riuer arage much dangerous came vnto tolouse time neuer durst horsema passe ouer water wherefore ye people coutrey wonderfully made aferd could tell sodeinly take could flee night prince lodged falgard little towne one mile tolouse tuesday came vnto faire great town called mount gistard parte inheritance lord almerike de la fossad towne frenche king taken fro bycause ye king england feed man fast sayde towne twelue windmilles set fire taken two espies certified prince earle arminake tolouse connestable france mount maban four league tolouse friday passed towards auinion good towne basige towne called franke whole armie lodged great towne called auion middleward rereward lay one side suburbes vaward lay side towne townesmen perceiuing fled euery one towne twenty windmilles set fire saterday last october lodged great towne called clastalnannar church chanons couet frier minor another carmelite hospitall uillage called le mauns de pucels couent frier augustine al cosumed fire sonday feast saincts armie rested army certaine going take booty tooke little towne inhabitant whereof spared spoyling gaue x florens golde monday marched along townes mathele port great towne called vilkapinch fro thence entred countrey carkason prince lodged little uillage called alse tuesday came carkason faire towne rich well built bigger london within walles betwixt towne senburge citie double walled ranne goodly water passed vnder faire stone bridge foote whereof foure couents religion ye frier ran away fled citie whole armie lodged towne abounded muskadell delicate victual day sonnes lord libret mayster basset rowland daues many made knightes wednesday thurseday armie lying still towne hauing made truce parlied citie concerning peace citizenscarkason france burned offering sauing towne burning golden souse prince answered came gold take city townes togither inhabitantes nexte day commanded towne bee brent friday towne brent army departed leauing left hand castell botenake vntouched passing champion countrey burning townes called la rustican countrey thereabout saterday trauayled great wind dust leauing lefte hande great poole freshe water beeing compasse aboute thirtie league called casibon came towne called silony whiche yeelded prince therefore neuer touched prince lodged night good towne called canet sonday eyght nouember passed water sandey partly foord called chastel de terre partly ouer bridge trauayled betwixt high hilles vnto great citie narbon whereof countrey taking name called gallia narbonensis citie strong well walled hauing great cathedrall church also notable castell belonging bishop strong tower earle towne also suburbe called borough much bigger better built borough carkason borough foure couents religious person betwixt borough citie runneth water called ande comming carkason runneth greekish sea betwixt citie borough two bridge stone third timber built storehouse diuers merchandise prince lodged house carmelite frier tuesday borough beeing set fire army passing water side wente ouer diuers place thence went lodged towne castell ambion wednesday trauelled euill iourney hurtfull horsse lacke water thurseday theodorike dale porter prince chamber made knight thence army passed good towne called vlmes middleward passed vnto good towne earle lile called arnile lodged night prince lay frier minor greate abundance muskadell beeing prouided countesse ile spoyled daye also good towne pipions destroyed castell thereof called redote friday army passing long stonie way lodged lamian saterday returning backe towarde gascoigne lefte right hand great poole esbone carkason iourney wente rereward lodged good towne called abier middleward puch iancies castell beeing defended withstoode season length wonne prince lay beyonde bridge faire running water sydes whereof countrey spoyled fire togither good towne pesaunce vawarde lodged night sonday trauelled long iourney bycause prince lodged great abbey lady de prolion seuerall cloysters liue predicants wherevnto prince deuoutely receiued day army set fire ye towne lemeins far greater couents religion carkason also brent faire towne called falange vnto towne belonged xxj windmilles brent also townes vnlard serre ye whole coutrey lying theraboutes monday middleward lodged good towne called dealpuhbon long time defended length gotten force castell whereof yeelded vnto towne castell prince co manded harme done fire tuesday earely passing ouer ye riuer beseile entred cou trey broade one aclocke came great abbey called bourgbon earle fluxens great ioy receyued prince newly escaped prison paris laine space two yeares said earle remained time faithful prince day rode lordship seigniory earle townes masell colmon right hand passed greate towne saint canole high castel called hautripe day brent nothing reuerence foresaid earle uineyards passed agayne ouer water arage leauing also tolous first one mile left hand four league right middle ward lodged great towne mermount togither castell brent wednesday passed castell earle flux called mounthane foote whereof horseman passed ouer great water geround tooke towne castell north leauing riuer gerond left hand passed vnto towne marconaw tooke returned ouer riuer againe tooke strong towne carbone thurseday ye armie rested friday word brought prince french vp gathered great force deuided fiue great battels field far wherevpo men set themselues battayle aray one mile place lodged beeing readie fight one souldioures chance start hare wherevpon great shout made enimies hearing sente fortie light horseman see cause thereof drawing nigh english armie perceiuing set battayle aray returned backe againe declared seene wherevpon presently whole armie frenchman fled great feare day barthelmew burwash iohn chandos iames de audley xxiiij light horseme appointed scoutes comming tayle frenchman toke prisoner xxxij knightes gentleman amongst whome toke erle romeme also slewe many carter wagoner prince lodged ye towne muwose saterday marched castell oradrie castell prince lodged morning brent sonday two twentith nouember euening perceyued theyr enimies side ye gret hil harde great towne gemount english men benighted sent lx lyghte horssemen certaine bowman vnto righte hande towne called auremount finding menne armes conestable fraunce chased towne slewe toke many middle warde lodged auremount uawarde colimont earelye morning wagoner commaunded remayne towne auremount residue deuided troupe went fielde wayting comming theyr enimies vaine prynce taking towne gamount tolde enimies fled away midnight twesday armye lodged fielde lacke water horsse faine drinke wyne whereof came passe nexte daye horsses drunke coulde goe right forth many dyed saint katherines daye wyth muche doe came water leauing towne florence theyr righte hande passed greate towne called silard middle warde lodged towne called realmount toke maine force therefore brent thursday rested fryday trauayled long iourney walled townes strong castels middle warde lodged serde saterday passed ouer certaine water great difficultie wood till came good towne called mesin sondaye prince rested toke homage othes townesmen monday sainte andrewes daye trauelling long iourney came towne tolows three castels twesday prince trauelled castel melan wher lodged wednesday prince came regla wher horsses wagon passed throughe riuer gerond thysanno reg towne regla prince appointed diuerse baron suche like winter diuerse place march intente shoulde keepe inland part gascoigne french men prince wale touching matter aforesayd consideration also caused newe coyne golde made gascoigne busied himselfe aboute repayring thing decayed throwen downe season sprang vp foolish fantasie french men heades king englande come normandie cause rumour rose vppe duke lancaster fortifyed strong place belonging king nauar whiche ile constance place direct iourney towardes brytaine whereof newly made chiefe captaine another cause phillippe brother to1356 king nauar came england earnestly craued ayde king frenche king kept hys brother prison mighte force armes restoare land vnto wrongfully withholden wherevpon hee offeryng doe homage fealtie hadde king appoyntmente mile stapleton manne great integritie martiall affayres skilful say king appointed faithful felow men two thousande men well appoynted trauelling throughe normandie toke townes fortress burning diuerse passing along tyll came castell nine league distaunte citie paris neyther lake theyr trauayle vntil hadde forced theyr enymies enter yearelye truce meanes great report lesse fear filled heartes french men whiche report length came eares prince lying regla wherefore gathering power hys dukedome intent meete hys father whiche muste doe trauelling fraunce came length brugetat certifyed earle armenia woulde departure haue spoyled countrey intent prouided greate bande men wherefore hee sent backe gouernour gascoigne vnto barnarde de libret thence prince went france coastes barny lymon stil encouraging men enimies sending iohn chandos iames dawdeley complices trye state enimies countrey least perhappes crafty ambushment might sodainely assaulte men afore ware remouing campe euery day entred pictauia espies broughte worde french king gathered greate armye beyng aurelian also knewe prince comming sente espies discouer armye amongst griffin micco chambly petie captaine two hundered men meeting espies came coaste oure espies toke thirtie slew residue one lefte carrye worde become theyr fellowes espies proceeded towardes romerentine meeting lord crone lord brisgande sette vppon slew chief captaines forced flee castle hauing taken lodging town prince commanded morning great assault giuen ye castell day folowing men al armed passed ditch came vnto ye wals castel applied scale ye wall ladder burne gate entring slew gret many chief men ye lord named fled vnto principal tower ye castel ye prince determined depart til besieged eyther taken yeelded length castell vndermyned men besieged humilitie yeelded vp castell spy declared frenche king come downe turon prouide army go prince tydings prince gladde pighte tentes againste frenche king could passe riuer leger reason greate floudes frenche king hadde broken bridge intent shoulde passage betwixte prince duke lancaster whose armyes might wel euerye nyght perceyue eache others fiers campes prince folowing alongst riuer leger eastwarde pyghte hys tentes neare vnto turon loking frenche kyng foure dayes hoping fighte hee distaunte one league vnderstoode frenche king retyred backe blamia ten league passing ouer bridge riuer leger place vsed betwixt two strong townes towarde poyters retyring frenche king certifyed prince returned backe intending haue mette waye whych coulde doe yet crossing ouer imagined nerer way sette vpon tayle enymies cut fro earles inyni winter also marshall burgonie take died thought great toyle taken night drawing men gaue themselues reste wood intending next day take theyr iourney towarde poiters waye certifyed frenche king greate prouision prepared himselfe battayle drew nigh tentsthe batayle poyters prince therefore committed vawarde armye earles warwick oxford middle ward guided prince rerewarde led earles salisburie suffolke whole armye prince aboue foure thousande menne armes one thousande armed souldiours two thousand archer pompous nobilitie french men drewe nygh greatly disdayning small company englishe men number eight thousande fighting souldiours also seuen auntients matter gret many men murmured bycause late great part army sent defende gascoigne among french men certaine scotte called william douglas man great force practise warres manne french king make knight bycause knewe woulde deadly enimie english men gladlye hearkned aduices william captain ouer two hundred scottes men vnderstoode wel custome englishe men dayes fighte foote point followed scottes scot also prouoked french king french men fight like maner french king obeying foolish counsel gladly agreed vnto saying wherevpon sente lighte horssemen cittie shoulde suffer man make chase horssemen well appointed come againste archer beginning conflict runne ouer treade vnder theyr horsse feete performed whiche commaunded appeared sequele thereof army set readinesse side fighte early sonday morning notable fayre beholde came cardinall petragoren charged prince name god crucified mighte please deferre warre tyme ecclesiasticall peace also sparing christian bloud ende might treatie peace whiche promised shoulde performed wyth great honour side prince neyther feared refused peace modestly agreed request father day nowe appointed obtaynyng peace army french men encreased number thousande men armes also morrowe cardinall came againe frenche king behalfe request truce endure one whole yeare whiche prince denyed yet importunate sute cardinal graunted truce continue till christmasse next comming therefore cardinall returning frenche king requested pledge truce marshall dawdenam geffrey de charney douglas scot perswaded common reason coulde come passe english men shoulde time preuayle especially bycause fewe straunge countrey wearyed miserably toyle trauel therefore ableto indure great number french men fraunce stood defence theyr lande prince wale certified captaines french wold haue kind peace could get force armes calling men togither made oration first generall archer followeth hoode saith hath bin alwayes known great da gers sheweth yt degenerate fro true son english men descended bloude heretofore vnder father dukedome predecessor king englande vnto whome labour paineful place inuincible ground vnpassable hil wer neuer high inaccessible tower vnscaleable army inpenitrable armed souldiour whole hostes men formidable liuely couragiousnesse tamed french men ciprians siracusians galabrians plestinis brought vnder stiffe necked scottes vnruely irish men yea walsh men also could wel indure labour occasion time daungers maketh feareful verye strong stoute doeth manye time dull witted men make wittie honour also loue countrey desire rich spoyle french men doth stirre vp follow father step wherefore follow auntients wholy intentiue follow commaundement captaines well minde body victorie come life may still continue firme friendship togither hauing alwayes one one minde enuious fortune whych god forbidde shoulde let v presente runne race fleshe ende life labour togither sure name shall want eternall fame heauenly ioy also gentleman companion wyll drinke cuppe shal doe vnto shal eternal glorie name haue wonne nobilitie fraunce ouercome god forbid ascribed vnto daunger time courage men hauing spoken word perceyued hill harde whiche planted toppe hedge ditch inside whereof playne pasture fielde one side thereof manye roughe bush side planted vine residue playne top wherof imagine armye french lye betwixt men hil gret lowe vallyes peece marish ground one company prince finding narrowe passage entred valley toke hyll among bush hidde themselues taking aduantage place fielde wherein men laye witte vawarde middle warde deuided playne frenche armye laye long hedge ditche one ende whereof dyd reache downe marishe aforesayde hyll nexte marishe earle warwicke kept captaine vawarde vpper part hedge toward hanging hil gret gap whiche stone cast stoode rereward ouer whiche earle salisburie captayne oure enymies perceyuyng oure prince auntiente bee displayed ofttymes bee remoued place place reason hill time quite sighte iudged prince fledde yet douglas scotte marshal de clarimount sayde marshal dawdenam deceiued owne opinion thought otherwise cry still followe chase prince fleeing also douglas intet get preferment worthy name new warfare clarimount washe awaye euill opinion whiche conceyued touching fidelitie vehement perswade forwarde vnto charge vawarde deputed went fashion certaine chase iuste againste certain wer vnder hill vaward came meete marshal dawdenam staying see end iusting kept himselfe encountring meane time clearimount thinking come gap hedge come backe vawarde compasse met earle salisburie perceyuing comming purpose suspected whole intent whiche gouerned rereward making haste take gap keepe enimie passing way sustayned first charge battayle began terrible meeting betwixte armed menne laide loade swordes speares neyther dyd archer slacke theyr duetie lying safe trench start vp aboue ditche shot ouer hedge preuayling arrowes fought armes thus rerewarde slaying enimies came stragling gap vawarde lay hanging hil towarde marish gouerned earle warwicke alwayes readye met french men beating downe archer vawarde placed marishe daunger horssemen yet al preuaile somewhat ye horseman appointed purpose ouerrunne archer earle oxforde considering discommodity might ensue therof departed prince ward leading archer sette one side french men commaunding shoote yt hinder partes horsses meanes whereof horsses gauld wounded fel tumbling sat backes else turned backe ran vpon followed making great slaughter vpon maisters horssemen thus beaten backe archer retyred towardes place whence came shooting gauling side french men fought right ouer time force heate battayle beganne prime earles warwicke salisburie like fierce lion endeuored purpose shold dung land poyters french men bloud nether wise counseller thomas dassord suffolke ydle season righte worthylie actes behaued himselfe experte skilfull actiuitie continually running ward warde troupe company comforted styrred vp good word doe well hauing gret regarde youthfull sorte lustie souldiours beyng bolde vppon good heartes courage shoulde without regarde go farre placed archer sundry time great aduantages oftentimes leasure would suffer woulde encorage vp mind souldiours clarimount slaine william dowglas also wounded fledde hauing fewe scot hys bande archebald dowglas hys brother men retiring put themselues good array vaward midlewarde ioyned themselues togither marcheth forth newe armye french men whiche eldest son french king dolphin vienna brought forth order array army terrible fierce shewe last oppressed yet al coulde make men afrayde sharp set desirous honor also reuenge themselues fellowes whiche little slayne wounded therefore boldely goe side makyng showts noyses cry saint george borrow saint denis v within come fight man man euery man readye dy fight saue theyr lyues neither doth ye lion make wolf afraid tegre terrible simple beast lusty gentleman enimies chaced slew like wolues chace kil sheepe though battel withstood men firste yet lost great many men suche deuise saued manye yet running away faire retreate whiche frenchman accustomed vse men considering victorie field doubtful long french king mighte presence wyth armye lay halfe hid ualley woulde afterward chaced fled go field worthy man maurice barkley son thomas barkley regard vnto ye space two houres togither men neuer spared wold stil forefront battayle inuading enimies wt firste maurice ye midst dolphens guard sowed blowes among first speare sword length al alone compassed wt multitude forely wounded taken prisoner meane time carryed wounded camp laide vnder bush hedge way hauing spent weapon toke speares sword fro ouercome archer lacking arrowes made hast draw fro pore wretch halfe dead one eyther wounded quite wearied gret labor except keeping yt chief standart wer appointed meete french king dolphin thus put flight one came frenche k sayd lord k field fallen english men eldest son hath withdrawen vnto frech king answered othe would day forsake field vnlesse taken slain mean carried away force wherfore auntiente bearer coma ded march forward followed two gret copanyes armed wide fielde shewing themselues men struck gret feare heartes much hope conquire whyche thing great wisedome standing ye prince signified wt howling voyce saying ala poore wretch ouercome prince hauing great trust saith christ checked saying thou liest thou dastardly fellow thou canst say yt ouercome log liue captain de la buche noble man al affayres soone perceyued armes french king marching forth tentes asking licence prince departed awaye lx souldiours hundred archer many men thought haue fled away wherfore souldiors excepting chiefe captaines quite hope victorie committed theselues wholy mercie god prince comanded auntient bearer sir walter woodland march foreward toward enimies wt ew fresh men ioyned battayle ye gret army french king sounde trumpet one giuing answere another made suche noyse wals poyters souded wt eccho therof like wood sort man would haue thought hils bellowed ye valley ye cloud giue forth terrible thu der ye ther wated cruel lightning whylest ayre shone ye bright armour spear dashing shining harneis came cruel copany crosbowme making darknesse y yt multitude quarels shot came worthy copany english bowman flyes also dart ashe met wt enimy afar ye frech army ful diuers troups many armed defeding brest shield proceede forwarde againste enimies wherefore oure archer hauing emptied quiuers vain armed sword target fayn encounter laden armour bestirreth hymselfe worthye prince wale cutting hewing french men sharp sword mean time captain de la buch marcheth compasse vnder hangyng hil prince little forsoke priuily compassing fielde length commeth close vnder place frenche campe laye thence ascended toppe hill waye whiche french men beaten theyr trauayle sodainely breaking forth vnloked shewing ensigne saint george friend prince great courage giueth freshe charge french armye desirous breake ranckes captaine aforesayde shoulde set side battayle prince lustilye encountring enimies goeth middle throng seeth companye hee layeth aboute hym euerye side meane time side friend serued captaine de la buche backes enimies beating killing without pittie archer also placed purpose shot thick wounding backes side french men suche sorte forme battayle quite spoyled neyther could put themselues order array courage prince lenghth thrusteth thorough throng guarded frenche kyng shoulde see auntient beginne nod stumble bearer fall downe bloud flaues prince ran mingled togither water whiche nigh like sort bore cornwal rageth seeketh haue none way french king standard tha bloud came met wt opany stout men withstand english fight frenche men also lay length fortune making hast turne hir wheele prince preaceth forewarde enimies like fierce lion beating proud came yeelding vp french kyng french men scattered abroade fieldes poycers perceyuing standard flouerdeluce beaten fledde speede towards towne farre englishe menne perceyuing fleeing though themselues eyther sore wounded wearied followed chase euen gate poyters wher great skirmishe verie daungerous slewe great number french men last called back retreate ye sound trumpet assembling togither diuerse pauilians tentes set vp fieldes whole company throughlye comforted wyth victorie gaue theyr whole endeauour prouide wounded quiet rest wer wearied safe keeping wer taken prisoner refreshing almoste famished vntill ful vnderstanding many wanting among founde halfe dead founde lord iames dawdeley reason broade bucklet caried armes souldiours brought prince lodging prince hymselfe rise supper came caused stripped layd soft bedde somewhat better come remembraunce prince comforted swearing vnto frenche king yeelded vnto whiche newes languishing noble man hearde streight wayes reuiued prince returning french king willed deny bee vnworthy deede rose supper comfort almost deade spared hys owne bloude purchase victorie hauing talke concerning warres whiche iames dawdeley made frenche king sayde amongst stoute champion valiauntly day behaued themselues gretly wonder noble deed knight spake muche supper spake prince comforted noble praye like wordes sayde french king spake although chaunce fall euerlasting sorrowe yet thoughte good refrayne kinde measure though vnder subiection law righte war vnder noble cousin yet rascal faint harted runneawayes taken lying hidde close corner maner fielde end successe warre readie dye liue iustice sake fielde many richmen taken whose liues reserued raunsome fainte harted lewde chased away worthyest stoutest spoyled theyr liues battayle poyters fought nineteenth day september nexte day battayle al prisoner numbred wit french king also phillip scottes edward prince wale wyth many noble men sayde henrie picarde kepte hall commers soeuer willing play dice hazard like maner lady margaret wife also keepe hir chamber intente king cipres playing wyth henrie picarde hys hall dyd wynne hym markes henrie verye skilfull arte altering hys hande win king markes markes king began take ill parte although dissembled henrye saide vnto lord king agrieued couet golde play haue bid hyther might grieue amongst thing might trie playe gaue hym money agayne plentifully bestowing owne amongst retinue besides gaue many riche giftes king noble knightes whiche dyned wyth hym greate glorie citizen london dayes stephen candish barthelmew frostling sep sherifes maior sir iohn stody vintener october sir iohn stody gaue vnto uinteners london borowed prelate many great summes money saying would bestow defence church realme midsomer sente greate armie france whereof sir roberte knowles generall man time fortunately handled beyond sea warres scantly fortie horsses backe commonly talked lost thirtie thousande horsses vnluckie voyage great miserie bo walsing see poore state men warre suche knightes great wealth countrey hauing lost men horsses glad begge dore dore found reliefe countrey destroyed manured reason whereof dearth countrey victualles could scant gotten money duke yet wintered tenth aprill following day battayle appoynted betwixte duke aniow tholouse meane time truce taken till twentith may next following king england knew nothing day came great power armed men french appeared duke aniow assembled yet daye passed without battayle great shame reproch english frenchman sayd ready fielde day appoynted looke comming came wherefore spake many reprochfull wordes englishman calling false coward ha lesse end iourney grocer october parliament commonly called good parliament holden westminster subsidie demaunded answere made peter de la mare proloc tor parliamente king needed substance poore subiects well duke lancaster citizen london set libertie sir peter de la mere aforesayd instigation alice perce cast prison beautie bountie liberalitie farre passed progenitours ouermuch giuen rest quietnesse louing little deedes armes yong ruled yong counsell regarded nothing counsel sage wise men realme thing turned land great trouble himselfe extreame miserie uerses declared king first beganne raigne lawes neglected werevox clamantis iohn gower wherefore good fortune forsooke thearth quake feare people also whome pollde rebell time doth yet bewayle woe chronicle tell foolish counsell lewde yong receyue graue aduise aged head reiect leaue greedie thirst coyne subiectes accused gayne goodes hand thus realme abused king coronation made foure earles thomas earles created woodstocke king edwardes yongest sonne earle buckingham northampton gaue markes yearely treasurie til prouided land value thomas moubray earle notingham gifford angolisme gascoigne earle huntington whome likewise gaue markes yeare treasurie till prouided landes value henry percy earle northumberland peter day frenchman ship arriuedthe tovvne rye spoyled ile vvight taken rye spoyled towne brent time scottes brent towne rokesborow kalendes september frenchman tooke ile wight sauing castell sir hugh tirell kept manfully frenchman spoyled countrey tooke markes inhabitant spare house vnbrent taking said ile frenchman entring theirthe frenchman lye vvinchelsea galley againe coasted sea strond till came ouer towne winchelsea vnderstanding abbot battaill come thither defend sent redeeme towne abbot answered needed redeeme thing lost frenchman requested might sente forth fight man number trie matter view armes abbot answered religious man therefore lawfull admitte anye suche petition came thither fighte defend towne countrey thing heard frenchman supposing abbot people wanted courage assayled towne instrument warre cast forth farre whereof plentie ceassing noone till euening prowesse ye abbot french preuayled nothing meane time whilest busie thus winchelsea sent part company vntothe tovvne hastings brent frechmen hastings finding towne almost emptie brent frenchman perceyuing could good winchelsea departed thence left found andrew pikeman nicholas twiford sept sherifes maior sir nicholas brembar grocer october yeare frenchman comming vp towne rotingdon sussex neere towne lewes wheretho walsing prior lewes small companie met bythe prior levves taken frenchman multitude frenchman came vpon taken ledde shippes two knightes weete sir iohn fallesley sir thomas cheynie squire called iohn brokes died battayle almost hundred englishman frenchman therefore nauie returned home galley eyght caruales spayne certayne barkes streightwayes therefore came land went vnto seege arde treason alwayes familiar keeper castell almayne weete lord gunney deliuering towne streight got castell also keeper taken sir hugh caluerley keeper caleis sent england committed prison parliament holden london ended saint andrewes tide whiche parliamente alice peres banished lande hir moueable goodesalice peres banished forfeited king vse graunted king cleargie twotvvo tenthes granted cleargie tenthes payde yeare condition thenceforth king extort subiectes petition demaundes liue owne continue warre aunsweared owne good pertayning crowne sufficed finding1378 house mayntayning warres bestowed fitte minister keeping money two citizen london appointed william walworth iohn philpot english men hearing number spanishe shippes remayne sluce wante winde assembling great companye armed men great nauie meant take sea chiefe captaynes thomas woodstocke erle buckingham duke brytaine lord latimer lord robert fitz walter sir robert knowles many valiaunt personage entred sea tasted fortune disfauourable tempestuous winde rose theyr shippes scattered sunder theyr mastes broken downe theyr sayles rent many small vessel victualler drowned length shippes got togither againe arriued englande nowe rigged eftsoones freight men sea go time sir hugh caluerley making iourney towards bulloign found barge hauen ye town bare ye name towne another french king xxvj vessel lesse great part suburbes bulloigne caused dispoyled taking whatsoeuer desired certayne prisoner droue afore also gret bootie sheepe beastes whiche founde pasturing neere towne might well serue victuall caleis great time recouered day castel marke negligence bin lost english fleete whereof spake returned without great good successe toke eyght spanish shippes brytish coastes neare brest take businesse bin well done pretended therefore fleete returned home tossed stormes contrarie weather intestine discorde seemed wanted among god fauour lorde percy fleete remaining mending shippes whilest abrode went sea wyth great ship smaller vessel meeting fiftie ship laden french ware marchandize whiche flaunders spaine set al beholding bolde enterprice thinking hadde ayde hande gaue ouer make resistaunce xxviij escaping flight xxij yeelded themselues sayd thomas lord percy sir hugh caluerley power secretly armed wente towne staple fayre come manye merchauntmen bulloigne mutterel amience paris falling vnarmed slewe many toke many put ransomes sacked al good set fire town wholy consumed place excepted done returned caleis men safetie bringing faire ware turned greate profit calisians many yeares men winchelse rie gathered gret number people togither imbarqued themselues towardes normandie desirous requite ye loss receiued night arriuing town called peter hauen entred slaying many met thinke able pay raunsome carry shippes spoyled house church founde many rich spoyles sometime bin french men fet ric especially belle like shipped set rest fire land wilet far thence wher practised ye like cheuance theyr riche spoyle returned home time iohn duke lancaster requested ye ye mony granted k ye cleargie laitie might co mitted custodie affirming yt would kepe ye enimies coastes england space one yeare yt mony moreouer bring passe great commoditie whose importunate petitio lord although theyr willes agreed appoint therfore ye firste day marche meete counsel euery shold go forth iourney least ye sea ye mean time want shold keepe wer ix ship hired baion defend ye sea land fro incursion frech others ship furnished sufficiet nubers armed wein short time coasting ye sea met nauy marchandice ye spaniard entring battayle short time take xiiij ship laden wt wine marchandize returne england ioyfully vnto sir robert knowles captain brest giue firste fruites theyr pray c tunne beste wine passed homewardes meane time henrie ye bastard calling king spain hearing baion done harme vnto people lacaster prepared gret nuber enter ye sea sore afraid thinking ye minded defed sea rather seeke kingdome right wife ye lawful inheritour spaine ment chalenge wherfore ye said henrie comanded nauie prepared al land yt might stay said entring country might take prisoner happily done ye king portingale wt almost inumerable nuber entred ye kingdome spain ye self time yt bastard henrie prepared selfe ye deferring iourney day day wer appointed captain ouer nauie certain war got ye sea stay duke comming esteeming glorious liue sea prayes taking fro enimies liue spoile owne countreymen home certain dayes wa ted vp downe sea spaniardes met armed company men either part hope pray ioyned togyther fighte oure menne hauyng winde weather contrary lost victory theyr enimies escaping flight taken amongst sir hugh courtney noble knight one time iohn mercer scotte gathering togither small number french men scot spaniard set vpon certaine ship scaborow toke led scotlande reuenge father iniurie taken english men kept prisoner castel scarborow iohn philpot citize london iolly wit rich substance considering want ye duke lancaster lord ought haue defended ye realmanno reg lamenting oppression inhabitauntes hyred wyth owne money number thousand souldiours whiche mighte take sayde iohn mercer shippes good whiche reuenge take defended realme england suche incursion came passe within small time hyred toke sayde iohn mercer ship violently taken scarborow fifteene spanish shippes laden muche rich hym ayde present greate ioy made among ye people men praysing worthy man bountifulnesse loue towards king earles baron seeing laudable acte atchieued iohn philpot tooke grieuously althoughe knewe themselues guiltie firste secretly lye awayte displeasure spake openly saying lawfull doe thing without counsell king realme certayne lordes chiefe hugh earle stafforde rehearsed thing thus aunsweared iohn philpot sir know sayth neyther sente money men daunger sea shoulde take fellowes good renoume chilualrie winne sorrowfull see people myserie countrey whych nowe slouthfulnesse noble lady nation brought lye open spoyling euerye vilest nation one doth put hys hande defence thereof haue therefore set forth selfe mine sauing nation countrey earle aunswere xi august certaine wicked person kingsmurder church vvestminster tho walsing house armed high masse tyme entred churche westminster abbay set vppon two valiaunt esquiers iohn schakel robert hawley whyche escaped tower london sayde abbay refuge sanctuarie slewe sayde robert hawley quire priours stal slewe monke intreated spare sayde robert place syr ralph ferreis sir alan buxule captain tower say lord latimer wer captaines mischiefe aforesayd two esquire robert hawley iohn shakell battayle nazers spaine toke erle dene poisoner deliuered vnto pledge bycause would present sayde earles son king woulde giue little slew rich marchaunt genu woulde carry better market spice promised bring country doer wherof apprehended fact executed shal appeare great mortality men hapned north partspestilence north tho wals shyllings eight penny secular priest muche euery person man woman foure penny king whiche payde also ordayned euery couple wedded paye two shilling euery foote beast also homegilde neuer asked mean payment ye sommer following common kent essex sodainely rebelled beingcommons rebelled iohn bal sermon tho walsing animated therevnto iohn ball seditious prieste hys sermon vsed take theame adam dalfe eue spanne gentleman c affirming al men made like nature therefore ought laye away yoke bondage might enioye wished libertie c shamefull sedicious damnable bee taughte whyche neuerthelesse pleased common people cryed hee archbishoppe canterburie chauncellour england rebellion began dertford kent manner asrebellion bega dertford cro albons followeth collectours appointed gather foresayd groat pole mony comming house iohn tiler demanded ye wife hys daughter hys family tiler wife denied pay hir daughter saying vnder age sayd yt collector shal soone wit toke mayde violently dishonestly searched whether age wherwith mother made outcry hyr husbande ye towne worke tidyngs came caughte lathing staffe hande ranne reeking home reasoning collectour made bolde collectour proude fellow let flye tiler tiler voyding stroke smote collectour heade wyth lathing staffe braynes fell throughe great noyses arose streates poore people glad euerye man arrayed hym support iohn tyler thus common offered peace onessex men pacified condition woulde cease burning house slaughter men whiche essex men toke returned home kentishe men remayned burning slaying afore wherevppon king sent sir iohn newton k sent vvat tiler knight wat tiler captaine intreate come talke owne demaundes knight message wat tiler aunswered hee woulde come hys owne pleasure neuerthelesse followed softly came neare smithfielde king aboade comming knighte sent againe meete hym knowe requestes wat tiler seeing knight come neere vnto horsseback sayde hadde become hym better bee foote presence knighte aunswered harme ith himselfe also horssebacke therewith watte tyler drewe dagger offering strike called knightthe outnesse vvat tiler traytour knighte aunsweared lyed drew dagger king seeing knighte daunger comaunded hym alighte one foote deliuer dagger vnto watte tiler proude minde woulde pacifyed woulde needes runne knighte came king maior london william walworth manye knightes esquire affirming shamefull reproche shoulde permitte knyghte murdered wherevppon kyng taking boldenesse vpon hym commaunded maior arreste rebell whiche maior man incomparable boldenesse streyght arrested hym head suche sorte astonyed hym forthwyth whyche attended kyng inuironed rebell thruste diuerse place bodye theyr weapon drewe hym among people feete hospitall saint bartholmewe whenvvat tiler arested slaine common perceyued cryed theyr captaine trayterouslye slayne king rode sayde meane doe king wil captaine followe fielde haue whatsoeuer ye require therefore followed hym fieldes wythout suburbes towards yseldon meane time maior rod citie raysed citizen shortly returned thousande wel armed men sir robert knowles theyr leader king citizen lon deliuered king hys companye reioysing vnlooked ayde sodainelye compassed multitude common wyth fighting men common forthwyth throwing downe bowes billes weapon fel themselues grounde humbly crauing pardon graunted charter deliuered captain euery shire departed home rude multitude thus dispersed king made william walworth maior nicholas brember iohn philpot robert lande alderman london knight smithfield vpon said hil created erles marshal penbroke togither innumerable multitude woulde haue sodainly put death euery countrey lord maisters common people mighte appeare eyther counsell resistance againste v speciallye woulde haue destroyed knightes saint iohns lastlye woulde haue killed king himselfe men hadde possession bishoppes monkes chanons parson briefe wee woulde haue dispatched onlye begging fryer shoulde haue liued might haue sufficed
