skill wil let might helpe right skil wil right mighte goeth mill arighte might goe righte skill oure mill misdight iacke trewman doeth vnderstande falsenessei leaue iack carter iack trevvmans epistle guile hath raigned long trueth hath bin sette vnder locke falsenesse raigneth euery flocke man maye come trueth hee sings si dedero speake spende speede quoth iohn bathon therefore sinne fareth wilde floude true loue awaye good clearkes wealth wurcheth woe god bote time rebel burned sauoy one tookeone rebel felovves cast fire goodly siluer peece hid bosome another spyed tolde fellowes hurled hym peece plate fire saying zealous truth iustice theeues robber two thirtie entring seller sauoy xxxij rebel mured vp drunke muche sweete wine able come shutte wood stone mured vppe doore called cryed seauen dayes heard many none came helpe dyed number hadde sacked new templethe ende rebel labour wine lay vnder wals howsing slaine like swine one killed another olde grudge hatred others also made quicke dispatch watte tiler killed iacke strawe theyr principal captaines hanged hope confidence common decayed bycause mindes king noble yet wauering seeing people readie mischiefe graunted charter manumission suffered departe whiche done king caused army assembled london sente al countryes friendes make haste come hym london furnished horsse armour came passe wythin three dayes xl thousande horssemen seemely sort armed mustered blacke heath himselfe ryding greate courser hys standarde borne hym therefore myghtye armye assembled kyng aduertised kentishe men eftsoones conspyred wherevppon hee forth wyth sette forewarde mediation noble greate men kente vndertooke stayde pacisied wyth firste iustices sente seeke inquire malefactours countrey became quiet sight maior london sitting iudgement caused malefactours tryed well citie also kente essex southsex norffolke suffolke countryes might taken within liberty citie whome founde guiltie foresayde treason caused hoppe headlesse among iacke strawe iohn kirkesty alen threder c also iohn starling essex gloryed haue beheaded archbishoppe beheaded hymselfe king remayned nowe london nowe waltham greate armye armed menne considering done commoditie realme length counsell thoughte good sende king commission euerye shire resisting disquieters peace kyngdome commission muche comforte faythfull subiectes troubled false nowe compelled seeke corner toke vpon doe thing abroade lawyer nowe durst come forth dennes fledde tyrannie time looked th se nowe feared iudgement iustice bee done common thus feared place alike essex gathering newe multitude togither byllarica village neare hatfielde peuerell decreed eyther inioye lybertye gotten force dye fyghting sente kyng beeyng waltham messenger knowe hee thoughte good permitte inioye permittedanno reg lybertie lyke theyr lordes shoulde copelled come court gret leetes twice yeare vnto king answered thus oh miserable hateful land sea worthy liue yee require equall lordes yee worthy put moste shamefull death fith yee come messenger yee shall dye nowe ende yee may declare answeares fellowes declare therfore kyngs behalfe husbandman bondman shall remaine bondage vile without comparison far vnto thys whilest lyue god sufferaunce shal gouerne kingdome wit strength good wil endeuour selues keepe vnder duety seruice may example posteritie match present shall succeede may euer haue eies glasse misery matter curse feare commit like messenger gone sente straightwayes essex thomas woodstocke earle buckingham sir thomas percy brother earle northumberlande thomas woodstoke tothomas vvoodstocke sent scottes weete thousand launce two thousand archer restreyne attemptes thing knowne scottes afrayde themselues ende parliament came desirous entreate peace truse englishman hauing tried falsehoode often time woulde neyther treate compounde commanded returne home warned saue head well might defend rightes scottes returned lordes north tooke vpon defende countrey till thomas woodstoke earle buckingham readie come greater power king tooke temporality bishop norwich temporalty bishop norvvich seased hand bycause disobedient commandement sent haue stayde iourney flanders knightes ouer put prison till redeemed gold king richard held christmas manour eltham queene anne christmas iohn duke lancaster christmas went ouer france treate peace betwixt realmes returned england bringing abstinence warre till feast saint iohn baptist at1384 time returne treate againe confirme peace might agreed vpon betwixt ye king night purification lady great lightning thunder happened put men great feare shortly iohn northampto otherwise called combartowne bin yeare maior london sedition filled citie full comber attempted new trouble contempt maior elected yeare sir nicholas brembar knight went vp multitude seditious people gard oftentimes terrour manie said brembar maior woulde haue withstanded attemptes fauourers said iohn combertowne turned suche furie cobler owne estimation seemed maior required voyces communalty cause counsell sir robert knowles knight drawne house committed prison stirrer insurrection acte time staide commotion common sayd haue conspired time haue murthered elect maior many worthie men lente aproched iohn duke lancaster brother thomas woodstoke earle buckingham innumerable number knightes esquire archer went toward scotland stayde north till victualles countrey consumed hurt inhabitant scottes done length feast easter entred scotland little good custodie castell douer vacant death robert ashtonwald made connestable henry greene knightes put corde frier necke corde tying stone hanged vp grounde laying stone great weight vpon bellie till tormente made ende life morrow sed frier body drawne towne traytor might put away suspection put death wrongfully wondred neyther esquire yeoman grome meane estate would harme frier knightes themselues judge officer executioner fruite parliament excepte king asked laitie halfe fifteenth cleargie halfe tenth time bycause scottes ceassed diuersanno reg domages northumbers earle northumberland henry percy prepareth inuade scotland requite domage domage enterprise accomplished earle sooner returned sent home army scottes came againe heaped vp domage vpon domage countrey sommer sir iohn philpot knighte mostsir iohn philpot deceassed noble citizen london trauelled commoditie realme expences laide forth good affection borne oftentimes releeued king departed life leauing none behinde like good affection beginning august duke lancaster went france treate frenchman peace else truce duke company noble men remayning long thought haue brought glad ioyfull newes countrey returned knowledge warres followe beginning next sommer truce endure first day may returned spente markes siluer many noble assembled reading represse theiohn northampton conuict committed perpetuall prison seditious sturres iohn northampton late maior london attempted greate heynous enterprise whiche conuict hys owne chapleyne vttering manye thynges hee wente aboute hadde deuised well hinderance harme king citie london sentence shoulde haue bin pronounced king presente wicked man made exclamation mainteyned iudgemente ought passe absence lorde duke lancaster yet justice vsed word iohn sayth naughtie deedes obiected agaynste thee thou oughtest refell battayle else lawes land drawne hanged quartered stoode mute would vtter one word deecreede committed perpetuall prison goodes confiscate king vse shoulde come within one hundred mile london life sente therefore castell tintagell confines cornewall meane space king seruants spoyled goodes iohn richard northbery likewise conuict condemned perpetuall prison goodes confiscate king certaine congregation made fishmonger citie london nicholas exton iohn french september sherifes maior sir nicholas brembar grocer october feast saint martine parliament holden london whiche nothing done worth memorie still hand exacting money cleargie common people mainteine men warre besides combate fought listes betwixte esquire englande one ofa combate fought nauarre accused english esquire whose name iohn welch treason king realme effect captayne cherbrugh forced wife nauaroys sayde nauaroys afterward ouercome readie suffer death penly confesse cause king iudgemet drawne hanged although queene many make earnest intercessio haue life saued parliament yet ended newe camebervvike lost vvo againe north taking berwike castell scottes custodie whereof earle northumberland sir henry percy possesse right predecessor scottes mediation money got entrance castel one put trust keeping duke lancaster loued earle glad happe knew came passe therefore duke procurement earle condemned iudgement lord present execution within short releassed earle northumberland king fauour restored life possession without long delaye prepareth al furniture warre beseege winne sayd castell within gathered mighty armie sodeinly beseeged layne certaine time compounded betwixt without within within forsake castell haue liues moueable goodes surrendring castell haue earle two thousand markes english money meanes earle recouer castell foorth scottishmens hand certaine yong men brought vp kingtho wal arose great dissention betwixt duke lancast r departed court wente castell pomfret whiche fortified meanes king mother discorde appeased time third may earthquake1 king entred scotlande king richard great armie entred scotlande enimies would shew themselues wherfore brent countrey returned eighteenth july earthquake sir iohn de vienne serued french king sent scotland great multitude shippes men warre ioining scottes might e england whilst might draw power realme way forth frenche king nauie army might liberty enter partes realme none left home prohibit entrie arriuall sayd iohn knowne england king nobilitie prepared themselues make iourney thitherthe king maketh iourney scotland came flocking vnto king number knightes esquire archer like bin heard dayes much number horsses amou ted three hundred thousand iudged king reioyced heereat well might reioycing shortly darkened yorke fiercenesse sir iohn holland king brother slew lord ralph stafford ralph stafforde ayne sonne earle stafford way went queene whose seruant houshold greatly fa eur hir lesse beloued king bin brought vp bin playfellow tender age king taking greate indiguation determined pursue sayd sir iohn holland caused therefore goodes cofiscate sir iohn holland fledde beuerley enioy libertie church lady iane king mother sente intreate hir sonne brother messenger returned wallingforde mother could perceyue hope grace gotten behalfe king tooke heau ie fell sicke andqueene iane king mother dyed within foure ue dayes departed life hir body seared closed leade kept wallingford till king returne forth scotland buried stanford church frier minor moneth august king england mightie power entred scotland whose force scottes frenchman perceyuing themselues able matche seeke get wooddes place might way english army hath bin seene fairer stronger greater rideth countrey destitute inhabitantes yd cattell wanting victualles land left desolate men confessed saw much bird owles excepted found greene corne grounde faire plentifull whiche eyther eate vp horsses treade downe theyr feete enimies fleeing battayle men nothing accompted brent abbey melroys themeltoys edenborough brent towne edenborough house found way armie come edenborough victualles fayled many beganne ware sicke die hunger wherevpon king returned armie england king richarde scotland scottes frenchman entred englande brenning townes taking spoyles leading away many prisoner returned home countrey iohn organ iohn churchman september sherifes maior sir nicholas brembar grocer october souldiers caleis went secretly forth france got bootie four thousand sheepe three hundred head great beastes draw holdes feast saint martine parliament london laytie granted king fifteenth halfe codition cleargie giue tenth halfe william courtney archbishop canterbury standing said church ought befree wise taxed laytie whiche answerea bill put cleargie temporalty moued common forthwith presented king bill cleargie realme mouing take temporality thereby abate pride king hearing inordinate cry side iust answeres commanded bill cancelled inordinate petitio ceasse saying would preserue churche time good state found better archbishop therefore hauing made cleargie priuie wente king declared cleargie whole consent free willes prouided v tenth graunt king thankefully receyued hee openly affirmed rather haue free graunt foure time double constreyned eleuenth noueinber robert vere earle oxford state created made marquesse diuelin ireland thomas woodstocke duke glocester brother edmonde earle cambridge duke yorke michaell de la poole chancellour england made earle suffolke giue king thousand markes yeare earle march mortimer proclaymed heire apparantlib peter col crowne also king richarde earnest request bishop restored bishop norwich temporality holden manye yeares king richard queene anne wife kept christmas eltham whether came king ermony vnder pretence reforme peace betwixte king england comming profited onely vnderstoode beside innumerable giftes receyued king noble king granted charter thousand pound yeare life affirmed chased realme tartarians cause got great withstand frenchman comming contrarie windes returned king created robert vere marquesse irelande robert vere duke ireland duke ireland log michaell de la pole knight parliament deposed chancellorship first made admiral vpon uigill lady annuntiation great nauie flanders france spayne fraught of1387 warre diuers engins discouered whome earles encountred tooke ship conteined xix tonne wine whiche theyrochell vvine taken brought diuers part england wherby wine sold thirteene shilling four penny tonne robert de vere duke ireland sooke wife yong lady noble faire borne lady isabell daughter noble k edward maried another came queene anne forth boheme called vulgar tong hir conntrey lancecrona lordes tooke indignation heerewith especially duke glocester unkle ye yong lady forsaken duke ireland studied take duke glocester ye way easter past time whiche duke ireland shoulde haue transported ireland least shoulde muche sturre realme among lord king bring water side goeth wale leaue keepe might denise take away glocester earles arundell warwike darby notingham earle suffolke michaell pole robert tresilian justice many slowly ireland conspired death said noble great time passed king duke irelads iourney bin forgotten returned forth wale castell notingham treate ofanno reg death said noble men therfore sent diuers lodon whome knew would readie way soeuer moued called thither also sherifes justice realme interdited lord many crime king imagined meane time rumor came lord eares whervpon first ye king unkle glocester might mitigate king displeasure bishop london manye noble swearing vpon euangelistes tooke vpon oth neuer imagined thing king hinderance done thing displeasure except giue good countenace ireland would heereafter giue dishonested kinswoman firmelie determined reuenge william venor hugh forstalfe september sherifes maior sir nicholas exton fishmonger october glocester calling togither secretly earles arundell warwike darby like danger co demnatio prouided speedily discouereth matter therfore gathering army togither determine talke king vpon premise contraryly king party deliberate howe might take themselues way first sent castell rigate earle arundell lay earle northumberland many arrest perceyuing great nuber warre fearing commanded departed without errand came whome sent many night haue take haue slaine messenger sent fro glocester preueted coming caused ride al night morning come haringey hauing passed army xxx mile without great trauayle found assembled glocester earle warwike great power men k enformed assembly harnesey wood said demaded familiar done case end mediation came betwixt matter brought issue lord come westminster receiue answere king thing bishop ely many worthy credit taking oth king part fraude deceipt peril prepared whe lord prepared theselues according ye couenant foresaid mediator peace sent word yt treason deuised ambush laid place called mewes neere charing crosse therfore willed come sure hand whervpo stayd k demanding lord kept couenat b ely answered bycause saith ambush laid armed men place contrary couenant therefore neyther come repute faithfull king moued forthwith sware knew thing therefore commanded sheriffes london going mewes shoulde kill founde assembled cause thomas treuit nicholas brembar knightes secretly sente away armed men london king therefore sent agayne lord streightwayes came westminster strong power agaynst whose comming king adorning himselfe kingly robe crowne scepter entreth westminster hall bishop elie lord chancellour speaking king demanded cause assembling power whervnto lord answered done king profit realmes plucke traytors whiche kept whome named robert de vere duke ireland alexander neuell archbishop yorke michaell pole earle suffolke robert trisilian false justice nicholas brembar false knight london therevpon threwe downe gloues swearing would prosecute battayle nay sayth king shall next parliament appoynted holden morrow purification lady pacified time maner exhalation likenesse fire appeared strange likenesse fire iohn leycester night many place england went men went stayde sometime like wheele sometime like barrell sometime like timberlogge many went togither appeared farre lord departing fro k notwithstanding kept togither seemed great wisdome ireland partes chester wale assembled great nuber whose captaine ye connestable chester thomas moleneux great wealth hardy ireland multitude hasted towards london yt ioyning londoner might make inuincible army ye ireland riding forth stately glorious array ye armie thinking none durst haue encountred sodeinly loked one side beheld host lord ready far fro tarying coming midst valley sight heart streightwayes fayled said friend must flie greater puissance seemeth yoder haue quarell ye shifted away ye shall escape wel ynough forthwith setting spurres horse fleeth away ye foresaid tho moleneux prepared himselfe battayle lordes yet al come place fought awearied entred riuer amog sir thomas mortimer knighte exhorted come vp else would shoote riuer come vp sayth thomas moleneux wilt thou saue life doe make promise sayeth eyther come vp yu shalt steight die answered suffer come vp let fight eyther thee dye like man came vp knight caught helmet plucked heade streighte wayes hys dagger strucke hym braynes duke ireland fleeing came riuer thamis forced horsse enter made horsseman swimmer gotte side horsse helmet gauntlet brest plate came share lordes thoughte long drowned got ouer flaunders archbishoppe yorke fledde robert tresilian michael de la pole got caleis lord beeing returned battayle bin nere burforde fast bablack made great ioy ouerthrowe enimies muche lamented escape duke ireland heade earthe made oxforde arte negromancie time appointed spake word caput decidetur head shall cut caput eleuabitur heade shall lift vp pes eleuabuntur super caput feete shall lift aboue heade dissention fel oxford sotherne welch men one part northerne schollers manye slaine part went countryes wherfore chauncellour depriued doctour nicholas brightwel deane newerke leicester made chancellour lordes hasted london king kepte hys christmasse tower london hauing assembl army neare hande morrowe christmasse day came london mustered field might seene tower londoner greatfeare waying diuerse peril king displeasure opened gate lord shut forth indignatio vndiscrete multitude duke glocester entred tower hauing little talke king recited conspiracie wherby bin indited shewed forthe also th letter sente duke irelande shoulde assemble armye distruction c ende king promised nexte morrow come westminster intreate large reformation matter morning king came westminster wher little talke noble sayde honour commoditie kingdome behouefull certain ship enemy taking drowning bre ning lxxx shippes entred ile beas spoyled brent yeare scottes prepared themselues soone truce exspired mighte readie inuade north partes great army entred englande committing gret slaughter people toke booty euery place ledde away manye prisoner burned townes approched newcastel vpon tyne picht theyr tentes farre thence towne sir henrie percy yonger syr ralph brother desirous warlike renowme sore enimies scottes thys sir henrie came vpon sodayne assayled campe making greate slaughter william douglas also chiefe captaine scottes beholding thing thousande time hadde wished sir henrie percy within campe rydeth againste slayne sayde henrie commeth earle dunbar excessiue number scottes toke sayd henrie brother ralphe slaying many englishe menne place yet scottes loste manye theyr beste men thys battayle otterborne soarest fought thatbattaile otterborne iohn belandine iohn maior frosert h rudborae parliament cambridge euer betweene englishe northumberlande came castel tinmouth hauing refreshed certain dayes toke iourney towards maner plecy mortalitie increased norffolke many country vnlike greate pestilence within yorke dyed xj thousand person citizen london toke orphan chesteanno reg markes buye victualles xxiiij alderman eache layde twentie pounde like purpose buying corne bestowed diuerse place poore mighte buye appointed price suche lacked money pay downe put suretie pay yt yeare following brewer dwelt signe cocke westcheape little conduite neare vnto powles gate murdered night time theef came gutter windowe knowne long confession theefe gallowes bee hanged fellonie brewer wife firste brente therefore three men drawne tiborne hanged wrongfully iohn chadworth henrie vamer september sherifes maior sir iohn hinde draper king richarde queene anne wife foure bishoppes many erles duke yorke many lord fifteene ladyes helde royall christmasse langley neare saint albons christmasse day dolphin came forth sea playde himselfe thamis london bridge shewing hapily tempest follow within weeke seene citizen followed much difficultie intercepted broughte againe london shewing spectacle many height bodye ten foote length dolphin fish sea yt followe voyces men reioyce playing instrumentes wont gather themselues musicke play riuers hastie springings leaping signify tempest follow sea containt nothing swift nimble oftentimes theyr skippes mount ouer sayles shippes king sent londoner requesting borrowe of1392 tho walsing one thousande pounde whiche stoutely denyed also euil entreated bette neere hand slew certain lumbard woulde haue lent king sayde su king heard maruellously angried calling togither almost noble lande hee opened malitiousnesse londoner co playned theyr presumption whyche noble men gaue counsell insolencie shoulde speede oppressed theyr pride abated king iudgement therefore maior london sherifes best citizen arrested maior sente windsor castel prison til king counsell determine done determined thenceforth londoner shoulde chose haue anye maior king shoulde appointe one knightes ruler citie priuiledges reuoked liberty adnulled lawes abrogated king appointed warden citie certayne knighte called sir edwarde de dalingrige quicklye deposed king bicause men said fauoured londoner baldwin radinton constituted place meane time throughe sute certaine knightes butanno reg specially duke glocester king somewhat pacified little little abateth rigor purpose calling minde diuerse honor greate giftes receyued londoner wherevpon determineth deale mildely call hope grace pardon sendeth commaundement come windsore shewe pryuiledges liberty lawes whyche shewed ratifyed condemned could obtaine king full fauour till satisfied ye king iniuries whiche sayd done king thys assembly windsor hadde got togither almost lordes greate army londoner cause afrayde thereof aboute whiche preparation greate charge whiche sure londoner muste pay therefore ignoraunte ende thing money matter submitted themselues king pleasure offering ten thousand pound yet dismissed home returne againe vncertaine satisfaction sum shoulde pay citizen returned noble gone home king hearing londoner hauens dismayde sayde men wil go sayth london comforte citizen longer dispayre fauour sentence sooner knowne citie al menne filled incredible ioy euery generally determined meete liberal gift coronation king therefore hee came shine surrey london queene anne wife xxj august principall citizen rode meete wandesworth sainte gorge churche southwarke receyued procession rob braybroke bishop london cleargie citie conuayed london citizen men woman child order meeting king honor attended westminster passed citie streetes hanged cloth golde siluer silke conduite chepe ran red white wine childe angellike presented costly crowne golde queene another table trinitie gold giuen king valued worth eight hundred pounde another queen saint anne bycause hir name anne diuerse giftes horsses trapper plate golde siluer clothes gold silke veluets basons ewer gold also golde coyne precious stone iewels rich excellent beautifull value price mighte well esteemed citizen recouered auntient customes liberty king bench yorke chauncerie notingham returned london granted might choose maior time done londoner beleeued giftes escaped daunger thenceforth quiet wer deceiued wer copelled giue k pound collected comons conclude final peace betwixt ye kingdom brought passe wished reason frenche king sicknesse september lightning thunder manye place england much hurte especiallye cambridgeshire brent house corne neare house men woman hardly escaped drowning yeare lorde de ro returned forth holy lande citie paphos ile cipres intemperauncie ayre departed life octaues hillerie parliament holden london whiche subsidie demaunded king minded go irelande wherefore cleargie graunted full tenth would passe thyther went graunted halfe tenth certaine lordes scotlande came england get worship force armes erle marre challenged earle notingham iust rode togither certaine cources ful chalege erle marre cast horsse man two ribbes broken fall borne smithfielde conuayed towarde scotlande died way yorke sir william darrel knight ye king ba ner bearer scotland challeged sir pierce courtney knight king bannerbearer englande ru certain course gaue ouer without conclusio victory cockborne esquire scotland challenged sir nicholas hawberke knight rode v course cockborn borne ouer horsse man seauenth june queene anne dyed shine southerie buried westminster anno reg k toke hir death heauily besides cursing place dyed also anger throw building vnto whiche former king beyng wearyed citie wonte pleasure resorte moneth auguste proclamation made irishman shoulde auoyde realme gette home feast nauitie lady pain life william bramstone thomas knowles sept sherifes maior sir iohn froysh mercer october king richard went ouer ireland ye duke glocester earles march notingham rutlande irish men afrayde suche preparation made durst shewe themselues openly secrete assaultings often troubled king army yet englishman preuayled many lord land submitted themselues king kyng helde wyth hym leaste shoulde attempte new styre king helde christmasse dublin irelande feast held parliament also time lord warden england called parliamet london came sent forth ireland duke glocester al state shewed king need spent treasure amongst irishme tenth granted cleargie fifteenth the1395 laytie voiage chargeable king came small effect easter forced returne england appease certaine trouble begon sir rycharde sturry sir thomas latimer sir lewes clifforde syr iohn montacute yeare england suffered great losse pirate ye queene donmarke spoyled marriners merchatsanno reg especially men norffolke assembled multitude togither toke vppon fight enimies preuayling many slaine verye many taken prisoner reserued grieuous redemption losse twentie thousande poundes borde make merchandice roger elles william sherington september sherifes maior sir william vintener october month nouember king richard caused body deare friend robert de vere duke ireland brought louaine buried priorie colne essex solemne funeral honored wt presence causing co en cipres wherin body embalmed lay opened might behold his1 face touch finger openly shewing loue dead carkasse ought aliue iohn duke lancaster k giuen duchie aquitaine nowe laide forth estimable sumanno reg treasure partes purchase good wils countreymen haue desire sodainelye called home k returning england came langley k held christmasse receyued k honor taking leaue courte made hast lincolne toke wife katheren swinford yeare according couenaunt made established betwixt king england fraunce sayde king mette place caleis appointed talke wher concluded peace toke corporal england xiij nouember queene came london southwarke multitude people went see hir vpon1 lon bridge nine person crowded death prior tiptor essex one worshipfull matrone cornehil another christmasse parliamet holden lond lancaster caused issue katheren swinford made legitimate also thomas son lancaster said katheren created e somerset gaue surname bello fortie bewfort graunted k halfe tenth cleargie yeare realme england seemed inioy chiefest peace might reason king marriage great rich heaped vp togither reason truce yeares established presence many noble men like forrain realme able shew sodainely thing troubled brought turmoyle while king atanno reg plashy essex vpon sodaine toke vncle glo force armes suspecting thing caused hym conueyed caleis kept prison caused earle warwicke surety prosecuting appeale richarde earle arundell arreigned redde gowne scarlet whood forthwith duke lancaster sayde lorde neuell take hym hys girdle whoode done heerewith article appeale beeing sayde earle declared valiaunt bolde mynde hee denyed hee traytor required benefite pardon protesting would goe fauour king grace duke lancaster sayde hym thou traytor pardon reuoked earle answered truely thou lyest neuer traytor also duke lancaster sayde diddest thou purchase thy pardon earle answered escape tongue myne enimies whome thou arte one verily farre forth toucheth treason thou hast neede pardon king sayde make answere vnto thyne appeale earle answered see well person haue accused treason shewing appealementes truely lye neuer traytor aske alwayes benefyte pardon whyche youre grace granted within sixe yeares last past full age francke good proper motion sayd king grant sayde duke lancaster graunt auayleth erle answered truly pardon know lesse thy selfe side sea said sir iohn bushy pardon reuoked king lordes v faithfull people earle answered faithful people know thee well thy company ye gathered togither deale faithfully faithful people realme heere therefore people lamente well know thou hast bin euer false bushy fellowes cried behold soueraigne lord king traytor goeth reyse sedition betwixt v people home earle answered ye lye traytor rose earle darby sayde didst thou say thus huntington first assembled togither rise best afore thing take king earle sayd earle darby thou lyest thy head neuer thought soueraigne lorde king good honor sayd king didst thou say time thy parliament bath behinde white hall sir simon de burley worthie death many cause answered knew cause death yet thou thy fellowes didst trayterouslie put death duke lancaster pronounced iudgement manner richard iohn steward england iudge thee traytor condemne thee drawne hanged beheaded quartered thy land tailed tailed thee thine heires thy body descending confilcate king reuerence bloud commanded beheaded ledde tower hill beheaded buried augustine frier london also day king appoynted lord cobham accused common arraigned also vpon saterday sir thomas de mortimer sommoned vpon confiscated banished realme tuesday rikell king justice borne ireland read certayne confession drawne writing vpon said treason put forth affirming confession said duke put forth discouered written king commanded quiet fight kyng sitting hys royall apparell within tente girt sworde hee commanded hys decree bee proclaymed thys king decree henry duke hereforde hys disobedience towardes kingdukes anished shoulde bee banished tenne yeares likewise duke norffolke banished euer england taking reuenues thousand markes yeare till towne caleis repaired iohn wade iohn warner september sherifes maior sir drew barrentine goldsmith october feast saint michaell king caused seauenteene county east england bee indited layde theyr charge bin agaynste duke glocester earles arundell warwike wherefore hee sente honourable men induce lord spirituall temporall make submission writing sealed theyr owne handes acknowledging themselues bee traytors king though neuer offended word deede moreouer compelled religious gentleman common setblancke charter seales blanckes ende might pleased oppresse seuerally common payde thousande markes thousande pounde c also ordeyned euery prouince englande gentleman substance swornevn customed othes firmely maynteyne according possible power statute article constitution ordeyned last parliament newyeares day neere vnto bedforde deepe water ranne betwixt townes swelstone harleswode stoode sodeinly still deuided selfe space three mile botome remained drie wonder many one thought signifie deuision people falling away king whiche hapned shortly roger mortimere earle march vlstar ireland earle march slaine irelad cro pet coledge w l wilum lying castel came great multitude wilde irishman assayle issuing fought manfully till hewen peeces whose death king determined reuenge candlemas dyed iohn gaunt lancaster bishop elyes inne holborne london wasduke lancaster deceased honourably buryed paules church london sonne henry duke hereford beyond sea whitsontide king richard nauie ship sayled milford hauen towards ireland arriuedking richarde sayled ireland waterford last day maynfrem whence marched armie thirtie thousande kilkenny fourescore mile within countrey remayned xiiij dayes tarying edward duke aumarle midsommer euen went thence toward mackmore whoanno reg remayned amongst wood right hardy seemed little feare englishman entring wood king commanded fire vsed many house many village brent king made duke hereford sonne knight ten pioners appoynted fell wood make wayes ye englishman irishme feared greatly shot englishman yet dartes assayled slewe diuers caught aduantage unkle mackmore came yeelded himselfethe vnkle mackmore submitted king richard king withie necke many naked bare legged like king pardoned king sente mackmore promising would come unkle done withie necke pardoned vtterly refusing sayd would fight death defending right knew englishman wanted victualles brought could bought gold siluer already scarcitie four sixe small lofe bread liue day eate grayne fiue dayes togither king therefore departed day june toward diuelin time mackmore sent beggar notice king hee would friend aske mercy else pleased treate peace send noble whervpon earle glocester sent led reregard wherof captayne two c lance archer betwixt two wood farre sea mette irish mackmore himselfe rode whitemackmore good horseman horsse without saddle furniture cost sayde foure hundred kowes whiche horsse ranne downe hill beholder reported neuer seene hare deere haue runne swiftly hys righte hande bare darte greate long whiche threwe exceeding well mightie strong man personage earle hee talked good whyle aboute murthering earle march thynges agree coulde departed earle aduertised king foud nothing enimie woulde crie mercie might sure haue peace without griefe otherwise would long liued defend himselfe wherefore king wrath knowing lette might happen sware would neuer depart irelande till eyther aliue dead host dislodged lacke victualles thirtie thousand comming ouer lay diuelin fifteene dayes king forthwith deuiding armie three partes sente seeke mackemore promising hundreth markes could bring offer well hearkened vnto sounded well could caught day edwarde earle rutlande duke aumarle connestable englande arriued hundreth sayle whose comming king verie glad though indeede taried long mighte haue come muche sooner remayned sixe weekes diuelin heard newes englande passage dangerous winde beeing contrary tempestes greate length came shippe heauie newes duke hereforde deceasse father duke lancaster arriued england rauenspore duke hereford returned englande beside wadlington yorkeshire beheaded william scrope earle wilshire treasourer englande iohn bushy henry greene caused thomas arundell archbishop canterbury preach againste king richarde also shewed bull procured rome promising remission sinnes whiche ayde sayde henry conquering enimies death placed paradise preaching moued manye cleaue duke upon newes king perswaded make hast ouer duke aumarle sayde better stay till hys shippes mighte bee brought togither hundreth readie make sayle wherevpon iohn mountacute earle salisburie sente power whilest king going waterforde mighte gather hys fleete promised within sixe dayes haue followed hym earle salesburie landed conwey hee soone aduertised howe duke taken parte englande lord got threescore thousand men earle salesburie caused sommon welchmen cheshire come weening king bin arriued conwey within foure dayes come togither fortie thousand men ready goe duke hereford stayd fourteene dayes saw king came stealed away left earle salisburie manner alone vnneath c men duke hereford aduanced towards earle salisburie withdrew conwey king euill counsellking richard returned ireland landed milford hauen stayd earles departure eyghteene dayes arriued milford hauen whence midnight following desguised like priest feare knowne thirteene person went conwey thinking earle salisburie helde fielde duke excester surrey earle glocester continued faithfull vnto last houre three bishop also two like good men bishop lincolne saint dauids third continued faithfull bishop carelile also two knightes stephen scrope william fireby ianico gascoigne king rode warely came conwey breake daye great sorrow lamentation made king earle meeting earles host dispersed gone duke otherwayes duke aumarle connestable chiefe gouernour king armie milford immediately whe king departure knowne sayde souldiers let v shift selues maysters king fledde wherevpon euery man trussed away sir thomas percy steward houshold talking connestable also departed tooke way wale welshman seeing disorder assembled togither spoyled englishman goodes sent packing dublets white staues hand rode heere tenne heere twentie heere fiftie heere hundred welchmen comming downe mountaynes english lost king many horsses beyond sea broode great rich apparell iewels keeping sir thomas percy connestable came duke henry hereford fiue hundred companye naked whome welchmen despoyled beaten well king conwey great discomfort sent duke excester surrey henry duke hereford lancaster know meaning himselfe remayning still conwey great perplexitie earle salisburie bishop carelile sir william ferebe knight sir stephen scrope mine author another frenchman xvj person newes brought king connestable demeaned likewise steward caused rich brought aland going wale welchmen taken king aduise earle salisburie departed conwey vnto beawmareis ten mile thence went carnaruan beawmaris strong fortresse bin manned victualled carnaruan faire towne strong castell vnprouided thing fiue sixe nightes lay hard base victualles none wherefore returned againe conwey sore lamented estate duke excester surrey entring citie chester duke henry taken brought streight castell duke glad see forthwith asked duke excester newes tolde poynt poynt shame dishonour woulde dealt vniustly towardes prince deposed hee therefore demaunded speede duke lancaster slow dispatch tolde hym shoulde goe one weeke king well aduised sende hym fellow beeing men calling sith ynow meaner estate message remayned great discomfort duke excester duke henry still kepte hys company duke surrey committed safekeeping within castell chester castell sixe mile chester called beston castell builded rocke verye strong scituation therein hundred men armes chosen able men diligent deliuered duke might well ynough haue kept ascending steepe victualled sixe yeares founde within coyne better hundred thousande markes beside jewel king richard caused kepte value two hundred thousande markes duke henry tooke wyth returned chester taking counsell friendes best bee done archbishop canterburie sayde sith kyng wale whych countrey strong reason mountaynes impossible armie passe wyth bagge baggage hee thought best sende vnto king richarde make hym beleeue hee sought nothing peace parliamente bee made wherein offended putting death unkle duke glocester shoulde bee punished thenceforth king duke good friendes king pleasure appoynte day place thys parliamente withoute thys shifte shoulde bee vnpossible duke gette hym handes hee mighte departe sea hee woulde hauing retayned conwey shippes purpose lord assenting counsell duke appoynted earle northumberland go king four hudred launce thousand archer earle came flint castell deliuered hand thence hasted rudland also giuen ouer laying vnder rocke two great embushments people commandemente keepe passage went fiue company sea coast till came towne sent herault king safeconduct come presence declare message duke agreement safeconduct granted passed water entred castell conwey founde king earle salisburie declared peace woulde made would good judge true cause named tried iustice certayne day parliament westminster duke holde togither duke might keepe place high judge father auncesters done space one hundred yeares would haue tried law duke excester duke surrey earle salisburie bishop carelile thomas marke fiue giuen king counsell put unkle duke glocester death please pardon duke wrath would readie come knee aske mercie might goe london togither one one way another earle offered sweare shoulde perfourmed duke assured oth stand king liking libertie go eyther companie duke alone vnto london purposed take offer pretend excuse going alone meete duke lacke victualles like take byway thorough wale rayse power accorded goe duke masse celebrate earle northumberlande sware vpon host duke holde tolde king earle hasted king forwarde horssebacke king prayed erle go vnto rutland prepare dinner erle rode pace till came mighte see people vnder mountaine muche commended obseruing commaundement king passing water rode four mile came rock sawe ambush wask r betraye sore abashed knowing well betrayed earle place coulde escape sea beating one side rock keeping shoulde haue fled backe woulde haue caught could haue come conway past three twentie company k disse ding rocke earle came kneeling excused matter saying hadde caused people come guarde person king tolde fewer wold haue serued contrarie othe promised haue sixe company sayde therefore would goe backe conway earle aunsweared nowe sith would leade duke promised ten dayes since caused breade wine bee broughte offered king durst refuse leaping horssebacke againe rode rutlande dinner flinte lay night morrow two twentie day august king got castell wals beheld al host hundred thousand men comming sand came departed army archbishop canterburie sir thomas percy earle rutland duke taken office conestable colour displeasure bare duke order harte whyche king archbishoppe entred firste great traine went vp dungeon king came downe walles vnto reuerence lowlye knee king toke vp drew archbishop apart two talked log togither earle rutland kept aloof toke horsse againe rode towards duke approched neare kyng went vp againe walles lame ting sore saw duke hoste within two bowe shootes castell compassed rounde sea earle northumberland wente forthe duke long talke concluded duke enter castel king dyned fasting earle returned king set dynner whome sate assured friend earle salisburie bishop carlile sir steuen scrope feribe sat long eate little haste rise dinner duke entred castel armed basenet excepted king richard came downe meete duke soone saw king fell downe hys knee comming neare vnto kneeled second time hat hand king put hoode spake first faire cousin lancaster yee righte welcome duke bowing lowe grounde answeared lord come sent reason wil shew comon fame among people suche yee haue space twentie two twentie yeares ruled rigorously please lorde helpe gouerne better kyng aunswered fayre cousin lancaster sith pleaseth pleaseth mee wel duke spake yee haue heard king spake also bishop carlile sir stephen scrope feribe earle salisburie spake whereby earle perceyued duke hated deadly duke high sharp voyce bad bring forth king horsses two little nagges worthe fortie frank brought forth king set one earle salisburie thus duke brought king flinte chester delyuered duke glocesters sonne earle arundales sonne loued little put theyr father death ledde hym strayghte castel thirde day went nantwich next daye newe castle earle warwickes son mette iournying forth next day came stafford departed lichfield k thought haue escaped slypping downe gardaine windowe great tower espyed thrust tower againe liechfielde duke went couentrie coulde come thyther welchmen much harme slew many englishman great chaunce coulde take anye welchmen tyed horsse tayles drewe way ful stone caused die miserablye duke passed couentrie deintrie next day northampton thence dunstable saint albons fiue sixe mile hys comming london maior companyes lyueries greate noyse trumpet mette duke doyng reuerence hym kyng reioycing god sente suche prince conquered realme within one monthes space duke came within two mile citie duke caused hoste stay said common citie maisters beholde youre king consider yee doe wyth answered woulde ledde westminster wherevppon deliuered vnto ledde westminster thence water tower london entred london ye chief gate rode cheape sainte paules lodged bishop pallace fiue sixe dayes saint iohns without smithfield remained xv day thece remoued hertforde abonde three weekes came backe london hold parliament began firste wednesday october westminster hall hung trimmed sumptuously hadde caused set vp royall chayre purpose chose new king neare whiche prelate set side sat lord commos order first sat duke lancaster duke yorke duke aumerle duke surrey duke excester marque order earles arundale norfolke march stafford penbroke salisburie deuonshire erles northumberlande westmerlande sat went vppe oftentimes kneeled fell theyr office archbishop canterburie made sermon toke theame habuit iacob benedictione pre suo sermon ended latin doctour law stoode vp red instrument contained k richard owne confession disabled himselfe worthy raigne woulde resigne crowne one sufficiente rule instrument red archbishop perswaded proceede election new k perceyuing al cotented ther wer past four person wer king richards part durst say nothing asked wold haue king whether duke yorke aunswered asked would haue eldest son aumarle sayd asked would haue yongest son sayd diuerse staying asked wold haue lancaster aunswered would haue none diamounde made thrice drew certain instrument charter red presence ye archbishop coming duke fell theyr knee declaring chosen king willed take regarde would consent thereto knee rose declared accepted realm sith ordayned god ye archbishop red yt new k bound vnto certain ceremony signed crosse kissed achbishop toke ring king wedded realme bare lord percy conestable receyuing shewed al assembly put king finger king kissed conestable archbishop led royal k made prayer knee spake vnto first ye prelate lord al set seate thus inuested k richard put sat good kept silence rest prayer prosperitie gouernement ended wher office voyde k created lord percy conestable toke staffe chosen ralph earle westmerland marshal iohn skirley chanceller sir richard clifforde keeper priuy seale many officer newely confirmed arcbishoppe spake certayne thing latin praying king prosperitie realmes spake english exhorting present pray like euery man sat king rose made eldest son prince wale lord sworne true prince done father hys seconde sonne made duke lancaster thus king richard deposed raigned two twenty yeres three monthes odde dayes p henrie bolengbroke henrie fourth son iohn g unte dukeanno reg lancaster ordayned king englad force lawfull succession election began raigne september yere lord god crowned westminster xiij october thomas arundale archbishop canterburie duke yorke surrey aumarle earle glocester bare canapie ouer sir thomas dimmocke champion rode three time hall noble valiaunt prince ciuill warres appeased shewed himselfe louing subiectes made henrie sonne prince wale duke cornwal erle chester heyre apparaunt crowne william waldren william hyde september sherifes maior sir thomas knowles grocer october solemnitie coronation lord common streight proceeded parliamet inquired death duke glocester hee bin murdered caleis duke norsfolke vpon king commaundement king hent e created hys eldest ne prince wale duke earle chester duke aquitaine parliament ordained statute made parliament holden yere king richard westminster proroged vnto shrewesburie circustances adnulled reuoked made voyde vtterly blotted also parliament holde westminster xj yere k richard holden firme stable also lord persos iudged forth parliament holden yere king richard heires deade shoulde wholy restored possession without uing liuerie thereof made excepted lord shal haue nothing ye issue receiued ye mean time gaue e northumberland ye ile man holde k seruice beare sword wt entred england westmerland gaue coutie richmond also judgement giuen appellauntes duke glocester maner lord glocester preset lose name heires ye aboue named person al castels possession manor belonged appelled fro ye day arrest glocester lord time simply without fauour mercie shal lose al castels possessios windsor iohn holland late duke excester erie huntington thomas holand late duke surrey earle kente edwarde late duke aumerle earle rutlande sonne duke yorke iohn mountacute eri sabsburie thomas spencer sir ralph lumley sir thomas blunt sir benedict cely knight fauoures king richarde conspired king henrie appointed priuily murder vnder colour justing pastime pretended time approching theyr purpose sent messenger london letter duke aumerle shoulde fayle come ye day appointed company helpe feate whervnto sworne minde altered hee bare letter streighte father duke yorke caused number men forthwith carrye son king shewing letter king woulde beleeue morning came maior london court informed matter whervpon king made tariance got forth toward london companye maior king coulde gette london backe enimies come windesore entred castell armed band fourth januarie night vnderstanding king escaped theyr hand sore amazed withdrewe windesore vnto sunning certaine manour neare reading queene wife king richarde lay persuaded hyr houshold king richarde escaped romfrete astel would go thence went walling forde abingdon mouing people take armes vppon goe meete king richarde came farindon vale white horsse barkeshire daye circester xij day late eneni g harbored greate number men ar e many archer ther bruted k richard escaped forth prison hee make word haue credite got chaplaine king richardes called madeleine like hym proportion fauor one could vnneth descerned many time sayth mine aucthour haue seene ireland ride king master faire priest goodly person lightly seene put armoure crowne helmet men mighte take king richard morrow wednesday people towne misliking proceeding fought length toke chiefest ledde abbay put fayre chamber vnder safe custody thursday said lordes fearing people imagined howe escape theyr handes caused seruauntes sette fire certaine house towne thinking therevppon people woulde departe seeke staunche fire chaunced contrarie people turned maruellous rage ranne vppon great violence drew market place beheaded duke excester duke surrey earle salisburie thirde day epiphanie seruauntes taken prisoner bound brought oxforde monday following beheaded castell number xxvj person also sir thomas blount knight beheaded weeke nexte following beheaded thomas spencer earle glocester bristow time beheaded iohn holland earle huntington brother king richard pardoned sixth day februarie king henrie caused ye blank charter made king richard brent standert cheape london king richard imprisoned pomfrait castel xv dayes nightes vexed continuall hunger thirste colde finally bereft life suche kinde death neuer time knowen englad dyed xiiij day februarie whose body brought tower london cittie paules church bare faced stoode three dayes beholder seruice king henrie present thence carryed langley buried church ye frier preacher upo death famous excellente poet iohn gower wrote certaine verse may englished thus mirrour world meete shouldst golde bette wise worthy one high degree soone came newes king leto lain battayle bassacke sonne noble balthazardan destroyed ierusalem countrey rounde aboute bycause god grace ouercome contrarye opinion became returned fraunce richarde yet twelue yeares age departed douer towardes caleis fraunce hyr father owen glendouerdew welchmen much harme englishman returned founde king bedde clothes yronk h escapeth great daunger three sharp pike slender round standing vpright layde traytour kyng haue layde downe might haue thrust himselfe vpon time vsed exceeding pride garmentes gownes deepe broade sleeues commonlye called poke sleeues seruauntes ware well theyrtho wals aditions polic maisters whiche mighte well haue bene called receptacle diuel stole hidde sleeues whereof hung downe feete leaste knee ful cuttes iagges whervpon made anno reg verse hath lande little neede brome sweepe away filth streeteth hoc li sen side sleeues pennilesse gromes vp licke drie weete england stand vpright thy feete foule waste simple degree banish shal ore repent thee william venor iohn fremingham septemsherifes maior sir iohn chadworth mercer october conduit vpon cornehil london made time bene prison called diuinitie beinga stout frier executed asked would k richard present answered woulde fight quarrel man euen death wherfore condemned drawen hanged religious habit weede daneburie essex vpon corpus christi day diuell appeared likenesse gray frier entring church raged insolentlye greate feare parishioner houre tempeste whyrlewinde thunder toppe steeple broken downe halfe chauncel scattered abrode shortlye sir roger claringdon knighte bastard sonne edward blacke prince wyth squire yeomanne beheadded eyghte graye frier hanged beheaded london two leicester whiche hadde published king richard bee aliue owen glendouerdew company welchmen inuaded shire bordered neare vnto hym wherefore sir edmund mortimer wyth manye knightes esquiers wente encounter owen stronger countrey came martial affayres owne archer turned theyr handes againste whome shoulde haue defended flayne aboue eleauen hundred men sir edmunde mortimer taken welchwomen ye battayle done vsing deade carcass shamefullye bee spoken woulde suffer buryed without great raunsome kyng went wyth greate power wale pursue owe glendouerdew profited nothing loste muche welchmen conuayed themselues vnknowen place wherefore king constrayned necessitie returned englande spoyled brent countrey time scottes cruelly entred england supposed lord beyond humber occupyed party wale erles northumberlande henrie percie sonne henrie earle dunbarre good whyle agone hauing forsaken scottes sworne true king england number armed men plentie archer sodainly came resiste scottes woulde haue retourned home hadde spoyled brente countrey nowe vppon sodayne theyr waye forelayde muste needes abyde take place fighte vppon chose therefore mountaine neare towne wollor called halydowe hill whiche place themselues wyth theyr armed men archer men beheld leauing way stoode scottes clynie hill stoode ouer scottes without delaye time archer placed valley set arrowes scottes battayle might mean force come downe side scottishe archer let flye men yet felt grieuous waighte bin shower tempest arrowes shotte englishman fledde earle dowglas perceyuing men flee generall leader tooke hys speare manfullye wyth multitude came hyll trusting doubtlesse armour ye armour hys complices hadde bin three yeares makyng forced himselfe runne vpon archer whiche archer sawe stepped backe shotte fiercely pierced armed men body stroke throughe theyr helmet ryued speares rente theyr armoure wyth lyghte adoe earle dowglas hymselfe wounded fiue place residue scottes come beside hyll turnyng backe arrowes flewe fledde awaye theyr flyghte nothing auayled whilest archer followed compelled yeelde themselues earle dowglas also taken manye drowned riuer tweede whylest knewe fourdes number fiue hundered sayde thys battayle lorde knighte squire gaue anye stroke enimyes onely god gaue victorie englishe archer lordes armed menne beeyng onelye looker daye flower scottishe chi alrye taken witte earle dowglas murdake eldest sonne duke albanie heyre apparente realme seemed fight cruell battayles although farre might see yet neere hande could see finde whiche thing deceyued many coueted approch come neere henry percy yonger sodeinly shew himselfe king enimie vnto whome ioyned thomas percy earle worcester unkle sayde henry make conspiracie excusable write vnto shiresbattayle shrevvsburie pretended nothing alleageance fidelitie ought king neyther gather ende familiar king richarde meanes many gaue greater credite countesse much religious abbot countrey giue credite vnto hir tale afterward taken af king commandement emprisoned bycause beleeue giue credit king called parliament couentry sent processe sheriffes choose knight burgess knowledge lawes realme reason wherof called lay man parliamet piked knightslay man parliament burgess could deuise none way releeue king lacke money depriue cleargie temporall land goodes thomas arundell archbishop canterbury made answere cleargie alwayes giue king much lay people considering er giue king tenthes laytie gaue fifteenes moreouer tenant serue king warres tha tenant lay fee besides prayed prosperitie king faithfully serued whe speker ye parliamet said loud voice little regarded ye prayer church archbishop caterbury answered quoth know end fortune realme come whe suffrage ye church set wherwith ye godhead wont appeased surely kingdome neuer cotinueth stable voyde prayer deuotion notwithstanding thinke thou shalt without punishmet take away possessios church archbishop canterburie liue thou shalte haue euill taking thing archbishoppe rose vppe kneeled downe kyng desiring hym consider howe gratiouslie god fauour atteyned kingdome would cosider first promis would preserue vnto euery man right title farre lay also willed remember oth voluntarily made would honor defend church minister thereof wherefore desired permit suffer church enioy priuiledges liberty time predecessor enioy feare king whome king doe raigne archbishop said like word king commanded go seate againe sayde intent purpose leaue church good state better found archbishop speaking knightes burgess sayde like haue giuen counsell vnto king predecessor confiscate goodes thein edvvard third time celles whiche frenchman norman possesse england sayd heape vp great rich deede woorth many thousand gold notwithstanding true king day richer thereby halfe marke haue extorted least begged handes haue appropriated saide goodes vnto selues may coniectured request haue temporality king profite owne couetousnesse without doubt king god forbid fulfill wicked purpose one farthing richer next yeare following surely sooner let head cut churche destitute least right perteyneth c cleargie granted tenth halfe common two fifteenes condition lord furniuall receyne spend king warres time abundance water brake sodeinly ouer bankes kent neuer seene like partes whereby drowned beastes cattell without number neyther england bewayle theyr loss also zeland flanders holland susteyned like great excesse water yeare died william wikeham bishop winchester colledge oxford whose charge trauell cleargie england much encreased builded notable colledge oxford encrease learning placed warden company sonday fifteenth march fight betwixt englishman conspiracy king henry archbishop yorke welchmen sonne owen glendouerdewe taken fifteene hundred taken slayne henry percy earle northumberlande richard scrope archbishop yorke thomas mowbray earle marshall thomas lord bardolph cospiring king henry assembled togither citizen yorke many stand commoditie realm animate common readier vnto businesse set article vpo dores monastery church citie written english agaynste king bycause put downe king richard offering themselues article liue die caused great number people resort ralph neuill earle westmerland farre togither iohn duke lancaster king sonne enformed thing gathered armie speede goe archbishop company vayne archbishop power farre greater wherevpon earle westmerland sente messenger enquire archbishop cause great assembly armour contrarie king peace wherevnto archbishop answered tooke nothing hand king peace armour munited men feare king whome could safely come vnto speake purpose said good comodious ye king realme happily would know shewed scedule ye article conteyned earle westmerland read word countenance praysed bishop holy vertuous intent promised would prosecute archbishop archbishop glad beleeued earles word perswaded earle marshall vnwilling therevnto go place appointed talke togither whome like number came writing article read ouer streightway earle gaue assent article sayde earle subtiller rest behold labour haue take hand come end would haue people hath bin long armour let beare word vnto people go way home lay downe armour euery fall occupation accustomed labour meane season token concord drinke togither people side shall see without delay take hand knight sent archbishop behalfe beare word ye people peace command euery man lay downe armour go owne home people beholding signes peace lord drinking togither aweeried vnaccustomed trauell war turned reines bridle homewards came passe whe people ye archbishop side went away ye nuber aduersaries increased appointed archbishop perceiue yt betrayd vntill time ye earle arrested arrested marshall also many promised yt haue harme promise kept archbishoparchbishop yorke beheaded earle marshall beheaded king came yorke morrow whitsonday whe king punished yorke pleasure set forth armie pursue earle northumberland thomas lord bardolph tooke maner munition armie thousand fighting men earle northumberland perceyuing king intent gote himselfe berwike three hundred horsse fro thence scotland king bent earle northumberland went berwike whence earle fledde scotland lord bardolph whome dauid lord fleming scotte receyued alliance king vnderstading earle fled commanded castell render vnto whiche refused king caused greate gunne shotte whiche ouerthrewe parte tower wherevpon castell gaue ouer submitted themselues king caused beheaded residue sent prison castell alnewike rest earles castels small ado rendred handes successe king encouraged went streight wale contrarywise nothing prospered wherefore returned loosing charets carte wagon number treasure comming backe worcester sent archbishop bishop declared misfortune desiring help whome archbishop answered woulde talke cleargie matter meane season frenchman came succour welchmen shippes l nded milford hauen hauing lost almost horsses lacke fresh water lord barkley henry pay burnt fifteene shippes hauen frenchman beseeged towne carmarden tooke graunting inhabitant moueable goodes goe whether would time foresayde lorde barkley thomasanno reg swinborne henry pay tooke fourteene shippes french whiche tooke steward france right captaynes towne reystone hartfordshire brentreyston brent henry barton william groome september sherifes maior sir iohn woodcocke mercer october yeare weares thamis townevveares thamis medvvay destroyed stanes weast vnto water medway east maior communaltie london destroyd trunckes brent great plea discord followed betweene thomas arundell archbishop canterbury lord knightes one party maior communaltie partie citizen preuayled vertue charter statute parliamente beganne whiche lasted nigh oneparliament great taske whole yeare knightes parliament long delayde graunt king subsedie yet ende ouercome granted taske demanded priestes frier liued almes forced euery one pay halfe marke henry percy earle northumberland l bardolfe counsell dauid fleming fled wale declared scottes conspired deliuer vnto owne king exchange prisoner dauid fleming trayterous scottes flew reysed ciuill warre amongst selues ende constreyned request truce yeare obteyned scottes sente iames sonne robert king scottes butthe king scottes sonne heire taken sea nine yeares olde towardes france brought vp instructed pleasant eloquence french tongue whome certayne marriners cley norffolke tooke sea bishop earle orkney whome father committed brought england deliuered king forth burst laughter sayde surely scottes mighte haue sente speake french bishop escaped fledde earle orkeney sayde iames yong ladde sent tower london remayned prisoner till second yeare henry sixth whiche aboue eighteene yeares frenchman came help owen glendouerdew shippes whereof taken full armed men rest escaped wale long taken fiftene shippes laden wine waxe whilest parliament yet continued duke yorke restored olde dignitie whome many men thought haue bin dead prison edmond holland earle kent married duke ofanno reg millaynes daughter priory saint mary ouery southwarke nicholas wootton geffrey brooke septemb sherifes maior sir richard whittington mercer october iohn couentry iankin carpenter executor richly paynted saint innocent cloyster paris metre french signifyingthe daunce death commonly called daunce paules speech death estate seuerall answeres againe death whiche translated english iohn lidgate monke bury afore sayde richly paynted sayd cloyster saint paules church therefore commonly called daunce paules henry pay fiue porte withtho wals fifteene shippes tooke hundred twentie shippes lay ancker sea briteine laden iron salt oyle rochell wine sommer corruption ayre great plague shedde vpon men bodyes seene like many yeares land men might say south windes warme blow heate pestiferouspestilence pestilence beare great rule city populous london short consumed aboue thirtie thousand men woman countrey townes great mortalitie fell among husbandman great household dyed cleane vp house emptied fifteenth day august deceassed sir roberte knowles knight manour sconethorp norffolke sir robert knovvles iohn leyland brought london honourably buried white frier church newly reedifyed builded sir robert knowles bin valiant captayne warres france raigne edward third richard second whose force realme france felt feared dukedome briteine register bermondsey people hence spayne life made uerses latin may englished thus robert knowles woorthy fameverses thy prowesse france made tame thy manhoode made frenchman yeeld dint sword towne field sir robert knowles founded small byrdes dyed hunger colde while king helde great counsell london noble realme henrie earle northumberlande thomas lorde bardolfe came againe england long iournying came towne thriske caused bee proclaymed woulde haue libertie shoulde take vp armour weapon follow whervpon much people resorted sir thomas rockley sherife yorkeshire knightes countrey went bramham moore nere hasewold fought great battayle slew earle whose head streyght wayes cutte lord bardolph sore wounded taken aliue dyed shortly battayle fought xviij day february erles head put stake caryed openly citie1408 london set london bridge bishop bangor taken lordes pardoned lyfe bycause founde armour king wente yorke condemned transgressed confiscated good pacified countrey hanged abbot hayle bin armour returned south partes againe upon seuenth september suche flouds rayne olde men age neuer seene edmunde hollande earle kent whilest besieged castell briake brytaine wounded arrowe crossebowe heade notwithstanding toke castel destroied ground long braines rotted diedanno reg sherifes maior thomas ducke william norton september sir drew barentine goldsmith october aboute feaste al saintes cardinall burges came gregorie obserue othe hadde made magnificence two king co corde mighte made church vnto whiche businesse frenche kyng hadde gladlye graunted sente messenger vnto pope gregorie notwythstandyng1409 obstinate kyng englande hee vnderstoode cardinalles message hee commaunded curtesie gentle entertaymente shoulde gyuen hym offered beare hys charge long hee woulde abyde englande feaste epyphanye sundry partes world euen late number thirtie thousande reason dissention vpon bishoprick leon betwixte two striue contende one aucthoritie true pope aucthoritie antipope slaughter fielde lamentable thing spoken slaine distroyed truely apostolike sea woulde greate heauinesse heart woulde rather forsake honor apostolicall sea tha see henceforth wicked slaughter committed woulde take example true duke orleaunce duke burgonie euer al returned whiche agoe went ouer ye erle arundale ayde duke burgonie many men maruelled sodaine chaunge small tyme englishman dyd ayde assiste two contrarie part notwythstandyng foresayde noble wente forewardes arriued normandie duke orleaunce meete tyme appointed brent hys townes spoyled countrey tooke manye holdes length thoughe late duke clarence orleance mette talked togither matter entreated betweene menne shoulde desyste raungyng throughe countrey refrayne robberie men hadde graunted departed aquitaine wynter duke orleaunce wente home hys countreyanno reg ralph leuenhynd william seuenocke sep sherifes maior sir william waldren mercer october tyme lorde herle marshall fraunce manye noble men men armes number foure thousande besieged certayne holde aquitaine whyche keepyng iohn blunte knight three hundered ayded hym putte flight whole army frenchman toke twelue men name gentleman number kyng henrie kept christmasse manour eltham sore sick sometime men thought bin dead notwithstanding pleased god recouered strength againe little christmasse called noble ye realm togither parliament london liued end therof great fortunate chaunces hapnedtitus liuius deliuered ciuill diuision hee taken sicknesse languished til appointed houre sickenesse euil disposed people laboured make dissention betweene king prince sonne reason wherof acte youth exercised meanely great recourse people vnto court time aboundant king father king suspected would presume vsurpe crown aliue suspitious iealousie occasion part withdrewe affection singular loue prince noble prince aduertised father iealousie disguised gown blew atten made full small oylet hole euery oylet neeble wherwith made hanging stil threede silke arme ware dogges coller set ful golde tirets also fine gold thus apparelled great companye lordes noble men court came king father time laye westminster coming owne commaundement one hi panye auaunced himselfe tha fire hall notwithstanding greatly ofte desired contrarie lordes great estate king court prince commanded giue lesse occasion mistrust king father himselfe accompanyed king house passed forth king father due salutation desired shewe intent minde secrete manner kyng caused himselfe borne chayre secrete chamber bycause deseased might goe wher presence three foure person king confidence commaunded prince shewe effect minde prince kneeling father saide wordes redoubted lord father time come presence liegman sonne naturall thyngs obay grace soueraigne lord father whereas vnderstand yee haue suspect behauiour grace yee feare would vsurpe crowne againste pleasure highnesse co uersation youre grace knoweth yee feare man estate soeuer duetie endaungering life punishe person therby race sore hearte howe muche rather oughte suffer death bring grace feare yee haue naturall sonne liegeman intente haue thys daye confession receyuing sacramente prepared selfe therefore moste redoubted lorde father beseeche honour god easing youre harte heretofore knee slea dagger worde wyth reuerence deliuered king hys dagger saying lorde father lyfe desirous mee woulde liue one daye shoulde displeasure couet much life doe pleasure welfare thus presence lordes tofore god daye iudgemente clearelye forgiue deathe wordes prince king taken compassion hearte cast dagger imbracing prince kissed effusion teares saide vnto right deare hartily beloued sonne trueth partly suspecte perceyue vndeserued partie seeing humilitie faithfulnesse shall neyther slay henceforth haue mistrust report shall made vnto thereof assure vpon mine honor thus great wisedome wrongfull imagination father hate vtterly auoyded hymselfe restored king former grace fauour thys reported earle ormonde translatour myne author titus liuius king gaue sonne prince diuerse notable doctrine insignments among eruditios one king lying grieuously diseased called prince sonne sayd vnto sonne feare sor departure life discord shal grow arise betweene thee thy brother thomas duke cla ence whereby realme may brought destruction miserie knowe greate stomacke courage wherefore feare throughe high mynde wyll make enterprise thee intending vsurpe vpon thee whiche knowe thy stomacke maye abyde tasily dreade hereof ofte remembraunce soare repente euer charged selfe wyth crowne realme wordes king prince aunsweared thus righte redoubted lorde father pleasure god grace shall long continue v rule v god haue prouided euer shall succeede thys realme shall honour loue brethre aboue menne long true faythfull obediente theyr soueraigne lord anye fortune conspyre rebell againste mee assure shall soone execute iustice vppon one shall vpon worst simplest person within realme kyng hearing thys aunsweare therewith maruellouslye reioyced hys mynde sayde deare wel beloued sonne wyth thys aunswere thou haste deliuered greate ponderous agonye beseeche thee vppon blessing charge thee like thou haste sayde thou minister iustice equally wise suffer oppressed long call vpon thee justice redresse oppression indifferently wythout delay perswasion flatterer bee partiall suche vse haue handes replenished wyth gyftes deferre justice vntill morrowe thou mayste doe iustice thys daye leaste peraduenture god doe justice thee meane tyme take thee thyne authoritye remember wealth thy body thy soule thy realme resteth execution justice doe thy justice thou called tyraunte vse thy selfe meanely betwixte justice mercie thing belong thee party iustice truely extreamely co solation thy poore subiects suffer iniuries punition extortioner doer oppressios therby may take example thus thou shalt obtayne fauour god loue fear thy subiectes therefore also thou shalte haue thy realme tranquillitye reste whiche shal bee occasion greate prosperitie wythin thy realme whyche englishman naturally desyre long haue wealthe ryches long shalte thou haue obeysaunce bee poore bee alwayes readye euerye motion make insurrection causeth rebel agaynst theyr soueraygne lorde nature suche rather feare losing theyr good worldly substaunce ieoparding theyr liues thou thus keepe subiection mixed loue feare thou shalte haue moste peaceable fertyle countrey moste louyng faythfull manlye people worlde whyche shall small feare thyne aduersaries sonne shall please god call waye decrede euerye worldely creature thee sonne heyre muste leaue crowne realme whyche aduise thee take vaynelye manne elate pryde reioyced worldlye honour thinke thou arte oppressed wyth charge puruie euerie person wythin realme exalted vaine honoure worlde thou shalt exalted crowne wealthe conseruation realme thy singular commoditie auaile sonne thou shalte minister thy realme keepe tranquilitie defende like harte myddest bodye principall chiefe thyng bodye seruesh couet desire thyng moste necessarie euerye thy member sonne thou shalte amongst thy people chiefe principall minister imagine acquire thyngs maye moste beneficiall thy people shall obediente thee ayde succoure thee al thing accomplishe thy commaundemets like thy member laboure euerye one theyr office acquire get thing hearte desireth thy hearte force impotent without ayde thy member without thy people thy raygne nothing sonne thou shalt feare dread god aboue thing thou shalt loue honour worship wt thy hearte thou shalte attribute ascribe hym thing wherein thou seest thy selfe well fortunate ee victorye thyne enymies loue thy friendes obedience thy subiectes strength actiuenesse body honor rich fruitefull generation thing whatsoeuer chanceth thy pleasure thou shalt imagine thing shoulde fortune thee thyne acte thy desert thou shalte thinke cometh goodnesse lord thus yu shalt thine heart prayse honour thanke god hys benefit giueth vnto thee thy selfe eschew al vaineglorie elation heart following holesome counsell psalmist sayeth non nobis domine non nobis sed nominituo dagloria say vnto v lord vnto v thy holy name giuen laude praise many admonishment doctrine victorious king gaue vnto noble prince sonne effect followed death father whereby obtained grace lorde attaine gret victory many glorious incredible conquest helpe succour lord whereof neuer destitute king father
