normandy whiche betwixte hereflete imflete whose comming city state th partes aduertised striken great feare king duke clarence glocester breethren duke yorke unkle earles baron knightes gentleman souldiours tooke land without resistance king forthwith falling ground vpon knee deuoutely prayde god honor would giue iustice enimies landing host sixe thousande speares xxiiij thousand footemen besides gunner enginars artificer labourer whome king great abundance king gaue diuers gentleman order oftitus liuius knighthoode assigned bearing standarts banner knew great strength prowesse thing set good order array king host ascended toppe high hill nigh rested next day sixteenth day august duke clarence leader foreward good ordinance entred iourney towarde towne called herefleete distant kedecamp scarcely three league lodged host field towne king comming lodged himselfe nigh first warde farre towne earle suffolke michaell poole chiefetayne rereward lodged side towne noble men conduct two wing lodged one right left forthwith sent towne men armes great number see scituation thereof shortly returned great pray cattell enformed king demaundes hereflete key see normandy scituate enguerant description herefleete vpon sea side riuer seene betwixte two hilles middle thereof runneth riuer whiche farre towne entreth seane thence riuers one descende sea great goodly hauen belonging towne hauen garnished defence two faire strong tower hauen right great nauie shippes may ride safetie inhabitant towne enclose kepe within towne course foresayd riuer sluces may right well riuer riseth without towne high forecloseth entry walles man may approch towne part towne also defended high thicke walles tower also enuironed broade deepe ditch towne also belongeth two gate entry one called calturances mostrouillier towne besides inhabitant thereof defence foure hundred men armes deputed garrison amongst whome lord lord discouteuile chiefe captayne towne lord blanuile lord haqueuile lord harmanuile lord eancourt lord gaillard bos diuers lord men expert warre king commanding duke clarence asseege towne endeuouredtitus liuius conuey people ouer riuer passage whereof great skirmish inhabitant towne last aduersaries put flight recoyled within walles duke conuayde ouer riuer ward company bycause riuer deuided king camp duke ordeyned ready sure passage ouer riuer betwixt campes keeping whereof certayne gentleman appoynted theyr enimies myghte endomage neyther water lande meane time befell great misaduenture theenguerant frenchman beseeged gonnepouder shotte sent vnto french king encountred vpon sea englishman taken great displeasure domage king gaue charge fielde brothertitus liuius humfrey duke glocester side riuer king lay ye duke yorke high connestable england lodged band euery man placed ye towne streightly asseeged entry issue towne stopped ye towne dispaire haue succour realme france many engins reysed english short time haue bin destruction walles towne sooner stopped riuer towne within wherby water gathered reised without towne betwixt king clarence semblance little sea caused englishman withdraw gonne engins whereby time walles saued king caused toenguerant made vnder water three great mine vnto walles towne like maner bin cause ruine inhabitant countermined letted purpose inhabitant town perceyuingtitus liuius themselues thus streightly asseeged well land sea conuayde shippes within haue bound togither cheynes two tower made defence hauen put certaine garrison armed men oftentimes attempted inuade king nauie time shippes beaten constreyned recule still within hauen last captaynes inhabitant considering skirmish well vpon land vpon sea gained nothing tooke appointment king rescued frenchman within certayne dayes limited shoulde delyuer hys handes towne thirtie person greatest noble within towne suche king woulde desire bee ordered king pleasure residue well menne warre inhabitantes towne without armoure leauing behynde theyr goodes shoulde freely goe woulde suretie whyche appoyntemente bee kepte deliuered vnto king twelue greatest personage pledge captaynes inhabitant towne seeing day appoyntment approch themselues vtterly desperate succour people ordeyned perfourme couenant day prefixed whiche xxij september day came sir lionell braquemont gouernour towne vnto king kneeling sayd victorious prince beholde heere keyes towne promis yeeld vnto towne selfe companie brought king lord coteuile lord gangcourt number thirtie residue well souldioures inhabitant suffered vnarmed depart king constitute captayne towne sir thomas beawford earle dorset hys unkle whome also committed two thousand souldiers chosen men host considering winter drew also losse men reason flix reigning amongst infirmitie died michaell poole earle suffolke bishop norwich theenguerat lord beawmont others common number two thousand aboue king henry created sonne michaell poole earle suffolke liued long king henry remayned harefleete fifteene dayes ye deliuerie towne tower departed thence towards caleis whereof histitus liuius enimies aduertised also way intended passe people countrey city townes maruellouslie oppressed feare wherefore hasted defensible place apt warre tooke horsses assembled togither great number small companie footemen might oppressed englishman king host kept easie pace without making hast approched towne ewe enimies assayled fieldes great force noyse party foughten sore vigorouslyenguerant frenchman reculed towne good suretie thence king departed came passage riuer frenchman call blankhestoke blanch tache passage attitus liuius comming vnto fixed sharp stake enimies could passe constreyned go farther seeking passage vntill came directly haue citie amiens castell gorby left side sayde citie began new fight soone forced english returne citie agayne xix october king passed riuer passage vienna bethewcourt wente lodge mouchelegach fro whence aduanced towardes riuer miramont meane time french king duke guyen sonne dolphin purposing resist englishman came roane whence sent three heraults king england giue vnderstanding escape without battayle vnto whome sayde king answered thing done pleasure god keepe right way towardes caleis aduersaries attempt disturbe v oure iourney thinke shall without owne great danger perill thence king henry remouedenguerant uillage called forceuile aduancing host towardes riuer miramont next day passed cheue king lodged night bonyers lestaillon next day king remoued vnto bangy thetitus liuius next day late night king came uillage named agencourt enguerant sayeth masencelles lodged distant french host space two hundred fiftie space frenchman fixed bannersenguerant standerts banner royall whereof connestable conduct field deuised chosen countie paule groud agencourt whiche day following englishman battell agencourt titus liuius passe go caleis xxv day october king england morning earely set forth host array commanded horsses carriage shoulde left uillage lodged order field thus middle battell whereof king conductor set midst field directly middle battell aduersaries right side first battell therewith right wing left side last battell left wing battayles ioyning nigh togither prouidence god proued vnto king defensible place host uillage wherein lodged defended host inuasions backe field wherein defended side two small riuers noble king armed sure right beautifull armour head bright helmet wherevpon set crowne golde repleate pearle pretious stone maruellous rich shield bare armes england france thus armed mounted vpon goodly great horsse hym ledde certayne noble horsses bridle trapper goldsmithes worke vpon also beaten armes england france thus victorious king prepared battell encouraged people field approached hand night cruell battell aduise counsell said duke yorke king giuen commandemet host euery puruey stake sharp end englishman fixed ground field defend oppression horssemen frenchman confidence great multitude people great horsses many great prince lordes leauing behinde souldiers standerts ensignes came towards englishman right great hast bin assured victory battayles englishman large theenguerant field wherein fought would suffer greatly aduantage meanes enimies letted come vpon side backes host frenchman ordeyned battels two sharpe front like vnto two horne alwayes backward broader broader sharp battels set vpon englishman middle ward intending haue runne thorough whole fielde frenchman slayne wounded english archer helpe stake englishman fixed grounde whereby horssemen constreyned returne else runne vpon stake many ouerthrowne wounded many horsses men slayne battell fight encreased maruellously space three houres whych time man taken prisoner innumerable slaine vpon whose dead bodyes followed ouerthrowne slayne thus long cruell battell approched man battell death whome innumerable company slayne victorie remayned englishman spared sley take prisoner frenchman mortall battell noble king england fought enimies famished lion pray receyuing helmet armour many greate stroke last victorie obteyned greate host frenchman slayne taken wounded vanquished forthwith another host frenchman lesse firste supposing englishman weeried prepared themselues begin agayne newe battayle king england seeing second assemble aduersariestitus liuius sente heraults vnto commaunding eyther forthwith come battayle else immediately depart delayed departe came battell already taken prisoner also taken without redemption put death message frenchman heard fearing strength englishman also death themselues prisoner taken heauinesse departed forthwith king england assured victory gaue greatest laude prayse god might battayle slayne french parte duke alaunson barry braban lord helly enguerant lord labret chiefe connestable france archbishop saunce eyght earles hundred mo baron fifteene hundred knightes aboue tenne thousand estate whereof scarcely fifteene hundred fifteene thousand men armes moneth june king henry beseeged noble towne louens compelled within yeelde vpon condition euen saint iohn baptist king xxij june remoued armietitus liuius towards pount large layde seege one side towne middle whereof riuer seene hath course could haue passage ouer riuer lay seege ye side ye bridge without ye town defended strong tower garrison king henry commanded make boates wicker closed beastes skinnes boates fifth july duke clarence hys companie passed ouer secretly great number beseeged side towne bycause riuer seene diuided host whereby eyther part haue neede could come togither riuer king caused made many small square boates wicker aforesayd tyed togither cast riuer made bridge inhabitant garrison perceyued thus enuironed partes agreed king within fifteene dayes deliuered thys seege deliuer king towne castell day come perfourmed promise first bridge ouer riuer seene king subdued power king thus obteyned bridge ouer riuer seene none riuer floud mighte lette iourney hast might entred hys iourney towardes roane citizen hearing approche enimies fearing least shoulde bee lodged suburbes whiche muche larger citie within walles also muche replenished monastery church tower burned made euen grounde citie thirtith day julye thys victorious king approched agaynste whome came citizen theyr garrison men warre parte day continued battell fought sore partes frenche forced seeke succour within walles citie whome theyr recoyle king pursued still citie hee ordered seege maner first king noble company yong hardy men lodged himselfe gate saint hillarie duke clarence power lodged gate caulx duke excester c king lodged people gate ye castel called beanuice erle marshal lodged ye gate called markeuile earle warwicke come castle donfrounte lodged vpon hil strong monasterie saint katherie erles salisburie huntingdon lodging ther vpon side riuer seene vpon enimies made many assault bycause riuer seene diuided english hoaste two partes king caused made strong bridge tymber ouer riuer neede shoulde require might haue free passage foote horsse bycause enimies shoulde approch vnto wt ship galley k caused made great cheyne drawen ouer riuer betwixt citie bridge tyme king portingale co king england sent nauie shippes wel manne king ayde king commaunded lye betwixte citie sea enclose citie succour water towne caudbeke fearing daunger time couenaunted king england citie roane taken deliuered king obeysaunte like manner woulde yeelde without assaulte vnder appointed according king xiiij defensible townes castels nigh borderer vnto roane many cruell battayles assaultes citizen fearing legth famished dayly put citie gret number poore people hunger encreasing forced eate horsses dogges cattes rattes mise like thing consumed eaten plague famine entred citie people defaulte reliefe dyed liuing might scarcely burie deade whereby noble citie brought muche miserie lesse maruayle pitiful heare mean time siege roane duke excester besieged citie eneroys also xx august king henrie three maruellous victory normandie first one hundered englishman take iij great lord place called kilbuife put flight three hundred fourescoure person besides second foure hundered enimies entred within suburbes towne ebroicens eleauen englishman chased away toke foure slew twelue tooke horsses thirde enimies would indeede haue taken town called leuers captaine hundered men wente thousand ouercame toke gentleman enimies aboute thys tyme also captaine de la bouche toke towne pontoys paris parson wrotham norffolke whiche haunted new market heath robbed spoyled many concubine brought newgate london dyed prison iohn brian ralphe barton sep iohn parnesse sherifes october iohn brian sherife came one time wapping woose thinking haue eased himselfe beyond saint katherines mill fell thamis dragged vp againe men miller dyed therof within seauennight whose place chosen iohn parnesse william seuenoke grocer october maior william seuenoke newe borne babe founde town called seuenoke kent charitable people christened name william hys father mother could known gaue surname seuenoke broughte vp till able serue bounde prentise citizen london good seruice god indued wisedome wealthe came maior citie vnthankefull god common wealth among charitable workes founded towne seuenoke hadde bin nourished free schole thirteene almes house citizen roane perceyued themselues maruellously afflicted famine shewed also dispaire succour frenchman nowe halfe yeares siege vpon certaine condition deliuered king england citie castle tower abbayes church house citizen captaynes garisons generallye thing within citie whatsoeuer wer xix day januarie dyed within citie sayde defalt victual siege mo xxx thousand people thisanno reg noble king rather relieue oppressed citie ordayned chiefe chamber normandie ordayned hys exchequer hys treasurie hys coynage kepte also dified strong tower behinde castle whilest king ordered businesse roane sente diuerse lordes strong puissaunce people receyue castelles townes borderyng vppon roane amongst duke clarence short tyme redused king mightie castell galiarde towne vernon towne naunte castall bandmounte manye strong place holdes earle salisburie wyth garrison hym assigned tooke town hounslowe towne moun iour de villers towne ewe towne gurney newe castle generallye place part yere queene iane king stepmother de amed certaine person wicked practice witch craft deuised counsell dolph doctour diuinitie hir confessor ing hir seruaunts put hir committed custody iohn wellam appoynted nine seruaunts attend hir brought hir vnto castell pemsey gouerned vnder prouidence frier randolph sent tower length weete anno fifte june slaine parson tower falling wordes queene ioane deliuered kyng henry sente brother humfrey duke gloucester accompanyed wyth earle marshall greate power armed men laye siege afore towne castell yuory town many assa t battayles duke tooke force castel thereof yelded til thirteenth may king also sent earle huntington wyth power maunt towne pontois taken might haue sure easie passage paris whyche sent entry night come nygh vnto pontois wood lefte horse done darkenesse night went foote ditch towne whych drye parte lay bank ditch ladder handes ready scale walles time shoulde serue residue hyd uines might ready enter town opening gate breake daye towne changed watche whych change e lefte without watch time englishman seeyng time accomplishe intent aysed ladder scaled walles meanes entred towne forthwyth brake gate made entry reste company whiche garrison town perceyued amazed turned themselues flight long armed assayled enimies englishman great auayle earle huntingdon wt company set spurres theyr horsses hasted succour first company whereby frenchman al discouraged dispaire saue towne sight newe rescue came englishman leauing behinde rich substaunce endeanoured themselues escape flighte towne pointois auoyded frenchmenne lefte free english enterprise thus atchieued king company came towne pointois aboade certaine time whence sent duke clarence wt chosen power men paris view ye scituation strength thereof citie tarried certaine dayes seene liked none frenche men woulde issue citie fight returned king assertayned al seene xviij august king henrie hoste departed pointois bycause castell bokinvillers bokinvillers yeelded done certaine inhumane cruelty king landes bordered thereabout intente represse theyr malice king lodged far thence sent certaine assault castle inhabitant garrison feared much king men desperate succour yeelded castel good townes castels holdes within great circuite without abyding battaile yeelded king strong mightie town gysors wherof castel much defensible town would submit king wherefore last day august king host toke iourney thyther enclosed towne pauilions tentes betwyxt towne many sharpe battayles cruell assaultes time englishman put frenchman flight wherfore inhabitantes garisons towne castel deliuered king xxiiij september richard whitingham iohn butler september sherifes maior richard whitington mercer october king henrie returned army maunt deuided host three battayles whereof deliuered one duke glocester whome sente subdue towne saint germaines manye battayles assaultes short time yeelded seconde battayle sent castell mount oye like manner yeelded thirde battayle king hys owne perfom went besiege mewlance aboue al strong situation town plenteous ile betwixte two armes sea c notwithstanding inhabitauntes garisons sawe great prouision king yeelded town last day october thence kyng returned againe maunt sente duke excester besiege castle g arde whiche yeelded xx december king henrie kept christmasse citie roane sent earle salisburie take towne fresvey shorte time toke earle marshal earle huntington sente kyng subdue prouince shenon dolphin deputed captaine strong power whiche captaine mette two earles gaue battayle englishman remayned conqueror thus two earles subdued prouince shenon without great resistaunce whilest many victory wer atchieued king continuing citie roane ambassador charles french king duke burgoigne came king treate peace king right honourably recoyued sent french king duke burgoigne hys ambassadours wyth full aucthority conclude long soughte peace principall ambassadour earle warwicke company certaine bishop discrete men accompanyed strong power armed men ambassador first brought duke burgoigne bycause hee next vnto toke iourney vntil came citie troy founde king charles anno reg fraunce queene wife beautifull lady katheren theyr daughter entring communication peace king counsell fraunce waye peace founde betwixt two king aliance say mariage made betwixt victorious k england lady katherin daughter king queene fraunce bicause perceyued many thing mighte done wtout presence king wel apposition seales ye ratifying article peace solemnization ye matrimony also king charles man many yeres condescended k englad certain day amogst limited shoulde come foresayde citie troy wt great armed power woulde whiche day appointed fayled al comunicatio peace shold voyde thing thus concluded set writing erle warwicke wt company returned k englande declared order done contente thing performe appointment prepared iourney called togither knight men armes archer nuber xvj part archer time came would depart toward troy accustomed deuided people three part battayles two wing maner viij day may entred iourny toward troy campaine met duke burgoigne accompanyed manye noble two league wtout town receiued wt gret honor due obser ance victorious king accompanyed bothe english frenchman euery estate degree entred resaid citie troy streetes wherof wtout abyding passed vntil came king place wher k charles queene wife abode comming receyued goodly princely maner king england thus royally receiued due resolution part made king charles queene departed duke burgoine great estate well england fraunce conueyed lodge cittie deuided two p rts wherof one half assigned frenchman burgonians halfe englishman bicause parte assigned englishman suffised receyue within walles great part must lodged suburbes king englande bicause hys people part shoulde haue free concourse togither caused wall part citie lodged cast ground king charles gaue aucthoritie power isabel wife queene phillip duke burgoigne certaine counsell plenarily conclude peace king henrie hym realme france vnder condition shold decreed also proue ratify cofirme oth solemnized parso k charles without fraude al thing obserued vnto sayd k henrie heyres successours sayde king charles heyres successor c xxj may xl yere reigne king charles cathedral churche troy king englande duke clarence brother duke earles bishop realmes othe queene duke burgoigne theyr owne name themselues theyr heyres successours made vnto king heyres successours many present king counsel also parliament bishoppes lord knightes common made fraunce also duke clarence many bishop lord knightes england king henrie matrimonie solemnized betwixt victorious king henrie england excellent glorious lady katherin daughter charles fraunce isabel queene peace confirmed betwixte sayd two king realmes red foloweth king henrie nowforth life kyng charles shall name write himselfe king fraunce shall suffer himselfe people named written death king charles king henry shal king fraunce peaceably hys heyres successours bicause king charles reason infirmitie vnable gouerne common weale king henrie ye life charles shal rule gouerne realme fraunce profit honor king charles king charles al writing shal name king henrie son heyre france life said king charles king henrie shall written henrie king englande heyre regent fraunce like maner hee shal write himselfe thing shall aucthorized vnder owne seale king henrie shall call king charles hys father queene isabel hys mother shall honoure king henrie shal prohibite holde defraude king charles father crowne france issue reuenues thereof queene mother time hi life shall keepe due estate belongeth hi maiestie c diuerse article libertie set downe place final end accomplishing marriage couenants condition ratifyed partes king henrie accompanyed king charles counsel two queenes isabel katherin duke burgoigne departed troy toke iourney paris paris many dayes went laye siege citie sen whiche contrarie whole hoste setled place captaine citizen garisons submitted bodyes citie king hasted monstrean towne toke force xv july went citie melune inuironed strong siege king englande france scotlande duke burgoigne tho wals bauier clarence bedforde excester earles march warwicke huntington somerset c siege co tinued xiiij weekes odde dayes feast mary magdalen feaste saintes without maner euery day conflict sore skirmishe length wante victualles besieged yeelded themselues kyngs englande fraunce whence forsayde kyngs greate parte theyr armye wente paris iohn butler iohn wels september sherifes maior william cambridge grocer october king henrie kept hys christmasse citie paris castle saint anthony holden parliamente went roane therewith hystitus liuius norman englishman helde parliament established sure guarde realme fraunce dutchie normandie passed throughe picardie caleis douer queene landed candlemasse day fourteenth februarie queene katherin crowned westminster vnto king assigned hir dowrie markes also consented deliuerie king scot bin long prisoner englande condition departure englande shall take wi e duke somerset sister niece cardinal winchester anno reg xxij march duke clarence many lord slaine beyond water leire fraunce many lord taken prisoner earle huntington earle somerset principal parliamet westminster ordayned man profer gold payment helde waight wherfore ordayned balance weightes king suppressed french house religious monkes frier like englande bycause thought ill conquest ouer fraunce theyr land giuen henrie sixth monastery colledges learned men parliament demaunded subsidie bishop winchester lent king pounde straine matter king hauing disposed thing order cocerning realme england war scotland leauing englande queene greate power number enguerant thirtye thousande returned fraunce hadde visited king queene fraunce paris tooke castell wex assault heard enimies prepared themselues battaile approched floude loyre aboute whychetitus liuius floud said enimies came man wherfore kyng ledde hoste laye siege city sen commonlye called king new town whiche towne lacke victualles yeelded themselues town king iohn mortimer brake foorthe tower london beyng afterwards taken hee drawen hanged richarde gosselin william weston septemb sherifes maior sir robert chicheley grocer october syr robert chicheley deceased anno willed testament vppon mindday competent dinner ordained pore men housholders citie twenty pounde mony distributed amongest whyche euery man two penny also brother william chicheley alderman london gaue liberally almes house founded brother henrie chicheley archebyshop canterbury higham ferrers nothamptonshire whych towne borne moneth october king henry deliueredti u liuius citie paris annoyaunces h ste went be ege citie meaulx brye whych city nigh adioyning place called market meaulx betwixt two place floweth riuer marne whiche also enuironeth bothe place thys citie besieged winter wherein manye greate stormes flouds raine king host often annoyed huger colde sixth december lady katherine queen englande broughte forth hir firste begotten sonne castell windsore name gyuen henry receyued hym fonte iohn duke bedford hys vncle lord warden england henrie king vncle b winchester iaquelyn dutch holland remained england henry archbishop canterburie office baptisme moneth februarie knight garison principall citie mealx perceyuing sommer comming shoulde cause siege light lesse painefull englishman difficil vnto themselues departed citie wente thatanno reg place called market mealx defensible holde whose departing comon people hauing none ability resist king power yeelded themselues citie king moneth may king sore beaten forsayd market meaulx constrayned frenchman besieged condescende vnto certaine couenauntes deliuer place vnto shortly deliuered king towne orepy valois castle pier pountmeralaw offemout many others rendering townes castle king returned paris moneth aprill katherin queene englande shipped hampton sayled ouer fraunce strong power vnder conducte iohn duke bedforde king brother humfrey duke glocester appointed warden england duke bedfordes place whe comming queene katherin knowne kyng henry hir husband charles king france king queene fraunce accompanyed many great lordes estate well englande fraunce went meete hir boy de viscenne wher ioyfully receyued bin angell sente god xxx day may two king englande fraunce theyr queenes departed bois de viscenne went paris king england queen lodged castell lowre king france queene lodged pallace saint paule king henrie hearing dolphen great power besieged towne guisney determined goe himselfe raysing siege came town corbeil senlis waxed sicke hee constrayned tarry send brother duke bedforde rescue cosney dolphin raysed hys siege departed thence king henrie disease increasing departed life castell called boyes de visceme far paris last august yeare raigned nine yeares fiue monethes odde dayes present death king charles fraunce two queenes death prudent king disposed guarde yong prince sonne defence realme englande hys brother humfrey duke glocester custodie body yong prince king committed vncle duke excester reuenues dutchie normandie bequethed brother iohn duke bedforde gouernaunce dutchy realme france life time reedified royall manour called shine nowe richmount hee founded two monastery vpon thamis farre richmount one carthusian whiche named bethlem religious men woman saint bridget named sion founded gartar principal kyng armes englishman also brotherheade sainte gyles without creple gate london shortlye hys departing bowel enterred church sainte de fosse corp well enbaulmed seared closed leade accompanyed lordsenguerant estate common england presente also many lord great estate well france normandie burgondie picardie brought greate honour paris set churche ladie done right solemne exequies distributio mony great almes poore thence broughte roane aboade long thing necessarie prepared conueyaunce deade king englande hys body layde chariot whiche drawen foure great horsses aboue dead corpes layde figure made boyled hydes leather representing person nyghe semblaunce could deuised painted curiously similitude liuing creature vpon whose heade set emperiall diadem golde precious stone right hand helde scepter royall lefte hand ball gold manner adorned figure layde bedde sayde chariot hys vnsage vncouered toward heauens couerture hys bedde red silke beaten golde besides body shoulde passe anye good town canapie maruaylous great value borne ouer chariot men great worshippe manner accompanyed king scottes prince lordes knightes hys house broughte roane abeuile corpse set churche sainte offr ne abuile broughte hedin thence menstreull bulloigne caleis thys iourney many men chariot clothed al white bare theyr handes torch burning followed al housholde seruauntes blacke came prince lordes estate kyngs bloud adorned vesture mourning thys sayde corpse distaunce two englishe myles followed queene englande righte honourably accompanyed thys manner entred caleis whence fewe dayes departed continued theyr iourneys water lande vntyll came london arriued tenth nouember conuaied london bridge cheap cathedrall churche saint paule vppon couering moste foure horsses conuayed chariot wer imbrodered auntient armes englad vpon couerture seconde horsse armes england fraunce one shielde quarterly vppon couerture thirde horsse imbrodered armes fraunce without maner difference fourth horsse armes king arthur exequies solemnized saint paules church london hee brought thece enterred abbay saint peter westminster amongst hys noble auncestoures thus thys victorious renoumed kyng entred way decreed euery creature floure lustie time hys age witte sixe thirtie yeares olde p king henry windsor henrie sixth infant eight moneths old beganneanno reg titus liuius raigne last august yeare continuing time youth gouernance realme committed ye duke glocester gard person duke excester duke bedford giuen regiment france right wisely nobly ruled long liued henry witte nature simple gentle meeke loued better peace warre quietnesse mind businesse world honestie profite rest ase trouble care iniuries euer happened many suffered patiently reputed worthely sent god offence william gastfield robert tatarsale septem sherifes maior william walderne mercer october xxj october charles king france passed world buried denis france ha history loys duke orleance charles le bievv king france dyed bin crowned king yeares greatly beloued people life time therefore called le roy charle le biew ame yet sicknesse part raigne witte woulde strike came neere tooke first citie man shortly bin flanders reduce fleming obedience reason heereof great trouble france bycause neere lignage sought euery one haue chiefe gouernement theyr hand thus dyed realme left miserable state people strange nation gouernoures realme first englishman conquered great parte sought haue rest duke burgoigne many great lordes alied hym sought conquere yong king henry englande claymed king france likewise allhenry king england france money coyned axmes realmes quartered crownes stamped tyme charles money forbidden currant called minte king henry caused peece stamped called salus worth two twentie shilling blans eyghtpence peece place france king henry obeyed money receyued suche armes france england stamped charles duke tourayne dolphin sonne king charles le biew ame clayming right inheritor thedolphin france proclaymed king france realme france france began aduance himselfe burgoignes land connestable scotland accompanied many lord men war k charles side layd seege towne carnens marshall burgoigne assembled men warre raise seege whome went earle salisburie valiant andthe earle salisburie vvan diuers hold france rased come togither fought enimies wan field tooke connestable whose sonne slayne field many k charles men slayne taken number tenne twelue hundred good men warre whiche victorie earle salisburie layde seege montaguillon champeigne continued eyght monethes could haue rendred caused rased throwne downe earle salisburie beseeged castell monnes lengthanno reg yeelded castell also rased bet downe strongest place champaigne repaired king charles nicholas iames thomas wanford septemb sherifes maior duke bedford married duke burgoignes daughter william crowmar draper october time duke burgoigne gaue sister lady anne marriage duke bedford alliance made strong betwixt english burgonians phillip de comines writeth iohn bedford wasphi comi regent france englishman monethly allowace office amounting crownes least also duke burgoigne bedford britein met ye town amiens also earle richmont brother duke briteine many great lordes whiche earle richmont married duke briteines eldest sister margaret sometime wife duke guyen dolphin france three duke fiue sixe dayes togither amiens great friendship reuerence promising perpetuall amitie continue duke briteine returned countrey duke bedford regent france paris burgoigne arras within earle richmont reuolted king charles vpon misliking conceyued duke bedford king charles receyued ioyfully made connestable france time duke bedford caused crotoy beseeged water land foure fiue monethes seege towne castell deliuered duke ordeyned ralph butler bee captayne time duke bedford obeyed regent place vimeu pontieu picardy paris rein chalons troyes vp water loyre feast saint andrew captaynes king charles assembled force le fere nelle tooke night towne campeigne spoyled inhabitant goodes shortly came duke bedford mondidier twelue hundreth fighting requested lord sanenses lay seege campeigne woulde finde men money wage wherevnto graunted fifteene dayes seege deliuered moneth february iames steward yong king scottes taken englishman theking scottes releassed imprisonment eyght yeare king henry fourth remayned england prisoner till time deliuered married saint mary oueryes church southwarke lady iane daughter iohn earle somerset cousin king henry sir iohn mortimer knight drawne tiborne hanged quartered body buryed saint iohns church clarkenwell king henryes people beseeging castell dinry in1424 march normandy within compounded yeeld day assigned englishman fought withall day frenchman wherevpon well king charles duke bedford made great leuies men keepe day appoynted heerewith drew towards yury king charles heard thethe battell vernole perche duke bedford comming towardes puissance counselled draw backe towards vernole perche whome duke bedford followed found armie neere vernole eyther armie sight put themselues order battell englishman made hedge horsse behind battell bycause french shoulde strike among backes frenchman ordered themselues battell array making great battell footemen put floure chiefest men appoynted horssemen set englishman trauerse battayles foote came vpon ioyned sore fight betwixt continuing two houres togither man might iudge way victorie would encline length men king charles began breake englishman began thrust among much discom ted enimies slayne earle dowglas duke turon iames dowglas earle wighton iohn earle boughan uicount nerbon many number tenne thousand sayth fabian fourerobert fabian thousande sayeth mine author frenchman sayeth duke bedford bare himselfe valiantly fighting axe fiercely prayse earles salisburie suffolke gouerned themselues also right valiantly lord torsy lord normandy taken part englishman day turned french hoping englishman shoulde haue lost battell true frenchman would neuer suffer king charles present person battayle thought pitch fielde sent strong towne losse battayle fought seauenteenth august vernole inanno reg perche king charles put great hinderance able puissance giue englishman battayle hauing ynough defende keepe townes fortress duke bedford returned normandy punished many fledde day battayle went paris found duke burgoigne receyued dutch bedforde duke burgoigne enamored vvith countesse salisburie vvhere came great displeasure losse england breach amity betvvixt english burgonions wife sayde duke burgoignes sister right ioyfully made great feast whiche feast also earles salisburie suffolke olde queene france mother king charles many greate estate diuers nation amongst whiche duches bedford holden gallantest lady hir countesse salisburie faire lady duke bedford neuer iusted iusted duke burgoigne goodly amiable personage excellently well whatsoeuer tooke hand especially dansing iusting exceeded countrey feast became desirous countesse salisburie message passed betwixt came earle salisbury eare whereof nothing contented duke therfore sought displeasure afterward feast ended duke burgoigne went countrey burgoigne tooke wife duches neuers bin wife unkle duke neuers hir two child halfe sister duke burbon liued long burgoigne also gaue sister yongest named agnes second cause breach amitle betvvixt england burgoigne marriage vnto charles de barbon earle cleremont duke bedford englishm wroth made suche alliance enimies without accord yeare frenchman repaired castell mouns champaigne bin little destroyd englishman well stuffed victual men began make sore war countrey shortly earle salisburie beseeged messire iohn de luxenburg much castell yeelded bedford wife duches lay parte paris leading pleasant life lady greatly loued lodged ye house tournels eere castel saint anthony made faire building men still made sore warres againste french towards riuer loyre place vpon base normandy toward duchie alanson yeare englande n aime eldest brother king charles liuing notwithstanding thus married duke brabant yet conuayed sir robersart knight brought england duke glocester married sayd duke glocester sheiaqueline married glocester two husbandes aliue brabant glocester thing thought vnreasonable god world church bin four fiue yeares companie duke brabant fallen variance betwixt come henault last aprill began parliament westminster wherein graunted subsedie twelue robert fabian parliament london first subsedie payde pound manner merchandize comming passing realme three shilling tunne wine tearme three yeares holden furthermore enacted merchant stranger set english host within fifteene dayes comming port sale make sale merchandize ereall stranger lodged vvithin english hostes lodged within fortie dayes following make sale brought remayned vnsold sayd fortie dayes end merchandize vnsold forfeyted also stranger caried woolles land pay xliij shilling four penny sacke custome english merchant denisons payde fiue noble c marriage bin solemnized betweene duke glocester iaqueline duches holland aforesaydethe duke glocester goeth holland within moneth duke glocester assembled armie twelue hundred fighting men least englishman taking duches co panie passed ouer caleis streight thence l artois henault making outrage passed duke phillips countreys comming henault many townes obeyed refused likewise noble diuided burgoigne hearing sore offended iniurie done cousin brabant dishonor cousin duch iaqueline euill dealing duke glocester third cause amitie broken betvvixt england burgoigne losse many tovvnes france therefore ayde duke brabant appoynted many captaynes xij c fighting pickards go duke glocester duke brabant man weake complexion therefore counsell brabant ordeyned yonger brother philip earle saint pol chiefe captayne warre duke glocester great armye part noble brabant henalt burgoigne piere de luxenburge earle conuarson neere kinsman leading armie himselfe yong duke burgoigne put men garrison within towne braine countie henault made sore warre countrey earle saint pol conuarson come beseege braine continuing afore twelue dayes within yeelded compounding departe bodyes goodes saued hauing wonne braine destroyde vtterly done tooke field puissance great duke glocester likewise came fielde approched neere togither vauntcurrers skirmished battayle ioyned duke glocester sent heraulte andhumfrey duke glocester chalengeth combate vvith phillip duke burgoigne written duke burgoigne calling traytor disloyall king england france sente men ayde offered combate wherevnto duke burgoine aunswered hee would accept combate denying euer fayled promise duke glocester done great wrong duke brabant haue bereft wife contrarye ordinance god holye church wordes duke vttered duke burgoignes honor gaue lye farre matter went word betwixt day appoynted combate duke burgoigne chose iudge combate emperour almayne duke burgoigne sent duke glocester safeconduct departe safely england prepare himselfe thing necessarie combate wherevpon campes brake vp duke glocester wente mon henalt duches wife tearmed gaue hir vnderstand desirous trie combate duke burgoigne many thing told hir performed within four dayes tooke power returned englad left duches mon smally accopanyed ye people countrey shortly departure duke burgoigne sent lord lilladam towne men receyue iaqueline duches deliuered vnto conueyed hir gaunt duke made great semblance ioy togither promising bee gouerned alwayes aduise goe hir olde husband duke brabant would espied hir time stale away hir countrey holland well receyued many lordes began forthwith mainteyne warre duke philip burgoigne sent duke glocester ayd sente hir thousand fighting men vnder conduct lorde fitzwaters duke burgoigne fearing least iaqueline would deliuer countrey holland possessio glocester assembled power wente holland put coutrey obeysance comming thither iaqueline accompanyed many noble countrey lord fitzwaters woulde haue defended landing notwithstanding al defence could make entred vpo neere ye towne brusseils ioyned battaile burgoigne people englishman hollander taking ye duches iaquelines part fierce battayle side end hollander englishman discomfited dyed place aboue seauen eight hundred besides taken prisoner lord fitzwater hardly escaped battell gote duke burgoigne diuers townes countrey reuolted iaqueline duches dordrecht sericzee many shortly duke burgoigne leauing garrison townes obeyed make resistace duches lay towne gaunt hee returned countrey flanders artoyes prepare abiliments necessary vse combate appoynted betwixt duke glocester duke glocester likewise england made pronision habilimentes furniture duke bedforde brother duke glocester tooke greate paynes make friend also counsell yong king england nothing content variance doubting least might occasion duke burgoigne mighte withdrawe himselfe amitie whereby businesse france hindered duke bedford therefore tooke hys iourney paris caleis englande ende agree saydeanno reg duke tooke duches wife past four fiue hundred men michaelmasse prince portugale came england honorably receyued feasted king uncle william mildred iohn brokell september sherifes maior rob fabian iohn couentry mercer october morrow simon iudes day maior london bin westminster take hys charge asdebate betvveene duke glocester bishop vvinchester custome suche tyme hee holding hys greate dinner hee duke glocester lord protector sent speedie manner hee came hys presence gaue hym commaundement see citie surely watched night following done ye next morrow ix clock certain seruats bishop winchester brother ye said protector would haue entred citie bridge warder keeper thereof kept force commanded wherwith greeuously discontented gathered greater number archer men armes assaulted gate shot meanes warre much common citie shut shoppes spedde thither great number greate bloudshed woulde haue followed wisedome maior alderman stayde matter time archbishop canterbury prince portugale tooke great labour vpon pacifie variance betwixt two breethren protector bishop muche rode betweene eyght time ere might bring reasonable conformitie lastly agreed stande rule duke bedford regent france would assigne wherevpon citie set quiet bishop winchester wrote letter duke bedford lord regent followeth right high mighty prince right noble one leuest earthly lorde recommende vnto grace heart ye desire welfare king soueraigne lorde realies england france owne weale hast hither troth ye tarrie long shall put land ieoperdy field brother yee haue heere god make good man wisedome knoweth well profite france standeth welfare england written london last october tenth day january next ensuing sayde duke bedford wyth hys wife came vnto london also came said bishop winchester maior citizen receyued merton ayde hym citie vnto westminster lodged king pallace bishop winchester lodged within abbot lodging morrow following maior presented regente paire basin siluer ouergilt thousande marke gold xxj february began great counsayle saint albons reiorned northampton due conclusion mighte made the1426 parliament leycester xxv march called parliamente leycester endured till xv day june called parliamente battes bycause men forbidden bring sword weapon brought great battes staues neckes whe weapon inhibited tooke stone plomets leade parliament variance betwixt two lord debated much duke glocester put bill complaynt bishop conteyning sixe article article bishop sufficiently aunswered finally counsell lord regent matter variance betweene sayd two lordes put examination iudgemente assistance lordes parliamente henry archbishop canterburie thomas duke excester iohn duke norffolke thomas bishop durham philip bishop worcester iohn bishop bath dome haue followed vnreasonable beast rored drew townes hideous noyse also foules ayre likewise cryed suche worke god time call people repentance iohn arnold iohn higham september sherifes maior vvardes london discharged fifteenes iohn reynwell fishmonger october iohn reynwell maior london gaue certayne land tenement citie london whiche citie bound pay euer fifteenes shall graunted king passe daye thomas beawford duke excester deceassed greenewich buryed sainte edmonds burie suffolke purification lady duke bedford regent france wife familie passed sea vnto caleis picardy france ere yeare vnseasonable weathering reyned part continually easter michaelmasse yeare duke alanson taken prisoner battayle vernole perch deliuered raunsome scuttes golde whiche wasrob gagwin markes sterling diuers strong holdes adioyning citie forced bren great part suburbes one day ye saydanno reg earle salisburie thomas mountagew rested bay window gunne leuelled citie tosquashed face whereof dyed iiij rate rate like euery benefice lowest highest inhabitant city boroughes euery value xx aboue houshold stuffe apparell wife pay foure penny rate vnto richest corpus christi day briton good widdow honest woman cherished brought vp almesmurther quitte vvith murther dwelling white chappell parish without aldgate murthered sayd woman night sleeping hir bedde conuayde iewels stuffe might carrie pursued vpon feare tooke churche foresware king land connestables caused brought london intended haue conuayde westward soone come parish committed murther wiues cast vpon much filth ordure streeteanno reg notwithstanding resistance made connestables slew hand first september cardinall winchester cardinall vvinchester returned beyonde sea mette maior breethren certaine citizen london passed sea intending haue made warre vppon inhabited countrey prage neede men regente fraunce cardinall chaunged purpose taryed season regent william ruffe ralph holland september sherifes maior william castfielde mercer october sixth nouember king henrie age ninteene yeares solempnely crowned saincte peter churche westminster whose coronation made xxxvj knightes bath solemnization churche finished honorable feaste greate hall westminster kept wherof yee may reade large discourse robert fabian whiche feaste great preparation made king iourney france xxiiij januarie battayle done smithfielde within listes king betweene two men feuersham kent iohn vpton appellaunte iohn downe defendaunt long fought kyng toke vp matter forgaue party xxvij day april king toke shipping douer landed day caleis hauing company duke yorke norffolke bishop bath ely rochester earles huntington stafforde warwicke oxforde deuonshire mortaine ewe ormonde barrons lorde boucher beaumond typtoft fitz water roos arundale audley faucobridge gray codner scrop welles whilest kyng remayned caleis manye skirmish fought betweene englishman frenche diuerse partes france frenchman preuayled greatly helpe woman named mayden god lastlye hir companye came towne champaigne end remoue siege layde therevnto duke burgoigne englishe captaines xxiij maye gaue battaile englishman fought long time ende manhoode burgonian knight named sir iohn luxemborough taken aliue hir company distressed conuayed citie roane kept season fained hir selfe child ye contrarie known condened brent king henrie small iorneyes fraunce came paris wher honorably receiued ye citizes taken theyr soueraigne lord king while heerobert gagwine remayned sayeth gagwine frenchman wan many hold englishman burgonians country bry third august dyed countesse vrmonde buried saint thomas acre london anno reg sherifes maior walter chertesey robert large september nicholas wotton draper october soone easter lord protector warned assembly certaine lewde person assembled abington wherefore sent thyther certaine person also rode thyther himselfe arrested baylye towne named william mandeuil weauer whiche appointed captain named iack sharpe wigmers lande wale examined confessed ment haue done many mischiefes especially priest would haue made head cheape sheep head say three peny write ten penny manye complyces taken sent dyuarse prison captaine drawne hanged headed abingdon head sent london set bridge fautors executed diuerse place countreys terror xiij julye richarde russel woollman drawn hanged quartered wold haue made duke earles pleasure richard robsert lord bourcher deceased buried westminster king henrie remayning still fraunce earle arundale accompanyed two thousand englishman sente certaine company vnto towne called bealmount prouoke frenchman issue towne smal copany boyssycant sentrales captain behelde souldiours sped forth take sayd englishman little little gaue backe till tolled frenchman good space towne sette vpon stoute courage helde hand tyll earle company rescued betwixt cruell fighte end frenchman chased sayd sentrayle many footman sayde town slaine iohn aderle stephen browne september sherifes maior iohn wels grocer october thys iohn welles maior london caused conduite commonlye called standarde cheape bee builded seauenth day december kyng henrie crowned paris cardinall winchester coronation presente duke burgoigne duke bedforde regente diuerse noble france solemnitie thys feaste ended king departed paris came roane helde hys christmasse done returned caleis hadde soiourned season tooke shipping returned england landed douer eleauenth februarie rydyng towarde london mette barham downe betwixte douer canterburie greate companye gentles common kent cladde liuerie wyth redde hood whiche accompanyed hym tyll came blacke heath one twentith day february mette maior london rode gowne crimson ueluet alderman scarlet citizen al white gownes red hoodes diuerse work cognisance brodered vpo sleeues ye facultie misteries craft due obeysace saluting king rode towards ye city king come bridge deuised mightie giaunt standing sworde drawen hande hauing written certaine speech metre great reioycing welcoming king citie middest bridge diuerse place citie diuerse faire sumptuous pageant replenished goodly beautifull personage order speech whereof sette downe robert fabian hys cronicle thus coueyed pallace westminster maior citizen returned london xxiitj day februarie maior alderman yode king presented hampire golde and1433 therin thousand pound noble yeare reason souldiours caleis restraynte made woolles content wage wherefore regente fraunce came downe thyther easter weeke time many souldiours wer arrested rode tirwine hauing long buried lady anne late wife sister duke burgoigne married earles daughter saint paule shortly returned caleis caused foure souldiours beheaded xj june souldiours banished towne besides banished tyme vpon midsommer euen lord drowned sea much harmes done tempest1433 parliament eight day july king henrie began parliament westminster continued till lammas adiourned vntil saint edward tide yere southweast appeared blasyng kiriel captaines slewe many englishman toke many prisoner soone sayde captaines strength taken paris layde strong siege aboute saint denis finally agreed deliuer town englishman thys season also earle time manfully gagwine sayeth saide hirus companye issued castell gaue vnto sayde earle cruel skirmish sayde earle receiued deadly wound dyed shortly afteranno reg sherifes maior thomas barnewel simon eyre september roger otley grocer october great froste lasted fiue andgreat frost twentith noueber vnto tenth februarie thamis frozen merchandice came thamis mouth landed carried kent london pope eugeny fourth cardinalles14 long laboure coulde make peace betwixte king henry england france charles also named king fraunce length made peace betwixte said charles philip duke burgoigne whereby said duke burgoigne became vtter enimy king england soone said duke beganne order lillie golden fleece ordayned certaine knightes order made thervnto many statuts wherof like vnto statute garter fourteenth daye september roan normandy dyed noble prince iohn duke bedforde regent fraunce great solemnitie ryed within churche ir dame itieanno reg sherifes maior thomas catworth robert clopton septemb henry frowike mercer october king charles fraunce recouered citie paris newyeares tide wanne towne harflewe and1436 sainct denis manye townes holdes expellyng murdering englishe people greate number ninteenth daye julye duke burgoigne wyth great multitude burgonians flemmings appearedcaleis besieged caleis pight pauilions tentes season lieutenaunt caleis sir iohn ratclife knight castell lieutenant baron dudley siege endured three weekes whiche season many knightlye actes done exercised partes second day august duke glocester protectourrobert fub englande sayles write landed caleis entended vppon thirde day following haue issued towne haue gyuen battel flemmings testifyeth englishe writer soone duke burgoigne ware great power lorde protector toke ordinaunce might lightly carrye cumberous left behind duke host thus fledde lorde protectour people followed hym countrey space eleauen dayes whiche season brente two townes popering bell returned caleis england yeare castel towne instrumentes negromancye saye chayre paynted wherein hee wonte sitte vpon foure corner chayre stoode foure swordes vppon euerye sworde image copper hangyng wyth manye instrumentes hee stoode highe reforme wrong done realme withstand malice destroyer common weale amend defaultes chiefe counsellers king shewed vnto article complaint touching misgouernment realm wherein nothing conteined seemed reasonable wherof copie sent parliament holden time westminster also one byll requestes made thing reformed haue answere thereof agayne none bill article intituled complaint common kent cause assembly blackheath inprimis openly noysed kent shoulde destroyed royall power made wylde forest death duke suffolke common kent thereof neuer guiltie item king styrred lyue onely common men haue reuenues crown hath caused pouertie excellencie great paymentes people nowe late king graunted parliament item lordes royall bloud put dayly presence meane person lower nature exalted made chiefe priuie counsell stoppeth matter wronges done realme excellent audience may redressed lawe bribe giftes messenger handes sayde counsell item people realme payde debt owing stuffe purueyaunce taken vse king housholde vndoyng sayde people poore common realme item king meniall seruauntes housholde person asken dayly good land empeached indited treason king graunteth anon ere endaungered conuict canseth receyuers thereof enforge labour meanes applyed death people appeached indited subtyl meanes couetyse sayde grauntes people empeached indited though vntrue may committed lawe deliueraunce helde stil prison vttermost vndoyng destruction couetyse good item though diuers poore people common realme haue neuer great right trueth perfite tytle theyr lande yet vntrue clayme enfeffement made vnto diuers state gentles king meniall seruauntes maintenaunces againste ryghte true owner dare holde clayme pursue right item noysed common voyces king landes fraunce bene aliened put awaye crowne lordes people destroyed vntrue meanes treason desyred enquiry thorough realme bee made howe suche traytors may found guiltie haue execution lawe without pardon example item collector xv pennie kent greatly vexed hurte paying great summes money eschequere sue writ called quorum nomina allowaunce baron port nowe desyred hereafter lieu collector baron aforesaide may sue ease owne costes item sherifes undersherifes let ferme office bayliwikes taking great suertie therfore causeth extortion done baylifes people item simple poore people vse hunting greatly oppressed inditements fained done saide sherifes undersherifes baylifs assent cause encrease paying said ferme item returne name enquests writing diuers courtes kinges somoned warned people dayly leese great sumes money welny vttermost vndoyng make leuie amercementes called greene waxe summes money founde due recorde king bookes item minister courte douer kent vexe arest diuers people shire castle warde passing band libertie vsed olde time diuers subtile vntrue meanes action falselye fained taking great see lust great hurt people shire kent item people saide shire kent may haue free election chosing knight shire letter bene sent diuers estate great ruler country enbraceth tenaunts people force choose person common item knightes shire chose king collector indifferetly without bribe taking haue set late diuers person notifying collector wherevpon giftes bribe taken collector office bought sold extortionously knightes lust item people sore vexed costes labour called session peace sayd shire appearing fro farthest vttermost part west vnto east causeth men v dayes iourney vpon desire saide appearaunce deuided two partes one part appeare one place part place releuing greeuaunce intollerable labour vexation said people requestes captaine great assemble kent inprimis desireth captaine common welfare soueraigne lord king al true lord spirituall temporall desiring saide soueraigne lorde al true lordes counsell take al demaines may raigne like king royall according borne true christian king annoynted saye contrarye liue die quarrell true liege men item desireth said captaine auoide al false progenie affinitie duke suffolke whiche beene openlye knowne punished custome lawe land take noble person true lordes royal bloud realme say high mightie prince ye duke af yorke late exiled saide soueraigne lordes presence motion stirring traiterous false disposed duke suffolke affinitie mightie prince duke excester buckingham norfolke earles baron land shal richest king christen item desireth said captaine common punishment vpon false traitor contriued imagined death high mightful excellent prince duke glocester whiche much rehearse ye duke proclaimed traitor upon quarrell purpose liue die vpon false item duke excester holy father cardinal noble prince duke warwike also realme fraunce dutchie normandie gascoyne gwi anioy mayne deliuered lost meanes sayd traytors true lord knight esquiers many good yoman lost sold ere wet ye great pitie heare great greeuous losse soueraigne lorde realme item desireth sayd captayne common extortion vsed dayly among common people might layde downe say greene waxe falsely vsed perpetuall destruction king true common kent also king bench greefefull shire kent without prouision soueraigne lord true counsell also taking wheate graynes beefe mutton victual importable sayde common without briefe prouision saide soueraigne lorde true counsell may longer beare also vnto statute laborer great extortioner say false traytors slegge crowmer isle robert este bylles counsell well perused onely disalowe condemne author proude presumptuons also perswaded king rather suppresse rebel force fayre promise whervpon king remoued westminster vnto greenewiche whence woulde haue sent certayne lordes powre haue destressed kentishmen men sayde lordes would fight labour amend common weale wherevppon lordes driuen leaue purpose kentishmen cryed lorde say king chamberlayne king committed towre london went king agayne london king henrie vvent kentishmen vvith great povver within ij dayes went kentishmen xv thousand men well prepared warre sayd kentishmen fled night comming wood countrey neere vnto senocke wherevpon king returned againe london sent sir humfrey stafforde knight william stafford brother gentleman follow kentishme finding senock set vppon rebel fought long time ende staffordes slaine many otherking henry povver ouercome people iacke cade thus ouercome staffordes forthwith apparelled knightes apparell refreshed people returned blackeheath pight agayne fielde lay xxix daye june tyll first day july season came vnto archbyshop caunterburie duke buckingham long communication founde ryght discrete aunsweres howbeit coulde cause submit himselfe lay downe people meane king queene hearing increasing rebel also lordes fearingking henrie vvent killingvvorth owne seruaunts least would take captaines part remoued london killingworth leauing citie without ayde except onely lorde scale left keepe towre manly warly man named mathewe gowghe captaine kent thus houering blackeheath bring himselfe fame kept good justice beheaded petie captayne named paris muche offended agaynst ordinaunces established incaptaine kent k ttishmen entred citie london hoste hearing king lordes thus departed drewe neere vnto cittie vppon first july entred borough southwarke beyng wednesday lodged harte myght bee suffered enter cittie vpon day common essex greatrobert fabian number pight fielde vppon playne myles ende vppon seconde day sayde moneth therebels essex pight field myles end maior called common counsell guild hall pur ey withstanding rebel assembly diuers men sundrye opinion thought good sayde rebel receyued cittie otherwise among robert horne stockefishe monger alderman spake sore agaynst woulde haue enter common moued agaynst ceassed till committed ward afternoone v clocke ye captaine people entred bridge cutte rope draw bridge sunder sworde passed citie made sundrye place thereof proclamation king name man payne death shoulde robbe take thing without paying therefore reason whereof wanne harte common done beguile came london stone strake sword said mortimer lorde citie shewing minde maior ordering people returned southwarke abode done people comming going lawfull houres would morrowe ye third july sayd captaine agayne entred citie caused lorde say fette tower guild hall araygned maior king justice robert horne alderman named haue bene likewise araygned wife friendes v hundred markes gat restored libertie lord say desiring might tried peeres rebel forceably taken officer brought ye standard cheape strake head pight pole bare body caused drawne naked horse tayle vpon pauement cheape southwarke sayd captaines inne also squier called crowmer sherife kent wedded ye said lord sayes daughter commaundement captaine brought flete committed thither certaine extortion done office led mile end without london without iudgement head smit lord sayes head borne vpon tj long pole vnto london bridge set vp lorde sayes body quartered daye captaine went vnto house philip malpas draper alderma robbed spo led house taking thence great substance returned southwarke next morowe againe entred citie dyned day parishe saint margaret patyns one cherstis house dyned like vncourteous guest robbed day malpas two robbery althoughe poore people drewe hym parteners spoyle yet honest wealthy commoner cast mynds sequele matter feared least delt lyke manner maior alderman assistaunce worshipful commoner safegarde themselues cittie toke counsell might driue captaine adherent citie performaunce whereof maior sent vnto lorde scale mathew gowghe hauing tower gouernment requiring ayde assistaunce promysed v july captayne southwarke caused manne beheaded day entred cittie night come maior citizen mathew gowghe kept passage bridge defended kentishmen made great force reenter cittie captayne seeyng bickering went harneys assembled people set fiercely vppon citizen draue backe stoupes southwarke bridgefoote vnto drawbridge defending wherof many man drowned slaine among iohn sutton alderman mathewe gowghe squire wale roger hoysand citizen skirmish continued night tyll nyne clocke morrowe sometyme citizen better sometymes euer kept vpon bridge citizen passed neuer much bulwarke bridge foote kentishmen farther drawe bridge thus continuing cruell fighte destruction much people sydes lastly kentishmen putte worst truce agreede certayne houres truce archbyshoppe caunterburie chauncellor england sonte generallcaptaine rebel pardoned pardon captayne selfe people reason wherof company withdrewe little little captayne put pillage good robbed barge sent rochester water himselfe went land woulde haue entred castle quinborow fewe men lefte let purpose wherefore fled wood countrey beside lewes sussex captayne people thus departed long proclamation made diuers place kent sussex southerey might take foresaid captaine aliue dead haue thousand markes trauaile copie writ proclamation king taking sayd cade felowship henricus dei gratia rex angliae franciae dominus hibernia vniuersis singulis custodibus c much one iohn cade borne ireland calleth himselfe iohn mortimer writing calleth himselfe captayne kent iohn cade last yeare tofore dwelling sussex knight called sir thomas dagre slewe woman childe cause tooke greeth churche cause sware king lande iohn cade also sworne frenche parte dwelled hath nowe late time intent enrich selfe robbyng dispoyling king liege men nowe openly knowne bring himselfe great high estate falsely vntruely deceyued many king people vnder colour holy good intentes made assemble king regalitie lawes nought setting king grace pardon grauted onely al king subiectes deceyt haue assembled great reuerence receiued munday last passed assembled withstanding al laboureth newe assemble king people againe intent beareth hand king letter pardon graunted auaileable none effect without authoritie parliament wheras contrarie true openly knowen king grauntes tyme tyme charter pardon lyst manner crime offence generall speciall king therfore willeth commaundeth none subiectes giue fayth credence said fals information sayde false raylor accompany wise comfort sustaine victuall thing whosoeuer king subiectes may take shall take euer taketh bringeth quicke dead king cousel shal haue thousand markes labour truely payde without faile delaye prouision king counsell euer taketh day forth accompany shal haue v marke reward truely paide maner forme aboue saide ouer commaunding constable minister officer said shire none paine death take vpo execute comandement word writing sent made vnto said cade calling himselfe mortimer captaine rere people intent arest make arested take vpo bring comaundemet writing word et hoc nullatenus omittatis teste ipso apud westminster x die iulij anno regni proclamationcaptaine kent taken kent done king sent comissioners kent rode caused inquiry made riot cau terbury vitj iudged executed townes kent sussex dane like execution yeare common also diuers partes england sussox salisbury wilshire place didde much harme many person among xxix june william ascoth bishop salisburie sayde masse edington owne tenauntes drawen ye altar albe stole necke toppe hill shamefully murthered free passage shoulde paye vnto french king lvj scu amount fourteene thousand mark sterling also bounde deliuer french king possession townes castels day possession englishman wythin dutchie normandie
