auringham despight al french king power laide sea lande helde full moneth lacke rescue gaue vppe appoyntmentan reg matthew phillip christopher warton sep sherifes maior william gregorie skinner october sixteenth februarie king henrie accompanyed duke somerset many lord tooke towardes march wale muche credibly informed duke yorke assisted wyth diuerse lordes men name partes gathered strong power people entring land helde iourney towarde whe duke witting king greate power returned way taken king hoste hasted towardes london receyued knowledge citie might receyued went ouer kingstone bridge kent vpon brent heath neare vnto dertforde pight fielde wherof king hauing knowledge sped lastly came vnto blacke heath pighte hys fielde hostes thus embattelled mediation peace made betweene furtheraunce whereof duke sente bishop winchester ely earles salisburie warwicke answered duke none company entended hurt king person hys cou sayle beyng louers common wealth hys land intent purpose remoue king fewe euill disposed person whose meanes common people greeuously oppressed communaltie greatlye impouerished whome named duke somerset principal c vnderstande duke meaning forcible entring realme himselfe pretended may appeare certaine letter written king also king aunsweares whiche thinke good set downe finde recorded please highnesse coceiue sith departingrichard duke yorke letter king rie realm commandement seruice land ireland haue bin informed diuerse language hath bene sayde moste excellente estate whiche shoulde sounde dishonour reproch charge person howe aye haue bene euer true liegeman seruaunt man wyll dare say contrarie charge otherwise beseech rightwisenesse call high presence wyll declare discharge true knighte ought doe doubt shall beseech punishe poorest man lande hee bee founde vntrue suggestion information beeseech highnesse punished desert example please youre excellence knowe well departyng thys realme goe lande irelande full noble seruice sith certaine person haue lyne awayte hearken vppon syr iohn talbot knighte castell holte syr thomas stanley knighte cheshire pulforde chester elton worcester brooke gloucester richarde grome chamber beaumarres whyche hadde charge enformed take putte youre castell conway strike heade syr william oldehall knighte haue put prison sir william deuereux knight sir edmond malso knyghte withouten enlarging vntyl time highnesse appointed theyr deliueraunce item tyme purposed haue arriued youre hauen beaumarres haue come youre noble presence declare true man subiecte duetie landing stopped forbarred henrie norres thomas norres william bulkeley william grust bartholmew boulde officer northwales lande haue victuall refreshing mee fellowshippe haue written excellence farre henrie norres deputye chamberlayne northwales sayde vnto hee hadde commaundemente shoulde wise haue landing refreshing lodging men horsse thyng myghte turne worshippe ease puttyng blame vppon william saye usher chamber saying affyrmyng youre intente traytoure informed moreouer certaine letter made delyuered vnto chester shrewesburie place lette myne entrye item aboue wrong iniuries abouesayde done vnto malice wythout cause beyng lande irelande youre honourable seruice certayne commission made dyrecte vnto diuerse person whiche execution satte certayne place jury empaneled charged whiche iniuries certayne person laboured instauntlye haue endited treason intente haue vndone myne issue corrupted bloude openlye publyshed beseeching maiestie royall ryghteousnesse doe examyne matter therevppon doe suche iustice behalfe cause requyreth mine intet fully pursue highnesse conclusio matter coosin haue seene byll yee tooke v late andansvvere king henric duke yorke also vnderstand good huble obedience yee selfe shewe vnto v well worde deede wherfore intente hastily ease suche thing sayde bil leysure might aunswere sayde byll yet let wit cause aforesayde declare intent matter sith long time among people hath bene vpon many straunge language especial anone disordinate vnlawfull slaying bishoppe chester diuerse manye vntrue shipmen sayde maner word estate making manace person yoursayings yee shoulde fetched many thousandes yee take vpon whiche yee neyther oughte doubt yee attempt farre forth sayde person diuerse especiallye remember one wasnes whyche hadde like word v also ther diuerse false people went like language diuerse townes lande whiche subiectes taken duely executed wherefore sente diuerse courtes place hearken take heede manner co myng bin resist comming lande true subiecte yee intente ye lesse estate subiectes none youre seruauntes shoulde haue bin letted warned goodly wise receyued howe peraduenture sodaine comming without certayne warnyng caused oure seruauntes dyd considering cause aboue sayde enditement yee spoke thinke verily holde certaine warning caused seruaunts doe considering cause aboue sayde enditemente yee spoke thinke verylye holde certaine none suche ye maye truely proue person thereaboutes matter shall demeaned case shall require shall know greate displeasure upon thys easing hearte matter declare repute adn tte true aud faythful subiecte faythfull coosin please highnesse tenderly consider greaterichard duke yorke k henrie againe murmur grudging vniuersally realm iustice duely ininistred suche trespasse offende lawes especial endited treason openly noised whereby greate inconueniences haue fallen greate like fall hereafter sayde realme god defende highnesse prouision couenable made due reformation punishment behalfe wherfore humble subiect true leigeman richard duke yorke willing effectuallye desiring suretie prosperitye moste royall person welfare thys noble realme counsell aduertise excellency conuersation good tranquility peaceable rule among subiectes ordain prouide true iustice bee endited openly named wherin offer selfe wil put endeuour execute youre commaundemente premiss punishing suche offendours redresse sayde misrule might power hastie execution hereof like highnesse addresse letter priuie seale writ officer minister doe take arrest suche person noysed endited estate degree condition soeuer committe tower london prison abyde without bayle mayne prise vntil tyme vtterly tryed determined termined course lawes coosin touching bill last put vp v vnderstandeaunsvvere k henrie duke yorke well yee good harte counsayle aduertice v setting vp justice speedy punishing person endited noysed offering seruise bee readie commaundemente sithe manye cause mouing v haue determyned soule stablishe sadde substancial counsell giuing ample aucthoritie power euer afore whiche haue appointed one sithe accustomed sure expedient take conclusion conduct aduise counsell one person hymselfe conseruation obserued greatest beste riche poore libertye uertue effect voyces equall haue therefore determyned wythin selfe sende chauncellour england lord counsel yea al togither within short time ripelye common greate matter whiche communication suche conclusion grace god shal take shal sound pleasure weale v land well matter length agreed king duke somerset shoulde committed warde abyde answere suche article duke yorke would laye vpon promise made kyng duke sawe people kent place came promised strong ynough king part much brake vp fielde first marche yeelded himselfe king dertforde contrarie promise made founde duke somerset chiefe king duke yorke sent london holden partly prisoner streighter shoulde haue bene kepte noysed sir edward earle march sonne sayde duke yorke comming towarde london strong power welchmen whych feared queene counsell duke set full libertie tenth march saide richarde duke yorke made submission toke hys othe true faythfull obedient subiect king henrie sixth king england saint paules church london present king nobilitye saye duke buckingham northampton somerset earles warwicke arundale salisburie shropshire deuonshire wiltshire northumberlande stafford dorset viconnts beaumount welles baron fitz warren sainmounde cobham douglas others bishoppes cardinall archbyshoppe yorke canterburie winchester ely london wordes following richard duke yorke confesse beknowe oughte bee humble subiecte liegeman soueraigne lorde king henrie sixth owe therefore beare fayth trueth soueraigne liege lorde shall doe dayes vnto liues ende shall time wyll assente thing attempted done againste moste noble person euer shall haue knowledge anye suche thing imagined purposed shall speede diligence possible mee make youre hyghenesse shall haue knowledge thereof ouer doe shall possible withstanding lette thereof vttermoste lyfe shall anye thing take vppon agaynste youre royall estate obeysaunce due thereto suffer anye man doe farre forthe shal power let also shall come youre commaundemente whensoeuer shall called humble obeysaunte wise letted sicknesse impotence person cause shal bee thoughte soueraigne lord reasonable shall neuer hereafter take vpon gather row e make assembly people without co maundement licence lawfull defence interpretation declaration lawfull defence shall reporte time highnesse case require peeres thing attempt againste subiects estate degree condition ye soeuer finde selfe wronged agreeued shal sue humblye remedie highnesse proceede course lawes none otherwise sauing mine owne lawfull defence manner aboue saide otherwise haue highnesse hu ble true subiecte oughte haue soueraigne lorde thing aboue sayde promise truely obserue keepe holy euangelistes contayned booke laye hande vpon holye crosse touch blessed sacrament oure lordes bodye shall nowe hys mercye receiue ouer agree wil tyme hereafter grace lord god neuer shall thing attempt waye feate otherwyse againste royall maiestie obeysaunce owe thereto thyng take vppon otherwise aboue expressed tyme forth vnabled helde taken vntrue openly foresworne man vnable manner worship estate degree occupye might wise grow vnto hereafter haue promised sworne proceedeth myne owne desire free volunte constraynyng coaction witnesse thing aboue written richarde duke yorke aboue writ subscribe mine owne hand seale oth also toke westminster couentrey sundry timesanno reg sherifes maior richard lee richard alley september godfrey filding mercer october twelfth day christmas king holding arobert fabian solempne feaste westminster made two bretherne mother side knightes also made edmunde elder earle richemonde iasper yonger earle penbrooke moneth marche witnesseth gagwine towne harflewe wonne frenchman soone citie bayons giuen vppe appointment souldioures shoulde leaue theyr armoure behinde one twentith july iohn talbot earle shrewsburie wyth sonne lorde lisle syr edwarde hull knight slaine besides burdeaux lorde molins taken prisoner deliuered greate raunsome bartholmewe daye wrestling neare vnto clearken well gentleman belonging prior saint iohns made rumour tumulte whiche commaundement maior arrested richard alley one sherifes deliuered paris sergeant suche resistance made partes taking sherife faine craue help maior brother alderman arose game strengthned sherifes rescue said gentleman one named calleis came saint iohns greate strength archer resiste maior fray yeoman saint iohns laine many sore hurte maior himselfe escaped hardly cap smitten head arrowe maior citizen putte flight sente principall newgate toke place til ye game ended time citizen gathered selues greate nuber fetched home neuer maior strongly honorably anno reg yeare king lay longsicke claringdon greate daunger haue ended life thirteenth daye october queene westminster deliuered hir firste sonne named edwarde iohn waldren thomas cocke september sherifes maior iohn norman draper october thys time maiors alderman commoner cytie london wonte ride westminster maior shoulde take hys charge maior rowed thyther water whiche waterman made hym song rowe boate norman c ninth marche nighte greate fire nexte wythout ludgate cordwayners house whyche cordwayner wyth hys wife three yong men mayde burnte prisoner ludgate remoued newgate bycause almoste smoulderedan reg sherifes maior iohn fielde william tayler september stephen foster fishmonger october greate fray london sanctuarie men saint martin le graunde issued forth hurte dyuerse citizen appeased maior hys brother one twentith may king hery taking iorney1455 westminster toward saint albons mete duke yorke earles warwicke salisburie lodged nighte wateforde wadeforde thys side sainte albons morning earely came saint albons wyth hym assembled hys partye duke somerset buckingham earles penbroke northumberlande deuonshire stafforde dorset wiltshire lordes clifforde sudley baron roos wyth diuerse knight esquiers gentleman yeoman nuber time assembled richard duke yorke richarde earle warwicke richarde earle salisburie diuerse knightes esquiers fielde called keyfielde beside saint albons king hearing duke comming lord aforesaid pight banner place called goselowe place sometimes called sandforth saint peter streete commaunded strong manner keepe wardes barrier towne duke yorke knowing strength made againste abyding fielde afore sayde seuen clocke morning vntill almost ten clocke without stroke smitten eyther parte aduise hys counsell sente vnto king vnder wordes following wordes writing duke yorke king please vnto excellente grace richarde duke yorke take hym true liege manne humble subiecte consider tender reuerence god way charitie true intent commyng good gratious soueraigne vnto true liege menne whych power mighte readye lyue dye right al thing shal like maiestie royal commande v worship crowne england welfare noble realme moreouer gratious lorde please vnto youre maiestye royall youre greate goodnesse rightewisenesse encline youre heare feele rightwise parte v youre true subiects liege men fyrste praying beseeching oure soueraigne christe jesus hys hyghe aod mightye power giue vertue prudence throughe prayer glorious martyre sainct albon gyue verye knowledge oure trothes knowe intent assembling time god heauen knoweth oure intent rightfull true therefore praye vnto mighty lorde woordes domine si clypeus defensionis nostrae wherefore gracious lorde please maiestie royal deliuer accuse haue like haue deserued done honorably worshipped moste rightfull king true gouernour shoulde nowe tyme promised afore thys time vnknown haue bin promise broken whiche haue bin full faithfully promised therevpon greate othes sworne nowe cease suche promise othe tyl haue haue deserued death else dye therefore aunswere king duke yorke king henrie charge commaunde manner person degree estate condition soeuer abyde auoyde field hardie make resistaunce owne realm shall knowe traytour dare bolde arise anye people mine owne lande great disease heauynesse faith owe vnto saint edwarde vnto crown england shal destroy euery mother son eke hanged drawn quartered may taken afterward example make suche traytours beware make anye rising people within mine owne land trayterously abyde theyr king gouernour conclusion rather shall haue lorde time shall day sake quarrell selfe liue dye wordes duke yorke gentleman assembled hym sir king soueraign lord wil reformed beseeching ne prayer wil wise vnderstad intente wherfore assebled gathered time ful purpose destroy v al vpon great othe hath made none waye power pursue v taken giue v shamefull death leesing liuelodeand good also heyres shamed euer therfore sir sith none otherwise yt shall vtterly die better v die field cowardly put vtter rebuke shamefull death right england standeth v considering also perill standeth time redresse mischiefe thereof let euery man helpe power daye quarrell quite v like men crowne england praying beseeching vnto lord eternal raigneth glorious kingdome celestial keepe saue v thys day right throughe giftes holy grace may made strong withstad greate abhominable horrible malice purpose destroy v realme england put v shamefull death praye therefore vnto lord comfort defendour saying wordes domine si clipeus defensionis nostri wordes sayde duke yorke earles warwicke salisburie hoste betweene eleauen twelue noone breake three seueral place sayd streete king place edmond westby hundreder sayde towne saint albons hearing saide duke comming commaunded hoste slaye manner lordes knightes squiers gentleman yeoman might taken party foresayd duke yorke thys done lorde clifforde kepte strongly barriours towne forsayde duke yorke might wise power hee hadde enter breake sayde towne earle warwicke knowyng thereof tooke gathered hys menne togyther wyth hym brake garden side sayde towne betweene signe keye exchequere holywel streete anone within fayde towne blew vppethe trumpet cryed high voyce warwicke warwicke maruayle heare tyll tyme duke yorke might neuer haue entry town strong hande brake vp barrier foughte fierce cruell battayle whiche slayne lordes name edmonde duke somerset earle northumberlande lorde clifforde sir barton entewsell knighte william souche iohn botreaux ralphe balithorpe sonne william coruin willia cotton receyuer dutchie lancaster gilbert faldinger reignalde griffin iohn dawes elli wood iohn cyt e robert woodwarde gilbert scarlocke ralph willowby esquire gentleman courte roger mercraft queenes messanger hawbin king porter malener padington william butler yeoman fiue twentie moe whose name knowne slayne bene buryed saint albons eighte fourtie person battayle wounded lordes name king shotte necke wyth arrowe duke buckingham lord sudley visage wyth arrowes earle stafforde right hande arrowe earle dorset sore hurte might goe fayne carried home carte syr iohn wenloke knighte likewise hurt carried thence chayre diuerse knightes esquiers sore hurt substaunce kyngs hoste dispoyled theyr harneis owne requeste made deliuerye duke hoste sauation theyr liues fled earle wiltshire thorpe many fled cast away harneis ditch wood done duke yorke erles warwicke salisburie came vnto king hee besoughte hym theyr knee grace forgiuenesse done presence besoughte highnesse take grace true liege men king desired cease people shoulde hurte done obey hys commaundemet cause proclaymed king name maner people shoulde cease theyr malice smite one stroke ceased battayle vpon day next king duke yorke earles warwicke salisburie came london lodged bishoppes pallaice london kepte theyr whitsontide great ioye solemnitye concluding holde parliament begin ninth july next following yeare moneth june appeared comet starre called stella cometa betwixt north east extending beames towards south parliament begun ninth july afore saide richarde duke yorke made protectour realme earle salisburie made lord chauncellour englande richarde earle warwicke made captaine caleis iohn yong thomas owlgraue september anno reg sherifes maior william marrow grocer october yeare meanes queene lordes hir counsell duke yorke discharged protectourship earle salisburie chauncellourship called priuie seale couentrie like haue bene intrapped hardlye escaped moneth maye italian seruaunte walkyng1456 robert fabian throughe cheape london wyth dagger hangyng hys gyrdle merchauntes seruaunt tyme bin italy blamed wearing like weapon chalenged straunger howe hee durst bolde beare weapon consydering hys natiue countrey knowyng countrey straunger suffered wear like questio answere made straunger merter toke hys dagger brake vpon heade wherevpon stranger complayned maior morrow sent yong man ye guilde hall wherfore aunswere made vnto complaynt agreemente full courte alderme sent ward court finished maior sherifes walking homewarde thoroughe cheape mette suche number mercer seruauntes mighte passe ought coulde speake doe till hadde deliuered yonug manne sente prison daye afternoone sodainely assembled multitude lewde pore people city without heade guide ranne vnto certaine italian house especially florentine luke venetian toke spoyled founde dyd great hurt sundry place moste foure house standing breadstreete warde whereof three stoode saint bartholmewes parishe little one parish saint beni finke maior alderman worshipful commoner citie theyr diligence resisted coulde sente diuerse newegate fynallye wythout shedding bloude mayming diuerse citizen rumour appeased yong manne beginner thys businesse tooke sanctuarie westminster long duke buckingham noble menne sente kyng cytie charged maior uertue commission inquirie shoulde hee made thys ryot called oyer determyner guilde hall satte judge maior kyngs lieuetenaunte duke buckingham hys ryghte hande chiefe justice lefte hande manye men name whyle enpanelyng theyr inquestes common citie manye secretly putte armour ment haue roong common bell haue raysed whole force citie haue deliuered person robberie committed toward matter discretely handled counsel labour discrete commoner appeased neighbour wise furie quenched worde brought duke buckingham commonaltie harnesse lordes tooke leaue maior departed ceased inquirie day upon morrow maior commaunded common counsell warden fellowship appeare guild hall recorder king name maiors commaunded euery den afternoone eyther asseble whole fellowship comon halle giue straight commaundement euery see king peace kept within citie time citizen brought quietnesse day enquirie duly perused iij person said ryot put execution hanged tyborne whereof ij sanctuarie men saint martin le graunde otheranno reg shipman robbing anthony mowricine lumbardes iohn steward raph verney september sherifes maior thomas caning grocer october moneth nouember ile portland farre towne weymouthe seene cocke comming sea hauing great crest vpo head great red beard legges halfe yarde long stoode water crewe iij time euery time turned1457 beckened head toward north south west colour like fesauntrobert fabian crowed iij time vanished away shortly taken erithe within xij myles london iiij great wonderfull fish whereof one called mors marina second sworde fishe two whale xxvitj day august peter brice steward normandie iohn maior flete frenchman landed sandwiche fyre sword wasted towne ash slewe inhabitauntes almost last man also fowey deuonshire spoyled pirate writing mouth garter king armes onely said highnesse also good worthie lordes beyng noble presence largenesse sayde trueth duetie intent disposition serche motion might serue conueniently affirmation thereof perfect suerties suche inconuenient vnreuerent ieopardies wee haue beene put diuers tymes whereof haue cause make ought make suche exclamation complaint without reason vnknowen sayde worthie lordes land wil offer v high presence intent myght doe without sayd suertie onely causeth v keepe suche fellowshippe doe leefull manner hereto haue forborne auoyded thinges might serue effusion christian bloud dreade haue god royall maiestie haue also eschued approche sayde noble presence humble obeysaunce reuerence wherein haue lyfe haue yet neuerthelesse heare proclaimed defamed name vnrightfully vnlawfully sauing high reuerence vntruely otherwise god knoweth haue giuen cause knowing certainely blessed noble intent said good grace righteousnesse thereof take repute accept true lawfull subiectes accordeth neyther sayd intent wyll pleasure shoulde otherwise taken reputed ouer lordshippes tenantes bene high violence robbed spoyled agaynst peace lawes ryghteousnesse wee therefore suffice beseeche sayde good grace take repute receyne therevnto sayde trueth intent god knowne wee shewe sayde tenor indenture apply sayde blessednesse ne great righteousnesse equitie wherewith god hath euer endued high nobilitie ye importune impacience violence person intende extreme malice proceede vnder shadowe high might presence destructio suche inordinate couetise wherof god pleased haue landes office good letting sparing therefore put suche thing lamentable sorrowfull ieoperdie might wyse take effecte mysterie god power hauing regarde effusion christian bloud ne tendernesse noble bloud land serue tuition defence thereof ne waying losse true liege men saydo realme god defend knoweth intent wee haue auoyded farre may suerties dreade wee haue sayde person onely comfort enter conquest sayde lande letter irishe enemy sent vnto sayde duke yorke maruelled greatly letter shoulde sent speaking therein great shame villanie sayd realme item like wise king excitation labour lordes wrote letter enemy aduersaries land wise shew fauour good towne calleis whereby comforte ynough proceede wynning thereof considered also ordayned labour sayd lord victuall thing refreshing defence come englande succour reliefe sayde towne intent woulde haue lost may openly appeare item deemed ought greatly deemed lordes would put rule england might haue purpose intent handes tyrannie therein shewe largenesse violence malice vengeably remedie prouided king highnesse whose blessednesse neither assenting knowing thereof therefore seeyng sayde mischiefes hearing also frenche houres noone would speake dye field bishop hereford white frier king confessour incouraged king parte fight wherfore battayle committed castelf warwicke long prisoner teth july two clocke noo earles march warwicke let cry field man lay hand vpon king e comon people lordes knight espuiers host incountred foughte halfe houre lord grey king vaward breake fielde came earles partie great helpe highnesse exile v land woulde haue v put finall shame confusion come intent vnquiet ne grieue sayde highnesse please noble person desiring tenderly high welfare prosperitie therof al realme true liegeman liues shall endure king word greatlye recomforted anone led northampton procession rested three dayes came london sixteenth july lodged byshops pallaice ninteenth julye tower london lacke victualles yeelded came forth afterward drawn headed lorde scale late euening entred wherry three person rowing towarde westminster haue taken sanctuarie descried woman anone wherry men fel killed cast hym lande beside saint marie oueries queene margaret heard king take wyth hir sonne eight person fled castel hardlagh wale robbed way lancashire hir goodes valewe ten thousande markes thence went scotland tenth august iames king scottes besieging castle rockesborough slaine gun brake campe one twentith september duke somerset came gwines england anno reg sherifes maior richard flemming iohn lambert september richard lee grocer october vitj october parliamet begun westminster vnto came ri duke yorke little beforeparliament come irelande lodged pallaice kyng brake vp dores kyngs chamber king giuing hym place tooke chamber sayde duke right heyre lyneall descent richard seconde chalenged realme purposing haue bin crowned alhallown day next following herevppon sente parliament wryting hys sayde clayme title pedigree whych clayme diligent deliberation approued sayde parliamente peace concorde betweene king duke uigil alhalow established co cluded article followeth blessed iohn whose handes bountie refieththe article betvvixt king henrie duke yorke peace vnitie betwixte prince weale euerye realme knowe whose direction agreed appointed accorded followeth betwixte moste high moste mightis prince king henrie sixth king england fraunce lord irelande one party right high mightie prince richard platagenet duke yorke party vpon certain matter variaunce moued betwixt especially vpon clayme title vnto crownes england fraunce royall power estate dignitie appertayning lordship irelande opened shewed declared sayde duke afore lordes spirituall temporall present parliament first saide richarde duke yorke hath declared opened aboue sayde title clayme maner followeth right noble worthy prince henrie kyng englande third issue lawfullye got edwarde first begotten sonne borne westminster xv kalendes july yeare lord edmond second sonne borne saint marcel day yeare whiche edwarde death kyng henrie hys father intituled called kyng edwarde firste issue edward first begotten sonne called decease father kyng edward seconde whiche issue edward thirde edward third issue edward prince wale william hatfield hys seconde sonne leonel thirde duke clarence iohn gaun fourth duke lancaster edmond langley fifth duke yorke thomas woodstocke sixth duke glocester w windsor seuenth said edward prince wale dyed life time hys father issue richard succeeded edwarde thirde grandsire richarde dyed without issue william hatfield second sonne edwarde thirde dyed without issue leonel thirde sonne edwarde thirde duke clarence hadde issue phillip daughter heyre whych coupled matrimony vnto edmond mortimer earle marche issue roger mortimer earle marche hyr sonne heyre roger issue edmond erle march roger mortimer anne elianor edmonde roger alianor dyed without issue sayde anne coupeled matrimony richard earle cambridge sonne edmond langley fifth sonne henrie third issue richard plantagenet commonly called duke yorke iohn gaunt fourth son edward yonger brother sayde leonel issue henrie earle darby whiche incontinent king richard resigned crownes realmes lordship irelande vnrighteously entred vppon aliue edmonde mortimer earle marche sonne roger mortimer earle march sonne heyre saide phillippe daughter heyre sayde leonel thirde sonne sayde king edward thirde whiche edmonde right title sayde crownes lordship lawe custome belonged whiche richard duke yorke sonne anne daughter roger mortimer earle march sonne heyre sayd phillip daughter heyre sayde leonell third sonne kyng edwarde thirde righte title dignitie royall estate crownes realmes england frace lordshippe irelande pertayneth belongeth fore anye issue saide iohn gaunt fourth sonne king edwarde sayde title notwithstanding without preiudice sayde richarde duke yorke tenderly desiring wealth reste prosperitie land set apart might trouble consyderyng possession sayde kyng henne sixth hathe hys tyme bene named taken reputed kyng englande fraunce lorde irelande contented agreede consenteth hee bee hadde reputed taken kyng englande fraunce wyth royall estate dignitye preheminence belonging therevnto lorde irelande hys naturall lyfe time saide duke without hurte preiudice saide righte title shall take worshippe honor soueraigne lorde item saide richard duke yorke shall promis binde solempne othe maner forme foloweth name god amen richarde duke yorke othe richard duke yorke promise sweare faith truth owe almightie god shal neuer consent procure stirre directly indirectly priuie aperte neyther much shall suffer done consented procured stirred thing may sound abridgement natural life king henry sixth hurt diminishing raigne dignitie royall violence anye otherwise againste freedome libertie anye person person wold presume thing contrary shal might power withstande make withstoode farre power wil stretche herevnto helpe mee god holie euangelistes item edward earle march edmund earle rutlande sonnes saide duke yorke shall make like othe item accorded appointed agreed said richard duke yorke shal called reputed hence forth rightfull heire crownes royall estate dignitie lordshippe aboue saide decease saide king henry lay saide crownes estate dignitie lordshippe sayde duke heyres shal immediately succeed saide crownes royal estate dignitie lordship item saide richard duke yorke shall haue authoritie present parliament castels manor land tenementes wyth wardes marriage relief seruices fine amercementes office anowsions fee appurtenaunces belonging soeuer yearely valewe tenne thousande markes ouer al charge reprises fiue thousand markes shall owne state three thousande fiue hundred markes edward first begotten sonne earle march estate one thousande pounde edmond earle rutland seconde sonne yearely sustentation suche consideration suche intent shall declared lord king counsell item person person imagine compasse death sayde duke thereof probably attaynte open deede done folkes condition deemed adiudged high treason item establishing sayde accorde appointed consented lordes spirituall temporall thys present parliament shal make othes accepte take worship repute said richard duke yorke hys heires aboue rehearsed keepe obserue strength muche apperteyneth vnto thing abouesayd resist power woulde presume contrarie according estate degree item sayde richard duke yorke erles march rutland shall permitte make helpe ayde defende sayde lord euery althose wyll quarrell thing attempt sayde lordes anye occasion agreemente consenting sayde accorde assistaunce giuing duke earles item agreed appointed accorde euery article thereof opened notifyed king letter patent otherwise time place maner shall thought expedient sayde rycharde duke yorke aduise lordes king counsel king vnderstandeth certainely sayde title sayde richarde duke yorke iust lawfull sufficient aduise assent lordes spirituall temporall common parliament assembled aucthoritie parliament declareth approueth ratifyeth confirmeth accepteth sayde title iust good lawfull true therevnto giueth assent agreemente free libertie ouer sayd aduice aucthoritie declareth entitleth calleth stablisheth affirmeth reputeth sayde richarde duke yorke true rightfull heire corones royal estate dignitie realm england fraunce lordship irelande aforesaid according worship reuerence therto belongeth taken accepted reputed worship reuerence state sayde realme englande hys subiectes thereof fauyng ordayning aucthoritie king haue saide corones realme royal estate dignity preheminence ofthe sayde lordshippe ireland life naturall furthermore aduice authoritie consenteth agreeth decease shall please highnesse laye hym sayde corones estate dignitie lordshippe sayde richarde duke yorke hys heyres shal immediatelye succeede sayde corones royall estate dignitye worshippe haue inioye acte parliament statute ordinance thing contrarie made interruption discontinuaunce possession notwithstanding moreouer saide aduise aucthoritie stablisheth graunteth confirmeth approueth ratifieth accepteth said accorde al thing therein contayned therevnto freely absolutely assenteth agreeth aduice authoritie ordayneth establisheth anye person person ymagine compasse deathe sayde duke probably attaynt open deede done folkes condition deemed adiudged highe treason furthermore ordayneth establisheth sayde aduice aucthoritie statute ordinaunces actes parliament made time said king rie fourth whiche heyres bodye comming henrie late king england fifth sonne heyre sayd king henrie fourth heires king henrie fifth inheritable saide crownes realmes heritage bee adnulled repelled dampned cancelled voyde none effect ouer king saide aduice assent authoritie ordayneth establisheth actes statute made afore thys time acte parliamente repelled adnulled like authoritie otherwise voyde force effecte vertue afore making ordinaunces letter pattents royalx record actes judicial made done afore tyme repelled reuersed ne otherwise voyde lawe preiudiced hurte present acte also ordayned parliamente sayde richarde duke yorke shoulde called prince wale duke cornewall earle chester protectour englande moneth december duke somerset earle deuonshire wente northe countrey eighte hundered men anone saide duke yorke earle rutlande sonne earles salisburie little christmasse fewe person wente northe also represse malice northerne men whiche loued duke yorke ne earle salisburie lodged castell sandale wakefielde lorde neuill brother earle westmerlande vnder colour friendshippe came duke yorke requyring hym commission hym rayse people chastice rebelles sayde hadde raysed number eighte thousande menne hee broughte lordes countrey saye earle northumberlande lorde clifforde duke somerset aduersaries duke yorke laste december fell sayde duke richarde killed hym sonne earle rutland many knight esquiers witte lorde harington thomas harington knighte sir thomas neuil sonne earle salisburie syr henrie ratforde knight number earle salisburie taken aliue ledde duke somerset castell pomfraite graunte hys life greate summe money common people countrey whyche loued hym toke hym castel violence smote hys heade death lordes knowen king commaunded writ commission sent shire people goe againste rebelles northe suppresse northe came sodainelye downe town dunstaple robbing countrey people came spoyling abbayes priory parish church bearing awaye chalisses bookes ornamentes whatsoeuer worth carriage thoughe bin sarisens christian againste twelfth februarie duke norffolke suffolke erles warwicke arundale lord bonuile king wente london towarde saint albons heard northe nyghe tooke fielde beside little towne called sandriage farre sainte albons barnarde heathe place called man lande kyng stoode sawe hys menne slayne bothe sydes tyll laste throughe wythdrawyng manye kentishmen captaine louelace vaward king henry parte lost fielde lord fled king wente queene margaret come wt northerne men hyr sonne edwarde earle warwicke wente towarde earle marche comming towarde london wale lord bonuile woulde haue withdrawen king assured hym haue bodylye harme neuerthelesse instance queene duke excester earle deuonshire beheaded saint albons wyth hym syr thomas kyriell kente battayle fought shroue twesday seauenteenth februaryexlibre norwicensis whiche slain person day thomas thorpe baron exchequer beheaded high gate common kent citizen london dreading malice queene duke somerset sente vnto dutchesse buckingham treate beneuolent citie summe money promised shoulde come citie wyth certayne number person vpon certayne speares men armes sente haue entred citie duke commyng whereof slayne sore hurte remnaunte putte flighte common tooke keyes gate manfully defended citie vntill comming edwarde earle marche wherethroughe king henrie wyth queene margaret northerne men forced return northwarde thirde februarie edwarde earle marche foughte wyth welchmen beside wigmore wale neare vnto mortimer crosse whose captaynes earle penbroke earle wilshire put flight slewe welchemen aboute foure thousande owen tewther whome iohn leylande sayeth shoulde called dicke father sayde earle penbroke whiche owen hadde married katherin mother king henrie sixth taken beheaded afterward buried chapel gray frier church hereforde day battayle tenne clocke noone seene three sun firmamet shyning like cleare closed togither one eight twentith februarie edward earle march accompanied erle warwicke mightie power marchmen came vp london ioyfully receyued seconde day march sonday hys hoste mustered saint iohns fielde redde among people certaine article pointes king henrie offended demanded whether said henrie worthy raigne still people cryed nay naye asked would haue erle march theyr king sayde yea yea certaine captaynes sente toerle march elected king earle march baynardes castel tolde erle people chosen king whereof thanked god aduise archbyshoppe canterburie byshoppe excester earle warwicke wyth hee tooke vpon hym dutch yorke mother edwarde earle marche fearing fortune worlde sente hyr two yonger sonnes george richarde ouer sea citie vtricke almaine remayned tyll elder brother got crown also phillip malpas alderman london thomas citizen lo fled vaghan esquire maister william atclife many fearing queenes comming london shypped shippe antwerpe purposing haue sayled thyther way taken french shippe named colmapne length delyuered greate raunsome edwarde earle march elected abouesaidedvvard erle march toke kingdome next morrowe went procession paules offered te deum beyng sung gret royaltie conueyed westminster hall sette king seate saint edward scepter hand asked people would haue king cryed yea yea certaine homage hym receyued procession conuayed abbay sette quire king whyle te deum singing done offered saint edwardes shryne returned water vnto saint paules lodged wythin bishop pallaice thus tooke possession realme vpon tuisday fourth marche proclaymed king england name edward fourthe king henrie hadde raigned thirtie yeares eight monthes odde dayes p edward earle march edvvarde earle marche borne roane sonne heyre toanno reg rouse richarde duke yorke age eighteene yeares began raigne fourth day march name edward fourth yeare man noble courage greate wit time muche trouble vnquietnesse realme twelfth marche walter walker grocer thatvvalter vvalker beheaded dwelt cheape word spoken touching king edwarde beheaded smithfield knightes esquiers ladyes gentlewome came england great triumph feasting shewes pageant straunge deuises justings haue read like would ouer long place set downe sir thomas cooke late maior londo one named robert fabian sir thomas cooke hawkins appeached treason sent towre place within london seased lorde ryuers wife seruauntes clearely put therof cause forenamed hawkins came vpon season vnto sayd sir thomas requesting lend thousand markes vpon good suertie wherevnto answered first would know intent length vnderstanding shoulde vse queene margaret answered currant ware whereof shiftes might made without much losse therfore required hawkins moue farther matter intended deale withall yet sayde hawkins exhorted remember benefites receiued hir prosperitie making hir wardrober customer hampton c meanes sayde cooke woulde graunt good money although last sayd hawkins required hundreth poud fayne depart without value pennie neuer came againe moue rested two three yeares tyll sayde hawkins cast towre length brought brake called duke excesters daughter meane payne shewed many thing amongst ye motion one made sir thomas coke accused himselfe farre put death meane confession sayde sir thomas troubled shewed saide sir thomas lyen towre whitsontide fyll michaelmas seaso many enquiry made finde guiltie euer quit till one iurie meanes sir iohn fogge endited treason determine set guildhall sat ye maior duke clarence earle warwike ye lorde riuers sir iohn fogge ye king counsell place saide thomas brought arraygned vpo life death acquited ye said inditement counter bredstreete thence king bench certaine time thus acquited wife gat againe possessio hir house ye found euill plight seruants lord riuers sir iohn fogge assigned keepe made hauoke listed also place essex named guydy hall set sort keepe place destroyed deare parke connies fishe without reason spared brasse pewter bedding might carie might neuer one pennie gotte recompence yet could sir tho cooke deliuered til paid ye k ye queene ende august castle harlowe wonneharlovv ca l vvonne assaulte lorde herberd castle one strongest holdes wale yeere many murmurous tale ran citie betwene ye earle warwike queenes blood ye earle euer great fauour comons land reason exceeding houshold dayly kept country euer soiourned lay whenearle vvarvvike house keeping came london held house vj ox eaten breakefast euery tauerne full meate acquaintance house haue much soden rost might carrie vpon long dagger simon smith william hanot sept sherifes maior cordvvainer streete discharged fiftens anno reg william tailour morning till x diuers time earle warwikes men supposed gotte victorie fielde happened ye earle oxford men starre streames behinde liueries king edward men sunne streames lyuery whervpon earle warwikes men reason myst well decerning badge lyke shot earle oxfordes men owne parte earle oxforde men cryed treason fled eight hundred men marque mountacute priuily agreed wyth king edwarde gotten hys aldegate london bridge c along thamis side shooting arrow gunnes citie fiered suburb brent house wanne bulwarkes aldegate entred citie ye parcolise let downe suche entred slaine citizen pursued rest farre stratforde blacke wall slaying many tooke manye prisoner thomas bastarde went london weastwarde farre kingstone vppon thamis prosecute king edwarde lorde scale nicholas faunte maior canterburie fayre wordes caused fawconbridge returne blacke heath kent whence night stale hoste sixe hundred horssemenne rochester sandwiche abode kyngs comming one twentith may king edwarde came toking henrie murdered london thirtie thousand men nyght king henrie murdered tower london morrowe brought saint paules church london open cophen bare faced bled thece carried blacke frier bled thence chersey abbay boate buryed since remoued windsor resteth thus ended king transitorie life hauing inioyed great prosperity fauourable fortune coulde aforde greate trouble side frownyng coulde poure yet state patiente vertuous maye patterne moste perfect vertue worthy example fortune inconstancie plaine vpright far fraude wholye giuen prayer reading scripture almesdeedes integritie lyfe bishoppe whyche hadde bene hys confessour tenne yeares auowched hee tyme committed anye mortall cryme continente suspition vnchaste life neuer touched hym hauyng christmasse shewe yong womenne wyth theyr bare breastes layde presented hym immediately departed wyth wordes fie fie shame forsooth blame marryage liked woman shoulde enter hys courte thys respect committed hys two brother mother side iasper edmonde moste honest vertuous prelate bee broughte vppe farre couetousnesse executor hys vncle bishoppe winchester surnamed rich cardinall would haue giuen pounde playnelye refused willing discharge departed woulde scarcely condescend length accept money towarde endowing colledges cambridge eaton religiously affected tyme principall holydayes would sackeclothe next skinne othe vsed none moste earnest matter wordes forsoothe forsooth pityfull hee sawe quarter traytour agaynste hys crowne ouer criple gate hee willed taken awaye wyth wordes wyll haue anye christian cruellye handeled sake manye greate offence hee willinglye pardoned receyuing tyme greate blowe wicked manne whyche compassed hys deathe onelye sayde forsooth forsooth yee doe fowelye smite kyng annoynted another also thruste side wyth sworde hee restoared hys state kyngdome long hys death beyng demaunded hee hadde long helde crowne englande vniustlye replyed father kyng englande quietlye enioying crowne hys raigne grandsire kyng englande euen chylde cradle proclaymed crowned king without anye interruption helde fortye yeares well neare state homage vnto antecessors wherefore may saye king dauid lotte fallen vnto faire grounde yea haue goodlye heritage helpe lorde whyche saueth vprighte hearte good king hymselfe alwayes naturally enclinedthe king colledge cambridge doe good fearing leste might seeme vnthankfull almyghtye god hys greate benefittes bestowed vppon hym since tyme firste tooke vppon hym regimente realme determyned aboute sixe twentith yeare hys raygne hys primer notable worke wordes hys wyll finde expressed erecte founde two famous colledges honoure worshippe hys holy name encrease vertue dilation cunning establishmente christian fayth whereof one cambridge bee called hys cambridge euen finde mentioned almost verbatim said wil supposing rest house proceeded according chappel alreadie finished full intent meaning lyke colledge coulde skant haue bin found againe christian land word thus touchingthe chappel dimension church sayde colledge lady saint nicholas cambridge haue deuised appointed church shal containe length foote assise without iles widenesse xl foote length church ye west end vnto alters quire dore shal contayne foote prouostes stall vnto greece called gradus chori foote stals either side quyre aunscoering lxx fellowes ten priest conduit sherifes maior william edward grocer october xij nouember ladye anne king sister deuorsed duke excester hyr owne sute kyng ed christmasse day crowned westminster queene also likewise twelfth day kyng agayne crowned wente procession crownedanno reg queene time crowned bycause great childe thys yeare sente ambassadours king edwarde duke burgoigne landed bridge seconde aprill honorablye receyued wythout towne lorde grantehuse name ambassador sir iohn scot knight marshall caleis mayster william hatclofe secretarie kyng mayster iohn russel doctour archdeacon master richarde marten archdeacon london sir iohn yong knighte merchaunte london fourth april conueyed horssebacke duke lodging c george neuill archebishoppe yorke windsor kyng edwarde hunting king promised archebishoppe come place hartfordeshire whiche archebishoppe hadde purchased buylded commodiouslye hunte make merry hym wherevppon archebishoppe made greate prouision kyng sente muche plate hee hadde hydde tyme barnet tewkesburie field besides borrowed muche hys friendes thys beyng done king sodaynely sente archbishoppe come windsor arrested treason shoulde helpe earle oxforde sente caleis hame continued long prisoner thys meane whyle sir william parre knight sir thomas vahan esquire sente cease hys good kyng came samme twentie thousande pounde kyng edward thys time brake bishop miter many riche stone made therof crowne himselfe also earle oxforde withdrawen hymselfe barnet fielde first scotland france getting muche good sea landed weast countrey entred saint michael mounte men last september wheron king appointmet besieged bodrigan wyth fauour earle reuictualled mount fortescue sente thyther continue siege king edwarde sending pardon erles men long practised last earle submitted himselfe king edward bin taken fortestue entring mount fifteenth februarie found victuall ynough haue serued till mydsommer iohn vere earle oxforde lord beaumonde two brother sayde earle thomas clifforde brought prisoner king earle oxforde sente prisoner gwines remayned long thys kyng raygned whyche tyme ladye hys wife myghte neuer come hym anye thyng liue vppon people theyr charityes woulde giue hyr shee gotte hyr needle moneth september lewes de bruges lorde grantehuse came englande charles duke burgoigne thirteenth october created earle winchester openly parliament chamber iohn broune thomas bledlow september sherifes maior sir william hampton fishmonger october maior aboue al hys predecessours corrected strumpet caused ride citie wyth rey hoodes vppon heades banished citie euer also caused paire stockes set euery ward london sixth october beganne parliamente westminster authoritie wherby ayde graunted king towards charge war whiche leuied men land well lordes duke burgo gne hauing greate warres wythanno reg french king sente ambassadours englande require king edwarde hys brother lawe make warre frenche kyng vnto whiche requeste kyng edwarde easily graunted bycause hee wished reuenged frenche king hys enymie ayding erle warwicke queene margaret hyr sonne prince edwarde complices wherevpon promised also determyned beginning next yeare bring greate armye ouer caleis inuade kingdome fraunce forthwith diligence prepared thing readie hys iourney makyng manye shiftes prouision money serus hys turne william stocker robert ballisdon september sherifes maior iohn tate mercer october thys yeare duke excester founde deade sea betweene douer caleis howe came certaintie coulde knowne king edwarde hauing prepared hys armye ledde theanno reg douer thence crosse sea caleis force passed wyth hym thys presente greatest euer came fraunce moste beyng horssemenne verye good order well armed noble realme fewe excepted fifteene hundered menne armes well mounted moste barded richly trapped manner frenche warres well accompanyed horssemenne theyr retinue leaste fifteene thousande archer horssebacke greate number f temenne others well pitche theyr tentes whereof well furnyshed also attende vppon theyr artyl erye inclose theyr campe theyr armye hadde one pledge besides thys thr e thousande englishe menne appoynted lande brytaine king edwarde came douer duke burgoigne helpe passage sent boates hollande seland called cuttes whiche flatte lowe builte verye commodiously transporting horsses notwithstanding thys helpe hadde duke kyng englande coulde commaunde hymselfe hee aboue three weekes passing betweene douer caleis one shippe ewe tooke two three small passenger kyng edwarde embarqued hee sente douer kyng fraunce one heralte alone called gartera norman borne broughte letter defiaunce king englande verye good language excellently well penned myne aucthour perswaded neuer englishe man doyng contentes whereof kyng shoulde yeelde vnto hym realme fraunce beyng hys inheritaunce ende might restore cleargye nobilitie theyr auntient libertye ease greate charge sustayned deliuer misery whyche hee refused doe protested greate mischiefe shoulde ensue thereof manner forme suche case accustomed kyng read letter softlye himselfe afterwarde alone withdrewe hymselfe wardrobe commaunded heralte brought hyepresence hee made thys aunswere fyrst knewe well king englande passed sea hys owne free motion perswasion duke burgondie comminaltie england secondelye sommer nowe almoste paste du burgoigne returned nunz man discomifited vtterlye vnfurnished thing thirdlye touching conestable fraunce knew wel sayde yt intelligence wyth ye k england bycause hadde married hys niece would deceyue kyng mayster ad notwithstandyng great benefit receiued rehearsed adding therevnto saide conestable ment liue continuall dissimulation entertaine euerye man make profit last alleaged heralte diuerse reason perswade kyng hys mastor peace gaue hym hys owne hand crownes promising peace cocluded opely gaue present goodly peece crimson ueluet thyrtie elles heralte aunsweared woulde trauayle beste coulde peace thoughte kyng hys mayster woulde easilye wonne therevnto willed kyng fraunce sende haraulte englishe campe demaunde safeconduite certaine ambassadours woulde sende kyng englande directe hys letter lorde hawarde lorde stanley hymselfe also conuene hys haralte one tyme oure bothe king englande landed caleis duke burgoigne departed nunz greate haste rydde streyghte caleis sayde kyng wyth verye small trayne hadde sente armye spoyle countrey barroys loraine kyng englande departed caleis companye duke passed bolloigne thence marched peronne duke gaue englishe men colde entertaynemente caused gate bee streightly kepte woulde suffer fewe enter greatest parte lodged fieldes come peronne conestable france set ye duke burgoigndie one seruants hee used himselfe wythholdyng quintins alleaging hee restored could haue stoode hym stee e realme fraunce shoulde vtterly haue loste hys credite intelligence nowe seeyng kyng englande come ouer person promysed doe hereafter duke shoulde commaunde hym whereof better assure hym hee sente hym letter credite declaration duke hee gaue duke hys faythe wryting serue suc ure hym hys friendes confederate well king englande others men none excepted duke deliuered kyng englande hys letter matter credite adding somewhat thereto hys owne heade assured king conestable woulde deliuer handes saint quintines place whiche kyng easilye beleeued partly bycause hee hadde marryed conestables nie e partlye bycause hee sawe hym greate feare kyng fraunce hee thoughte hee durste fayle hys promise made duke hym duke beleeued also conestable meante nothing lesse feare frenche kyng greate coulde force hym thus vsed yl onted dissimulation king englande reioycyng thys message sente conestable departed peronn wyth duke burgoigne towarde saint quintins wherevnto hee approched greate bande englishe menne ranne thynkyng belle shoulde haue bene rong theyr commyng citizen woulde haue receyued wyth crosse holye water drewe neere towne artill e shotte souldi ur ed bothe hors e backe foote two three englishe menne slayne taken thys state returned great rage theyr campe againste conestable nexte morning duke woulde haue taken hys leaue king englande departe hys armye barrays promising maruayles hys fauour frenche kyng sente seruaunte lord halle lykenesse herraulte wyth coate made trumpet banner englishe campe hee came hee broughte tente dynner talked wyth kyng hys message chielely grounded vppon greate desire kyng hadde long time bee peace wyth kyng englande saying since hee crowned kyng fraunce neuer hadde attempted anye thyng againste king england realme secondly excused himselfe receiuing time paste earle warwicke dominion saying hee dyd onely agaynste duke burgoigne declared sayd duke burgoigne none cause called hym fraunce occasion hys comming hee mighte conclude bett r peace hymselfe wyth kyng happily anye furthered matter onely amende broken estate theyr owne affaire owne priuate commoditie touching kyng englandes good successe altogither carelesse thereof hee putte hym also mynde tyme yeare alleaging winter approched likewise great charge sustained lastlye sayde notwithstanding great number englande desyred warre fraunce yet kyng englande inclyne peace kyng hys parte would condescende suche condition doubted hee hys realme woulde allowe finally demaunded sa e conduite certaine ambassadours come well enformed maisters pleasure king england part noble liking ouertures well graunted harrault fraunce large safe conducte demaunded gaue foure noble golde rewarde also sente englishe harrault bring like safe conducte nexte morning uillage neare amience commissioner prince met king france bastard bourdon adm ral france lord saint pierre bishop eureux called heberge king englande lord howard one chalenger doctor morton many article peace treated laste resolution french king shoulde paye king englande presently departure fraunce thousande crownes dolphine shoulde marrye king edwardes eldest daughter shoulde haue duchie guien hir maintainaunce crownes yearly paid tower london space nine yeres terme expired dolphine shoulde peaceably enioy reuenues whole dutchie gnien kyng france clearly discharged payment king englande decreed two prime shoulde meete togither sworne treatie meeting obserued town called picquigny august king england vppon receit hys money departed towarde cal great haste fearing duke burgoignes malice subiectes departure lefte hostage king fraunce till returne england lorde howarde maister horse called sir iohn cheyney king edward tooke shipping calais landed douer receyued blackeheath mayor london brother boorely nathelesse comely youth greatly giuen f eshely wantonnesse health body great prosperitie fortune without speciall grace hardly refraineth faulte greatly greeued people neyther could one man heartie fauour amongest common people whiche oftentimes esteeme take greater kindnesse little courtesie great benefite deceassed haue sayd noble king time lyfe desired whose loue people entire affection towarde beene noble child hauing themselues also many giftes nature many princely vertues much goodly towardnesse age could receiue maruellous fortresse sure armour diuision dissention
