country like maner loue countrey toward great learning pregnant witte eloquence much doth abounde person muste needes thinke realme fortunate whyche hathe prince store meete apt gouernor side call memorie good quality late protector nowe called king violated tyranny altred vsurped authoritie clouded blinde ambition muste needes say neither meete king noble realme famous realme meete gouerned tyrant first enterprice obtaine crowne begunne murther dyuers noble personage secondarily proceed againste owne naturall mother declaring hir openlye woman giuen carnall affection dissoulute lyuing declaring furthermore hys two brother two nephewes bastardes borne aduo trey yet contented obtayned garlande hee caused two pore innocent nephewes committed shamefully murthered bloude whiche little babe dayly cry god earth vengeaunce sure tie shall realme person eyther life goodes vnder suche cruell prince whych regardeth destruction owne bloud lesse losse nowe conclude meane toward noble person say affirme loue god linage natiue coutry must self take vpon crown realme ye maintenace honour also deliueraunce natural countreyme bondage tyrante self wil refuse take vpon ye crown realme adiure faith owe god deuise way realme may brought conuenient regiment vnder good gouernour whe b ended saying sighed spake gret night comoned ore next daye duke sent b vnto sayd l ely must needes hart thinke mouth confesse sure friende trustie counsaylour verye louer countrey sith last communicatio haue disclosed secret hart touching ye new vsurper crowne also haue little touched auncement two noble family yorke lancaster shal likewise declare vnto priuie entents secrete cogitation beginne king edwarde deceased beganne studye deliberation ponder maner realme shoulde gouerned perswaded wyth selfe take part wyth duke glocester thought cleane without dissimulation tractable without iniurie mean made protector king realm whiche auathoritie gotten neuer ceased printly require lord wel spirituall temporall might take vppon hym crowne till prince came age xxiiij yeares able gouerne realme sufficient king thing saw somewhat sticke brought instrumets autentike doctor proctor notary law deposition diuers witness testifying king edwardes child bastard whiche deposition thought true nowe knowe fayned sayde deposition v read diligentlye hearde hee stoode vppe bare headed saying well lordes euen would nephewes haue wrong praye nothing right witness saying famous doctours true onelye vndubitate heyre richarde plantagenet duke yorke adiudged verye heire crowne realme aucthoritie parliament whyche thynges learned men veritie v declared caused take lawful vndoubted prince soueraigne lorde agayne aide protector made king crowned king full possession realme caste awaye olde condition selfe sued parte earle hereford landes brother kyng edward wrongfully detained also requyred haue office highe conestableship englande diuers noble auncestours time haue hadde long descent continued firste sute hee first delay afterward deny gaue suche vnkind wordes though neuer furthered al suffred pacietly whe informed death two yong innocentes lord heart inwardly grudged much abhorred ye sight toke leaue court returned brecknocke iourney returned diuerse imaginatios depriue vnnatural vncle frst santi ed list take vpon crowne way made playne occasion giuen sawe dysdayned lord temporall accursed lordes spiritual diuerse cogitation matter rode betweene worcester bridgenorth encountred lady margaret countesse richmonde wife ye lord stanley daughter sole heire iohn duke somerset grandfather elder brother hir sonne garle richmond betweene gate enter maiestie royall getting crowne little comoned concernyng sonne departed beganne dispute wt selfe whether best take vpon election nobilitie communaltie take power thus standing ye wauering ambiguitie considered first offi e dutie pain king surely think mortall men iustlye truely obserue excepte hee ee elected god king dauid remembred toke gouernaunce realme daughter king edwarde theyr ally bothe hys sake muche helpned also greate iniurye done muche pytied woulde neuer cease barke one syde mee sen b abye coosin earle richemonde hys aydes kinsfolke wyll surelye attempte eyther yte pierse mee syde life rule shoulde euer hang vnquiet pubte deathe deposition sayde two ly age yorke lancaster shoulde ioyne one againste mee surelye matched wherefore haue cleerelye determyned vtterlye relinquishe imagination concerning obtayning crowne told countesse richmond returne newe named king meeting high waye prayed first kinred sake secondly loue bare grandfather duke humfrey whiche sworne brother hir father moue king good hir son hencie earle richmonde license fauour returne againe england pleasure doe promised earle hir sonne shoulde marrie one king edward daughter appointment king without anye thing demaunded sayde espousalles king fauoure whiche request ne ouer passed departed seruice called memorie matter bente earle richmonde heire house lancaster shal take wife lady elizabeth eldest daughter k edwarde marriage house yorke lancaster maye vnite one duke sayde bishop morton whiche fauoured euer house lancaster wonde ous ioyfull imagination tended effecte least duke courage shoulde swage minde alter sayde duke lord buckingham sithe god prouision incoparable wisedome thys noble coniunction first moued necessarie consider person shall firste make pri e polliticke conclusion troth quoth duke beginne wyth ladye richmonde earles mother whyche knoweth brytaine sith begin waye sayde byshoppe haue olde friende wyth countesse called reignalde bray shall send iyoc pleasure byshoppe wrode come brecke ke streight came backe messenger dirke bishoppe declared hadde deuised prefermente earle richmonde sonne hys ladye land maistresse willyng hyr firste compasse howe obtayne good wyll queene elizabeth also hir eldest daughter secretly send hir sonne britaine declare highe honour prepared would sweare marrye lady elizabeth soone king realme reynold bray glad heart returned countesse ladie bray gone byshoppe tolde duke isle elie could make many friendes enterprise duke knewe true yet lothe lose companie counseller gaue byshoppe fayre wordes saying shoulde shortly departe well accompanied feare enemy bishop duke company assembled secretly disguised night departed came elie founde money friendes sayled flaunders earle richmond good seruice reynold bray declared message countesse maruaile glad wherefore deuised meanes hold breake matter queene elazabeth sanctuarie westminster hauing hir family certayne wel hman called lewes learned phisicke nowe hauing opportunitie breake hir minde vnto declared time come hir sonne bee ioyned marriage ladye elizabeth daughter heyre king edward king richard shoulde honour estate detected required goe queene elizabeth messenger one came friendly visite hir tyme place serue make hir priuie deuise phisition good diligence repayred queene saw tyme conuenient said vnto hir madame although imagination verye simple yet entire affection beare child bolde vtter vnto secrete conceit haue compassed brayne remember great losse haue sustayned death louing husband great sorow haue suffered cruell murther innocent chyldren lesse doe daylye studie howe bring heart comforte also reuenge quarrell child cruell tyraunt king richard first consider battayle mischiefe hath risen dis ention betweene two house yorke lancaster two family may ioyned one doubt line shall againe restored great ioye comforte knowe madame house lancaster earle richmond nexte bloud house yorke daughter nowe heyres ye coulde inuent meane howe couple eldest daughter earle richemond matrimonie doubt vsurper bee shortly deposed heire agayne hir ryght restored queene heard thys friendly motion shee instantly besought hym beene first inuenter good enterprise would desist folow requrring would resorte countesie richemond mother earle henrie declare hir queenee behalfe friendes king edwarde hir husband assist take part erle richemond hir sonne woulde take othe kingdome obteyned espouse lady elizabeth hir daughter c lewes spedde businesse made final en busynesse betweene two mother ladye margaret countesse richemond brought good hope preferment hir sonne made reynold bray chiefe solicitor conspiraoie geuyng hym charge secretely inuegle suche person enterprise duke promised performed whervpon earle sent england hugh conway thomas ram declare comming shortly england meane season chiefe conspiracie england beganne many enterprise beyng neuer priuely handled yet knowledge thereof came kyng richard knewe duke buckingham bee chiefe heade ayde commination thought necessarie plucke hym parte vppon adressed louing letter duke exhorte duke come courte duke required kyng pardon hym excusing himselfe well king richard content wyth excuse directed duke letter wyth checkyng wordes commaunding hym wythout delaye repayre hys presence duke made messenger determinate aunswere woulde come mortall enemye immediatelye prepared warre agaynste hym meanes thomas marque dorset came sancturie gathered great bande men yorke shire syr edwarde courtney peter brother byshoppe excester raysed armie deuonshire cornewall kent ir richard calfortle gentleman ray comparrie king richarde meane tyme gotten together great strength remoued london towarde salisburie entent myght set duke army king starce two dayes tourney salisburie duke buckingham accompanyed great powre wilde welchmen ende forsooke duke powre marched forest dene intending haue passed ryuer seuerne glocester haue ioyned armie courtneys westerne men done doubte king richard beene great ieoperdie could attayne seuerne syde force continuall raine riuer rose high ouerflowed countrey adioyning rage water lasted x dayes inundacie passage closed neyther ye duke could come ouer seuerne complices hym wing time welchmen lyngering ydle wythout money victuall sodainly scaled departed duke thus left almost alone necessitie compelled flie conueyed himselfe house humfrey banister seruaht beside shrewesburie tenderly brought vp whe knowne adherent euery man shifted himselfe fled sayled britaine among peter courtney byshop excester sir edward courtney brother thomas marque dorset iohn lord welles sir iohn bourchier sir edmond woodvile brother queene elizabeth sir robert willoughbie sir gyles daubney sir thomas arundale sir iohn cheynie two brothren sir william barkerley sir william brando thomas brother sir richard edgecombe iohn halwell edwarde pownyngs c proclamation made thousande pound promised coulde bring duke buckingham vpon humfrey banister bewrayed guest andhumfrey banister betrayeth maister maister iohn mitton sherife shropshire whiche stronge powre apprehended duke little groue adioyning manor humfrey banister great haste conueyed citie salisburie king richard kept housholde banister afterbanister trayed maister miserably plagued let like traitor looke like vvorse vvithout speedie repentance betrayed maister sonne heire waxed mad dyed bore stye eldest daughter sodainely striken foule leperie seconde sonne maruellously deformed lymmes made lame yonger sonne small puddle drowned himselfe extreme age arraygned found guiltie murther clergie saued thousande pounde king richarde gaue one farthing saying woulde vntrue good maister would false duke confessed whole conspiracieduke buckingham beheaded vpon second nouember without araignement iudgement salisburie beheaded whilest thing thus handled england henrie earle richmond prepared armie fiue thousand briton fortie wel furnished shippes al thyngs prepared day setting forward appoynted xij october whole armie hoysed vp sayles tooke sea toward night wind turned huge tempest arose ship dispersed sunder driuen normandie againe britaine morning tempest asswaged earle approched south parte england mouth hauen pole dorcet might see bankes full men warre appoynted defend arriuall wherfore gaue charge man shoulde lande vntil tyme whole nauie assembled perceyued none ship appeare hoysed vp ankers away arriued safe normandie returned lande britaine soone aduertised duke buckingham loste hys head marque dorcet great number noble men england little enquired hym meane season king richarde apprehended diuers partes realme certaine gentleman ye earle richmondes faction amongst sir george browne sir roger clifford iiij put death london iij december sir thomas sentlegar marryed duches excester king owne sister rame diuers executed excester xxx december great fire leaden hall infire leaden hall london london brent much housing stock gunnes like prouision belonging ye citie king richard called parliament which1484 attainted earle richemond person led realme feare cause enemyes natural countrie landes good confiscate king vse yet notwithstanding laid people great taxe troublesome season nothing maruelledanno reg lorde stanley bene taken considering working lady margaret wyfe mother earle richemond muche enterpryse woman hym reputed regarde estimation lorde stanley hir husband purged hym selfe innocent attemptes hir committed giuen charge keepe hir secrete place home without hauing seruaunt company thence forth shee shoulde neuer send letter hir sonne friendes kyng myghte bee molested commaundement whyle put execution yeere king richard began high towre westminster remaineth yet vnfinished also caused thek henry sixt remoued vvindso body king henry sixte remoued chertesey abbey surrey buried windsor nowe resteth xij august richard chester thomas britaine september sherifes ralph austry februarie tho hill grocer october w stocker draper maiors sep anno iohn ward grocer sep william collingborne made ryme iij kingcolingborne executed richards cousellers lord louell sir richard ratclife sir william catesby ratte catte louell dogge rule england vnder hogge drawne fro westmin towre london hyll hanged headed quartered king richard considering ities concluded betweene prince cause realmes fortified double power say owne strength ayde friendes practised league king scot long made diuers incursion roades realme englande therefore sued haue truce peace concluded wherfore commissioner appointed met notingham end concluded iij yeeres certaine article xv numbertruce vvith scotland three yeeres peace thus concluded king richard nowe doubtyng owne people continually vexed feare returne earle richmond complices wherfore nothing purpose agayne price prayer attempt duke britaine whose territorie erle abode deliuer hand wherfore incontinent sent certaine ambassador duke britaine tooke vpon king richard shoulde yeerely pay aunswere duke britaine al reuenewes rente profites landes possession well belonging earle richmond noble gentlema erles companie time would keepe continuall prison restrayne libertie orator furnished instruction ariued britaine could speake wt duke reason weakned long dayly infirmitie began waxe ydle remembraunce whiche cause peter landoyse chiefe treasurer ruled thing pleasure vnto english ambassador moued message offering rewardes land haue offered duke peter faythfully promised accomplishe king richardes request kept promise wyth fortune fauourable publike weale england deadly compact tooke none effect iohn morton byshop elie soiourning flaunders al craftie deuise certified wherfore sent christopher vrswike declare earle richemond deceyt giuing charge hast possible company retire britaine fraunce newes came earle incontinent sent charles french king requiring myght safely passe fraunce desire graunted earle rest dispatched priuily mought fraunce man susspecting departure erle tooke iourney charles frenche king great thanks giuen disclosed occasion accesse person required helpe succour intent myghte returne nobilitie realme generally called take vpo crowne king charles promysed ayde bad hym good comforte assured woulde gladly shewe to1485 bountifull liberalitie while earle richemond thus attended frenche court iohn vere earle oxforde perswaded iames blonte captaine hame castle sir iohn forteskewe porter towne calleis selfe set libertie also leauing fruitfull office condescended goe fraunce earle richemond meane season king richard credibly aduertised promise othes earle confederate made sworne erles meanes english men passed britaine fraunce wherefore manner desperate imagining howe infringe earles purpose meane mariage lady elizabeth niece pretend clayme crowne came minde thing onely detestable much cruell put execution cleerelye determined reconcile fauour brother wife queene elizabeth meanes earle richemond affinitie nice shoulde bee vtterly defrauded ingenious remedie coulde bee otherwyse inuented shoulde happen queene anne hys wyfe departe worlde himselfe woulde rather take wyfe hys cosin nice ladye elizabeth lacke affinitie whole realme shoulde runne ruyne wherefore hee sent queene sanctuarie diuers often messenger whiche shoulde excuse hym thing agaynst hir attempted shoulde largelye promyse promotion onely hir hir sonne thomas marque dorset shoulde bryng hir possible wan hope messenger perswaded queene shee beganne somewhat ent muche shee faythfully promysed yeelde hir selfe kyngs wyll pleasure shee first delyuered vnto kyng richardes handes hir fyue daughter afterwarde shee sent letter marque hir sonne beyng paris wyth earle richemond wylling hym wyse repayre englande prouided great honour assertayning hym offence party forgiuen forgotten king richarde hadde thus pleased mutable mynde queene elizabeth caused hir daughter bee conueyed palace solempne receyuing nowe nothing contrarie purpose ut mansion voyde wyfe first abstayned bedde companye hys wyfe complayned many infortunate barrennesse wife procured common rumor published among common people queene dead queen heard tell horrible rumor hir death sprong amongst communaltie sore suspected world almost ende hir long howsoeuer fortuned queene departed life due solemnitie buryed westminster king thus losed bond matrimony began cast fancie lady elizabeth hys neece making much suite haue hir ioyned lawfull matrimonie bycause men mayden hir selfe detested thys vnlawfull copulation hee determined deferre matter till quiet case thys season oppressed weighty affayres euery syde considering dayly parte nobilitie sayled france priuily fauoured earle richmond amongst noble men whome hee suspected principall thomas lorde stanley sir wyllyam stanley hys brother gilbert talbot sixe hundred whose purpose though king richard ignorant yet gaue credence one least lord stanley bycause ioyned matrimonie wyth lady margaret mother earle richmond sayde lorde stanley would haue departed hys countrey king wyse woulde suffer hym departe lefte hostageanno reg courte george stanley lord strange first begotten sonne heire whyle kyng richarde thus troubled sodeynely hee hearde newes castell hame delyuered handes earle richmonde meanes earle oxford onely also iames blunt captayne castell fledde france ayde earle richmond henry earle richmond obteyning king charles small crue men borowing certayne summes money hym dyuers hys priuate friendes hee departed french court came citie roane whyle taryed making prouision harefleete mouth riuer seyne thing necessarye hys nauye tydings broughte hym kyng richarde beeyng wythout child widdower intended shortly marrye wyth lady elizabeth hys brother daughter whyche newes hee tooke small momente thys thyng onely tooke away hys companyous theyr hope obteyne happye enterprise reason whereof hee iudged hys friendes englande woulde shrinke yet notwithstanding earle henry richmonde bycause woulde longer linger weerie hys friendes lyuing betweene hope feare determined hast conuenient sette forwarde caryed hys shippes armour weapon vitiayle ordinance expedient warre beeyng done onely accompanyed wyth two thousande men small number shyppes weyed vp hys anckers kalendes august hee sayled harefleete wyth prosperous wynde seauenth day afterhenry earle richmond landed milford hauen hee arriued wale euening port called milford hauen incontinente tooke lande came place called dale sunne rising remoued hereford west receyued people wyth great ioy thence remoued cardigan fiue mile hereford west whether came earle richard griffith men power day came iohn morgan wyth hys men earle aduanced forwarde making abode anye place sodeynly hee ascertayned sir walter harbert rice appe thomas harnesse hym readye encounter wyth hys armye stoppe theyr passage wherefore first determined set vpon eyther destroye take fauour hys power gyue battayle king richarde intent friendes shoulde knowe de teritie attempted enterprise forwarde sent messenger letter instruction ladye margaret mother lorde stanley brother talbot declaring holpe ayde friendes intended passe ouer riuer seuerne shrewsburie passe directly citie london requiring speciall trust hope fidelitie woulde meete waye diligent preparation messenger departed marched forward towardes shrewsburie passage mette saluted rice ap thomas goodly band welchmen submitted himselfe whole order commaundement meane tyme messenger laden rewardes returned daye entred shrewsburie made relation friendes readie poyntes doe thing myghte doe earle henrie continued iourney came little towne called newporte pitched campe little hyll adioyning reposing himselfe nyghte euenyng day came sir george talbot whole power young earle shrewsburie beyng warde accounted ij thousand men thus power increasing arriued towne stafforde paused whome came sir william stanley accompanyed fewe person earle departed thence lytchfield lay without walles campe night next morning entred towne lyke prince receiued day two lorde stanley hauing band almost fiue thousand men lodged towne hearing ye earle richemond marching thetherward gaue hym place dislodging repaired towne called adrestone abiding comming ye earle auoyde suspition afraide least seene openly fawtor ayder earle sonne law day batiayle king richard yet vtterly put mistrust woulde put cruel death sonne heire apparat george lord strange king richard hostage king richard season keeping house castle notingham informed earle richmond banished men fled england arryued wale thing necessarie enterprise vnpurueyed weake nothing meete withstande power suche king hadde appointed resist yet notwithstandyng sent iohn duke norfolke henrie earle northumberlande thomas earle surrey hys trustie friendes willyng muster viewe theyr seruauntes tenaunts electe moste couragious actiue person whole number repaire presence al speede also wrote robert brakenburie lieutenaunt ye tower commaundyng power come armie bring fellow armes bouchier sir walter hungerford diuers knight esquiers cast small suspition thus ordring affayres tidings came earle richmond passed seuerne come shrewsburie detriment encombraunce message sore mooued cryed contrarie othe deceyued haste sent viewe way enemyes kepte passed declared king earle encamped ye towne litchfield wherof whe perfect knowledge hauing cotinuall repayre subiects incotinently made battayles set forwarde toward ye way enimies reported intended passe keeping array great pomp entred towne leycester sunne set earle richmond reysed campe lichfield tomworth midde way passing saluted sir walter hungerford sir thomas bourchier knightes diuers others submitted themselues pleasure diuers noble personage likewise resorted withall power hapned progression earle richmond strange chance little afrayd bycause could assured father law thomas lord stanley whiche yet enclyned neyther partie wherfore earle accompanyed twenty light horseman lingring iourney behind host meane whole armie came towne tomworth darkenesse coulde perceyue steppe passed wandred hyther thither seeking companye abode little uillage three mile armie tarried night next morning dawning returned good fortune came armie excusing himselfe haue gone way ignorance purpose excuse made priuily departed agayne downe aderstone lorde stanley sir william brother band abiding earle came father law little close saluted sir william brother consulted giue battayle king richard would abide whome knew farre huge armie euening day sir iohn sauage sir brian san ord sir simon digby many leauing king richarde turned came earle richmond elect companye men meane season king richard marched place meete two battayles encounterbattayle bosvvorth uillage called bosworth farre leycester pitched field refreshed armie tooke rest next day king richard furnished men abiliments warre bringing men camp ye playne ordered forewarde maruellous length appoynted horseman footemen forefront placed archer ouer battayle captayne iohn duke norffolke whome thomas earle surrey hys sonne long vauntgard followed king richarde strong company approued men warre hauyng horseman wing side battayle earle richmond returned communication wyth hys friendes hee wyth diligence pitched hys fielde iust campe hys enimies lodged nighte morning betime caused hys men put theyr armour apparrell themselues fight gyue battayle sente lorde stanley requiring hym wyth hys men approche neere hys armye helpe set souldyers array answered earle shoulde sette hys owne men good order whyle hee woulde come hym tyme conueniente earle made hys forewarde somewhat single slender according small number hys people front hee placed archer whome hee made captayne iohn earle oxforde right wing battayle appoynted sir gilbert talbot leader lefte wing assigned sir iohn sauedge hee wyth ayde lord stanley accompanyed wyth earle pembrooke hauyng good companye horssemen small number footemenne hys whole number exceeded fyue thousande menne besyde power stanley whereof three thousand fielde vnder sir william stanley kyngs number double much armyes thus ordred men ready set forwarde king richard called hys chiefetaynes togyther perswadyng valiaunt c people vnfaythfull ende hys nephewes vntrue vnnaturall begynnyng earle richmond knewe king neere embattayled rode aboute hys armie giuyng comfortable wordes men whiche made pithie oration perswadyng haue victorie fyght iust quarrell scantlye finished hys saying one armye espyed betweene bothe armyes great marrishe earle lefte hys ryght hande doyng hadde sunne hys backe face hys enemyes king sawe earles companye passed marrishe commaunded wyth haste set vpon terrible shotte side passed armyes ioyned came hande stroke whiche incounter lorde stanley ioyned earle earle oxforde meane season fearing least company fighting compassed enemy gaue commaundement man go aboue x foote fro standard commaundement knowne kni themselues together ceased litle fro fighting enemy sodainely abashed matter mistrusting fraude began also pause earle oxford bringing band together one part set enemy freshly againe aduersaryes perceyuing placed men slender thinne thicke broade behynde begynnyng agayne battayle whyle two fore wardes thus mortally foughte kyng richarde admonished earle richmond accompanyed wyth small number men armes farre approched hym perfectly knewe hys personage beeyng inflamed yre put hys spurres hys horse rode side range battayle leauyng vauntgardes fighting wyth earein wrest ranne towarde earle perceyued well king furiou lye comming towarde bycause whole hope wealth purpose bee determined battayle e gladlye pr fere encounter body body man man king richarde set sharply first brunt ouerthrew earles standard slew sir william brandon sta derdbearer matched hand hande sir iohn cheny man great force strength would haue ed saide iohn man fully ouerthrowne making open passage dint sworde went forwarde earle richmonde withstoode hys violence kept sword point longer companion thought almost dispaire victorie sodainelye recomforted sir william stanley whiche came succour tall men instaunt king richards men driuen backe fled himselfe manfully fighting middle enimies flaine meane season earle oxforde ayde lorde stanley long fight disco ited fore ward king richarde wherof greate number slaine chase greatest number yt came fielde neuer gaue stroke battaile died fewe aboue number person nobilitie flaine iohn duke norffolke walter lord ferrers chartley sir richarde ratclife robert brakenburie liuetenat tower many gentleman moe sir william catesby learned lawes realme one thiefe counsellours late king diuerse two dayes beheaded leicester amongst ranne awaye syr frauncis vicount louel humfry stafforde thomas stafford brother toke sanctuarie saint iohns glocester erle richmond part wer slayn scarce person amongst principal sir william brandon standardbearer battel fought bosworth lecestershire august yeare lord whole conflict udured little aboue two hour earle thus obtained victorie rendered thankes god souldiours litie people cryed king henry king henry lord stanley sa good people tooke crowne kyng richarde whiche founde amongest spoile fielde sette earles head thoughe hee beene elected kyng voyce people whole campe remoued towne leicester rested two dayes meane season dead corp king richarde shamefully carryed towne leicester gorgeouslye daye pompe departed towne body naked skinne muche one clowte aboute hym trussed behinde pursiuant armes like hogge calfe head armes hanging one side horsse leg side sprinckled myre bloud brought gray frier church within town homely buried raigned two yeres two moneths one daye p henrie erle richmonde henry seauenth borne anno reg penbrooke castell began raigne xxij auguste yeare oure lorde god prince maruellous wisedom policie iustice temperaunce grauitie notwithstandyng manye greate occasion trouble warre kept realme right good order greately reuerenced forraine prince forenamed xxij august greate fyreparson saint mildreds bren bredstreete london whiche fire brente parson saint mildreds one man parsonage king henry departure leicester sente sir robert willoughbey knight manour sherenton yorke edwarde plantagenet earle warwike sonne heire george duke clarence age fifteene yeares sente vppe tower london put vnder sure custody meane season kyng remoued towards london approched citie august maior magistrate company clothed violet met shoredich great pompe conueyed citie saint paules church hee offered three standard one saint george seconde red dragon thirde dun cowe prayer saide te deum sung departed bishoppes pallaice soiourned season sweating beganne one twentith september continued till ende october ye sicknesse wonderfull number dyed london besids dyed thomas maior whose place chosen william stocker likewise deceased seauen dayes space departed foure alderman thomas ilam richard ramson thomas norland iohn stocker chosen maior iohn warde continued til feast simon iude iohn tate iohn swan september sherifes maior sir hugh brice goldsmith october euen sainte simon iude king henrie came kenington house vnto lambeth dyned wt thomas bourcher archbishoppe canterburie cardinal saint ciria thermis dinner goodlye company estate realme spirituall temporal thence wet tower london land ouer london bridge noble riding guise frace vpon small hackney two two vppon horsse london bridge ende maior london brother craftes met receyued king king proceeded grace church corner tower morrowe feast daye simon iude king henrie created thomas lord stanley earle darby edwarde courtney earle deuonshire iasper earle penbroke created duke bedforde one time tower london thirtith october king henrie crowned westminster ordayned number chosen archer strong hardie person giue dayly attendaunce parson whome named yeoman guarde seauenth nouember beganne parliamente westmi ster establishing thing whiche caused proclaimed al men pardoned al offence shoulde restored landes good would submit themselues clemency began remember especial friendes aduannced honor dignitie enriched possession good beginne lord chandew brytaine made earle bath sir gyles dawbeney made lord dawbeny sir robert willoughby lorde broke edward stafford eldest sonne henrie late buckingham restored dignitie possession parliament dissolued king redeemed marque dorset sir iohn bourcher left pledge paris mony borrowed sent also flaunders iohn morton byshop ely eighteenth daye ianuarie king henrie married lady elizabeth eldest daughter edward fourth whiche meanes two family yorke lancaster long bene great diuision vnited made one king henrie sente lorde treasurer maister bray vnto lorde maior london requiring1486 loane king hym citizen preste markes wherefore maior hys brother common graunted prest two thousand pound leuied co panies ward prest repayred againe yeare next followinganno reg wheate sold iij shilling bushell bay salt like price moneth september queene elizabeth deliuered hir first son named arthur winchester iohn perciuall hugh clopton septemb sir henry collet mercer octob beautifull crosse cheape newe builded towarde building whereof thomas fisher mercer gaue markes sir richarde simon wily priest came geralde erle kildare deputie irelande presented hym lad scholler named lambert fained ye sonne george duke clarence lately escaped tower london childe hadde learned prieste princely behauiour lightly moued earle manye noble irelande tendering bloude royall rycharde plantagenet george sonne also maligning aduancement house lancaster henry seauenth eyther thinke make world weene thought verily childe edward earle warwicke duke clarence lawfull sonne althoughe king henrie tha halfe marred sport shewing right earle thorowe streates london yet lady margaret dutch burgoigne sister edwarde fourth iohn de la poole hir nephewe lorde louell sir thomas broughton knight capitaines thys conspiracy deuised abuse colour yong earles name preferring purpose came good agreed depose lambert erecte verye erle deede nowe prisoner tower whose quarrell pretended fight deemed likely haue beene made awaye wherfore blazed ireland kyng mocke subiects schooled boye take vpon earle warwickes name shewed hym aboute london blind eies simple folke defeate lawfull inheritor duke clarence theyr countreyman protectour hys lyfe whose lynage also diuided tytle crowne al ye hast assemble diueline christes church crowned idoll honouring tytles emperiall feasting triumphing rearing mighty showtes cry carying thence king castel vppon tall men shoulder might seene noted surely honourable boy looke vppon thys meane tyme earle lincolne lordedward hall louell hadde gotten ayde sayde margaret aboute almaines martin swart germaine martiall actes verye experte capitaine notable foundation poore done king henry seauenth vnto purchased gaue land releeuing one hundred poore people first named sauoy place peter earle sauoy rec canterbury church father boniface archbishop cardinall eighte hundred manner rerewarde sir anthony oughtred sir iohn neuell king speares followed foure hundred whole armye eleauen thousande three hundred men maister ordinace set forth king artillerie faulcons slyngs bombard powder stone bowes arrowes suche thing necessarye fielde whole number carriage thirteene hundred leader driuers nineteene hundred men king laye firste nighte betwixte calkewell freydon nexte night castel gwisnes bocarde next night laye beside arde good waye wythout englishe pale little beyonde dernome came greate hoste french men purposed haue sette vpon kyng hoste kepte ground shotte greate ordinaunce wherewyth aray french men broken fourth august king good order battell came citie turwine planted siege warlike wise eleuenth day august maximilian emperor came king henrye receiued greate triumph betweene aire campe emperor seruants reteyned king englande wage daye euery person according degree emperor king souldioure ware crosse saint george rose hee traine came king campe thirteenth august receyued wyth greate magnificence three twentith august towne turwine turvvine yeelded k henry giuen ouer vnto kyng england wyth condition men towne mighte safely passe wyth horsse harnesse foure twentith auguste came oute towne foure thou men warre moewell appointed whereof sixe hundred well horsed theyr standardes borne sixe twentith august king remoued singate agreed walles gate bulwarkes tower turwine shoulde defaced razed caste downe whyche conclusion emperoureturvviue raced brent sent word saint omers aire whych ioyous tydings sente thither pioners englishe pioners brake wals gate tower filled ditch fiered towne except cathedrall churche palaice ordinaunce king sente aire kept vse concluded king person shoulde laye hys siege citie turney wherefore hee sente forwarde three goodly battayles firste conducted earle shrewsburie seconde battell led king hymselfe wyth whome emperour rerewarde conducted lorde harbert firste nyghte laye campe beside aire fourteenth september king hys armye came beatwin morrowe passed forwarde came straite forde whiche greate difficultie passed next day passed bridge called fount anandiew c one twentith daye september kyng remoued hys campe towarde tourney lodged wythin three myles citie whyche nighte came hym emperour palsgraue people aboutking henry ieged turney tourney theyr goodes fledde citie yet citie hadde menne warre defende wyth multitude inhabitantes citie well replenished kyng came aray battell tourney planted ordinaunce rounde abonte citie dyuers french caste rampiers made citizen coulde issue oute ayde come wherevpon length weete nyne twentith september citie yeelded king appointed lorde isle lorde burgeyny lorde willoughby take possession whyche wyth sixe thousande menne entered citie tooke market place walles mayster thomas wolsey king almoner called citizen sware kyng englande number whiche citizen four score thousande seconde daye october king entred citie turney ordayned sir edwarde poynings knight order garter hys lieuetenaunt wyth captaines horseman archer artillerie conuenient hee made hys almoner thomas wolsey byshoppe tourney returned honorious estate sodeiue falling againe haue bin enformed person good credite thomas wolsey poore man sonne ipswich ascending thomas vvolsey countie suffolke borne child apt learned meanes parent cardinal armes hatte cognisance deuises glorious sorte thought thereby haue appeased olde displeasure deceasse lorde marquesse thys schoolemayster considering himselfe simple beneficed man haue lost fellowship colledge much reliefe thought long vnprogided help trauell thereabout fell acquayntance one sir iohn naphant sir iohn naphant treasurer caleis thomas vvolsey chaplayne graue auntient knight great caleis vnder king henry seauenth knight hee serued behaued hymselfe discretely obteyned especiall fauour mayster muche committed charge hys office vnto hys chaplayne vnderstand office treasureship caleis consideration hys greate age discharged hys roome returned agayne englande hys instant labour hys chaplaynethomas vvolsey vvas chapleyne henry vij promoted bee kyngs chaplayne hee cast ancker porte promotion wrought shall somewhat declare hauing ust occasion sight king dayly reason hee sayde masse hym hys closet bee ng done spet day ydlenesse would attend vpon whome thought beare rule counsell tyme doctor fox bishop winchester secretarie lord priuie seale also sir thomas louell knight sage counsellor mayster wardes connestable tower graue counsellor proces time perceyued chapleyne haue fine witte thought meete person preferred wittie affaire chanced certayne season king vrgent occasion send embassador vnto emperour maximilian lay present low countrey flanders farre caleis bishop winchester sir thomas louell whome king counselled debated vppon embassage saw conuenient occasion preferre king chapleyne whose witte eloquence learning highly commended king king commanded bring chapleyne presence whome fell communication great matter perceyuing witte fyne thoughte hym sufficiente commaunding hym therevpon prepare hymselfe hys iourney hauing hys depeach tooke hys leaue king richmond noone came london four clocke barge graues ende ready launch forth prosperousthomas vvolsey embassadour emperour tyde winde without abode entred barge passed foorth suche speede hee arriued graues ende within little three houres hee tarryed longer post horsses prouiding trauayled speedily hee came douer nexte morning whereas passenger readye vnder sayle caleis passenger without tarrying entred sayled foorth wyth long noone hee arriued calleis hauing post horsses departed thence speede night emperour disclosed whole summe embassage emperor required speedie expedition granted emperour next day cleerely dispatched king requestes fully accomplished time made longer delay tooke post horsses night rode towarde caleis conducted thyther person emperour appoynted opening gate caleis came thither passenger readie returne england iourney forward muche arriued douer tenne clocke noone hauing post horsses came court richmond night taking rest vntill morning repayred king first comming bedchamber closet whome king sawe hee checked iourney sir quoth may please youre highnesse haue already bin emperour dispatched affayres trust grace contentation presented king letter credence emperoure king great confuse wonder speedy returne proceeding dissembled wonder demanded whether encountred pursiuant sent vnto supposing london letter concerning necessary matter neglected consultatio yes forsooth quoth chaplayne met yesterday way hauing vnderstanding grace letter pleasure haue withstanding bin bold vpon mine owne discretion perceyuing matter necessary behalfe dispatch forasmuch haue exceeded grace commission humbly require grace pardon king reioycing little sayd pardon thereof also giue princely thankes proceeding therein also good speedie exployte commanding time take rest repaire agayne dinner relation ambassade embassador saw tyme repaired king counsayle declared effect affaire exactly grauitie eloquence counsell heard commended esteeming expedition almost beyond capacitie man king gaue time deanerie lincolne thecethomas vvolsey deane lincolne forward grew estimation authoritie promoted king hys almoner death king henry seauenth andthomas vvolsey king almoner flourishing youth king henry eyght thys almoner handled himselfe politiquely soone found meanes made one king counsailethomas vvolsey priuie counsayle vvith king henry eyght grow fauour king whome king gaue house bridewell fleete streete sometyme sir richard empsons kept house familie dayly attended vpon king especiall fauour great sute made vnto sentence wittie perswasions counsell chamber alwayes pithie counsayle occasion moued continually assigned expositor king proceeding whome king receyued leaning fantasie earnest readyest counsayle aduance king pleasure king therefore esteemed highly counsaylors put great fauour much king committed vnto disposition almoner perceyuing tooke vpon therefore discharge king weightie troublesome businesse per wading king neede spare time pleasure businesse happen counsell whereas counsaylours would diuers time perswade king haue sometime recourse counsell chamber heare done almoner would perswade contrarie delighted much thus almoner ruled hys policie witte bring passe hygh fauoure maister almoner ruled vnder king maister almouer thus perseuered fauour vntill last came present giftes reward plentifully lacked nothing might eyther please fantasie enrich coffer thus proceeding fortune blisfulnesse chanced warres betweene realmes englande france open much king beeing fully perswaded hys royall person inuade hys foraigne enimies puissant armye wherefore necessarye thys royall enterprise shoulde bee speedily prouided furnished euery degree thing apt conueniente expedition whereof king thought man witte meete policie paynefull trauayle hys almoner whome therefore committed hys whole trust therein hee tooke vpon hym whole charge businesse brought thing good passe decent order manner victualles prouisions necessaryes conueniente noble voyage armie thing beeyng hym perfected king aduanced hys royall enterprise passed sea marched forwarde good order battayle vntill hee came strong towne turwyne whyche hee layde hys seege assayled strongly continually vehemente assaultes within short space yeelded vnto hys maiestie vnto place emperour maximilian repaired vnto king greate armie like mightie prince taking king grace wage rare thing seldome seene emperour fighte vnder king banner thus king obteyned puissant fort taken possession thereof sette thynges due order defence preseruation thereof hys vse departed thence marched towarde citie turney layde hys seege like manner gaue fierce sharpe assault constreyned fine force render towne vnto victorious maiestie time king gaue almoner bishoprike seathomas vvolsey bishop turney towards hys paynes diligence susteyned iourney king established thing agreeable pleasure furnished noble captaynes men warre safegard towne hee returned agayne englande taking diuers noble personage france prisoner duke longuile uicount clarimont whiche taken skirmishe whose returne immediately sea lincolne fell voyde death doctor smith late bishop benefice grace gaue almoner late bishop turney elect negligent take possession thereof andthomas vvolsey bishop lincolne made speede could hys consecration solemnization whereof ended found meanes gate possession predecessor goodes hand long doctor bambridge archbishop yorke dyed rome king embassador vnto sea king immediately presented hys late newe bishop lincolne three bishoprickes hand one yeare giuen hym prepared translation sea lincolne vntothomas vvolsey archbishop york sea yorke whiche solemnization done beeing archbyshop prima angliae thought himselfe sufficiente compare canterbury therevppon erected hys crosse court euery place well within precinct iurisdiction canterbury anye place muche canterbury claymeth superioritie ouer yorke ouer bishoprikes within englande cause claymeth knowledge aunciente obedience yorke abate aduauncing hys crosse presence crosse canterburie notwythstanding yorke nothing minding desiste bearing thereof manner sayde beefore caused hys crosse aduaunced well presence canterburie elsewhere wherefore canterburie moued therewith gaue vnto yorke certayne checke hys presumption reason whereof engendred grudge betweene yorke caunterburie yorke intending prouide suche meanes hee woulde bee rather superior dignitie canterburie eyther obedient equall hym wherefore hee obtayned made prieste cardinall legatus de latere vnto whome pope sente cardinal hat wyththomas vvolsey cardinall certayne bulles hys aucthoritie behalfe yet shall vnderstande pope sente hym thys worthye hatte dignitie iewell hys honoure aucthoritie whych conueyed varlet budget seemed menne bee person small estimation wherfore yorke beyng aduertised basenesse messenger people opinion thought meete hys honour iewell conueyed simple person therefore caused stopped way immediatly arriualin england newly furnished manner apparell wyth kynde costlye silkes whyche seemed decent suche hyghe embassador done encountred vppon blacke heath receyued wyth greate assemblye prelate lustie gallant gentleman thence conducted throughe london greate triumph greate speedie preparation made westminster abbey confirmation acceptance thys hygh order dignitie whyche executed byshoppes abbot aboute nyghe london wyth theyr rych myters cope ornament done solempne wise bene seene like vnlesse bin coronation myghty prince king obtayning thys dignitie thoughte himselfe mee e beare aucthoritie among temporall power among spirituall iurisdiction wherefore remembring well tawntes sustained canterburie hauing respecte aduauncement worldlye honor promotion found mean king made lord chancelourthomas vvolsey lord chacelour englande canterburie whiche chanceloure dismissed continued roume since long deceasse henrie seauenth nowe possession chancelorshippe endued wyth promotion archebyshoppe cardinall de latere hauyng power correcte canterburie al byshops spirituall person assemble hys conuocation would assigne hee tooke vpon hym correction matter iurisdictions visited spirituall house hauing euerye diocesse maner spirituall minister commissary scribe apparators al officer furnish hys court presented preuention pleased vnto al benefice throughout thys realme aduauncing legantine iurisdiction honor hadde maisters faculty maisters ceremontarum suche glorifying dignitie two great cross syluer one hys archebyshopricke hys legacie borne whyther euer wente rode two tallest priestes hee coulde gette wythin realme encrease gaines also byshopricke durham abbey saint albons commendation doctor foxe byshopthomas vvolsey byshoppe vvinchester winchester dyed surrendred durham ryngs handes tooke winchester hys hande firme bishoprickes bathe worcester hereforde sorasmuch incumbent stranger made abode continually beyond sea owne country else rome whence sente legation thys realme vnto king rewarde departure kyng henrie seauenth gaue bishoprickes beeing stranger thoughte meete assuraunce suffer cardinal haue benefice conuenient summe mony payd yearely remayned either troubled charge yearely burdened conueyance theyr reuenues vnto al spiritual presentation byshoprickes fully hys disposition prefer listed also greate number daylye attending vpon hym noble men worthye gentleman small number tallest yeoman coulde gette realme insomuche well nobleman gentleman coulde prefer tall yeoman seruice ye shal vnderstande hallthe order cardinalies house continually three boordes kepte three seueral principall officer say stewarde whych alwayes priest treasourer knight comptroller esquier also cofferer beeyng doctor three marshalles three yeoman usher hall besides two groomes almoner hal kitchen two clearks kitchen clearke comptroller surueyor dressor clearke spicerie whyche togither kepte also continuall messe hal also hys hall kitchin hee maister cooke twoo cooke laborer child kitchin twelue person foure yeoman scullerie foure yeoman siluer scullerie two yeoman pastry two pastelers vnder yeoman priuie kitchin master cooke went daylye ueluet sattin wyth chayne golde wyth two yeoman groome scalding house yeoman twoo groomes pantery twoo person buttrey two yeoman two groomes twoo page yewrye lykewise seller three yeoman three page hys chaundrey two wafarie two wardrobe beddes maister wardrobe person laundry yeoman groome thirtie page two yeoman purueyors one groome bake house yeoman two groomes wood yarde yeoman groome barne one garden yeoman two groomes porter gate twoo yeoman two groomes yeoman hys barge maister hys horse clearke stable yeoman sadler farrier yeoman hys chariot sumpter man yeoman styrrop muleter sixeteene groomes hys stable euery kepte foure gelding almorie yeoman groome inthomas vvolseys chappell hys chappel hadde deane greate diuine man excellent learning subdeane repeater quire gospeller pistler singing priestes ten master child secular chappell singing men twelue singing child tenne one seruant awaite vppon child reuestry yeoman two groomes ouer besides dyuers reteiners came thither principal feastes furniture hys chappell passeth capacitie declare number costly ornamentes riche iewels occupyed continuallye hathe beene seene procession aboute hall rich coapes one sute worne besides riche cross candlestickes ornamentes furniture hee two crossebearers two piller bearer hys great chamber hys priuy chamber person fyrste chiefe chamberlaine uizchamberlaine gentleman usher besides one priuie chamber hadde twelue daylye wayters gentleman wayters hys priuye chamber hadde sixe lordes nyne tenne hadde eche two men allowed attend vpon except erle darby allowed fiue men gentleman cup bearer caruers sewer beth priuie chamber great chamber wyth gentleman dayly wayters fortie person ofyeomen usher sixe groomes chamber eight yeoman chamber fiue fortie daylye also almose men sometime number sometime attending borde doctor chapleines besides chappell sixeteene daylye clearke closet secretary two two clearkes signet foure counsellours learned lawe asmuche necessarie haue dyuers officer chauncerie attende vppon hym saye clearke crowne ryding clearke clearke hamper chafer waxe clearke checke well vppon chapleins yeoman chamber hee also foure footemen whyche garnished riche running coates euer rode anye iourney hee harraulte armes sergeant armes phisition poticarie foure minstrel keeper tent armorer instructer hys ward two yeoman hys wardrobe hys robe keeper hys chamber continuallye court also house surueyor yorke clearke greene cloth dayly attending downe lying vprising meales kepte greate chamber continuall borde chamberers gentleman officer hauing wyth messe yong lord gentleman besides neuer officer gentleman worthy person allowed house three two al one leaste whiche grewe greate number person thus far ute checker roll besides officer seruantes teyners futers moste commoulye dyned hallthomas vvolsey tvvice embassador emperour charles thus furnished sente twice embassade emperor charles fifth diuers vrgent cause touchyng king maiestie thought noble prince cardinall moste meete sente wherefore readye take vppon hym charge thereof furnished degree purpose moste lyke greate prince firste proceeded forth furnished lyke cardinall hys gentleman beeyng verye many number clothed lyuerie coates crimosin ueluet best wyth chaines golde aboute theyr neckes hys yeoman meane officer coates fine scarlet garded blacke ueluet hande broade thus furnished twice sente flaunders emperour lying bruges highly entertain discharging al charge me house within town bruges wherein gentlema cardinal lodged recourse owner commaunded emperoures officer vpon paine liues shoulde take mony anye thing cardinalles seruantes diode take anye kinde victuall althoughe disposed make anye costlye banquet commaunding forthermore saide hostes see lacked thing honestly required honesty pleasure also emperor officer euery night wet town fro house house whereas english gentleme repast lodged serued liueries night done maner first officer brought house cast fine manchet siluer two great pot white wine sugar waighte pounde white light yellowe lightes ware boule siluer wyth goblet drinke euerye night staffe torche order liueries euerye nighte morning officer came fetch away stuffe woulde accompte hostes gentleman costes spent daye thus emperoure entertayned cardinall traine time embassage done returned englande great triumphe nowe hys order going westminster hall dayly terme firste ere came hys priuie chamber hearde seruice closet said hys seruice wyth hys chaplaine goyng againe hys priuy chamber woulde demaunde seruants readynesse furnished hys chamber presence wayghting chamber thereof aduertized came oute hys priuy chamber aboute eighte clocke apparelled red saye hys vpper garment eyther fine scarlet else fine crimosin taffata commonlye fine crimosin satten engrayned hys pillion fine scarlet necke sette inner side wyth blacke ueluet tippet sable aboute hys necke holding hys hand orenge wherof substance within taken oute filled vppe againe wyth part sponge wherein uineger confection againste pestilent ayres whyche hee moste commonlye helde hys nose came among anye preace else pestered wyth manye suters beefore borne firste broade seale englande hys cardinales hat lorde gentlemanne worshippe right solempnely soone entred chaber presence two great cross attending borne hym cried gentleman usher going bare headed saide lordes maisters make waye lordes grace thus went downe hall wyth sergeant armes hym bearing greate mace siluer two gentleman carying twoo greate pillers siluer came hall dore hys mule trapped crimo n ueluet wyth saddle guilte styrrops attending vpponhym mounted hys two crossebearers piller bearer like case vppon greate horse trapped fine scarlet marched forward traine noble men gentleman hauing footman four number hym bearing eache guilte polare hand thus passed forth vntill came westminster hall dore lighted wente vppe thys manner chauncerie starre chamber howbeit moste commonlye woulde goe chancerie stay barre made hym beneath chancerie righte hande commune sometyme wyth judge time person done woulde repayre chancerie sitting vntill eleauen clocke hearing sutes determining matter thence woulde dyuers time go starre chamber occasion serued neyther spared highe ne lowe iudged euery state accordyng merites desert vsed also euerye sondaye resorte courte beeyng moste parte yeare greenewiche hys former triumphes takyng hys barge hys stayres furnished wyth yeoman standyng vppon bailes hys gentleman beeyng wythin aboute hym landed againe three crane vintr e thence hee rode vpon mule crosse pillar hat broade seale carryed afore hym horsebacke thamis streete vntill came billingsgate tooke barge againe rowed greenewiche receyued lordes chiefe officer king house treasurer comptroller conuyed vnto king chamber court wonderfully furnished wyth noble men gentleman dinner among lord hauing consultation king councell woulde departe homewarde like triumph thus greate honour triumph glory raigned long season ruling thynges within realme appertayning vnto king house alwayes resorted nobleman gentleman feasting banqueting embassador dyuers time al right nobly pleased king recreation repayre cardinalles house didde dyuers tymes yeare wanted preparation furniture banquet sette forth maskes mummery gorgeous sorte costly maner heauen beholde wanted dame damoisels meete apte daunce masker garnish place tyme kinde musicke harmony wyth fine voice bothe menne chyldren one tyme kyng came sodainely thither maskea maske banquet wyth dozen masker garmentes like shepheards made fine cloth golde crimosin satten paned cappes wyth uisars good visnomy haires beardes eyther fine goldewyre silke black silke hauing sixeteene torchbearer besides drum person wyth uisars clothed satten colour hys entring hall hee came water water gate wythout noise layd diuers chabers gun charged shot hys landing shotte whyche made suche tumble ye ayre like thunder made nobleman gentleman ladyes gentlewoman use shoulde meane comming sodainelye itting quiet solempne banquet vnder sorte first yee shall vnderstande table sette chamber presence iust couered lorde cardinall sitting vnder cloth estate hauing hys seruice alone sette lady wyth nobleman gentleman gentlewoman throughout table chamber one side whych made ioyned one table whiche order deuice done lorde sandes lorde chamberlaine king syr henrie gilforde comptroller kinges maiesties house immediately greate chamberlaine sayde comptroller sente looke shoulde meane thoughe knewe nothing matter looking oute windowes thamis retourned againe shewed hym seemed nobleman straungers arryued hys bridge comming embassadoures forreine prince quoth cardinal desire bycause speake frenche take paine goe hall receyue according estate conducte chamber shall see v noble personage beyng mery oure banquet desiring sitte downe v take parte fare wente hee incontinent downe hall whereas receyued wyth twentie newe torch conueyed vppe chamber wyth suche noyse drummes flewtes seldome hadde beene hearde like theyr entring chamber twoo twoo togyther went directlye cardinall hee sate saluted hym reuerentlye whome lorde chamberlaine saide sir muche bee straungers speake englishe haue desired declare vnto hauyng vnderstanding triumphaunt banquet assembled suche number excellent dame coulde doe lesse vnder supporte youre grace repayre hyther viewe well incomparable beautie accompanye mumme chaunce daunce sir require youre grace licence accomplishe saide cause comming whome cardinall saide well content doe went masker first saluted al dame returned moste worthiest opened greate cuppe golde filled wyth crownes peeces golde whome sette certaine peeces golde cast thus perusing ladyes gentlewoman loste wonne perusing maner al lady returned cardinal greate reuerence powring downe golde lefte cup whych aboue twoo hundred crown quoth cardinall caste dice wan whereat made great noise ioy thenquoth cardinall lord chamberlain pray quoth would shew seemeth nobleman amongest meete occupye seate place whome woulde moste gladly surrender according duety knewe spake lorde chamberlaine frenche rownding eare lorde chamberlaine saide lorde cardinall sir quoth confesse among suche noble personage whome grace appointe hym oute rest content disclose hymselfe accept place cardinal taking good aduisement among laste quoth seemes gentleman wyth blacke bearde shoulde euen arose oute hys chayre offered gentleman blacke bearde cap hande person whome offered chayre sir edwarde neuil comely knight much resembled king person maske anye king perceyuing cardinall deceyued could forbeare laughing pulled hys visar master neuels also dashed suche pleasaunt countenaunce cheere al noble estate assembled perceiuing king among reioyced much cardinal eft soones desired highnesse take place estate whome king aunswered woulde goe firste shifte hys apparell departed lorde cardinalles chamber newe apparelled whych tyme dish banquet cleane taken vppe table spred againe new cleane perfumed clothes euery man woman sitting stil vntill king masker came among againe newe apparelled king tooke seate vnder cloth estate commaunding euery person sit still came newe banquet kyng rest throughout table wherein serued two hundred diuers dish costly deuises suttilties thus passed forth night banqueting dauncing triumphes great comforte king pleasant regard nobilitie assembled thus passed cardinall time day daye yeare yeare suche greate wealth ioy triumph glorie hauyng alwayes hys side king especial fauor vntil fortune enuied prosperous estate worlde well knowne shall partely touched hereafter yeare moneth may sent englande xij c mason carpenter three hundred black frier anno reg great subsidy declared common house diuers cause king required subsidie pound reysed goodes land foure shilling euery pound demand many obiections wer made common one king already way loane two shilling pound pound demaund four shilling pouud amount whole pound third partthere vvas parish england haue prooued search record euery man goodes whiche coyne coulde within realme c among argument king sayde england parish euery parish pay suche summe named could great matter common answered proued england thirteene thousand parish long debating common granted two shilling pound euery man goodes land worth twentie pound might dispend twentie pound yeare vpward fortie shilling twentie pound twelue penny pound vnder fortie shilling euery head sixteene yeares vpward four penny paid two yeares parliament xxj may adiourned westminster among blacke monkes ended king palace westminster fourteenth august nine clocke night christerne king denmarke queene arriuingthe k qu denmarke leaden hall market london december citie couentry francis philip conspiracy couentrie schoole mayster king henxmen christopher pickering clearke king larder anthony manuile gentleman intended haue morguison sir robert iernegan wyth certayne dimilances caleis tooke diuers french prisoner first september doctour hanyball mayster ofa golden rose sent fro rome e hall rolles receyued london embassadour clement seauenth pope whiche brought rose gold token king presented windsore tree forged fine golde wrought branch leaues flower resembling rose set potte golde potte three feete tike fashion measure halfe pinte vppermost rose faire saphire leape pearced bignesse acorne tree height halfe english yard breadth foote ralph dodmer william roche september sherifes maior sir william bayly draper october chanced yeare passed grudge breake betweene french king duke burbon much duke safegard life fledde french king dominion whereof cardinall wolsey hauing intelligence comprised head king soueraigne lord could obteyne generall warre french king considering duke burbon fledde vnto emperour inuite like purpose wherefore hauing imagination head thought good mouea policie cardinall vvolsey end turned himselfe king matter king aduertised heereof conceyuing cardinal inuention last came consultation among counsell concluded embassade sente emperour matter whome king emperour ioyne warres french king duke burbon shouldthe duke burbon champion k england king france king champion generall fielde great number good souldiours ouer besides emperours armie small king pay vnto duke monethly wage himselfe retinue much sir iohn russell sir iohn russel lay continually beyond sea secret place receyue money king pay monethly duke duke began warres french king owne territorie dukedome king confisked owne hand perfectly knowne vnto duke enimies ayde england thus wrought french king much displeasure much french king constreyned1525 prepare puissant armie owne person resist duke power force king droue take pauy strong towne italy hys host securitie whereas king encamped hym wonderously strong intending enclose duke issue forth yet notwithstanding duke many time issue forth skirmished king let v returne agayne cardinall wolsey seemed sodeinly altered frenchanno reg emperiall howsoeuer came passe french king lying camp sent secretly englande priuie person wittie man treate peace betwixt french king king person named iohn iokin kept secretly might frenchman borne italian man great estimation france subtile witte elected entreate embassade french king giuen commission iokin secretly conuayde vnto richmond remayned vntill cardinall resortediohn iokin messenger french king thither vnto easter tearme ended kept feast whitsontide solemnely season cardinall caused diuers time iokin dine thus continued iokin england long vntill last brought passe matter commission sente immediatly restreynt sir iohn russell partes made abiding beyond sea shoulde reteyne monethes wage still hys ands vntill king pleasure knowne haue bin payde duke burbon bee ng wyth hys retinue encamped within towne want whereof day duke hys n sore dismayde saw ey brought wont beeing dan rous case victualles beganne ant nd deere imagined many wayes shoulde lette sayde thys sayde mistrusted nothing lesse cause thereof much last wante victualles necessary souldyoures captaynes beganne grudge mutter last lacke victual like perish souldyours extremitie came captaine duke burbon sayd sir must bee force necessitie constreyned yeelde v vp enimies better v sterue lyke dogges duke saw extremitie sayde vnto weeping eye sir quoth yee valiant men noble heartes haue serued heere right worthelie necessitie whereof perticipant doe little lament shall desire noble heart courage take patience day twayne succour come king england doubt nothing deceyue v well agree shall put oure selues liues vnto mercy lorde wherewith agreeable tarrying comming king money vntill tearme two dayes past duke seeing remedie called noble captaynes souldyoures hym weeping sayde yee noble men captaynes see remedie thys necessitie eyther wee must yeeld v vnto enimies else mishe yeelde towne selues know mercie enimies parte pas cruelty knowe well shall suffer death cruelly come hand selfe therefore doe lamente youre sake youre liues safegar youre person yee might escape dang oure enimies handes woulde gladly death therefore good companyons noble souldyoures shall require consider daungerous miserie calamitie wee stande sell liues dearely rather murthered lyk beastes yee wyll bee agreeable wee wyll take vpon v thys nighte gyue oure enimes assaulte meanes wee maye eyther escape else gyue ouerthrowe thus better die fielde lyke men lyue prisoner captiuitle miserie whiche agreed quoth duke yee perceyue enimies campe strong waye enter vppon one planted wyth ordinance strength men possible atteyne oure enimies wayes fighte wyth campe also nowe late perceyue haue hadde small doubt v muche haue kepte verye slender watche therefore deuice shall bee thus shall issue towne aboute dead nighte v number bee delyuerest assaulte theyr campe shall gyue assaulte righte secretly euen directly agaynste place entrie whyche strong inuincible youre fierce valiant assaulte shall campe doubtfull turne strength entrie lyeth ouer agaynst assaulte beate youre purpose issue posterne come place theyr strength newly turned ware enter fight theyr camp winne ordinance whiche haue newly burned beate wyth theyr owne ce pleased wonderous well pared daye purposed deuise kepte secret close without anye noyse tte peeces within towne whyche gaue theyr enimies lesse eare assaulte yghte wente theyr tentes cowched nothyng mistrusting afterwarde immediately happened vnto tyme came men rest assaylants issued towne according appoyntment gaue cruell fierce assault camp much possible resist euen duke declared souldiours within compelled turne shotte lay entrie assaylants issued duke fifteene sixteene thousand men secretly night enimies priuie comming vntill entred fielde entrie tooke ordinance lay slew gunner hee charged peeces enimies slewe wonderfully cutte downe tentes pauilions murthered many within ere ware comming wanne field euer kingfrench king taken could arise rescue much king taken hys lodging euer harnessed tentes robbed spoyled wonderous rith spoyle search king coffer duke burbon found league vnder great seale england newly made betweene king england french king perceyued began smell impediment money haue come vnto king hauing vpon due search intelligence matter deuised cardinall englande duke conceyued suche indignation heerevpon agaynst cardinall incontinente hee wente vnto rome intended sacke towne haue taken pope first assaulte walles duke first man stayne yet notwithstanding hys captaynes continued assaulte sast wanne towne pope fledderome sacked people fled vnto castell saint angell hee continued long calamitie notwithstanding yee haue hear newes brought england taking french king great triumph made ioy thereof ninth march time cardinall wolsey determinedcardinall vvolsey suppresseth priory build colledges oxford ipsvvich erect new colledges oxford ipswich obteyned licence authoritie pope clement seauenth suppresse number fortie monastery good bountifull hospitalitie wherein king bearing doings neyther bishop temporall lorde realme durst saye picked quarrell agaynste house gaue information cardinall agaynste taking small occasion commaunded house bee dissolued bee couerted hys new colledge thys irreligeous robberie done conscience patch vp pride whiche priuate wealth coulde furnishe punishmente hath since ensued god hande sayeth myne authour partly selues haue seene fyue person two fell discorde betweene themselues one slewe suruiuor hanged thirde drowned hymselfe well fourth beeing well knowne valued worth two hundreth pounde became three yeares poore hee begged hys dying day fifth called doctor allane beeyng thiefe executor doyngs cruelly maymed irelande euen suche tyme hee bishop cardinall falling king greeuous displeasure deposed dyed miserably colledges whiche hee meante haue made glorious building came neuer good effect pope clement himselfe whose authoritie house throwne downe ground enclosed dangerous seege within castell saint angell rome emperialles citie rome pitifully sacked himselfe narrowly escaped solemne oration effect whereof dreadfull warres bin betweene realmes england france declared power king englande conquest might haue made france french king prisoner whereof humbly thanked pitie compassion necessitie would consente peace oration sir thomas moore chancellour duchy lancaster made answere saying much reioyced king first considered hys power might haue oppressed hys pitie releeued wherefore would heere kindnesse shoulde shewe hym none vnkindnesse inuiolably keepe league cocluded moneth may proclamation made againstproclamation vnlavvfull g e vnlawfull game commission
