hauing hym gentleman three rancke ueluet coates moste greate chaines golde aboute neckes hys yeoman followed hym nobleman gentleman seruants al orenge tawney coates cardinalles hat thomas cardinall embrodered vpon coates aswell hys owne seruants al reste gentleman seruantes hys sumpter mule whyche twentie cariage carte hys traine passed rode like cardinall verye sumptuouslye hys mule wyth spare mule spare horse trapped crimosin ueluet vpon veluet stirrops guilt folowing hym twoo great cross siluer two great pillers siluer king broade seale englande hys cardinal hat gentlemanne carying hys ualence otherwise called cloake bagge whyche made fine scarlet altogyther embrodered richly golde hauing cloake thus passed forth throughe london waye euerye daye iourney thus furnished hauing hys harbengers euerye place whych prepared lodging hys traine first iourney made twoo myles beyond dertford kent vnto sir thomas wiltshires house reste hys traine lodged dertford countrey thereaboutes nexte daye marched roches lodged byshoppes pallaice rest traine citie strowde third day rode feuersham lodged abbey traine towne countrey thereaboutes fourth daye rode caunterburie encountred wyth worshipfull town country lodged priorie christchurch hys traine citie continued three dayes whiche season greate fayre towne reason feast thomas canterburie whych daye solempne procession wherein cardinal went apparelled hys legantine ornamentes hys hat heade commaunded monk queere sing letany sorte sanctum maria pro papa nostra clemente cardinall kneeling stoole queere dore monk queere stoode body church singing letany eleauenth july cardinall arriued calleis receiued officer counsell towne maior towne maior staple procession lauterne gate kneeled made prayer done passed vntill came saint mary churche whence repayred greate number nobleman gentleman beeing peeres towne vnto place called checker lodged kepte house long abode towne traine carriage landed euery thing prepared iourney called hys nobleman gentleman beyng seruants vnto hys priuie chamber al assembled hym sayde haue called hither intent declare vnto consider duetie beare good semblably beare seeing intendment aucthoritie haue commission whiche diligent ruice wil remember hereafter therefore meane declare directly king secondly shewe nature frenche men thirdely instructe howe reuerence yee shall vse honor king maiestie enforme howe ye shall entertaine accompanye frenche men ye shall meete anye time first poynt ye shall vnderstand king maiestie certaine waightie affaire grace hathe aduauncement royall dignitie assigned iorney lieuetenant reuerence belongeth tell parte muste vertue commission lieuetenantship ume take vppon esteemed honor degree seruice highnesse presence meete due nothyng neglected hys royall estate due appertinent parte yee shall see wyll omit one iote thereof therefore bycause ye shal ignorant dutie case one chiefe cause youre assembly willing haue fauour also charge king name ye doe forget time place euerye one obserue duety vnto accordingly ye w return auoide king gnation obtaine deserue hys highnesse thankes whiche sette forth eache shall deserue nowe seconde point nature frenche men suche firste meeting familiar bin acquainted wyth long commune frenche tongue though ye vnderstoode euerye worde therefore vse like maner familiar wyth speake natural tongue speake agayne vnto englishe tongue vnderstande shall vnderstande speakyng merilye one gentlemenne welche manne sayde rice quoth hee speake welche doubt thy speache shall defuse hym hys frenche shal hee thus quoth againe lette youre entertainement behauior according order gentlenesse humilitie may reported departure thence ye gentleman right good behauiour muche gentlenesse ye men knowe dueties soueraigne lord maister esteeming muche youre greate reuerence thus shall ye onelye obtaine youre selues greate commendation praise also aduaunce honor prince countrey nowe go wayes admonished al pointes prepare selues againste morrowe intende god willing set forwarde nexte morrowe beeing mary magdalen day thyngs beeing furnished cardinal aduanced calleis wyth suche number blacke ueluet coates hath beene seldome seene embassador al peeres calleis guisnes al gentleman besides traine beeyng garnished blacke ueluet coates chaines golde thus passed hee forwarde wyth traine gentleman three rancke supposall endured three quarter myle length hauyng cross accustomed glorious furniture carryed haue rehearsed excepte broade seale whyche lefte calleis wyth doctour taylour maister rolles vntil returne passing thus hys way scantly rydden myle beganne raine vehemently lightly beene seene like whyche endured vntill came boloinge ere came sandingfielde cardinal loraine goodly yong gentleman encountred cardinall englande receyued great ioy reuerence passed forth wyth cardinal communication vntil came nigh vnto saide sandingfielde whych place religion standing betweene englishefrenche emperours dominion beyng newter holding neyther awayted le countie brian capitaine pycardie greate number radiates albenois standyng arraye greate peece greene oates harnesse vpon high horse passing cardinall wing vnto bolongne throughe picardie cardinal doubted somewhat emperour lay ambush betray hym whyche cause french kyng commaunded attende vppon hym assuraunce person thus rode vntil came within one englishe myle bolongne encountred hym worshipfull citizen towne bolongne hauing learned man made vnto hym oration latine vnto whyche cardinall semblably made answeare done monsieur de bee capitaine bolongne retinue gentleman mette wyth horsebacke al assembly rode town lighting abbey gate thence conueyed wyth procession abbey churche offered went abbey hys lodging traine lodged high base townes next morning hee rode mutterell ser lemere like case encountred worshipful towne al one lyuerie hauing learned man make oration vnto latine whome aunswered also latine entred gate canapie made readie silke embrodered letter hat euen men coates lighted footemen fee due office nowe made dyuers pageant ioy comming called frenche tong al place throughe realme rode came le cardinall pacifique nexte daye hee tooke hys iourney towardes abvile hee encountred wyth diuers gentleman towne countrey recey ed towne pageant rode thorough towne hauing lyke canapie borne ouer richer broughte hys lodgy g thys towne remayned eyght dayes resorted dayly diuers frenche king counsell sitting counsell euerye daye continually feasting time came hys departing towne rode castell beyonde water called le chanel de picqiny adioyning saide watch vpon rocke wythin whyche colledge priest scituation whereof much like vnto castel windsore receiued solemnne procession lodged nighte nexte morning cardinall rode towarde amiens passing way encountred noble personage made diuers oration whiche answered extempore afterwarde frenche king goodly company mette cardinal embraced eche preace thicke diuers leg hurt horse king cardinall right hande rode forth towardes amiens euery englishe gentleman accompanyed fraunce traine two prince endured two long englishe myles nobly receyued towne amiens shot gun costly pageant vntil king brought cardinall lodging departed nighte king lodged bishoppes pallaice next daye dinner cardinal rode courte king whiche time king kepte bedde yet neuerthelesse cardinall came bedchamber one side bed sate king mother side cardinal loraine accompanied diuers nobleman fraunce shorte communication drinking cuppe wine departed hys owne lodging thus continued cardinall king amiens space fortnight consulting feasting eche dyuers tymes king cardinall remoued citie called champaine whych xx english myles amiens lodged great castel town wherof cardinal one halfe assigned lodging king halfe like wise denided long gallerie beetween made midst strong wal window dore king cardinal would many time meete window talke diuers time woulde goe said dore came lord cardinal lord chancelor france al king counsellers toke great paine dayly consultation insomuch cardinall england fel chancelor france laying hys charge went hinder league whyche comming cocluded insomuch madam regent hir self many noble france much labor trauel coulde scarcely bring cardinal former state communitation suche wroth chancelor meanes brought thing passe could attaine whiche feare affection matter heades counsell vnder gyrdle next morning conflict rose early foure clocke sate downe write letter englande vnto king commaundyng hys chapleines prepare hym ready say masse insomuch chaplaine stoode vesture vntill four clocke afternoone al season cardinal neuer rose eate drinke make water continually wrote aboute houre foure afternoone made end commaunding christopher gunner king seruant without delay ride post englande letter whome dispatched away euer dranke went masse said seruice chapleine went bothe dinner supper nexte night cardinall made great suppe madam regent queene nauar ate estate lady noble woman middest said banquet king fraunce ni came day elye vnlooked tooke place lowest parte banqu supper banquet finished ladyes gentleman fell daucing passed awaye moste nighte ere departed shortely king caused wilde bore lodged rest champaigne thither cardinal rode wyth hym see hym hunt lady regent number ladyes damoisels standyng chariot looking toyle oute side whyche pitched purpose among stoode cardinal regarde hunting madam regent chariot wythin toyle king diuers minion gentleman fraunce readye furnyshed thys highe daungerous enteprice hunting king beyng doublet hozen sheepes colour cloth hauing ippe brace greate white greyhoundes armed maner reste king gentleman appoynted hunte bore likewise doublet ho holdyng eache theyr handes verye sharpe bore speares king commaunded keeper vncouche bore euerye person beeing within toile go standing among whome dyuers gentleman yeoman englande incontinent bore issued den followed hounde came plaine beeing scaled whyle gazing vpon people incontinent pierced hounde spyed lyttle bushe standing behinde banke ouer ditche vnder whiche laye two frenche gentleman thither fledde trusting haue defended himselfe thrust head snuffing bushe whyche caused two gentleman flye thence danger death bore pursuite hunter hounde driuen thence ranne straighte one cardinalles footemen ta yong yeoman hadde handes line whiche faine defende hymself bore greate bore continually oyning hym tuskes faine laste pitche iaueline grounde betweene bore whiche bore brake force hys foyning yeoman drew hys sword stoode defence therewith hunter came rescue putte againe flight fledde yong gentleman england called maister henry ratcliffe sonne heyre lorde fitz walter borrowed chance frenche gentleman fine sharp bore speare thruste bore mouth throate wherevpon pastime ended cardinall passing diuers dayes consultation matter expecting returne christopher gunner laste returned letter againe vppon receite whereof cardinall intended remoue masse hys closet consecrated chauncelour fraunce cardinall putte vppon hym habite hys hatte cap scarlet tooke hys iourney returning againe englande makyng suche necessary expedition came gui e nobly receyued lorde sandes capitaine wyth retinue thence rode calleis tarryed shipping stuffe horse aine meane time stablished marte nation thing weale towne garrison perfecte tooke proceeding among whyche saide concluded amitie neuer heard realm well emperour v betweene king soueraigne frenche king perpetuall peace whyche confirmed writyng sealed fine golde affyrming kyng englande receiue yearly tribute name dutchie normandie wyth costes whyche hee sustained warres also restraint made fraunce frenche queenes dowrie whome duke suffolke married diuers yeres war concluded onelye receiue againe also arrerages payed peace thus concluded shoulde suche amitie betweene gentleman eache realme enterco rse merchant shoulde seeme al men territory one monarchie c twentith parke king wythin three myles hunt spen day vntill night whyth time returned againe hampton courte euery conueyed theyr seuerall chamber hauing greate er wi e comforte remayning vntil supper ready chamber supped banqueted ordered sort first great wayting chamber hanged rich arras none werea oreg better furnished tall yeoman serue sette table rounde aboute chamber banquet wise couered cupborde garnished whyte siluer plate hauing also chamber giue light foure plate siluer sette greate lightes greate fire wood coales nexte chamber chamber presence hanged verye riche arras sumptuous cloth estate furnished many goodly gentleman serue table ordered maner chamber sauing highe table remoued beneath cloth estate towarde middest chamber couered cupborde length broade chamber sixe desk haight garnished wyth guilt plate auing wyth lightes one payre candlestickes syluer guylte beeyng curiously wrought whyche cost three hundred markes standyng vpon twoo lightes waxe burning byg torch set forth cupborde barred rounde aboute manne coulde come nighe none plate touched baquet sufficient besides plate hong walles giue light siluer guilte hauyng great pearchers waxe burning greate fire chimney nd thing necessary furniture noble feaste nowe thing readinesse trumpettes blowne warne supper officer discreetely conducted nobleman theyr chamber chamber shoulde sup caused sette downe done seruice came vppe suche abundance costlye full suttleties suche pleasaunte noyse instrument musike frenche men seemed rapte heauenly paradice cardinall yet come mery pleasant seconde course cardinall came booted spurred sodainely amongest bade proface whose comming greate ioy wyth rysing euerye man place cardinall caused sit still keepe roumes beyng hys apparell rode called chayre sate midst highe table anone came vppe seconde course many dish suttleties deuises aboue hundred number whiche goodly proportion costly think french men neuer sawe like wonder lesse worthy indeede castels wyth image paules church quantitie counterfaited paynter shoulde haue painted cloth wall beastes byrdes personage moste likely made counterfaited fightyng wyth swordes wyth gunnes crossebowes vaughting leaping dauncing ladyes horse complete harnesse iustyng wyth long sharpe speares many moe deuises among al chesse boorde made spiced plate menne fame good proportion bycause french meune verye experte playe lorde cardinall gaue gentleman france commaunding shoulde made goodly cace preseruation thereof haste might conuey hys countrey tooke lord bole gold filled ipocrase putting hys cappe sayde drinke kyng soueraigne lord next vnto king master therwith dranke good draught done desired graund maister pledge hym cuppe whyche well worth fiue hundred markes caused bourdes pledge twoo royall prince wente cuppes merily aboute manye frenche menne faine ledde beddes rose vppe cardinall went hys priui chamber pul bootes shifte hym wente supper priuie chamber making verye shorte supper returned chamber presence among frenche menne vsing louingly familiarly coulde commende hym muche whilest communication pastime al lyueries serued chabers euerye chamber hadde bason ewer siluer great liuery pot siluer guilt yea chamber hadde two lyuerie pot wyth wine beere siluer candlesticke white plaine hauing twoo cizes staffe torche ware fine manchet chete loafe thus euerye chamber furnished al house yet cupbords two banquetting chamber touched thus time conuenient conueyed lodging rested night morning dyned cardinall departed windsore returne stranger windsore place order therof much commended day approched king inuited courte firste dyned dau ing pastime done time supper came banquetting chamber tylte yarde greenewiche whyche place stranger conducted noblest personage court didde bothe sup banquet straunge wonderful deuises dish suttleties whereof farre passed banquet hampton court golde doth siluer valewe waighte waight middest banquet ourneying barryers lustie gentleman compleate harnesse gorgeous foote like horsebacke moste goodlyest disguysing enter lude made latine player beyng riche strange deuises passeth comparison thys done came suche number fayrest ladyes gentlewoman bare brute beautie realme moste richest apparell mighte deuised whome gentleman fraunce daunced vntil gorgeous maske came gentleman daunced masked lady done came maske ladyes ladyes tooke eache one french men daunce maske woman masker spake good french french men delighted much thus nighte consumed fiue clocke vntill three clocke midnight euerye man departed lodging thys solempue cheere daye appoynted resorted court take leaue king nobleman came westminster vnto cardinall receyued king reward whyche euerye man honor estimation plate valewe three foure hundred pound lesse besides greate gift receyued king gownes ueluet riche furres greate chaynes golde goodlye horse wyth dyuers giftes leaste summe crown golde worste page amongest hadde twentie crownes hys parte beyng thus nobly rewarded departed frenche craer thirtie tunne manned wyth eighte thirtie feenche menne flemish craer seauen twentie tunne foure twentie fleming meeting margate one chaced along riuer thamis tower wharffe london sir edmond walsingham lieuetenaunte tower stayed tooke bothe captaines men xvij june terme adiorned mihelmasse bycause sweating sicknesse raigned citie london watch midsomer time bin accustomed ralph waren iohn long september sherifes maior legate rome sir iohn rudston draper october seauenth october came london legate rome called lawrence campaius cardinall king gift bishop salisburie lodged bath place without temple barre prisoner brake session hall newgate whe prisoner brake session house session done prisoner brought downe newgate basket seemed weake end session brake people grey frier church kept sixe seauen dayesregister grey frier ere sheriffes could speake bycause would abiure aske crowner violence tooke thence cast hym agayne prison law serued hang commissioner sent oxford cambridge louayne paris orleance bonony padua c knowe opinion learned uniuersities concerning marriage betwixt king henry queene katherine sometime brother wife marriage seemed bee vnlawfull affirmed vnder perticular seale euery uniuersititie moneths aprill may june july cardinall1527 campeius legate cardinall wolsey sate blacke frier london broughtanno reg question king mariage queene katherine vnlawfull two legate sate judgesthe king mariage vvith queene katherine called question blacke frier whome king queene assited sommoned appeare court platted table bench manner consistorie one seate reysed higher judge sitte midst said judge al oft aboue three degree high cloth estate hanged chaire royall vnder wherein sate king besides distance sate queene vnder judge feete sate scribe officer chiefe scribe doctor stephen caller court one cooke winchester king judge within court sate archbishop canterbury warham bishop stoode endes within counsellours learned spirituall lawes well king queenes doctor law king doctor simpson doctor bell diuers proctor side doctor peter doctor tregon others side queene doctor fisher doctor standish doctor ridley thus court furnished judge commanded silence whilest commisson red court people assembled done scribe commaunded crier call king name king henry england come court c king answered sayde heere called hee queene name katherine queene englande come court c made answere rose hir chaire bycause could come king directly distance seuered betweene wente aboute court came king kneeling downe hys feete whome sayde effect followeth sir quoth desire iustice right take pitie vpon poore woman stranger borne dominion hauing heere indifferent counsell lesse assurance frendship ala sir haue offended occasion displeasure haue shewed intending thus put sorte take god judge haue bin true humble wife euer confirmable pleasure neuer contraryed gaynesayde thing thereof beeing alwayes contented thing wherein anye delight whether little much without grudge displeasure loued sake whome loued whether friendes enimies haue bin wife twentye yeares moe haue dyuers child iust cause alledge agaynste eyther dishonestie matter lawfull put contente departe shame rebuke none pray let haue justice youre hande king father hys tyme excellente witte king spayne father ferdinando reckned one wisest prince raigned spayne many yeares doubted gathered wise counsellours vnto euery realme wisedomes thought meete thought marriage betweene good lawfull c wherefore humblye desire spare untill may knowe councell friendes spayne wyll aduertise take youre pleasure bee fulfilled wyth arose vp making low curtesie king departed thence king beeyng aduertised ready goe house commanded crier call hir agayne called hir wordes katherine queene englande come courte wyth quoth mayster griffith madame bee called agayne quoth maketh matter wyll tarrie goe youre wayes thus departed wythoute anye aunswere tyme anye neuer woulde appeare court king perceyuing departed sayde wordes effect much quoth queene gone hir absence declare onto hathe bene true obediente confirmable wife would wish desire hath vertuous quality ought woman hir dignitie baser estate also surely noble woman borne hir condition well declare quoth cardinall wolsey sir humbly require highnesse declare audience whether haue bin chiefe first mouer matter vnto maiestie greatly suspected heerein lord cardinall quoth king well excuse matter mary quoth ye haue bin rather tempting heereof setter forward mouer speciall cause moued vnto matter certayne scrupulositie pricked coscience vpon certaine word spoken time bishop bayon french embassador bin hyther sente vpon debating marriage concluded betweene daughter lady mary duke orleance second sonne king france vpon resolution determination desired respect aduertise king mayster thereof whether daughter mary legitimate respect marriage woman sometime brother wife worde conceyued within secret bottome conscience engendred suche scrupulous doubt conscience incontiently accombred vexed disquieted whereby thought selfe bee greatly danger god indignation appeared seemed rather sente v issue male issue male said wife died incontient came worlde doubted great displeasure god behalfe thus conscience tossed waues scrupulous conscience partly despaire haue issue already lady wife behoued consider state realme danger stoode lacke prince succeede thought good releasse weighty burthou ake conscience also quiet estate worthy realme attempt law therein whether may lawfully take another wi e lawfully whome god may sende issue case first copulation good without carnall concupiscen e displeasure misliking queenes person age whome would well contented continue day cardinal sate againe time counsell side answere king counsell alledged matrimonie lawfull beginning bycause nall copulation betweene prince arthure queene matter vehemently touched side proue alledged many reason ilitudes truth answered negatiuely againe side seemed former allegation doubtfull tryed man knewe truth thus court passed session session day day certayne session king sent two cardinalles queene bridewell perswade hir wisedomes aduise hir surrender whole matter king hand hir owne consent much better hir honour stand triall law thereby condemned whiche shoulde seeme much hir dishonour cardinalles beeing queenes chamber presence gentleman usher aduertised queene cardinalles come speake hir rose vp skeyne white th ead hir ke came hir chamber presence cardinalles attending whose comming quoth sh pleasure please grace quoth cardinall wolsey goe int pri ie chamber shew cause oure comming lord quoth yee haue thing say speake openly f ke feare nothing yee say would worlde heare see therefore speake minde began cardinall speake hir latine nay good lord quoth speake english fors th quoth cardinall good madame please come knowe mind disposed matter betweene king also declare secretly opinion councell vnto whiche zeale obedience beare vnto grace lord quoth thanke youre god make answere request sodeinly set among maydes worke thinking full little matter wherein needeth longer deliberation better head mine make answere fo neede councell case toucheth neere councel friendship find england profite thinke lord englishman councell friendly king pleasure subiect nay fors th counsell whome put trust spayne mine owne countrey lordes poore woman lacking witte answere noble person wisedome waightie matter therefore pray good vnto poore woman destitute friend heere forrayne region counsell also glad heare therewith tooke cardinall hand ledde hir priuie chamber cardinall tarried season talking queene communication ended departed king making relation hir talke thus case went forward fro court court till came judgemente euery men expected iudgement would giuen next day day king came thither set downe chaire within dore end galery opened directly councel comandemet se wil obserue case doubtful also party defendat wil make answer heere doth rather apeale fro v supposing indifferent wherefore ourne court time according order court rome court deliuery one earles seruants sir quoth seeing ye intend set one seruants place keepe gate knowe seruant ye haue able keepe gate purpose whatsoeuer also keyes deliuered lord mayster wherefore pray pardon whatsoeuer ye shall commaund ministratio mine office shall good quoth earle hold booke comaunded lay hand theron thou shalt weare quoth thou shalt well truly keepe gate king vse doe thing shall commaund ye shal let passe neither gate ye commaunded v oth receiued keyes earles hand doings knewe cardinall nothing stopped steire none went vp cardinal chamber came downe could go vp againe last one escaped shewed cardinall earle hall wherat cardinall maruelled would beleeue comaunded gentleman bring truth going downe staires saw earle northumberland returned said quoth cardinall haue dined feare officer prouided store good fishe make honourable cheere let table stande quoth rose vp going downe staires encountred earle coming vp tayle soone cardinal espied earle put ay said lord ye hartily welcome embraced cardinall tooke earle hand vp chamber whome followed number earles se ant thence led bedchamber al alone earle said vnto cardinall soft voice laying hande vpo arme lord arrest high treason word ye cardinal maruellously astonied sta ding stil good space last quoth cardinall authority haue arrest forsooth l quoth earle haue comissio comission quoth may see nay sir may sayde earle well quoth cardinall obey rest debating matter betweene chamber busie walsh arresting doctor augustine dore ye pallace saying vnto go traytor shal make thee last walsh entred cardinal chamber began plucke hoode kneeled cardinall vnto cardinal said come hither gentlema let speake sir heere lord northumberland hath arrested whose authoritie sheweth ye ioyned pray shew indeede lord quoth walsh sheweth truth well quoth cardinall pray let see sir beseech quoth walsh hold v excused annexed comissio certaine instruction may see well quoth ye cardinall trow ye one king priuie chamber name walsh content yeeld lord northumberland without see commission worst king priuie chamber sufficiet arrest greatest peere realme king commandement without commission therefore put commission authoritie execution spare obey king take god judge neuer offended kyng worde deede earle called chamber diuers gentleman owne seruauntes taken cardinalles keyes put custodie earles gentleman went house set thing order sent doctor augustine away london much speede could boune vnto horsse like traytor sunday toward night ere cardinal conuayd cawod lodged night abbey pomfret next day remoued towarde daneaster lodged blacke frier nexte day remoued shefilde parke earle shrewsburie lady traine gentleme gentlewoman receyued much honor departed great number gentleman conducted thether cardinall thus earle shrewsburie cotinued xviij dayes vpo whome earle appointed diuers gentleman attend cotinually see lacke nothing beeing serued owne chamber honourably house euery day earle would repaire vnto commune cardinall thus remained earle shrewsburie aboute fortnight came passe certaine time sate dinner chaber hauing boords end messe gentleman chaplaines keepe company toward end dinner come eating hys fruites colour perceyued often change whereby iudged good health vpon one ofthe cardinall ickne gentleman said sir seemes well ease whome answered loude voice forfooth quoth taken sod inly thing stomacke lyeth along colde whetstone wind pray go po icarie enquire haue thing wil breake winde vpward went earle sh wed estate cardinall desired earle caused poticarie called demanded thing would breake wind vpward man body answered geare quoth earle fetch apoticary fetched white cofectio fair paper shewed erle comanded one giue ye assay therof brought cardinall receiued vp al mouth immediatly surely auoided much wind vpward quoth ye may see wind nowe well eased thanke god rose fro table went hys prayer done came suche loosenesse caused go stoole long ye erle shrewsburie came gallery ye cardinall met sitting vpon bench ye erle asked lametably answered thanked gentle entertainment sir quoth erle ye remember ye haue often wished come king make answer haue writte ye king behalf making priuie lamentation ye inwardly haue receiued hys displeasure accepteth al doings therin friend accustoind case wherfore wold aduise plucke vp hart agast enimies doubt iorney highnesse shal much aduancement king hath sent worshipful knight maister kingston old seruats ye guard intet ye may safely come maiestie sir quoth cardinal trow master kingston costable tower ea quoth erle assure elected ye king one friend wel quoth cardinal god wil subiect fortune true man ready accept chance shal folow end pray master kingston quoth earle wil send hym pray th cardinal whose message came soone cardinal espyed made hast encounter coming kneeled saluted king behalf ye cardinal barehaded offered take vp said pray stande vp kneele wretch repleat miserie esteeming selfe vile ab ecte vtterly cast away without desert god knoweth said master kingston humble reuerence sir king hath commonded vnto thanke highnes quot cardinall trust health yea quoth maister kingston commanded saye shoulde assure selfe beareth muche good wil euer willeth good cheere report hath bin made ye comit hym certain heinous crime thinketh vntrue yet doe lesse sende triall take iorney owne pleasure comanding attendant vpon therfore sir pray shall pleasure take iorney shall ready gi e attedace maister kingston quoth thake newes sir lustie haue late would ride post diseased flixe maketh weake shal wyth al speede make ready ryde morrow night came cardinall waxed sicke laske whyche caused continually go stoole al night insomuch night stooles therefore consideration infirmitie caused tarry al day next day tooke iorney maister kingston guard til came house earle shrewsburies called hardwike hall lay al night euill ease nexte day rode notingham lodged night sicke nexte daye rode leicester abbey waye waxed sicke almoste fallen mule night came abbey leicester comming gate abbot al cou nt met diuers torch light whome honourablye receyued welcommed whome cardinall sayde father abbot come hyther laye bone among riding still vntil came ayres chamber alighted hys mule maister kingston led vppe stayres soone chamber went bedde satterday nighte encreased sicker sicker vntil monday men thought woulde haue dyed tuisday saint andrewes euen maister kingston came hym bade good morrowe e clocke asked howe didde sir quoth tarry pleasure god render vppe poore soule handes r quoth maister kingstone wyth grace god yee shall liue doe verye well yee good cheere nay good sooth maister kingstone disease suche liue haue hadde experience phisicke thus haue fluxe continuall feuer nature whereof alteration wythin eyghte dayes either muste ensue excorrition entra le ra sie else present death beste death suppose thys eyghte daye yee see alteration remedy saue though may liue daye twaine death muste ensue syr quoth maister kingstone bee suche pensiuenesse doubting thing good faith ye neede well wel maister kingstone quoth cardinall see matter howe framed hadde serued god diligently haue done king woulde haue gyuen ouer grey haires iuste rewarde muste receiue diligent paine study haue hadde doe seruice regarding seruice god onelye satisfie pleasure pray haue moste humbly commended vnto royall maiestye beseeche behalfe call hys prince e remembraunce matter proceeding betweene hym beginning worlde progresse c maister kingstone farewell saye wishe thing haue good successe tyme draweth fast euen beganne drawe speach length tongue faile eye beeyng sette whose sighte fayled hym dydde putte hym remembraunce chryste hys passion sed yeoman ard stand see dye wor departure incontinent clocke stroke audeley lord keeper great seale made lord chauncelor england beganne parliament whiche enacted person shoulde appeale anye cause oute thys realme court rome also queene katherine shoulde thenceforth called queene princesse dowager prince arthur twelfth aprill easter euen ladye1533 anno reg anne bolleine hadde beene priuily marryed kyng henrie wente hir closet openly queene proclaymed queene englande sixe twentith aprill arthure plantagenet sonne illegitime kyng edwarde fourth created viscount lisle bridewell twelfth may pauier towne clearke london hung himselfe king highnesse addressed letter maior communaltie london signifying vnto pleasure solempnize coronation deare welbeloued wife queene anne westminster whitsonday next ensuing willing make preparation well fetche hir grace greenewiche tower water see citie garnished wyth pageant place accustomed honor hir grace shee shoulde conueyed tower westminster wherevppon common counsell called commaundement gyuen haberdasher whiche craft maior shoulde prepare barge bachelers wyth wafter foyste garnished wyth banner lyke vse maior presented westminster morrowe feast saint simon iude also craftes commaunded prepare barge garnishe onely banner accustomed also decke target side barge sette vppe suche seemely banner banneret hadde hal e coulde get furnishe theyr sayde barge euery barge haue minstrel according whych commaundement greate preparation made thyngs necessary suche noble triumph nine twentith daye may beeing thurseday maior brother scarlet knightes hadde collar es residue hauyng greate chaines counsell citie assembled saint marie hill one clocke descended newe steire barge whyche garnished manye goodly banner streamer richly couered whiche barge shalmes shagebushes dyuers instrument musicke whiche played continually maior hys brother barge seeing company number fiftie barge readye waite vppon gaue commaundement company barge rowe nearer another twice length barge see order kepte three whirries prepared euerye one two officer call keepe order whyche commaundement giuen set forth order hereafter described firste maiors barge foiste wafter full ordinaunce whyche foyste greate redd dragon continuallye ng casting wilde fire rounde aboute sayde foiste stoode terrible monstrous wild men casting fire making hideous noise nexte foiste good distaunce came maiors barge whose righte hande bachelers barge whyche trum dyuers melodious instrumentes sayde barge saile yardes toppe elles hanged wyth ryche cloth golde foreshippe sterne two greate banner ryche beaten wyth armes king queene aud soppe castell also long streamer newly beaten saide armes side barge sette full flagges banner deuices companyes haberdasher merchaunt aduenturers lasserers cordes hanged wyth innumerable penselles hauing lyttle belle endes whyche made goodlye noyse goodlye sighte wauering winde side barge three dozen scutcheon mettall armos kyng queene whiche beaten vppon square buckeram deuided righte side hadde king colour lefte side queenes whyche scutcheon fastened clothes golde siluer hauging deckes lefte hand maior foyste whyche mounte mounte stoode white faulcon crowned vppon roote golde enuironed wyth white rose redde whyche queenes deuice aboute whyche mounte sate uirgins singing playing melodiouslye next mayor followed hys felowshippe haberdasher nexte mercer grocer euerye company hys order laste maiors sheriffes officer euery company hauing melodie barge selues goodly garnished wyth banne couered wyth sylke wyth arras suche like goodly sight beholde thy er rowed greenewiche pointe beyende greenwiche turned backward order weete maiors sherifs officer firste meanest crafte nexte ascencendyng vpper moste crafte order maior laste thy goe paules christmasse order wed downe warde greenewiche towne caste ancker makyng greate melodie three clocke queene apparelled riche cloth golde entred hir barge accompanyed wyth dyuers ladyes gentlewoman incontinent citizen set forward order theyr minstrel continually playing bachelers barge going queenes right hand whyche shee tooke greate pleasure beholde aboute queenes barge manye noble menne duke suffolke marque dorcet earle wiltshire hir father earles arundale darby rutland worcester huntington sussex oxforde many byshops noble men euerye one hys barge whyche goodly sight beholde shee thus accompanyed rowed towardes tower meane waye shippes whyche commanded lye shoare letting barge shotte dyuers peales gunnes ere landed maruellous shotte tower neuer hearde like hir landing mette wyth hir lord chamberlaine officer armes brought hir king whych receyued hir louing countenance posterne water side kissed hir shee turned backe agayne thanked mayor citizen wyth manye goodly wordes entred tower whyche entrye citizen houered tower makyng greate melodie went alande none assigned lande maior recorder two alderman speake people stoode euerye shoare beholde sighte hee sa e beleeue friday dinner serued king suche appoynted hys highenesse knight bathe whiche dinner brought chamber nighte bathed shriuen according olde vsage england nexte daye morning king dubbed according ceremony thereto belonging whose name ensue nineteene number marque dorcet earle darby lord clifford sonne heire earle comberland lord fitz walter sonne heire earle huntington lord mountague lorde vaux sir henrie parker sonne heyre lorde merle sir william winsore sonne heyre lorde winsore sir iohn mordant sonne heyre lorde mordant sir frauncis weston sir thomas arondale sir iohn hudlestone sir thomas poynings sir henry sauell sir george fitz william lincolnshire sir iohn tindale sir tomas ierney saterday one thirtith may queenethe conueying queen anne citie vvestm conueyed london order followeth intente horse shoulde slide pauement people shoulde hurte horse highe streetes wherethroughe queene passe graueled tower vnto temple barre rayled eche side wythin whiche raile stoode craftes along order grace churche merchauntes stiliarde stoode vntill lyttle conduite cheape alderman stoode side streete stoode conestables citie apparelled ueluet silke wyth greate staues handes cause people giue roume keepe good order streetes somewhat ordered mayor gowne crimosin veluet riche collar es two footemen clothed white red damaske rode tower giue hys attendaunce queene whome sherifes officer awaite till came tower hill taking leaue rode downe high streetes commaunding conestables see roume good order kept wente stoode alderman cheape queen hir traine come gracestreete cornehill hanged fine scarlet crimosin grayned clothes place riche arras moste part cheape hanged cloth tisshew golde ueluet many riche hanging whyche made goodlye shewe windowes replenished lady gentlewoman beholde queene hir traine shoulde passe firste queenes company sette forwarde twelue french men belonging frenche embassadoure clothed contes blewe ueluet wyth sleeues yellow blew ueluet horse trapped close trapper blewe sarsenet powdred white cross marched gentleman esquiers knight two two iudges knight bathe violet gownes hood purfled miniuer like doctor abbot baron bishoppes earles marquess lorde chanceloure englande hym archebyshoppe yorke embassadoure venice archebyshoppe caunterburie embassadour fraunce rode twoo esquyers honor wyth robe estate rolled worne bauldrikewise aboute neckes wyth cappes estate representing duke normandie aquitaine rode mayor london wyth hys mace garter hys coate armes whyche bare also hys mace westminster hall rode lorde wyllyam howarde wyth marshall rod deputy hys brother duke norffolke marshall englande whyche embassadoure fraunce hys righte hande rode charles duke suffolk daye highe conestable englande bearing warder siluer appertayning office conestableshippe lordes moste parte clothed crimosin ueluet queenes seruauntes officer armes scarlet next queene rode hir chancelor bare headed sergeaunts officer armes rode side lord came queene white litter white cloth golde couered bailled whyche ledde twoo palfrey clad white damaske downe grounde heade ledde hir footemen shee hadde kertle white cloth tissue mantle surred wyth ermyn hir haire hangyng downe hir heade shee hadde coy e wyth circlet aboute full ryche stone ouer hir borne canapie cloth golde wyth foure guylte staues foure siluer belle bearyng whyche canapie appoynted sixeteene knightes foure beare one space foote foure space according owne appoyntment nexte queene rode lorde browghe hir chamberlayne nexte wyllyam coffim master hir horse leading spare horse wyth syde saddell trapped downe wyth cloth tissewe hym rode seauen lady crimosin ueluet turned vppe wyth cloth golde tissewe theyr horse trapped wyth golde twoo chariot couered wyth redde cloth golde firste chariote twoo lady whyche olde dutchesse norffolke olde marchionesse dorcet seconde chariot foure ladyes crimosin ueluet rode seauen ladyes sute horse trapped came thyrde charyot white wyth syxe ladyes crimosin ueluet nexte came fourth chariot red eyghte ladyes also crimosin whome followed thirtie gentlewoman ueluet sylke lyuerie ladyes whome gaue theyr attendaunce followed guarde coates goldesmyths worke whyche order rode forthe tyll came fanchurche made pageaunt child apparelled like merchantes whyche welcomed hir citie wyth twoo proper proposition bothe frenche englishe thence rode vnto grace churche corner costlye maruellous cunning pageaunt made merchantes stiliarde therein mounte pernassus wyth fountaine helicon whyche white marble foure streames wythoute pype dydde ryse ell hyghe mette togyther little cuppe aboue fountaine whych fountaine ranne abundantly rackte reynishe wine till night mountaine sate apollo hys feete sate caliope euery side mountayne sate foure mus playing seuerall sweete instrumentes theyr feete epigrammes poesy written golden letter whyche euerye muse according hir propertie praised queene thence queene wyth hir traine passed leaden hall goodly pageaunte tipe heauenly rose vnder tippe goodly roote golde sette little mountaine enuironed wyth red rose white oute typpe came downe faulcon whyte sette vppon roote incontinent came downe angel wyth greate melodie sette close crowne gold faulcons head pageant sate saint anne wyth hir issue beneath hir vnder mary cleophe sate hir foure child whiche chyldren one made goodlye oration queen fruitefulnesse saint anne hir generation trusting lyke fruite shoulde come hir shee passed conduite cornehill three grace se te throne afore whome spring grace continually running wine afore fountaine sate poet declaring propertie euery grace done euery lady hirself according hir propertie gaue queene seuerall gifte grace done passed greate conduite cheape whiche newly painted wyth armes deuises whiche couduite goodlye fountaine sette ende ranne continually wine white claret afternoone rode standarde whyche richely painted image king queenes hanged banner armes toppe maruellous sweete harmony bothe song instrument wente forwarde crosse whyche newly guilte till came alderman stoode maister baker recorder came hir wyth lowe reuerence making proper briefe proposition gaue hir name citie thousand mark golde purse golde whyche shee thankefullye accepted wyth manye good wordes rode little conduite riche pageaunt full melody song whyche pageaunte pallas iuno venus afore stoode mercurie whiche name three goddess gaue hir ball gold deuided three signifying three giftes three goddess gaue hir say wisedom rich felicitie entred pawles gate prettie pageant sate three ladyes richly clothed circle head written regina anna prosper proceede raigne lady midst tablet written veni amica coronaberis vnder table sate angell close crowne lady sitting right hand tablet siluer whiche written domine dirige gressus meos third lady tablet gold letter azure written confido domino vnder feete written regina anna paris regis de sanguine natam et paries populis aurea saecla tuis ladyes cast downe wafer whiche ayd two uerses written thence passed east ende pawles church schoole stoode scaffolde child well apparelled sayde hir diuers goodly uerses poet translated english honor king hir highly commended came ludgate whiche gate new garnished gold bise leades saint martin church stoode goodly queere singing men child sang new ballet made prayse hir grace past ludgate proceeded towarde fleetestreete conduite newly paynted armes angle refreshed shalmes melodiously sounding upon conduite made tower foure turret euery turret stoode one cardinall vertues token property seueral speaches promising queene neuer leaue hir ayding comforting hir midst tower closely seuerall solemne instrument seemed heauenly noyse much regarded praysed besides conduite ran wine claret redde noone hir company maior rode forth temple barre newly paynted repaired stoode also diuers singing men child till came westminster hall whiche richly hanged cloth arras newly glased midst hall taken hir litter ledde vp high deske vnder cloth estate whose left hande cupbord tenne stage high maruellous riche beautifull beholde within little season broughte queene solemne seruice greate standing spice plate voyde spice sutteltyes ipocrase wynes whyche sente downe hir ladyes ladyes drunke gaue harty thankes lordes ladyes maior giuen attendance hir withdrew hirselfe fewe ladyes white hall hir chamber shifted hir wente hir barge secretely king manour westminster rested night whitsonday first june maior cladde crimson ueluet coller aldermencoronation queene anne sheriffes skarlet counsell citie tooke barge crane seauen clocke came westminster welcomed brought hall mayster treasurer king house gaue attendance till queene shoulde come foorth betweene eyght nine clocke came hall stoode vnder cloth estate came king chappell monkes westminster riche coapes manye bishop abbot coapes miter went midst hall stoode season ray cloath spread queenes standing hall pallace sanctuarie whiche rayled side high altare westminster ray cloth cast officer armes appoynted order accustomed first went gentleman esquire knightes alderman london cloakes scarlet cast ouer thier gownes scarlet judge mantle scarlet coyfes followed knightes bath beeing lordes euery man hauing white lace left sleeue followed baron uicountes parliament roabes scarlet came earles marquess duke roabes estate crimson ueluet furred ermin poudered according theyr degree came lord chancellor roabe scarlet open bordered lettice hym came king chappell monkes solemnely singing procession came abbot bishop mitered sergeant officer armes maior london mace garter coate armes marquesse dorcet hys roabe estate bare scepter gold earle arundell bare rodde iuorie doue togither alone earle oxford high chamberlayne england bare crowne duke suffolke roabe estate day high steward england hauing long white rodde hys hande lorde william haward rodde marshalship euery knight garter coller order proceeded foorth queene circote roabe purple ueluet furred ermine hir heare coyfe circlet saterday ouer hir borne canapie foure cinque porte chrimson point blew red hanging sleeues bishop london winchester bare vp lappes queenes robe hir trayne long borne old duches norffolke hir followed ladyes lord wiues circotes scarlet narrow sleeues brest letice barres powder according degree ouer mantel scarlet furred euery mantel letice necke like neckerchefe likewise poudered pouderings theyr degree might knowne followed ladyes beeing knightes wiues gownes scarlet narrowe sleeues without traynes edged lettice likewise queenes gentlewoman thus brought high place made midst church betweene queere high altare set rich chaire rested descended downe high altare prostrated hirselfe bishop canterbury sayd certayne collect ouer hir rose bishop annoynted hir head brest led vp agayne hir chaire diuers orison sayd archbishop set crowne saint edward hir head deliuered hir scepter golde hir right hand rodde yuory doue yt left hand queere song te deum c done bishop tooke crowne saint edward heauie set hir head crowne made hir went masse offering begonne descended downe offered crowned ascended vp agayne sate hir chaire till agnus wente downe kneeled high alter receyued archbishop holy sacrament went vp place agayne masse done went saint edward shrine offered whiche offering done withdrewe hir little place made purpose one side queere meane season euery duchesse put hir bonet coronell gold wrought flower euery marchionesse put demy coronell gold euery countesse playne circle gold without flower euery king armes put crowne copper gilt worne till night season towarde parke intended hunt commyng place called pikehay parishe hillingley found one iohn busbrigge iames busbrigge richarde somener standing togither fell quarrelling ensued fray betwixte sayde lorde dacres company one part said iohn iames busbrig richard somener much said iohn busbrigge receyued hurt dyed thereof seconde may nexte ensuing wherevpon well sayd lorde dacres wyth hym diuers likewise appointed go another way meete sayd parke indited murther seauen twentith june lord dacres himselfe arraigned lord audley walden lord chauncelor sitting day high steward englande peeres realme condemned sayde lorde dacres dye transgression afterwardes nine twentith june saint peter daye eleauen clocke forenoone sheriffes london accordingly appointed readye tower haue receiued saide prisoner haue led execution tower hill prisoner come forth tower heire gentleman lord chancelors house came king name commaunded stay execution till two clocke afternoone whyche caused many thinke king woulde haue graunted pardon neuerthelesse three clocke afternoone brought forth tower delyuered sheriffes led foote betwixte vnto tyborne dyed body buryed churche saint sepulchre paste foure twentie yeres age came thus throughe greate mishappe hys ende whome many sore lamented likewise three gentleman mantell frowdes roydon saide yong lord right towardly gentlema one many conceiued worth fifty pound vpwarde moneth august iames erle desmond irelande earle desmoude came submitted himselfe king returned firste october greate oneale irelande wasthe greate oneale created earle tiron hys base sonne mathew oneale baron donmagan shane oneale onely sonne bodye lawfully begotten little esteemed duke norffolke entred scotland one twentithduke norffolke entred scotlande october burning tower ladye iane lady marie eldest daughter king henrie eighte keninghall castell norffolke wyth hir earle bathe sir thomas cornwallis also earle sussex maister henrie ratcliffe sonne mmyng towardes hir wherevppon speedy councell concluded duke suffolke certayne nobleman go towards lady mary che hir vp tower thys firste determined night daye saide voyage duke suffolke cleane dissolued speciall meanes lady iane hys daughter takyng matter heauily wyth weepyng teares made request whole councel hir father might arry home hir company whervppon councel perswaded duke northumberlande take voyage vpon saying man therefore bycause hadde atchieued victorie norffolke already therefore feared none durste li e vp weapon beste man warre realme well ordering campes souldicures bothe battaile tentes also experience knowledge wisdome coulde bothe animate army wittie perswasions also pacifie alay hys ennimyes pride wyth hys stowte courage else dissuade neede enterprise finally said short long queene wise graunte hir father shall take vpon wherefore quoth thinke good may please grace lyeth remedy matter well quoth duke since ye thinke good mine go doubting fidelitie queenes maiestie whych leaue youre custodie nighte sente bothe lordes knightes shoulde goe wyth hym caused thing prepared accordynglye wente councell ladye iane tolde hir theyr conclusion humblye thanked duke reseruing hir father home beseeched vse hys diligence whereto aunswered woulde doe hym laye morrowe following greate preparation made duke early mornyng called owne harnesse sawe made ready durham place appointed retinue meete daye carte laden munition artillerie fielde peeces set forwarde forenoone duke moued efte soones counsell sende power hym determined meete wyth hym newe market promised woulde sayde lordes noble personage whole army nowe goe forth well behalfe establishing queenes highnesse shall aduenture body lyues amongest bloudy stroke cruell aduersaries open fieldes also wee leaue conseruation selues chyldren family home altogyther committed youre truth fidelity whome thoughte ye woulde throughe malice conspyracie dissention leaue v youre friendes bryars betraye v wee coulde well sundry wayes foresee prouide owne safegards anye betraying v doe nowe vppon onelye truste faithfulnesse youre honor whereof thinke selues moste assured wee hazarde oure liues whyche truste promise ye shall violate hoping thereby lyfe promotion yet shall god coumpt innocent blouds neyther acquite sacred holy othe allegeaunce made freely thys vertuous lady queenes highnesse enficement rather force placed hir ownseeking request consider also god cause whyche preferment hys worde e papistes entraunce hathe beene yee haue alwayes layde originall grounde wherevpon ye en firste motion graunted goodwils con t therevnto handes writing appeareth inke contrarye yee meane deceyte thoughs forthewyth yet hereafter god reuenge saye thys trouble tyme wysh vse constant heartes abandoning malice enuye priuate affection therewithall firste course lord came vp wherefore duke shut vp talke wyth wordes ha e spoken thys sorte ppon anye mistruste haue youre trueth whyche alwayes haue euer hitherto conceiued trusty confidence haue put remembrance thereof chance variance euer might grow amongst mine absence pray wish worse good speede iorney ye woulde haue selues lord saith one ye mistruste anye v matter grace farre deceyued whyche v washe hys handes cleane thereof shoulde shrincke one culpable v excuse himselfe guiltlesse therefore herein doubt farre caste praye god quoth duke let v go dinner sate downe dinner duke wente queene commission tyme sealed lieutenantshippe army tooke leaue hir didde certaine lordes also duke came councell chamber tooke leaue earle arundale prayed god grace saying sorie chance goe beare companye whose presence could finde hys hearte spende hys blo de euen feete earle arundale tooke thomas louell duke boy hande saide farewel gentle thomas al heart duke l marque northampton lorde grey dyuers tooke barge went dirham place white hall night mustred theyr men next day morning duke departed number menne aboutes rode thorough shordi che saith whether would haue captaines said yea mary saide ye shall haue throwe bottome sea captaines saide forthwith would serue queene mary willingly broughte forth men conueyed great ordinaunce commyng shippes ladye mary wonderfull ioyous afterwarde doubted little duke puissaunce newes therof broughte tower eche manne beganne draw backward ouer word greater mischiefe broughte tower saye nobleman nobilitie others councell remayning london proclaymed queene aboute fiue clocke night suche nobilitie company came market crosse callyng harrault hymselfe proclaymed queene mary among threwe vppe hy owne cap wythin houre letter councell said shoulde forthwith dismiss army come within tenne myles london fo woulde fight wyth hym rumour sooner abroade euerie man departed shortlye duke arrested king colledge one maister slegge sergeant armes laste letter brought councell london al shoulde goe eche way wherevpon duke sayde kepte yee doe wrong withdrawe libertie see counsel letter wythoute exception men shoulde go whither would wordes kepte hym nobleman sete libertie contynued night insomuche earle warwicke readye morning haue rode away came erle arundel fro queen ye duke chamber went meete soone saw earle arundale fel hys knee desired hym good loue god cosider saith haue done nothing co sent whole councell lorde quoth earle arundale sente hither queenes maiestie hir name doe arreast obey lorde quoth beseeche lorde arundale quoth duke vse mercy towardes mee knowing case lorde quoth earle yee shoulde haue sought mercie sooner muste doe accordyng commaundement therewith committed charge guarde gentleman stoode xxv july duke brought vp tower london vnder conducte henry earle arundale thus matter ended without bloudshed whiche men feared woulde haue brought death many thousandes p queene mary portrait queen mary mary eldest daughter king henrie eyghte beganneanno reg hir raigne sixth july yeare shee dissolued hir camp framingham whyche number thyrtie thousande declared doctour bonner byshoppe london late restored therein presence sermon hym place vpon gospell foure yeares uce vniustly caste vile prison marshalsea kepte raigne king edwarde whyche saying offended audience breaking silence saide bishoppe preached abhomination cryed meaning preacher pull oute pull hym oute beeing neare pulpit beganne clyme wherewith preacher stepped backe one maister bradforde preacher king edwardes tyme stepped place gentlye perswaded audience quietnesse obedience alleadging saint paule romaine let euery soule submitte himselfe authoritie higher power c neuerthelesse maister bourne standing mayster bradford one threwe dagger hym whych hit side poste pulpit anda dagger throvvne preacher rebounded backe againe greate waye vppon mayster bradford brake hys speach forced hymselfe helpe iohn rogers preacher conuey maister bourne oute audience whyche wyth greate labor broughte paules schoole xviij august iohn dudley duke northumberlande william parre marque northampton erle warwike sonne heire duke arraigned westminster hall thomas duke norffolke high steward englande duke northumberland wyth greate reuerence towardes judge protested hys faith allegeance queene whome confessed greeuously haue offended saide meante speake anye thing defence tact requested vnderstand opinion courte twoo poyntes first whether man anye acte aucthoritie prince councel warrant greate seale england doyng nothing without might charged treason thing whiche might doe warrant thereof secondly whether person equally culpable crime whose letter commaundementes directed doyngs myghte bee hys judge passe vppon hys tryall hys peeres wherevnto aunsweared concerning firste greate seate whiche layde hys warrant seale lawful queene realme passed aucthoritie seale usurper therefore coulde warrant hym second alleadged anye deepely bee touched case hymselfe yet long atteynder recorde agaynste neuer lesse person able lawe passe vppon anye tryall bee chalenged therefore prince pleasure whyche aunsweare duke vsed fewe wordes confessed inditement whose example prisoner arraigned like therevppon iudgement iudgement gyuen duke said beseech lord humble futers queenes maiestie graunte mee foure requestes whyche yr maye haue death whyche noble haue hadde tymes paste secondartly hir maiestie gratious chyldren whyche maye hereafter doe good seruice consyderyng wente commaundement theyr father tree willes thyrdlye maye haue appoynted learned manne instruction quiet conscience fourthlye shee sende twoo councell commune wyth mee whome declare suche matter shall expedient hir common weale thus beseech al pray nineteenth auguste arraigned westminster sir iohn gate sir henrie gate sir andrew dudley sir thomas palmer wythout anye quest pleaded guiltie submitted themselues queen mercy iudgement august doctdure watson chaplaine byshop winchester preached paules crosse queen appoyntment feare like un lie sonday laste paste certaine lordes counsell repayred sermon lorde treasourer lord priuie seale ye earle bedforde earle pembrooke lorde wentworth lorde bliche sir honrie ge g capitayne guarde wyth two hundred guarde whych foode aboute preacher halbert also maior warned company cittie preacher paules crosse guarded present ly erie whyche well accepted queenes counc l sermon quietly ended xxij august iohn duke northumberlande beheaded tower hill whose bodye head buryed bodye edwarde late duke somerset lyeth highe aultare w duke two queenes weere duke duke northumberlande queene anne queene katherine foure beheaded time place also likewise beheaded sir iohn gate sir iohn gate sir thomas palmer beheaded sir thomas palmer whyche sir iohn gate place vsed fewe word layd downe hea withoute kerchef st en three blowes syr thomas palmer loone came staffolde tooke euerye manne hande desyred praye hym putting gowne leaned vpon easte rayle sayde word effecte maisters quoth god saue ot wherefore come hither whyche haue worthilye well defe ed god handes knowe h diuine ordinance meanes call mercie teache knowe mys tre wherevnto subiecte thanks hys mercifull goodnes hath caused learne one litle darke corne euer learned trauell many place haue bin say haue seene god vnsearcheable wonderous workes infinite mercy haue seene selfe throughly nothing lump sinne earth dust vilenesse vilest haue seene know world dayne deceiptfull transitorie short wicked loathsome workes thereof sight god maiestie neyther regardeth man ee proude men mighty one neyther despiseth humblenesse poore lowly world finally haue seene death neere hanging ouer euery man head yet vncertayne time vnknowne men little feared feare death sadde therefore haue seene two dye mine eye yea within hearing mine eares neyther rinckling bloud sheading thereof bloudy axe selfe shall make afrayd taking leaue pray pray come good fellow quoth art thou must deede forgiue thee heart kneeled downe laying head blocke sayd see meete necke pray thee strike yet haue prayer say done strike god name good leaue haue thou prayer ended desiring man pray layd downe head agayne executioner tooke one stroke xxiij august queene deliuered greatenevv lord chancellour seale doctour gardener bishop winchester made lord chauncellour xxvij august seruice began latin beelatine seruice song paules church london xxvj august euening notablest shippegreat harry first day october queene went water old pallace remayned till eleuen clocke went foote vpon blew cloath rayled eyther side vnto saint peter church solemnely crowned noynted bishop winchester coronation ceremony solemnity vsed according old custome fully ended till nigh foure clocke night returned church whome borne three sword sheathed one naked great seruice day done westminster hall dinner diuers nobleman would aske long time write lorde maior london twelve citizen kept high cupb rd plate butler ye queen gaue maior fee cuppe gold couer waying seauenteene ounce fifth october parliament began westminster parliament fiue twenty day october barge graues end catch running vpon hir ouerturned fourteenegraues end barge ouerturned person drowned sixteene saued swimming sir thomas white merchant taylor october maior sir thomas white worthy patron protector poore scholers learning renued rather erected acharitable deedes sir tho vvhite colledge oxford called saint iohns colledge bernard colledge also erected schooles bristow reading moreouer worshipfull citizen life time gaue citie bristow two thousand pound ready money purchase land yearely value pound decreed maior burgeses communaltye bristow anno yearely tearme ten yeares next ensuing cause payd bristow one hundred pound lawfull money first pound lent sixteene poore yong men clothier free men towne space tenne yeares fiftie pound peece putting sufficient surety end ten yeares lent sixteene discretion maior alderman foure common counsell sayde citie two hundred pound employed prouision corne reliefe poore citie ready money without gaine taken end tenne yeares feast day saint barthelmew shall anno merchant taylor hall london vnto maior communaltie citie yorke attourney aucthorised hundred four pound lent vnto four yong men sayde citie yorke freeman inhabitant clothier alway preferred viz euery fiue twenty pound haue occupie terme tenne yeares without paying thing loane four pound ouerplus pound pleasure maior communaltie paine taken rescepts paymentes sayd pounde like order poyntes taken deliuerie pound yeare citie canterbury yeare reading company merchant taylours glocester worcester eyght beginning moneth january emperour sent noble man called ecmondane certayne embassador england conclude marriage betweene king phillip sonne queene mary englande fourteenth january stephen gardener bishop winchester lord chancellour england chamber presence westminster made lordes nobilitie gentleman oration eloquent wherein hee declared queenes maiestie partly amitie waightie consideration muche suite emperours prince spaynes behalfe made determined consent counsell nobilitie match hir selfe sayde prince godly lawfull matrimonie declared haue hir ioynter thirtie thousand duckets yeare lowe countrey flanders issue happened betweene two lawfully begotten bee heire well kingdome spayne also sayde lowe countrey sayde therefore bound thanke god noble worthy famous prince would vouchsafe humble hymselfe thys marriage take vppon hym rather subiect otherwise queene hir counsell shoulde rule thynges e dyd shoulde bee counsell stranger neyther haue custodie anye fortes castels c beare anye rule office queenes house elsewhere englande yuers article hym rehearsed e hee sayde queenes pleasure request lyke good subiectes hir sake woulde inglye receyue reuerence ioy honoure next day lord maior london breethren alderme sent court bring fortie head commoner citie vnto whome counsell lord chancellour made like oration desiring behaue themselues like good subiects humblenesse reioycing purpose marriage greeuously taken diuers men religion suchconspiracy sort conspired queene matter broken time appoynted men thought would haue brought much trouble daunger xxv january sir iohn gage lord chamberlayne certified lord maior london sir thomascommotion kent sir thomas vviat wyat certayne rebel vp kent aboute maydestone wherevpon great watche kepte night lord maior rode peruse euery night two alderman like day time gate citie warded substantiall citizes xxvij january lord treasurer came guild hall counsell request citizen prepare fiue hundred footemen well harnessed go agaynste wyat granted made ready night morrow deliuered captaines sent grauesend water xxix january duke norffolke captayne gard souldiersthe duke norffolke sente vvyat captaine souldiers sent london minded assault rochester castell wyat people lay setting forward thesevvyat strengthened vvith queenes ordinance men duke sent mayster nory herault vnto rochester queenes proclamation pardon would desist purpose comming bridge woulde haue gone citie kept bridge would suffer till captayne came last granted read citie holding dagge cryed speak softly else would shoote thorough would suffer people heare proclamation beeing ended man cryed done nothing wherefore neede pardon quarrell taken hande would lyue dye neuerthelesse last sir george harpar receyued pardon outwardly beeing receiued vnder duke norffolkes protection came forwarde againste kentishmen euen company set readinesse marched forward toward bridge brette beeing captayne fiue hundred londoner parte foreward turned himselfe aboute drawing sword sayd like word maysters go fight natiue countreymen england friend quarrell vnrightfull partly wicked considering great manyfolde misery like fall vpon v shall vnder rule proude spanyards heere assembled make resistance comming auoyding great mischiefes inconueniences likely light vpon themselues euery v whole realme wherefore thinke english heart ought say much lesse fighting withstande therefore others meaning ranke hym spende bloud quarrell worthy captayne mayster wyat gentleman heere assembled word pronounced man turned ordinance agaynst folowers therevpon cryed wyat wyat sodeyne noyse duke captayne gard beeing abashed fledde forthwith immediatly came mayster wyat hys company horssebacke rushing amongst well garde londoner sayde many wyll come tarrye wyth v shall welcome many wyll departe good leaue haue londoner parte gard three artes retinue wente campe kentishmen still remayned discomfiture duke lost eyght peeces brasse munition ordinance himselfe hardly escaped last january wyat company came dertforde next day came full whole greenewich depeford remayned thurseday fryday foorenone satterday fryday candlemas day parte housholders
