place went made proclamation agaynst queenes marriage prince spayne c people enclined first february proclamation made london duke suffolke discomfited fled two breethren also sir peter carow vnckle sir gawyn carow gibbes fledde france queene pardon whole camp kentishmen except wyat harpar rudstone iseley soeuer could take sir thomas wyat except sayde foure person haue hundred pound land hym heires euer day afternoone candlemas euen common citie assembled liueries guild hall whether queene hir lord ladyes camequeene mary came guild hall london riding westminster vehement wordes wyat declared meant otherwise marrie counsell thinke honourable commodious realme could continue vnmaryed done greatest part hir age therefore willed truly assist hir repressing contrarie duty rebelled done vnderstanding many london fauour wyat part appoynted lord william howard lieutenant oflord vvilliam hovvard lieutenant citie citie earle pembroke general field prepared thyngs necessarie theyr purpose meane season weete third day februaryvvyat came southvvarke three clocke noone sir thomas wyat kentishmen marched forwarde depeford towards london fiue ancient beeing estimation two thousand comming soone perceyued shot white tower sixe eyght shotte missed sometime shooting ouer sometime short knowledge thereof london forth draw bridge cut downe bridge gate shutte maior sheriffes harnessed commanded man shutte shoppes windowes ready harnessed dores chance soeuer might happen time wyat entred kentstreete saint george churche southwarke himselfe part hys company came good aray downe barmondsey streete suffered peaceably enter southwarke without repulse anye stroke stricken eyther inhabitant yet many men countrey innes reysed brought thither lorde william haue gone sayd wyat ioyned themselues kentishmen inhabitantes best enterteyned immediatly vpon sayde wyat comming hee made proclamation souldyour shoulde take anye thyng hee shoulde pay hys commyng resist spanish kyng c bridge foote layde two peeces ordinance beganne greate trenche betweene bridge hym hee layde one peece ordinance sainte george one going bermondsey streete one toward bishop winchester house shroue tuesday sixth february sir thomas wyat remoued southwarke towarde kingston bridge done vpon occasion nighte hys departing southwarke chance onevvyat remoued southvvarke lieutenant men tower named thomas menchen rowed sculler ouer bishop winchester place waterman tower staire desired sayde lieutenant man take beeing espyed wyat men seauen harguebusses called land agayne would whereupon man discharged peece killed sayd waterman forthwith falling downe dead sculler much payne rowed bridge tower wharffe lieutenant man dead man boate thing sooner knowne lieutenant euen night next morning bent seauen great peeces ordinance euluerings demicanons full foote bridge southwarke two steeple saint oliues saint mary oueryes besides peeces white tower one culuering diueling tower three fauconets ouer water gate soone inhabitant southwarke vnderstoode certayne men woman came wyat lamentable wise saying sir like vtterly vndone destroyed sake oure house shall bee throwne downe vpon head vtter spoyle thys borough shotte tower ready bente charged towardes v loue god therefore take pitie vppon v whiche wordes hee beeyng partly abashed stayde awhile sayde pray friendes bee contente whyle soone ease mischiefe god forbid least heere killed hurt behalfe speedye manner hee martched awaye marched towards kingstone met chance merchantvviat marched tovvards kingstone named christopher dorell whome called saying cosen dorell pray commend vnto citizen londoner say vnto libertie freedome offered woulde receyue neyther woulde admitte enter within gate theyr freedome disburthening theyr greefes oppression stranger would haue franckely spente blond cause quarrell nowe well appeareth theyr vnthankefulnesse v friendes meaneth much good therefore lesse bee moned heereafter miserable tyrannie stranger shall oppresse hee wente forwarde daye nighte hee came kingstone bridge broken kepte syde two hundreth men wherefore wyat caused two peeces ordinance layde ende bridge whiche feared syde durst abyde caused hee three foure hys souldyers leape thamis swimme syde lewsed westerne barge whyche lay tyed brought ouer meanes passed water woonderfull paynes hee tooke himselfe comming foote amongst neyther dyd stay anye whitte nyghte came almost brayneforde euer discryed queenes scoutes chaunce meeting brette hys companye brette sayde scoute backe villayne thou goe farther discouer thing heere thou shalte dye hande scoute returned great hast day afternoone two men hangedexecution paules churchyard gibbet paules church yard marciall law one seruant duke suffolke late sheriffe leycester baker one white coates sent citie agaynste wyat day came tidings duke breethren taken day towards night laden tenne twelue carte ordinace billes pike speares bowes arrowes powlder shotte shouels mattockes basket munition two cul erings one sacre three fawcons fawconet stuffe stayde paules church yard night also aboute fy e clocke trompetter went warned horssemen men armes saint iames field footemen also sixe clocke next morning queenes scoute vpon returne court declared wyat beeing brayneforde whiche sodeyne newes made courte wonderfullye afrayde drommes went london four clocke commanding souldiours armour charing crosse wyat hearing earle pembroke come field stayde knightes bridge vntill day men weerie trauell night day also partly feebled faint hauing receyued small sustenance since comming southwarke restlesse small ado london likewise tower made great preparation defence tenne cloke earle pembroke set troupe horssemen hill high way aboue newe bridge ouer saint iames footemen set two battels somewhat lower neerer charing crosse lane turning downe bricke wall islington ward set also certayne horssemen planted ordinance vpon hill side meane season wyat company planted ordinance vpponvvyat saint iames fielde hill beyond saint iames almost ouer parke corner himselfe word spoken souldyers came downe old lane foote hard court gate saint iames four fiue auntients menne marching good array cuthbert vaughan two antients turned downe towarde westminster earle pembroke horssemen houered whyle without mouing vntill passed sauing tayle vpon set cut marched forward array neuer stayd returned ayde theyr tayle greate ordinance shotte freshly sydes wyat ordinance ouershotte troupe horssemen queenes ordinance one peece strake three wyat company rancke vpon head slaying strake wall parke harme done greate shotte neyther partie queenes whole battayle footemen standing still wyat passed along wall towardes charing crosse sayde horssemen set vppon parte soone forced backe charing crosse stoode sir iohn gage lorde chamberlayne wyth garde number beeing almost thousande vppon wyat comming shotte hys companye last fledde court gate certayne pursued forced wyth shotte shutte court gate thys repulse sayde lorde chamberlayne others amazed manye cryed treason courte hadde thought earle pembroke assaulting tayle hys enimies hadde gone wyat takyng hys parte agaynst queene running trying ladyes gentlewoman shutting dores windowes suche shriking noyse wonderfull heare wyat wyth hys menne marched still forwarde along temple barre thorough fleetestreete tyll hee came bell sauadge inne nigh vnto ludgate wythout resistance hys menne goyng good order array sayde strand certayne lorde treasurer hand number three hundreth men whereof lorde chidioke powlet sonne captayne met going one side passed going side without thing saying also strange sayde wyat hys company passed along greate companye harnessed men whiche stoode side streetes without anye withstanding marched forward fleetestreete sword drawne cryed queene mary hath graunted oure request giuen v pardon sayde queene hath pardoned v thus wyat men came euen ludgate knocked calling come saying wyat whome queene graunted haue requestes lorde william howarde stoode gate sayde auant traytor thou shalt come heere wyat stayde rested hym vppon stall ouer agaynste bell sauadge gate last seeing hee could gette citie beeing deceyued ayde hee hoped returned backe agayne array towards charing crosse neuer stopped till hee came temple barre certayne horssemen came fielde mette face beganne fyghte agayne tyll clarensus herraulte came sayde mayster wyat sir best counsell yeelde see thys daye gone agaynstevvyat taken resisting gette good bee death souldioures youre great perill soule perchance maye fynde queene mercifull rather yee stint greate bloudshead lyke heere bee wyat heerewyth beeyng somewhat astonyed although hee sawe hys menne bente fyghte sayde well shall needes yeelde wyll yeelde gentleman whome sir mawrice barkeley came streight bade hym leape vp behynde hym another tooke thomas cobham wyllyam kneuet carryed behinde vpo horsses courte taking menne side saide thys conflicte one pikeman setting backe wall saint iames kepte seauenteene horssemen hym greate tyme laste slaine whole number bothe side slaine thys battaile passed fortie person farre coulde learned viewed feld many sore hurte noyse woman child conflicte charing crosse greate hearde toppe white tower also great shotte well discerned saint iames fielde stoode vpon leades marque northampton sir nicholas poines sir thomas pope maister iohn seimer fiue clocke thomas wiat william kneuet thomas cobham two brother name mantel alexander vviat sent tovver bret broughte sir henrie ierningham water tower prisoner sir philip deny receyued bulwarke wiat passed saide goe traitor neuer suche traytor englande whome sir thomas wiat turned saide traitor woulde thou shouldest well knowe thou arte traitor point honeste man call went forth came tower gate sir thomas bridge lieuetenant tooke wicket firste mantele saide ah thou traitour hast thou thy companye wrought holding hys head saide nothing came thomas kneuet whome maister chamberlaine gentleman porter tower tooke came alexander bret whome sir thomas pope tooke bosome saying oh traitoure howe couldest thou finde thy hearte worke suche villany take wage trusted ouer bande men fall hir enimyes returning againste hir battell bret answered yea haue offended case came thomas cobham whome sir thomas poines tooke said ala master cobham wind headed worke treason aunswered oh sir seduced came sir thomas wyat whome sir iohn bridge tooke collar saide oh thou villaine vnhappy traytour howe couldest thou finde thy hearte worke detestable treason queenes maiestie gaue thee thy life liuing already althoughe thou diddest beefore time beare armes fielde hir yeeld hir battel c saith law muste passe vpon thee woulde sticke thee throughe dagger whyche wyat holding hys armes vnder side lookyng greeuouslye grimme looke vpon lieutenant said maistery nowe passed thomas wyat hadde shyrte maile wyth sleeues fayre thereon ueluet cassocke yellow lace windlace dag hanging thereon paire bootes legges head fayre hatte ueluet broade boneworke lace aboute william kneuet thomas cobham bret like apparelled morrow next day folowing brought tower prisoner george cobham sir wyllyam cobham anthony kneuet hugh booth thomas vain robert rudstone sir george harper edwarde wyat edward fogge george moore cutbert vaughan tenth february earle huntington gentlemenne number three hundred horssemenne broughte tower prisoner duke suffolke lord iohn grey hys brother couentrie duke hadde remayned three dayes taking house custody christopher warren alderman eleauenth day sir henry isley fledde brought tower prisoner old freese coate olde payre hosen apparell worth foure shilling daye came twoo culpepers one cromar thomas rampton duke suffolks secretary twelfth february monday tenne clocke went tower scaffold tower hill lorde guilforde dudley sonne duke northumberlande husband lady iane grey daughter duke suffolke without bulwarke gate maister thomas offley one sheriffes london receyued hym brought scaffolde small declaration kneeled downe said prayer holdyng vppe hys eye handes heauen wyth teares last desired people pray hym beheaded hys body beyng layde carre hys head cloth broughte chappel within tower ladye iane whose lodging maister partridge house see hys deade carcasse taken oute carre well see hym aliue going death sight hir worse tha death time scaffolde made vpon greene ouer againste white tower lady iane dye vppon beeing nothyng abashed neyther feare hir owne death whyche approched neyther wyth sighte dead carcasse hir husbande broughte chappel came forth lieuetenaunt leading hir wt countenance nothing abashed neither hir eies thing moistned teares booke hir hande wherein prayed vntill shee came said scaffolde whereon mounted beheaded whose death hastened feare trouble stirre hir tytle lyke hir father attempted fourteenth fifteenth february aboute number fiftie wyat faction hanged twenty paire gallows made purpose diuers place citie xvij februarye proclamation made straungers shoulde auoide realme within xxiiij dayes nexte ensuing vpon paine goodes confiscate al free denizen merchant embassador excepted xviij february bright one captaines londoner fledde wiat two twentie person kentishmen deliuered sheriffe kent executed dyuers place kent thekentishmen pardoned moste parte pardoned xxij february certaine wiats faction number four hundred led westminster coupled togither halter neckes tylt yarde queene looked forth hir gallery pardoned themduke suffolk beheaded xxiij february henrie grey duke suffolke beheaded tower hill xj marche william lorde howard admirall englande created baron howard effingham westminster erle deuonshire sent tovver xv march earle deuonshire apprehended committed tower suspition haue co sented wiats conspyracie xviij marche palmsonday lady elizabeth queenes sister lord treasurer earle sussex conueyed tower london fromparliament westminster water tj aprill parliament beganne westminster whyche appoynted haue beene kepte oxforde baron created v aprill sir iohn williams created baron tame saint iames vij april sir edward north created baron chartlege saint iames viij aprill sir iohn bridge created baron chondoys sudley saint iames catte hanged cheape viij aprill sonday catte hir head shorne likenesse uestment caste ouer hir hir fore teete tyed togither round peece paper like singing cake betwixte hanged gallowes cheape neare crosse parish saint mathew whyche catte taken downe carryed bishoppe london caused shewed paules crosse preacher doctor pendleton x aprill doctor cranmer archbyshop canterburie disputation oxforde doctour ridley byshoppe london hugh latimer bishop worcester coueyed prisoner tower london windsore thence oxforde dispute wyth diuines learned men contrary opinion xj april sir thomas wiat beheaded thethomas vviat beheaded tower hill quartred hys quarter set vppe dyuers place hys head gallowes hay hill neare hyde parke whence shortly stolne conueyed awaye xxvtj aprill lorde thomas grey brother late duke suffolke beheaded xiiij may gerrard fitz garret created erle kyldare baron ophelley heyres saint iames william thomas gentleman apprehended conspyring queene mary death william thomas matter drawne tyborne hanged quartred xviij may xix may ladye elizabeth conueyed tower london water richemonde thence windsore lord williams ricot oxfordshire thence woodstocke xxv may edward courtney earle deuonshire erle deuonshire sent fodringaye deliuered oute tower sir ralph chamberlaine suffolk sir thomas tresham knight conueyed fodringay castel northamptonshire remaine vnder custodie x june doctoure pendleton preached paules gunne shotte preacher crosse whome gunne shotte pellet whereof went neare lighte churche wall shooter coulde founde xxtj june proclamation made forbidding shooting handgunnes bearing weapon fifteenth july elizabeth croft wenche abo anno reg spirite vvall age eighteene yeares stoode vppon scaffolde paules crosse sermon tyme shee confessed moued dyuers lewde person therevnto hadde vppon foureteenth marche laste passed counterfaited certayne speaches house withoute aldersgate london thoroughe whyche people whole city wonderfully molested men mighte heare voice see hir person saide angell voyce heauen holy ghoste c thys called spirite wall hadde laine whistling straunge whistle made purpose whiche giuen hir one drake dyuers companion confederate hir whiche putting theselues among preasse tooke vppon interprete spirite saide expressing certaine seditious word againste queene prince spaine masse cofession c xix july prince spaine arriued southampton fourth day came winchester euening going churche honorably receyued byshoppe greate ouerthrew man playing dogge spire steeple perished long taken downe lesse charge parish repayring woulde haue cost instant tempest one south dores saint dionise churche fenchurch streete dore queenes maiestie englande arriued harwich essex honourably receyued enterteyned ye earle oxford said earle lord robert dudley goodly baude gentleman yeoman conueyed london receyued diuers knightes gentleman court fifth october trayne number fiftie person well horssed conuayed bishop winchester place southwarke lodged abode heere remoued thence two dayes easter homeward sped message may appeare foloweth take iohannes lewenclaij comment de bellis moscorum ericus king sweden sonne gustabus late king sayde kingdome hauing committed prison brother iohn duke finlande whome little employed england embassage queenes maiestie whome sued marriage sute reiected agayne second time solicited hir maiestie suite notwithstanding great dishonor fell iust disgrace attempted matter yongest daughter phillip lantgraue vanhessen whose hand hauing seconde tyme bin reiected hir maiestie heere matter beeyng knowne also onely receyued denyall lady hir father bestowed vppon adolfe duke van holst unckleiohannes lewenalaij frederike kyng denmarke enemie sayde erice thus farre iohannes lewenclaij thomas lodge roger martin september sherifes maior anno reg sir william hewet clothworker october time many men warre conueyed france scotlande placed townes fortress towne leeth dunbarre inskith whereby bee suspected would sodeynely inuade thys realme wherevpon queenes maiestie sente duke norffolke towardsduke norffolke sent scotland scotland generall army remayned berwike moneth aprill lord grey wilton entred1560 scotland army tenne thousand beseeged towne l th betweene french englishlord grey beseeged lieth often skirmish many slayne side taken prisoner may noble man france licence queenes maiestie passed england scotland talke queene dowager frenchman appeasing matter returne agayne england obteyned queenes maiestie send sir william ciuill knight hir maiesties principall secretary mayster doctour wootton treate frenchman wisedomes well ordered matter agreed vpon peace concluded thirteene article frenchman depart great quietnesse safetie england scotland therevpon hir maiestie reuoked hir army fortes rased without seysure holding peece within scotland fifth july shooting gunne whiche brake house one adrian arten dutchman crooked lane setting fire firken barell gunpowder four house blowne vp diuers otherhouses blovvn vp sore scattered nine men woman slayne diuers sore brused michaelmas euen noone published bythe third fall base money proclamation testone coyned twelue penny reigne king edward sixt called downe sixe penny forthwith best sort marked portculeys taken four written followeth william gefferey blasphemous heretike denving christ fauiour heauen vvilliam geffrey vvhipped sayd gefferey stayd bethlem gate iohn moore brought forth whome william gefferey whipped till confessed christ heauen sayde iohn moore examined answering ouerthwartlya false christ vvhipt commanded put coate dublet shirte seemed willingly beeing tied cart whipped arrowes shoote bedlem last also confessed christ bee heauen himselfe sinfull man iohn moore sente agayne vnto bedlem william gefferey marshalsea layne prisoner nigh yeare halfe one professing himselfe christ disciple frenchemen huge army assembled outeiohn cai partes fraunce recouer place passage stopping whereof power double woe common wealth bred throughe season yere putrifactio aire miserable infortunate plague among men whyche maruellously encreased death diuers best captain souldiors withal folowed cruel quicke siege whereat present yong kyng hymselfe queene hys mother beste tryed number warlike souldiours within whole countrey besides sorte yong olde cared life lande aduenture might winne againe cause distresse wyth generall ayde marishes made passable firme ground whych men great experience thought impossible common helpe cannon placed castell wals battered sundrye breach made beyond expectation howbeit rewarded oure gunner made taste bitter fruit desperate approche greate terrour annoyaunce mighte made auoide imminent slaughter effusion bloude offer seemed vnmeete bothe party concluded towne delyuered nine twentith july wyth condition englishemen departe towne sorte surrendred frenche thyrtie yeares towne ossestrie wale twelue myles shrewsburie number house saye seauen score wythin walles three score without suburbes beesides cloth corne cattel c consumed whyche fire began two clocke forenoone ended f great maruelling many great spoile fo short time happen two long street great rich town brent anno lykewise worse anno xxiiij aprill sergeant feaste kepte greis inne neare vnto holborne timesergeants feaste made seauen newe sergeant lawe xxvij may towne milnal suffolke eightmilnal suffolke brent myle newmarket house besides barnes stable like cosumed fire space two houres shane oneale trayterously rebelled againstshane oneale discomfited statuta regni hiberniae edmond campion queenes maiestie ireland done manye greate outrage partes v ster yeare wyth hys greate losse manfully repelled siege dundalke garrison thereof afterward great valiancie sir henrie sidney knight order lord deputie irelande discomfited sundry conflictes losse men nowe foreseeyng hys declination iminant determined put colle necke disguising himselfe repayre lord deputy patiently require pardon haue life neil keuer hys secretary incited rebellion perswaded hym firste trye treate friendship certaine wilde scot say clan ibon vnder conducting alexander oge mec gilliam buske whose father vncle shane oneale hadde lately kylled ouerthrow giuen scot neuerthelesse wel liking perswasion went saide camp second june dissembled entertainment quaffing wine gilliam buske burning wyth desire reuenge father vncles death ministryngshane oneale slayne quarrelling talke issued tent made feay vppon oneales men gathering togither hys scot throng sodainely entred tent againe wyth slaughter swordes hewed peeces shane oneale hys secretarie hys company excepte verye fewe whych escaped flyght june sir thomas sackuile knight created baron buckhurst westminster queenes palaice saint iohns euen nighte like standyngvvatche midsomer watche london beene saint peter euen yeare passed xxix july charles iames yong prince ofcreation scotlande scotlande sermon made iohn knokes crowned king scot sterling churche read certaine commission wyth queenes priuy seale establishing first hir resignation crowne gouernement yong prince hir sonne seconde aucthorize earle murrey regent minoritie thirde gyue authoritie power seauen ioyning sayde erle murrey case shoulde refuse exercise alone saye duke cha leroy earles leunex argyle athelmorto lencarne marre commission beeing ended byshoppe akelley wyth twoo superintendent proceeded coronation earle morton lorde hume tooke king hee shoulde rule faith feare loue god maintaine religion preached scotlande persecute aduersaries c whole ceremony coronation done mother tongue time queene scottes prisoner loughleuen thomas ramsey william bonde september sherifes maior sir roger martin mercer october drye summer followed sharpe winter wyth suche scarcitie fodder hay dyuers place solde waighte yorkeshire peake haye solde fiue penny stone followed also greate death cattel especially horse sheepe moneth january queenes maiestie sente narrow sea three hir ship named antelope swallow aide one barke named phoenix whiche manned v c men hir highnesse appointed charge ship men mayster william holstoke esquier comptroller hir highnesse shippes commaundement stay subiects king philip according hys duetie charge hee vsed suche diligence eleauenth marche nexte following mette eleauen saile flemishe hoyes vppon bolongne whyche came roan foure hundred odde tuunes gascoigne french wine whyche intended haue conueyed flaunders william holstoke stayed al saide hoyes sent london made discharge fleming disappointed moreouer eight twentith march said william holstoke seruing antelope present admirall company william winter yonger time uizadmirall seruing ayde basing capitaine llowe thomas generley captaine phoenix te narrowe sea wyth foureteene sayle greate h lkes whych come portingale bounde flaunders theyr chiefe lading beeyng portingale salte yet hadde good store spanishe rialles plate also greate store spice fourteene hulkes mainteyne fight space two houres perceyue could preuayle sayd w holstoke hys company tooke eyght hulkes whereof sixe sent riuer thamis admirall uizadmirall sayd hulkes two great shippes w holstoke himselfe take conuayed harwich discharged xxviij march vehement rage tempestgreat vvinds windes many doyngs bee aduise consent nobilitie realme deede wholly bente manyfestly appeared spende theyr liues dutifull obedience agaynste traytors sometymes pretending conscience sake seeke reforme religion naylor champion simon lowe shortly thervpon sir ierome bowes leading nailor hand entreth lystes bringing hym downe square entred left judge til came next square iust judge making curtesi first one leg wyth passed forth til came middle place made lyke obeysance passing till came bar made like curtesie shield held vp aloft ouer head nailor put nether stock bare foote bare legged saue silke auilonions ye ankle dublet sleeues tyed vp aboue elbow bareheaded came aforesaid surety george thorne called bring thorne immediatly sir henrie cheyney entring vpper ende right hand judge vsed like order coming hys side naylor side comming bar like obeysance helde vp shield proclamation made none touch bar presume come within except appoynted solempne order finished l chiefe justice rehearsing maner bringing writ right simon low answere made thervnto paramore proceeding therein paramore chalenged defend right lande battel champion thomas thorne accepting tryall lowe champion henrie naylor default appearance lowe adiudged land paramore dismissed champion acquitting surety band also willed henrie naylor render againe george thorne gauntlet wherevnto sayde naylor aunsweared hys lordeshyp myghte commaunde hym thing willingly would render saide ga tlet thorne excepte hee coulde winne chalenged saide thorne playe wyth hym halfe score blowes shew pastime lorde chiefe justice assembled thorne aunsweared hee came fighte woulde playe lordo chiefe justice commending naylor valiaunt courage commaunded bothe quietly te departe fielde c sixeteenth july rebecca chamber late wyfe toa vvoman bret eloquent diligent preacher farre painfull studious writer hys workes remayning beare witnesse whereby hys fame shall neuer dye henrie milles iohn braunche september sherifes maior christian victorie againste turkes sir william allin mercer october ninth nouember great reioycing made london hanquetting bonefyres ioye late come newes maruellous victorie obtayned christian army sea turkes sixth october last passed wherein taken sunke turkes galleis brygantines two hundred thyrtie slaine turkes thyrtie thousande besides great number prisoner taken aboute twelue thousande christian bin slaues inquiry made land concealed contrarye hir maiesties meaning chalenging land ocks money plate c letting also make pretence belle lead suche thyngs belonging parishe church chappels hir maiestie meaning speedily wythstande suche manner vnlawfull practises commaunded al commission extant determined inquisition manner concealementes houlde supersidias oute hir exchequer reuoked also appoynted speedye queenes dayes serued fiue king queenes henrie seauenth henrie eight edwarde sixth queen marie queene elizabeth serued faithfully greately fauoured hymselfe see chyldr n hys child child growen ber blessing gyuen god men hys ing xxv xxvj march commaundement queenes maiestie hir councel citizen london assembling halle maisters chose oute mo e person euerye company e three thousande appoynted pikemen h pikemen forthwith armed r e r furniture according vnto gunner euery hys callyuer furniture theyr hea e appoynted dyuers valiant capitaines aine vp warlike ea r ce euery weeke sometimes artillery yarde teaching gunner handle peeces sometime mile end saint george fielde teaching skyrmishe whyche skyrmishe wythe mile end tenth aprill one goldsmith company shot wyth peece scowring sticke lefte one calyuers whereof dyed buryed twelfth aprill paules churcheyarde al gunner marching mile end battaile ray shotte theyr calyuers hys graue may day mustred grenewich ye queen maiestie shewed manye warlike feates hindred weather whych day showring returned nighte london discharged nexte morrowe fourth may walter deueroux lorde ferrers ofearles essex lincolne created chartley viscount fonde created earle essex edwarde fine lorde clinton say hyghe admirall englande created earle lincolne eight may parliament beganne westminster baron made daye parliament queenes maiesties writtes sir henrie compton knight lorde compt n hole sir henry cheyney knight lorde tudington sir william pawlet knight basing sir henrie norrice knight lorde rycote called baron higher house parliament muche whole realme england exceedingly pestred roags uagabonds sturdy beggers meanes wherof dayly hapned diuers horrible murder theftes greate outrage enacted person aboue age fourteene yeres beyng taken begging vagrant androags brente wandring misorderly shoulde apprehended whipped brent gri le right eare hote yron one ynch compasse firste time taken foure twentith may martin bulloke hanged gibbet well two bucket bishoppes gate streete london robbing shamefullye murdering merchaunt named arthure hall personage saint martine saide well thys martin hadde procured saide arthure hall come sayd personage buy hym certaine plate saide arthure hadde well viewed saide none plate hathe doctor gardener marke knowe true said martin bullocke hath appoynted sell c thys talke whyles said arthure weighing plate martin fetcht kitchen thicke washing bee le commyng behinde hym strake saide arthure head hee felled firste stroke strake hym againe tooke saide arthures dagger sticked hym wyth hys knyfe cut hys throate woulde haue trussed hym danske cheste shorte wherevppon tumbled downe paire stayres thinking haue buryed hym seller hys legges broken fyrst fal stiffe coulde drawe hym downe seller staires beeyng wynding wherefore cutte hys leg wyth hatchet ende trussed hym strawe drye fat saying apparell bookes caused carryed water side shipped rye sixe twentith may right honorable earle lincolne departed london towardes fraunce embassador accompanyed lord dacres lord riche lord talbot lord sandes lord clinton sir arthure chambernowne sir ierome bowes sir edwarde hastings knightes wyth dyuers gentleman takyng ship deuer cutte ouer bolongne honorably receyued thence conueyed iorneys paris lodged house ye king named le chasteau de loure attended king officer fiue dayes wente king house called madril kyng wyth two brother admirall moste parte noble fraunce mette distance place broughte house dyned remayned till sondaye followwyng whence kyng hys noble noble englande came paris kyng two brother oure embassador ryding one coche togither noble england fraunce placed also coches came saide castell loure dyned dinner king embassadour nobibilitie bothe realmes wente churche named saint germaine frenche king brother nobilitie hearde euensong noble men englande withdrawing chappell til euensong done fetched thence noble fraunce kyng hys brother auguste sir thomas smith one theenglishme sente vlstar irelande queenes maiesties priuie councell carefully tending reformation irelande sent hys sonne thomas smith esquyre thither colonie englishemen inhabite ardes vlster richarde pipe nicholas woodroffe september sherifes maior sir lionell ducket mercer october eyghteenth nouember mornyng anno reg strange starre appeared seene starre northwarde verye brighte cleare constellation cassiopeia backe hir chaire whiche wyth three chiefe fixed starres saide constellation made geometrical figure losinge wise learned menne called rombus thys starre bignesse fyrste appearing seemed bigger iupiter muche lesse venus seemeth greatest also said starre neuer changing hys place carryed daylye motion heauen fixed starres commonlye contynued little little eye appearyng lesse space almoste sixeteene moneths tyme small rather thoughte exercise ofte viewyng myghte imagine place eye coulde iudge presence one thyng herein chieflye noted learned skill consent best expect mathematician obserued state property circumstance belonging starre found haue bin place celestiall farre aboue moone otherwise euer anye comet hathe bin seene naturally appeere therefore supposed signification thereof directed purposely specially matter naturall celestiall rather supercelestiall straunge beginning worlde neuer like four twentith nouember edward earle ofearle lately offered tenne thousande men queenes maiestie owne charge suppression last rebellion godlye disposition tenantes neuer forcing anye seruice handes due payment rent liberalitie stranger shewed counsel pyrates kepte narrowe sea manye robbery also robbing earle worcester aforesaid hir highnesse aduice hir honorable counsell tooke order wyth lorde admirall englande shoulde sende sea shippes men scowre narrow sea apprehende manye pyrates ship mighte mette better thereof pleased hir maiestie sende one hir owne shippes named swallowe admiral vnder charge william holstocke london esquyre comptroller hyr highnesse shippes hadde wyth hym gyllian barke garet barke yarmouth able marriuers gunner souldiours saide three shippes one barke whyche scowred narrowe sea north forelande farre weastwardes falmouth inpyrates vveast seat cornwall tooke twentie shippes barkes sundrye nation viz englishe frenche fleming pirate fashion warre apprehended shippes barkes number men nation sent warde sandwiche douer wighte portesmouth wherof three robbed earle worcester shortlye executed wight also saidpirats executed william holstocke rescue take abouesaide pyrats shippes fifteene merchant shippes laden marchandise prises sundry nation set libertie said fifteene merchaunt shippes goodes whiche done returned portsmouth ended voyage march peter ramus hys commentary war france peter ramus writeth thus earle worcester passing france certaine frenchemen fleming set vppon hym tooke one ship kylled certaine hys men wherevpon queene englande takyng displeasure sente lorde admirall saith wherein mistooke matter maister william holstocke sente aforesaide set vpon shippes french fleming tooke carryed awaye came hande xx mongomeries shippes lost goyng rochell number fiftie shippes well furnished oute englande wyth money borrowed neuer repayed thus nauie diminished twenty shippes hee saw king nauie neere rochel directed course way landed bel isle tooke bothe isle castel fourth marche man hanged chaines ina man hanged saint george fielde saint george fielde beyonde southwarke london murdethe gaylour horsham fielde seauenteenth marche deceassed reinolde grey ofearle kent deceassed ruthen earle kent hernesey buryed saint giles withoute creeplegate aboute time dyed edmonde lorde chandos fiue twentith marche beyng wednesday in1573 george sauders murdered shooter hill easter weeke feaste n ciation lady george browne cruelly murdered two honest men neere vnto shooter hill kent one wealthie merchant london named george saunders iohn bean wolwich whyche murder committed maner followeth tuisdaye easter weeke foure twentith marche saide george browne receyuing secreate intelligence letter fro maistresse anne drewrie maister saunders shoulde lodge night house one maister barnes woolwiche thence goe foote saint mary cray nexte morning lay wayte waye little shooter hill slewe bothe hym iohn bean seruant maister barnes iohn bean hauyng senne eleauen woundes beeyng left dead god prouidence reuiued agayne creeping awaye foure founde olde manne maiden conueyed woolwiche gaue euident markes murtherer immediatelye vpon deede browne sent maistresse drewrie worde thereof roger clement among called trustie roger himselfe repaired forthwith courte greenewiche anone came thither report murther also departed thece vnto london came house maistresse drewrie thoughe spake personallye wyth hir co ference hadde hir seruant trustie roger prouided twentie pounde daye whych laide certaine plate hir owne maistresse saunders guage nexte morrowe thurseday hauing intelligence browne soughte sente hym sixe poundes roger warnyng hym shift hymself flight whyche thing forflowed doe neuerthelesse lordes queenes maiesties councell caused speedy narrowe searche made hym vppon eight twentith moneth hee apprehended man house owne name rochester brought backe againe court examined councel confessed deede haue hearde often time pretended sought instigation sayde maistresse drewrie promised make marriage betweene hym maistresse saunders whome seemed loue excessiuely neuerthelesse protested thoughe vntrulye maistresse saunders priuie consenting therevnto upon confessio arraigned king bench westminster hall xviij aprill hee acknowledged himselfe guiltie condempned principal murder according sentence excuted smithfield monday xx april time also vntruely hir selfe confessed afterward labouredgeorge brovvn hanged smith fielde al meanes cleare maistresse saunders comitting euill hir body flung himselfe besides ladder hanged vp chaines neare vnto place done facte meane time mistresse drewry hir man examined well owne confession falling matter also brown appeachment thought culpable committed warde mistresse saunders deliuered child churched time hir husbads death looked presently lie downe vpon mistresse drewryes man confession great likelyhoodes likewise committed tower wednesday sixth may arraigned mistresse drewry guild hall effect whose enditemet meanes vsed haue reduced dutifull obedience authority treatie hither haue duely hearkened vnto hinderaunce vniuersall peace realme withholding highnesse castle meaning seemeth reserue receptacle forraine force manifest daungers realme soueraignesse therefore necessarie remoue perilous daunger realmes consideration hir maiestie hath sente hir ayde succour men ordinaunce munition vnder charge leading repugnation recouerie sayde castel saide king vse behalfe therefore according hyr maiesties commandement commission shal due manner warne require summon render deliuer saide cascell whole ordinaunce artillerie munition jewel housholde stuffe implement within vse behalfe king soueraigne regent name immediately letter summons knowledge shall come obey duetie oughte shall hir maiesties xvij may began battery castell xxx canon shotte well bestowed dauids tower ruines therof force english canon easte seene xviij xix xx may canon demy canon ydle xxj whole battery began side castell trench mount hotly still within ceased make answer againe artillery killing hurting diuers english scottes diligence english gunner displaced ordinance castell stroke one chiefe canon iust mouth whereby broken peeces xxvj may assault giuen scauen clocke morning spurre hardy manhoode assaylants wonne sooner entred englishman general ensigne shewed spread vpon front toppe thereof great discomfort within castell meane time whilest appoynted giue assault thus spurre certayne englishman scottes commaunded make countenance assault west side castell whereby assaulted spurre might easily obteyne purpose rashly aduenturing farther commandement beaten backe repulsed xxviij xxx company slayne hurt day towarde night within castell drumme demaunded parley graunted assurance hostilitie said xxviij day may castell surrendred hand sir williamedenborough castell yeelded englishman drewry rested possession time ensigne set vp spread time sundry place castell afterwards great honor england deliuered vnto vse king scottes part spoyle castell giuen souldyers canon artillerie certayne instrument left king englishman force taken decreed haue whole spoyle except artillerie shoulde haue enioyed space three dayes cause deliuerie castell lacke water well within castel stopped defiled ruines castell well without castell could serue mount made hinder another water vnknowne without burchet hanged nigh place wounded maister hawkins yeare lammas wheate sold london anno reg three shilling bushell shortly reysed four shilling fiue shilling sixe shilling christmas noble seauen shilling continued long beefe sold twenty penny twodearth vvithout scarcitie twenty penny stone flesh white meates excessiue price kind salt fish deere fyue hearing two penny c yet great plentye freshe fishe oft time cheape pea foure shilling bushell otemeale foure shilling eyght penny bay salt three shilling bushell c thys dearth notwithstanding thankes giuen god want thing wanted money fourth aprill palme sunday was1574 taken saying masse lorde morleis house within aldgate london one albon dolman priest ladypriests saying masse apprehended morley hir child diuers others also taken hearing sayde masse also taken day houre saying masse lady gilfordes trinitie lane one oliuer heywood priest hearing sayd masse sayde lady gilford diuers gentlewoman also taken instant lady browne house cow lane saying masse one thomas heywood priest one iohn couper priest lady browne diuers likewise taken hearer sayd masse person offence indicted conuicted law according statute case prouided also found seuerall chappels dyuers latin bookes beades image palmes challices cross uestments pires pares like countie mongomery taken normandy thepeter ramus castell donfro xxvij may ix july sixe clocke night jste thanet besides ramesgate parish saint peter vnder clift monstrous fish whale sea dida monstrous fish monstrous reported eye great vvere head baeke shoote himselfe shore want water beating himselfe sand dyed sixe clocke next morning time roared heard mile land length fish two twenty yard nether iaw twelue foote opening one eye taken head sixe horse cart could draw man stoode vpright place whence eye taken thicknesse backe whereon lay toppe bellie vpward fourteene foote tayle breadth betweene eye twelue foote three stood vpright mouth ribbes xvj foote log tong xv foote long liuer two cart loade nostrels man might haue crept oyle boyled head parmasitie oile body whitishe sweete taste seauenth august solempne obsequie keptobsequie paules frenche kyng peter ramus saint paules church london charles ninth king fraunce poysoned deceassed thyrtith may laste passed fifteenth august sunday agnes bridge agni bridge rachell pinder paules crosse counterfayting possessed maide age xx yeres rachell pinder wench age xj xij yeres olde hadde counterfaited possessed diuel whereby onely maruellouslye deluded many people menne woman also diuers person otherwise seemed good wit vnderstanding stoode preacher paules crosse acknowledged theyr hypocriticall counterfayting wyth penitent behauioures requyring forgiuenesse god worlde people pray also seuerall examination confession openly read preacher afterwards published print posteritie hereafter beware like deceiuers fourth september afternoone storma lad yeres olde drovvned chanell london rayne happened london like long time coulde remembred wherethrough chanels city sodainelye rysing ran suche forcible course towardes common shore lad age eighteene yeres minding haue leapte ouer chanell neere vnto downgate borne ouer streame carryed conduit towardes thamis wyth suche swiftnesse man wyth staues wayes coulde staye hym tyll came againste cart wheele stoode water gate afore time drowned starke dead thomas blanke anthony gammage septemb sherifes maior iames hawes clothworker october maior wente water westminster tooke othe hathe bin accustomed kepte feast atno maiors feaste guild hall guyld hall althoughe greate prouision hadde beene made purpose dyned owne house wyth brother alderman company dined theyr seueral halle done appointment queenes maiesties councell auoide infection plague like haue encreased comming togither multitude weeke two twentith eighte twentith october deceassed citie liberty contayning parish al disseases whiche number accompted dye plague michaelmasse terme whyche hadde beene adiournedterme adiorned proclamation began westminster sixth nouember sixth daye morning hapned two greate tydes london thamis first bytvvo tydes one houre course within one houre ouerflowed marsh many vault seller neare adioyning foureteenth nouember sundaye aboute midnight following diuers strange impression fire smoke seene ayre proceede foorth blacke cloude north towardes south whych continued till nexte morning day light next night following heauens partes seeme burne maruellous ragingly ouer head flame horizon rounde aboute rysing meete double roll one beene cleare fornace eighteenth day night stormy tempestuousanno reg windes oute south haue knowne like quarter especially midnight till nexte morning day light receyued token god wrath ready bente agaynste worlde sinne nowe aboundyng also greate mercie doeth onely shewe rod wherewith wee dayly deserue beaten thys yeare london haruest price wheate began little little fall seauen shilling three shilling bushell price stayed little nothing rising falling yeare bay salte raysed three shilling foure shilling fiue shillingsbay salt deare sixe shilling bushell like whereof neuer bin seene heard within realme four twentith february feast saint mathie flyes february number strange whiche day faire kepte tewkesburie strange thing hapned floud great thereby medowes neere adioyning couered water afternoone came downe riuer seuerne greate number flyes beetels sommer euenings vse strike men face great heapes foote thicke aboue water credible men iudgement seene within paire butte length fly aboue hundred locke kay vveyghed one vvheate corne smith citizen london borne parish saint clements wythoute temple barre yall workemanshippe made one hanging locke yron steele brasse eleauen seuerall peeces pipe kay fyled three square wyth potte vpon shotte bowe wyth two es cleane wrought whyche weighed one graine gold wheat corne also time made chaine golde linckes whyche chaine locke kay fastened put aboute flyes necke drew ease whyche locke kay chaine flye weyghed one graine halfe thing almost incredible selfe amongest haue seene firste june deceassed robert horne doctoure ofbishop vvin chester deceased diuinitie byshoppe winchester prelate honorable order garter winchester place southwarke buryed winchester seauenteenth day july queenes moste excellenttrayterous fact appletree maiestie riuer thamis betwixt hir highnesse mannour greenewiche detteforde hir priuie barge accompanyed mounsier schemere french embassadour earle lincolne maister uizchamberlaine c entred discourse waightie affaire chanced one thomas appletree yong man seruant maister henrie carie two three child hir maiesties chappell one named barnard acton boate thamis rowing vp downe betwixte place afore named foresaide thomas appletree hadde caly er harquebuze whych hadde three foure time discharged bullet shooting randone rashly greate misfortune shot one waterman seconde man nexte vnto bale saide barge labouring hys oare whyche sate wythin sixe foote hir highnesse cleane throughe bothe hys armes blow greate greenous moued place forced hym crye scrit oute piteouslye supposing hymselfe slaine saying shot thorough body man bleeding abundantly though dagger thrust queenes maiestie shewed noble courage moste wonderfull heard spoken beholding maimed bleeding suche sorte neuer bashed thereat shewed effectually prudent magnanimous heart moste curteouslye comforting pore man good cheere saide shoulde want nothing mighte hys ease commaunding couered till suche time came shoare till whyche time laye bathing owne bloude whiche might haue bin occasion haue terrified eye beholder suche greate courage magnanimitie oure dread soueraigne ladye neuer quayled short thomas appletree rest apprehended broughte hir honorable counsel great grauitie wisedome employed time carefully greate diligence examined saide appletree companion finding case moste hainous wicked iustlye pronounced againste hym sentence death committhomas appletree haue suffered death iuly marshalsea southwarke whence tuisday following brought throughe citie knight marshalles men ledde vp tower hill radcliffe vppe blacke wall downe water side gibet set vppe directly placed beetwixte dertforde greenewiche execution male factour deede pitifully bewayled offence hee committed well prison way prepared himselfe penitently willingly offer body death thus verye godlye purposed finishe miserable wretched life prepared ascend goe vppe ladder turned himselfe spake people followeth good people come hither die god iudge neuer life intended hurte queenes excellent maiestie meant harme anye creature praye god heart long prosper keepe hir highnesse health blesse defende hir perilles daungers prosper hir hir affaire blesse hir moste honorable counsell gyuing grace doe thing glory god benefite thys realme thing moste sorie offence wofully bewaile penitent sorie good maister maister henrie carie hathe beene greeued fault suffering rebuke woulde god neuer bin borne haue greeuouslye offended wyth teares gusht oute eye verye faste saide perswaded men serue god take example hym euerye night morning moued deuoutly say lord prayer executioner put roape necke people cryed stay stay stay came righte honorable sir christopher hatton uizchamberlaine hir highnesse enquired confessed certified expressed vayled bonet declared queenes maiestie sente thither bothe make cause open haynous greeuous offence said thomas appletree signifie hir gratious pleasure continued message ye may reade printed self annexed discourse whyche declared hangman commanded take roape necke appletree come downe ladder receiued pardon gaue god prince praise greate benefite hir gratious bountie receiued done maister uizchamberlaine said good people pray queenes maiestie prayer saide whyche vsually read preseruation hir maiestie church almightie euerliuing god lord lordes king king whyche doest thy throne beholde dweller earth moste hartily beseeche thee thy fauour beholde moste gratious soueraigne lady queene elizabeth c wherevnto people ioyfully accorded saye amen trying god saue queene casting vp cappes thus dead man restored life broughte backe marshalsea againe euen led thence place execution way moste ioyfullye prayed securitie queenes maiestie mercifull message quenes maiestie sent right honorable sir christopher hatton place thomas appletree shoulde haue suffered hys traytourlike action set downe worde worde neare coulde gathered maister carie hir moste excellent maiestie pleased send deliuer hir commandmentthe people doubted pardon firste speach touching man nowe heere presently dye first thinke oute purpose notifie offence good people whereby onely worthy punishment iudgement forraine nation censure forraine lawes delyuered tormentor endure suche torture qualitie hys offence high case good pollieie shoulde condignely deserue speake facte suche fearefullthe people maruellous atte tiue heare heart quaketh eye refraine teares repeate againe amongest god hys mercy sake shielde defende hir moste excellent maiestie moste mightily hathe digested notable daunger tel tragedie course fell liked hir highnesse respecte greate heate take ayre water graue waightie negotiation passed time discourse french embassador space houre two hir returne itthe cause declared vvhy hir maiestie tooke vvater pleased hir take dyuers pause rather bicause earnestly read booke wherein seemed recreation sake tooke delight meanes whereof euen pleased god wth holy hande directe hir safetie commaunded bargeman slacke labouronly god prouidece sauing hir maiestie fro shotte slowly passe hadde hasted two stroke brought hir royal person shotte selfe wordes scarcely spoken hir maiestie caitiue moste vnhappily muste saye moste diuelishly discharged arquebuze strogly charged bullet barge hir maiestie god hath defended hir thou mightie god euer vouchsafe keep hir blowe seconde man bayles thea strange horrible terrour neuer heard seene like england barge wythin sixe foote hir royall person stricken seate wouded armes whiche hir maiestie beheld kingly handled cause euen straight tell lordes hir maiesties counsel dispersed abroadethe sodaine greate feare lord counsel hearing errible nevves affaire hearing moste perilous aceidente returned courte wyth suche speede waight cause might moue feareful louyng applausure towarde hir maiestie moste holily thanke god singular help preseruation oure moste deare righteous soueraigne done according loues dueties seruice god hir maiestie whole
